hebrew_text: מְגִילָּה נִקְרֵאת בְּאַחַד עָשָׂר, בִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר, בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר, בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר. לֹא פָּחוֹת, וְלֹא יוֹתֵר. כְּרַכִּין הַמּוּקָּפִין חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן — קוֹרִין בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר, כְּפָרִים וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת — קוֹרִין בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, אֶלָּא שֶׁהַכְּפָרִים מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה.
human_translation: The Megilla is read on the eleventh, on the twelfth, on the thirteenth, on the fourteenth, on the fifteenth not earlier and not later. Cities [ kerakin ] that have been surrounded by a wall since the days of Joshua, son of Nun, read on the fifteenth villages and large towns read on the fourteenth. However, that the villages may advance to the day of assembly,
llm_translation: The tractate of Megillah is read on the eleventh, on the twelfth, on the thirteenth, on the fourteenth, and on the fifteenth. Not less, and not more. Walled cities from the days of Joshua son of Nun - read on the fifteenth. Large villages and towns - read on the fourteenth, except that villages precede the day of entry.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד: חָל לִהְיוֹת אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר בַּשֵּׁנִי — כְּפָרִים וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם, וּמוּקָּפוֹת חוֹמָה לְמָחָר. חָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשְּׁלִישִׁי אוֹ בָּרְבִיעִי — כְּפָרִים מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה, וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם, וּמוּקָּפוֹת חוֹמָה לְמָחָר.
human_translation: How so? the fourteenth occurs on Monday, the villages and large towns read on that day, and the walled cities on the next day, occurs on Tuesday or Wednesday, the villages advance to the day of assembly, the large towns read on that day, and the walled cities on the next day,
llm_translation: How: If it falls on the fourteenth on Monday - villages and large towns read it during the day, and walled cities read it the next day. If it falls on Tuesday or Wednesday - villages precede the day of entry, and large towns read it during the day, and walled cities the next day.

hebrew_text: חָל לִהְיוֹת בַּחֲמִישִׁי — כְּפָרִים וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם, וּמוּקָּפוֹת חוֹמָה לְמָחָר. חָל לִהְיוֹת עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — כְּפָרִים מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה, וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת וּמוּקָּפוֹת חוֹמָה קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם.
human_translation: occurs on Thursday, the villages and large towns read on that day, and the walled cities on the next day, occurs on Shabbat eve, the villages advance to the day of assembly, and the large towns and the walled cities read on that day,
llm_translation: It is common to be on Thursday - villages and large towns read it during the day, and walled cities read it the next day. It is common to be on Friday - villages precede the day of entry, and large towns and walled cities read it during the day.

hebrew_text: חָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת — כְּפָרִים וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת מַקְדִּימִין וְקוֹרִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה, וּמוּקָּפוֹת חוֹמָה לְמָחָר. חָל לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת — כְּפָרִים מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה, וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם, וּמוּקָּפוֹת חוֹמָה לְמָחָר.
human_translation: occurs on Shabbat, the villages and large towns advance to the day of assembly, and the walled cities on the day after occurs on Sunday, the villages advance to the day of assembly, and the large towns read on that day, and the walled cities on the next day,
llm_translation: It is common for the new month to fall on Shabbat - villages and large towns precede the day of the entrance of the new month and read the Torah portion on the day of the entrance, and they encircle the town with a wall for protection for the next day. If the new month falls after Shabbat - villages precede the day of the entrance, and large towns read it on that day, and they encircle the town with a wall for the next day.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְגִילָּה נִקְרֵאת בְּאַחַד עָשָׂר. מְנָלַן? מְנָלַן?! כִּדְבָעֵינַן לְמֵימַר לְקַמַּן: חֲכָמִים הֵקֵילּוּ עַל הַכְּפָרִים לִהְיוֹת מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּסַפְּקוּ מַיִם וּמָזוֹן לַאֲחֵיהֶם שֶׁבַּכְּרַכִּים.
human_translation: The Megilla is read on the eleventh From where do we From where do we as we intend to say further on: The Sages were lenient with the villages to advance to the day of assembly, so that they supply water and food to their brethren in the cities
llm_translation: Tractate Megillah is read on the eleventh. Whence do we know? Whence do we know?! As we will say later: The sages were lenient with the villagers to be ahead of the day of entry, so that they could provide water and food for their brethren in the villages.

hebrew_text: אֲנַן הָכִי קָאָמְרִינַן: מִכְּדִי כּוּלְּהוּ אַנְשֵׁי כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה תַּקְּנִינְהוּ, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אַנְשֵׁי כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר וַחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר תַּקּוּן — אָתוּ רַבָּנַן וְעָקְרִי תַּקַּנְתָּא דְּתַקִּינוּ אַנְשֵׁי כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה? וְהָתְנַן: אֵין בֵּית דִּין יָכוֹל לְבַטֵּל דִּבְרֵי בֵּית דִּין חֲבֵירוֹ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ בְּחָכְמָה וּבְמִנְיָן.
human_translation: This is what we said, Now, all of these were enacted by the members of the Great Assembly As, if it enters your mind that the members of the Great Assembly enacted the fourteenth and fifteenth the Sages came and uprooted an ordinance that was enacted by the members of the Great Assembly? Didn’t we learn a rabbinical court cannot rescind the statements of another rabbinical court, unless it is superior to it in wisdom and in number?
llm_translation: We thus say: Since all the members of the Great Assembly enacted it, for if it were to enter your mind that the members of the Great Assembly were fourteen or fifteen in number, would the Sages come and uproot the enactment of the members of the Great Assembly? But we learned in a Mishnah: A court cannot annul the words of another court unless it is greater than it in wisdom and in number.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא כּוּלְּהוּ אַנְשֵׁי כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה תַּקִּינוּ. הֵיכָא רְמִיזָא?
human_translation: Rather, it is obvious all were enacted by the members of the Great Assembly, Where is the allusion
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious that all the members of the Great Assembly enacted. Where is the allusion?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לְקַיֵּים אֵת יְמֵי הַפּוּרִים הָאֵלֶּה בִּזְמַנֵּיהֶם״, זְמַנִּים הַרְבֵּה תִּקְּנוּ לָהֶם.
human_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the verse states: “To confirm these days of Purim in their times” they enacted many times for them
llm_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, the verse states: "to establish these days of Purim in their times," they established many times for them.

hebrew_text: הַאי מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ! אִם כֵּן לֵימָא קְרָא ״זְמַן״, מַאי ״זְמַנֵּיהֶם״ — זְמַנִּים טוּבָא.
human_translation: This is necessary for its own If so, let the verse say: time. What is “their times,” many times
llm_translation: This question is necessary for itself! If so, let him say the verse "time," what is "their times" - good times.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לֹא כִּזְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה! אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״זְמַנָּם״, מַאי ״זְמַנֵּיהֶם״ — שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ כּוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: But still, necessary the time of this is not the time of that If so, let the verse say: Their time, What “their times”? Learn from this all of
llm_translation: And once he asked him: His time is not like his time! If so, let us say the verse "their appointed time," what is "their appointed times" - you have heard all of it.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא זְמַנִּים טוּבָא! ״זְמַנֵּיהֶם״ דּוּמְיָא דִּ״זְמַנָּם״: מָה ״זְמַנָּם״ תְּרֵי — אַף ״זְמַנֵּיהֶם״ תְּרֵי.
human_translation: say many times, “their times,” similar to their time. Just as their time two so too, “their times” two
llm_translation: אֵימָא זְמַנִּים טוּבָא! ״זְמַנֵיהֶם״ דּוּמְיָא דִּ״זְמַנָּם״: מָה ״זְמַנָּם״ תְּרֵי — אַף ״זְמַנֵּיהֶם״ תְּרֵי. Translation: Say, good times! "Their times" is similar to "their appointed time": Just as "their appointed time" is two — so too "their times" is two.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא תְּרֵיסַר וּתְלֵיסַר? כִּדְאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר זְמַן קְהִילָּה לַכֹּל הִיא, וְלָא צְרִיךְ לְרַבּוֹיֵי, הָכָא נָמֵי: שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר זְמַן קְהִילָּה לַכֹּל הִיא, וְלָא צְרִיךְ לְרַבּוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Say the twelfth and the thirteenth as Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said The thirteenth is a time of assembly for all, there is no need to include it Here too, the thirteenth is a time of assembly for all, there is no need to include it
llm_translation: And why not thirteen and twelve? As Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: Thirteen times a congregation is for everyone, and it does not need to be multiplied, here too: Thirteen times a congregation is for everyone, and it does not need to be multiplied.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא שִׁיתְּסַר וְשִׁיבְסַר! ״וְלֹא יַעֲבוֹר״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And say the sixteenth and the seventeenth It is written: “And it shall not pass”
llm_translation: And why not twelve and thirteen! "And he shall not transgress" is written.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״כַּיָּמִים אֲשֶׁר נָחוּ בָהֶם הַיְּהוּדִים״. ״יָמִים״, ״כַּיָּמִים״ — לְרַבּוֹת אַחַד עָשָׂר וּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said: the verse states: “As the days on which the Jews rested from their enemies” “days” “as the days” to include the eleventh and twelfth
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, the verse says: "like the days that the Jews rested." "Days," "like the days" - to include eleven and twelve.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא תְּרֵיסַר וּתְלֵיסַר! אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר זְמַן קְהִילָּה לַכֹּל הִיא, וְלָא צְרִיךְ לְרַבּוֹיֵי. וְאֵימָא שִׁיתְּסַר וְשִׁיבְסַר! ״וְלֹא יַעֲבוֹר״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And say the twelfth and thirteenth Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: The thirteenth is a time of assembly for all, and there is no need to include it Say the sixteenth and seventeenth It is written: “And it shall not pass.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And why not thirteen and twelve! Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: Thirteen times is a congregation for everyone, and it does not need to be multiplied. And why not eleven and twelve! 'And he shall not pass over' is written."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר מִ״בִּזְמַנֵּיהֶם״? ״זְמַן״ ״זְמַנָּם״ ״זְמַנֵּיהֶם״ לָא מַשְׁמַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani did not state based upon “in their times,” He does not learn time, their time, their times.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani: What is the reason he did not say "from their times"? "Time," "their time," "their times" - it does not seem to him.

hebrew_text: וְרַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר מִ״כַּיָּמִים״? אָמַר לָךְ: הָהוּא לְדוֹרוֹת הוּא דִּכְתִיב.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rav Shemen bar Abba did not state based upon “as the days,” said to you: That is written to generations,
llm_translation: Rav Shemen bar Abba, what is the reason he did not say "from the days"? He said to you: That one is for generations, as it is written.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סְתִימְתָּאָה, דְּדָרֵישׁ ״זְמַן״ ״זְמַנָּם״ ״זְמַנֵּיהֶם״, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is the statement of Rabbi Akiva the unattributed. As, he derives time, their time, and their times. However, the Sages say: One may read only in its time,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: These are the words of Rabbi Akiva, a hidden matter, as he expounds "time," "their time," "their times," but the Sages say: One may only read it in its proper time.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַשָּׁנִים כְּתִיקְנָן וְיִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁרוּיִין עַל אַדְמָתָן, אֲבָל בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, הוֹאִיל וּמִסְתַּכְּלִין בָּהּ — אֵין קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yehuda said: When at a time when the years are established and the Jewish people dwell in their land. However, nowadays, since look one may read only in its time,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Challenger: Rabbi Yehuda said: When? - At a time when the years are as they were fixed, and the Israelites are settled in their land. But in this time, since they are gazing at it, it is only read at its proper time.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַלִּיבָּא דְמַאן? אִילֵימָא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — אֲפִילּוּ בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה אִיתָא לְהַאי תַּקַּנְתָּא!
human_translation: In accordance with whose Rabbi Yehuda If we say that it is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, even nowadays this ordinance applies.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah, whose opinion? If you say, the opinion of Rabbi Akiva - even in this time, this enactment is applicable!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, אַלִּיבָּא דְרַבָּנַן, וּבִזְמַן שֶׁהַשָּׁנִים כְּתִיקְנָן וְיִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁרוּיִין עַל אַדְמָתָן — מִיהָא קָרֵינַן, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Rather, is it not in accordance with the Sages, And, at least when the years are established and the Jewish people dwell in their land, is read The refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan is a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Rather, no, according to the opinion of the Sages, and when the years are as they were fixed and the Israelites dwell in their land — from here we read, the excellence of Rabbi Yochanan's excellence.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סְתִימְתָּאָה, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אָמְרוּ: בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, הוֹאִיל וּמִסְתַּכְּלִין בָּהּ — אֵין קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ.
human_translation: There are who say Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is the statement of Rabbi Akiva, the unattributed. However, the Sages said: Nowadays, since look one may read only in its time.
llm_translation: There are those who say: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: These are the hidden words of Rabbi Akiva, but the Sages said: In our time, since we contemplate it, we only read it in its proper time.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַשָּׁנִים כְּתִיקְנָן וְיִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁרוּיִין עַל אַדְמָתָן, אֲבָל בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, הוֹאִיל וּמִסְתַּכְּלִין בָּהּ — אֵין קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ.
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi Yehuda said: When At a time when the years are established and the Jewish people dwell in their land. However, nowadays, since look one may read only in its time.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namai the Elder said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda: When is this? When the years are as they were fixed, and the Jewish people are settled in their land. But in our time, since they are scrutinizing it, one may only read it at its proper time.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה,
human_translation: Rav Ashi a difficulty Rabbi Yehuda Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Rav Ashei kasheya lei d'Rabbi Yehuda ad'Rabbi Yehuda,

hebrew_text: וּמוֹקֵים לַהּ לְבָרַיְיתָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: and he establishes the baraita in accordance with Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda,
llm_translation: And establishes for her a covenant like Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, הוֹאִיל וּמִסְתַּכְּלִין בָּהּ — אֵין קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ״? וּרְמִינְהִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי — מָקוֹם שֶׁנִּכְנָסִין בַּשֵּׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי. אֲבָל מָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין נִכְנָסִין בַּשֵּׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי — אֵין קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ.
human_translation: And did Rabbi Yehuda say nowadays, since look one may read only in its time? raises a contradiction Rabbi Yehuda said: When a place where enter on Monday and Thursday. However, a place where they do not enter on Monday and Thursday, one may read only in its time,
llm_translation: And who said Rabbi Yehuda, "In this time, since we look at it - we only read it in its time"? And ask: Rabbi Yehuda said: When - a place where we enter on Monday and Thursday. But a place where we do not enter on Monday and Thursday - we only read it in its time.

hebrew_text: מְקוֹם שֶׁנִּכְנָסִין בַּשֵּׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי מִיהָא קָרֵינַן, וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה! וּמוֹקֵים לַהּ לְבָרַיְיתָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: at least a place where enter on Monday and Thursday, one may read even nowadays. And establishes the baraita in accordance with Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda.
llm_translation: The place where they enter on Monday and Thursday, we read from there, even in our time! And we establish for it a halakhah like Rabbi Yosei bar Yehudah.

hebrew_text: וּמִשּׁוּם דְּקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מוֹקֵים לָהּ לְבָרַיְיתָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה?!
human_translation: Because a difficulty Rabbi Yehuda Rabbi Yehuda, he establishes the baraita in accordance with Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda?
llm_translation: And because it is difficult for Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yehuda establishes it according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda?!

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ דְּאִיכָּא דְּתָנֵי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְאִיכָּא דְּתָנֵי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה, וּמִדְּקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַדְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אָמַר: מַאן דְּתָנֵי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — לָאו דַּוְוקָא, מַאן דְּתָנֵי לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה — דַּוְוקָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi heard that there were those who taught Rabbi Yehuda, and there were those who taught it Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda. And since he had a difficulty Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Yehuda, he said: The one who taught it Rabbi Yehuda is not precise, the one who taught it Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda is precise,
llm_translation: Rav Ashei heard that there are some who teach it in the name of Rabbi Yehuda, and there are some who teach it in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda. And those who are particular to teach it in the name of Rabbi Yehuda, honor Rabbi Yehuda. He said: One who teaches it in the name of Rabbi Yehuda - not specifically, one who teaches it in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda - specifically.

hebrew_text: כְּרַכִּים הַמּוּקָּפִים חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן קוֹרִין בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר וְכוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רָבָא, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״עַל כֵּן הַיְּהוּדִים הַפְּרָזִים הַיּוֹשְׁבִים בְּעָרֵי הַפְּרָזוֹת וְגוֹ׳״. מִדִּפְרָזִים בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר — מוּקָּפִין בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר.
human_translation: Cities that have been surrounded by a wall since the days of Joshua, son of Nun, read on the fifteenth From where are these matters Rava said: as the verse states: “Therefore the Jews of the villages, who dwell in the unwalled towns, From the unwalled towns on the fourteenth, the walled cities on the fifteenth.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Karkim hamukafim chomah miyamot Yehoshua ben Nun korin bachamishah asar v'chul. Menahanei milei? Amar Rava, de'amar kra: 'Al ken hayehudim haparazim hayoshvim be'arei haparazot v'chul.' Mid'parazim be'arba'ah asar — mukafim bachamishah asar." English translation: "Enclosed vineyards are considered a wall from the days of Joshua son of Nun when reading in the fifteenth chapter of Joshua, verse 5, and so on. What is the relevance of these words? Rava said, as the verse states: 'Therefore the Jews who dwell in the unwalled towns and so on.' From unwalled towns in the fourteenth chapter of Joshua, verse 5 — they are considered enclosed in the fifteenth chapter of Joshua, verse 5."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: פְּרָזִים בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, מוּקָּפִין כְּלָל כְּלָל לָא! וְלָאו יִשְׂרָאֵל נִינְהוּ? וְעוֹד: ״מֵהוֹדּוּ וְעַד כּוּשׁ״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Say unwalled towns on the fourteenth, the walled cities not at all. And are they not Jews? And furthermore: It is written “from Hodu until Cush”
llm_translation: And why? Parzim in fourteen, encompassing general general no! And are they not Israelites? And furthermore: "From Hodu to Kush" is written.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: פְּרָזִים בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר מוּקָּפִין בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר וּבַחֲמֵיסַר, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״לִהְיוֹת עוֹשִׂים אֵת יוֹם אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר לְחֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר וְאֵת יוֹם חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר [בּוֹ] בְּכׇל שָׁנָה״!
human_translation: Say the unwalled towns on the fourteenth the walled cities on the fourteenth and on the fifteenth, as it is written: “That they should keep the fourteenth day of the month of Adar and the fifteenth day of the same, in every year”
llm_translation: And why? Parzim on the fourteenth are encompassed on the fourteenth and on the fifteenth, as it is written: "To make the fourteenth day of the month Adar and the fifteenth day of it every year!"

hebrew_text: אִי הֲוָה כְּתִב ״אֵת יוֹם אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר וַחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר״ — כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, הַשְׁתָּא דִּכְתִיב ״אֵת יוֹם אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר וְאֵת יוֹם חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר״ — אֲתָא ״אֵת״ וּפָסֵיק: הָנֵי בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, וְהָנֵי בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר.
human_translation: If it had been written The fourteenth day and [ ve ] the fifteenth, as you said. now that it is written: The fourteenth day and [ ve’et ] the fifteenth day, et comes and interrupts, these on the fourteenth, and those on the fifteenth.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If it were written "אֵת יוֹם אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר וַחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר" — as you said, now that it is written "אֵת יוֹם אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר וְאֵת יוֹם חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר" — the "אֵת" came and interrupted: those are on the fourteenth, and those are on the fifteenth.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: פְּרָזִים — בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר, מוּקָּפִין — אִי בָּעוּ בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר, אִי בָּעוּ בַּחֲמֵיסַר! אָמַר קְרָא ״בִּזְמַנֵּיהֶם״, זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לֹא זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה.
human_translation: Say unwalled towns on the fourteenth, walled cities, if they wish on the fourteenth, if they wish on the fifteenth. The verse states: “In their times” the time this is not the time that
llm_translation: And why? "Parzim" - in the twelfth, "Mukapin" - whether in the twelfth, whether in the fifteenth! The verse says, "in their times," his time is not his time.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא בִּתְלֵיסַר! כְּשׁוּשָׁן.
human_translation: Say on the thirteenth as Shushan,
llm_translation: And why not thirteen! Keshushan.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן עֲשִׂיָּיה, זְכִירָה מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהַיָּמִים הָאֵלֶּה נִזְכָּרִים וְנַעֲשִׂים״, אִיתַּקַּשׁ זְכִירָה לַעֲשִׂיָּיה.
human_translation: We found observing from where do we remembering the verse states: “That these days should be remembered and observed” remembering is compared to observing.
llm_translation: I found a deed, where is its mention from? The verse says: "And these days are remembered and done," linking mention to deed.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: כְּרַכִּין הַמּוּקָּפִין חוֹמָה מִימוֹת אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ קוֹרִין בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר.
human_translation: the mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: Cities that have been surrounded by a wall since the days of Ahasuerus read on the fifteenth.
llm_translation: Mishnah that not like this Tanna. For it was taught, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: Enclosures surrounded by a wall from the days of Achashverosh are read on the fifteenth.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה? כִּי שׁוּשָׁן. מָה שׁוּשָׁן מוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ וְקוֹרִין בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר — אַף כֹּל שֶׁמּוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ קוֹרִין בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר.
human_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa? like Shushan: Just as Shushan that was surrounded by a wall since the days of Ahasuerus, and one reads on the fifteenth, so too every that was walled since the days of Ahasuerus reads on the fifteenth.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha? Like Shushan. Just as Shushan was surrounded by a wall from the days of Achashverosh, and we read it with a "hey" (15) — so too, any city surrounded by a wall from the days of Achashverosh, we read it with a "hey" (15).

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דִּידַן, מַאי טַעְמָא? יָלֵיף ״פְּרָזִי״ ״פְּרָזִי״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״עַל כֵּן הַיְּהוּדִים הַפְּרָזִים״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״לְבַד מֵעָרֵי הַפְּרָזִי הַרְבֵּה מְאֹד״. מָה לְהַלָּן מוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן, אַף כָּאן מוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן.
human_translation: What is the reason for the tanna of our derived unwalled and unwalled. It is written here: “Therefore the Jews of the villages, and it is written there, besides unwalled towns, a great many” Just as there, that was surrounded by a wall from the days of Joshua, son of Nun, so too here that was surrounded by a wall from the days of Joshua, son of Nun.
llm_translation: Our Talmudic text: And our Mishnaic source, what is the reason? It derives "Perazi" "Perazi." It is written here: "Therefore the Jews of the Perazi," and it is written there: "Except for the cities of the Perazi, very many." Just as there it is surrounded by a wall from the days of Joshua son of Nun, so too here it is surrounded by a wall from the days of Joshua son of Nun.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה לָא אָמַר כְּתַנָּא דִּידַן — דְּלֵית לֵיהּ ״פְּרָזִי״ ״פְּרָזִי״, אֶלָּא תַּנָּא דִּידַן מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה?
human_translation: Granted Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa did not state in accordance with the tanna of our because he did not hold unwalled unwalled. However, what is the reason the tanna our did not state in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa?
llm_translation: In truth, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha did not say like our Mishna, for he does not have the word "Perazi," "Perazi." Rather, what is the reason that our Mishna did not say like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha?

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא?! דְּהָא אִית לֵיהּ ״פְּרָזִי״ ״פְּרָזִי״! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֶלָּא שׁוּשָׁן, דְּעָבְדָא כְּמַאן? לָא כִּפְרָזִים וְלָא כְּמוּקָּפִין!
human_translation: What is the reason? Isn’t it he holds unwalled unwalled? This is what he said, in accordance with whom does Shushan observe not like the unwalled towns and not like the walled cities,
llm_translation: What is the reason?! Because it has "Perazi" "Perazi"! This is what he is saying: Rather, Shushan, who does it resemble? Not like the Perazim and not like the Mokafin!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ כְּדִי: שָׁאנֵי שׁוּשָׁן — הוֹאִיל וְנַעֲשָׂה בָּהּ נֵס.
human_translation: Rava said, and some say it unattributed Shushan is different since the miracle occurred in it
llm_translation: Rava said, and some say it was said to him: "Regarding the city of Shushan - since a miracle occurred within it."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְתַנָּא דִּידַן, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״מְדִינָה וּמְדִינָה וְעִיר וָעִיר״. ״מְדִינָה וּמְדִינָה״ — לְחַלֵּק בֵּין מוּקָּפִין חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן לְמוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ.
human_translation: Granted, according the tanna of our this is what is written: every province, and every city” “every province [ medina ]” to distinguish between that were surrounded by a wall since the days of Joshua, son of Nun, and was surrounded by a wall since the days of Ahasuerus,
llm_translation: In truth, according to our Mishna, that is what is written: "province and province and city and city." "Province and province" — to differentiate between a walled city from the days of Joshua son of Nun to an unwalled city from the days of Ahasuerus.

hebrew_text: ״עִיר וְעִיר״ נָמֵי, לְחַלֵּק בֵּין שׁוּשָׁן לִשְׁאָר עֲיָירוֹת. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה, בִּשְׁלָמָא ״מְדִינָה וּמְדִינָה״ — לְחַלֵּק בֵּין שׁוּשָׁן לִשְׁאָר עֲיָירוֹת, אֶלָּא ״עִיר וְעִיר״ לְמַאי אֲתָא?
human_translation: “every city,” also to distinguish between Shushan and other cities, However, according to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa, granted “every province” to distinguish between Shushan and other cities but what does “every city” come
llm_translation: "City and city" - it is necessary, to differentiate between Shushan and other cities. But according to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha, it is understandable "province and province" - to differentiate between Shushan and other cities, but "city and city," what does it come to teach?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה: וּלְתַנָּא דִּידַן מִי נִיחָא? כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לֵיהּ ״פְּרָזִי״ ״פְּרָזִי״ — ״מְדִינָה וּמְדִינָה״ לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא קְרָא לִדְרָשָׁה הוּא דַּאֲתָא, וְכִדְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כְּרַךְ, וְכׇל הַסָּמוּךְ לוֹ, וְכׇל הַנִּרְאֶה עִמּוֹ — נִידּוֹן כִּכְרַךְ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa said to you: According to the tanna of our does it work out well? Since he holds unwalled unwalled, why do I “every province”? Rather, the verse comes for exposition, and it comes in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A city, and all adjacent to it, and all seen with it, considered like the city,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said to you: And for our Mishna, who is suitable? Since he has "Perazi" "Perazi" - "province and province" what do I need it for? Rather, it is a verse for interpretation that he came with, and like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi who came. For Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Like a bundle, and all that is adjacent to it, and all that appears with it - is judged like the bundle.

hebrew_text: עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: כְּמֵחַמָּתָן לִטְבֶרְיָא — מִיל. וְלֵימָא מִיל! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: דְּשִׁיעוּרָא דְמִיל כַּמָּה הָוֵי — כְּמֵחַמָּתָן לִטְבֶרְיָא.
human_translation: Up to what Rabbi Yirmeya said, and some say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba like from Ḥamtan to Tiberias, mil . Let him say mil ; teaches us this: How much the measure mil ? like from Ḥamtan to Tiberias.
llm_translation: Until when? Rabbi Yirmiyah said, and some say Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: Like the heat of their oven for their bricks - a mil. And should we say a mil! But it is taught to us: The measurement of a mil is like the heat of their oven for their bricks.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: מַנְצְפַךְ — צוֹפִים אֲמָרוּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said, and some say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba The Seers, said mem , nun , tzadi , peh , kaf mantzepakh
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya said, and some say it was Rabbi Chiya bar Abba: "Mantzfach" - they said, "We observe them."

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״אֵלֶּה הַמִּצְוֹת״, שֶׁאֵין נָבִיא רַשַּׁאי לְחַדֵּשׁ דָּבָר מֵעַתָּה? וְעוֹד, הָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מֵם וְסָמֶךְ שֶׁבַּלּוּחוֹת
human_translation: And you understand Isn’t it written: “These are the commandments that a prophet is not permitted to initiate any matter from now on? And furthermore, didn’t Rav Ḥisda say: mem and samekh in the tablets
llm_translation: And was it created? And it is written: "These are the commandments," that a prophet is not authorized to innovate anything from now on? And furthermore, Rav Ḥisdah said: The mem and samekh that are in the tablets.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵס הָיוּ עוֹמְדִין!
human_translation: stood by way of a miracle?
llm_translation: In a miracle they were standing!

hebrew_text: אִין, מִהְוָה הֲווֹ, וְלָא הֲווֹ יָדְעִי הֵי בְּאֶמְצַע תֵּיבָה וְהֵי בְּסוֹף תֵּיבָה, וַאֲתוֹ צוֹפִים וְתַקִּינוּ פְּתוּחִין בְּאֶמְצַע תֵּיבָה וּסְתוּמִין בְּסוֹף תֵּיבָה.
human_translation: Yes, did exist but did not know which in the middle of the word and which at the end of the word, and the Seers came and established the open in the middle of the word and the closed at the end of the word.
llm_translation: There is, what is the difference, and not the difference, know be in the middle of the ark and be at the end of the ark, and they came and they established openings in the middle of the ark and closings at the end of the ark.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף ״אֵלֶּה הַמִּצְוֹת״, שֶׁאֵין נָבִיא עָתִיד לְחַדֵּשׁ דָּבָר מֵעַתָּה! אֶלָּא שְׁכָחוּם וְחָזְרוּ וְיִסְּדוּם.
human_translation: Ultimately, “these are the commandments” that a prophet is not permitted to initiate any matter from now on? Rather, forgot them, then reestablished them.
llm_translation: At the end, "These are the commandments," that no prophet is destined to innovate a matter from now on! Rather, they forgot them, and they returned and established them.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: תַּרְגּוּם שֶׁל תּוֹרָה — אוּנְקְלוֹס הַגֵּר אֲמָרוֹ מִפִּי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. תַּרְגּוּם שֶׁל נְבִיאִים — יוֹנָתָן בֶּן עוּזִּיאֵל אֲמָרוֹ מִפִּי חַגַּי זְכַרְיָה וּמַלְאָכִי, וְנִזְדַּעְזְעָה אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת פַּרְסָה עַל אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת פַּרְסָה. יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: מִי הוּא זֶה שֶׁגִּילָּה סְתָרַיי לִבְנֵי אָדָם?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said, and some say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba The translation of the Torah was composed by Onkelos the convert based on Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua. The translation of the Prophets was composed by Yonatan ben Uzziel based on Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi. Eretz Yisrael quaked four hundred parasangs [ parsa ] by four hundred parasangs, a Divine Voice emerged and said: Who is this who has revealed My secrets to mankind?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya said, and some say it was Rabbi Chiya bar Abba: The translation of the Torah - Onkelos the convert said it from the mouths of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua. The translation of the Prophets - Yonatan ben Uzziel said it from the mouths of Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi. And the land of Israel trembled four hundred parasangs by four hundred parasangs. A Bat Kol emerged and said: Who is this that revealed My secrets to the children of men?

hebrew_text: עָמַד יוֹנָתָן בֶּן עוּזִּיאֵל עַל רַגְלָיו וְאָמַר: אֲנִי הוּא שֶׁגִּלִּיתִי סְתָרֶיךָ לִבְנֵי אָדָם, גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לְפָנֶיךָ שֶׁלֹּא לִכְבוֹדִי עָשִׂיתִי, וְלֹא לִכְבוֹד בֵּית אַבָּא, אֶלָּא לִכְבוֹדְךָ עָשִׂיתִי, שֶׁלֹּא יִרְבּוּ מַחֲלוֹקֹת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Yonatan ben Uzziel stood up on his feet and said: I am the one who has revealed Your secrets to mankind it is revealed and known to You that I did this not for my honor, and not for the honor of the house of father, but rather for Your honor I did this, so that discord not increase among the Jewish people.
llm_translation: Jonathan son of Uzziel stood on his feet and said: "I am the one who revealed Your secrets to the sons of men, openly and known before You that I did not do it for my honor, nor for the honor of my father's house, but for Your honor I did it, so that disputes may not increase among the children of Israel."

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד בִּיקֵּשׁ לְגַלּוֹת תַּרְגּוּם שֶׁל כְּתוּבִים, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לוֹ: דַּיֶּיךָּ! מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּאִית בֵּיהּ קֵץ מָשִׁיחַ.
human_translation: And also sought to reveal a translation of the Writings, a Divine Voice emerged and said to him: It is enough for you What is the reason Because it has in it the end, Messiah
llm_translation: And furthermore he sought to reveal the translation of the Scriptures, a heavenly voice emerged and said to him: "Enough for you!" What is the reason? Because it contains the end of days of the Messiah.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְגּוּם שֶׁל תּוֹרָה, אוּנְקְלוֹס הַגֵּר אֲמָרוֹ? וְהָא אָמַר רַב אִיקָא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקְרְאוּ בְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרַת הָאֱלֹהִים מְפוֹרָשׁ וְשׂוֹם שֶׂכֶל וַיָּבִינוּ בַּמִּקְרָא״. ״וַיִּקְרְאוּ בְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרַת הָאֱלֹהִים״ — זֶה מִקְרָא; ״מְפוֹרָשׁ״ — זֶה תַּרְגּוּם;
human_translation: Was the translation of the Torah composed by Onkelos the convert? Didn’t Rav Ika bar Avin say Rav Ḥananel said Rav said: What is which is written “And they read in the book, the Torah of God, distinctly; and they gave the sense, and they caused them to understand the reading” “And they read in the book, the Torah of God,” this is the text; “distinctly,” this is the translation,
llm_translation: And the translation of the Torah, Onkelos the convert said? But didn't Rav Ikka bar Avin say that Rav Hananel said that Rav said: What is the meaning of what is written: "And they read in the book, in the law of God, distinctly; and they gave the sense, and caused them to understand the reading." "And they read in the book, in the law of God" - this is the Scripture; "distinctly" - this is the translation.

hebrew_text: ״וְשׂוֹם שֶׂכֶל״ — אֵלּוּ הַפְּסוּקִין; ״וַיָּבִינוּ בַּמִּקְרָא״ — אֵלּוּ פִּיסְקֵי טְעָמִים, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ — אֵלּוּ הַמָּסוֹרֹת! — שְׁכָחוּם וְחָזְרוּ וְיִסְּדוּם.
human_translation: “And they gave the sense,” these are verses. “And they caused them to understand the reading,” these are the cantillation notes, And some say these are the traditions The was forgotten and then reestablished it.
llm_translation: "And 'place understanding' - these are the verses; 'and they understood in the scripture' - these are the divisions of the accents, and some say - these are the traditions! - they forgot them, then remembered and reestablished them."

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא דְּלָא אִזְדַּעְזְעָה וְאַדִּנְבִיאֵי אִזְדַּעְזְעָה? דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — מִיפָּרְשָׁא מִלְּתָא, דִּנְבִיאֵי — אִיכָּא מִילֵּי דְּמִיפָּרְשָׁן וְאִיכָּא מִילֵּי דִּמְסַתְּמָן, דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִגְדַּל הַמִּסְפֵּד בִּירוּשָׁלִַם כְּמִסְפַּד הֲדַדְרִימּוֹן בְּבִקְעַת מְגִידּוֹן״,
human_translation: What is different of the Torah, did not quake, and of the Prophets, it quaked? The matters in the Torah is clear, the Prophets, there are matters that are clear and there are matters that are obscure, As it is written: “On that day shall there be a great mourning in Jerusalem, like the mourning of Hadadrimmon in the valley of Megiddon”
llm_translation: What is the difference between the Torah that does not cause trembling and the Prophets that cause trembling? The Torah - there are matters that are explicitly explained, the Prophets - there are matters that are explicitly explained and there are matters that are inferred, as it is written: "In that day shall there be a great mourning in Jerusalem, as the mourning of Hadadrimmon in the valley of Megiddon."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אִלְמָלֵא תַּרְגּוּמָא דְּהַאי קְרָא — לָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי קָאָמַר: בְּיוֹמָא הַהוּא יִסְגֵּי מִסְפְּדָא בִּירוּשְׁלֶים כְּמִסְפְּדָא דְּאַחְאָב בַּר עָמְרִי דִּקְטַל יָתֵיהּ הֲדַדְרִימּוֹן בֶּן טַבְרִימּוֹן בְּרָמוֹת גִּלְעָד וּכְמִסְפְּדָא דְּיֹאשִׁיָּה בַּר אָמוֹן דִּקְטַל יָתֵיהּ פַּרְעֹה חֲגִירָא בְּבִקְעַת מְגִידּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said: Were it not for the translation of this verse, we would not have known what it is saying, On that day, the mourning in Jerusalem will be as great as the mourning for Ahab, son of Omri, who was slain by Hadadrimmon, son of Tavrimon, in Ramoth-Gilead, and like the mourning for Josiah, son of Amon, who was slain by Pharaoh the lame in the valley of Megiddon.
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef said: Were it not for the Aramaic translation of this verse, we would not know what it is saying: On that day there will be great mourning in Jerusalem, like the mourning of Achav son of Omri who was killed by Hadarimmon son of Tabrimmon in Ramot Gilead. And like the mourning of Yoshiyahu son of Amon who was killed by Pharaoh Haggirah in Megiddo Valley.

hebrew_text: ״וְרָאִיתִי אֲנִי דָנִיֵּאל לְבַדִּי אֶת הַמַּרְאָה וְהָאֲנָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר הָיוּ עִמִּי לֹא רָאוּ אֶת הַמַּרְאָה אֲבָל חֲרָדָה גְדוֹלָה נָפְלָה עֲלֵיהֶם וַיִּבְרְחוּ בְּהֵחָבֵא״. מַאן נִינְהוּ אֲנָשִׁים? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: זֶה חַגַּי זְכַרְיָה וּמַלְאָכִי.
human_translation: “And I, Daniel, alone saw the vision, for the men who were with me did not see the vision; but a great trembling fell upon them, so that they fled to hide themselves” Who were these men? Rabbi Yirmeya said, and some say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba These are Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi.
llm_translation: "And I, Daniel, alone saw the vision, and the men who were with me did not see the vision, but a great terror fell upon them, and they fled to hide." Who are these men? Rabbi Yirmeya said, and some say Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba: This is the prophet Haggai and the angel Malachi."

hebrew_text: אִינְהוּ עֲדִיפִי מִינֵּיהּ, וְאִיהוּ עֲדִיף מִינַּיְיהוּ. אִינְהוּ עֲדִיפִי מִינֵּיהּ — דְּאִינְהוּ נְבִיאֵי וְאִיהוּ לָאו נָבִיא. אִיהוּ עֲדִיף מִינַּיְיהוּ — דְּאִיהוּ חֲזָא וְאִינְהוּ לָא חֲזוֹ.
human_translation: they, were greater than him, he, was greater than them. They were greater than him, as they were prophets and he was not a prophet. he was greater than them, as he saw and they did not see
llm_translation: They are superior to him, and he is superior to them. They are superior to him - for they are prophets and he is not a prophet. He is superior to them - for he sees and they do not see.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּלָא חֲזוֹ, מַאי טַעְמָא אִיבְּעִיתוּ? אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִינְהוּ לָא חֲזוֹ, מַזָּלַיְיהוּ חֲזוֹ.
human_translation: Since they did not see what is the reason that they were frightened? Even though they did not see their guardian angels saw
llm_translation: And when they did not see, what is the reason that they were afraid? Even though they did not see, their mazal saw.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַאי מַאן דְּמִיבְּעִית, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיהוּ לָא חָזֵי, מַזָּלֵיהּ חָזֵי. מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? לִיקְרֵי קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע. וְאִי קָאֵים בִּמְקוֹם הַטִּנּוֹפֶת — לִינְשׁוֹף מִדּוּכְתֵּיהּ אַרְבַּע גַּרְמִידֵי. וְאִי לָא — לֵימָא הָכִי: ״עִיזָּא דְּבֵי טַבָּחֵי שַׁמִּינָא מִינַּאי״.
human_translation: Ravina said: Learn from one who is frightened although he does not see his guardian angel sees What is his remedy? He should recite Shema , And if he is standing in a place of filth, he should distance himself four cubits from his location And if not let him say the following The goat of the slaughterhouse is fatter than I am,
llm_translation: Ravina said: Learn from it: Whoever is diligent, even though he does not see, his luck sees him. What is his remedy? To read the Shema. And if he is standing in a place of filth - he should wrap himself with four cubits. And if not - let him say thus: "The goat of the butchers' house is better than me."

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ ״מְדִינָה וּמְדִינָה וְעִיר וָעִיר״ — לִדְרָשָׁה, ״מִשְׁפָּחָה וּמִשְׁפָּחָה״ לְמַאי אֲתָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: לְהָבִיא מִשְׁפְּחוֹת כְּהוּנָּה וּלְוִיָּה, שֶׁמְּבַטְּלִין עֲבוֹדָתָן וּבָאִין לִשְׁמוֹעַ מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה.
human_translation: Now you have said “every province” and “every city” for exposition, for what “every family” Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: to include the priestly and Levitical families, that they cancel their service and come to hear the reading of the Megilla.
llm_translation: At this time, as you said, "province and province and city and city" — for interpretation, "family and family," what does it come to teach? Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said: To bring families of Kohanim and Levites, who cease their service and come to hear the reading of the Megillah.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כֹּהֲנִים בַּעֲבוֹדָתָן וּלְוִיִּם בְּדוּכָנָן וְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמַעֲמָדָן — כּוּלָּן מְבַטְּלִין עֲבוֹדָתָן וּבָאִין לִשְׁמוֹעַ מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה.
human_translation: As Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The priests at their service, the Levites on their platform and the Israelites at their watches, all cancel their service and come to hear the reading of the Megilla.
llm_translation: As Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The priests in their service, the Levites in their singing, and the Israelites in their standing - all of them suspend their service and come to hear the reading of the Megillah.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כֹּהֲנִים בַּעֲבוֹדָתָן, וּלְוִיִּם בְּדוּכָנָן, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמַעֲמָדָן — כּוּלָּן מְבַטְּלִין עֲבוֹדָתָן וּבָאִין לִשְׁמוֹעַ מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה. מִכָּאן סָמְכוּ שֶׁל בֵּית רַבִּי שֶׁמְּבַטְּלִין תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה וּבָאִין לִשְׁמוֹעַ מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מֵעֲבוֹדָה: וּמָה עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁהִיא חֲמוּרָה — מְבַטְּלִינַן, תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן.
human_translation: This is also taught The priests at their service, the Levites on the platform, and the Israelites at their watches, all cancel their service and come to hear the reading of the Megilla. the house of Rabbi relied here that one cancels his Torah study and comes to hear the reading of the Megilla. an a fortiori from the service: Just as service which is important, cancels not all the more so Torah study
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Kohanim in their service, and Leviim in their singing, and Yisraelim in their standing — all of them suspend their service and come to hear the reading of the Megillah. From here, the scholars of the house of Rabbi relied on that they suspend the study of Torah and come to hear the reading of the Megillah, a fortiori from the service: And if the service, which is severe, we suspend, all the more so the study of Torah.

hebrew_text: וַעֲבוֹדָה חֲמוּרָה מִתַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בִּהְיוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּירִיחוֹ וַיִּשָּׂא עֵינָיו וַיַּרְא וְהִנֵּה אִישׁ עוֹמֵד לְנֶגְדּוֹ [וְגוֹ׳] וַיִּשְׁתָּחוּ (לְאַפָּיו)״.
human_translation: Is the service more important than Torah study? Isn’t it written: “And it came to pass when Joshua was by Jericho that he lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, a man stood over against him and bowed down”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is service more stringent than Torah study? And it is written: "And it came to pass, when Joshua was by Jericho, that he lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, there stood a man over against him etc., and he bowed down (to his face)."

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אָסוּר לְאָדָם שֶׁיִּתֵּן שָׁלוֹם לַחֲבֵירוֹ בַּלַּיְלָה, חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא שֵׁד הוּא! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״כִּי אֲנִי שַׂר צְבָא ה׳״.
human_translation: How did do this, Didn’t Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: It is prohibited for a person to greet his fellow at night we are concerned that perhaps it is a demon? There it was different, as said to him: But I am captain of the host of the Lord.
llm_translation: And how does he do so? And didn't Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: It is forbidden for a person to greet his friend at night, for we are concerned that it may be a demon! It is different there, for he said to him: "For I am the commander of the army of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא מְשַׁקְּרִי? גְּמִירִי דְּלָא מַפְּקִי שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם לְבַטָּלָה.
human_translation: Perhaps and he lied? is learned do not utter the name of Heaven for naught,
llm_translation: Perhaps they are lying? We have learned that one does not utter the name of Heaven in vain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: אֶמֶשׁ בִּטַּלְתֶּם תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם, וְעַכְשָׁיו בִּטַּלְתֶּם תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה. אָמַר לוֹ: עַל אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן בָּאתָ? אָמַר לוֹ: ״עַתָּה בָאתִי״, מִיָּד: ״וַיָּלֶן יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בַּלַּיְלָה הַהוּא בְּתוֹךְ הָעֵמֶק״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: said to Yesterday, you neglected the afternoon daily offering and now, you have neglected Torah study, said to him: For which of these have you come? He said to him: I have come now, immediately “And Joshua lodged that night” “in the midst of the valley ha’emek Rabbi Yoḥanan said:
llm_translation: He said to him: "Last night you nullified the evening Tamid offering, and now you have nullified the study of Torah." He said to him: "For what purpose did you come?" He said to him: "Now I have come." Immediately: "And Joshua lodged that night in the midst of the valley." Rabbi Yochanan said:

hebrew_text: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁלָּן בְּעוּמְקָהּ שֶׁל הֲלָכָה. וְאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אוּנְיָא: גָּדוֹל תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה יוֹתֵר מֵהַקְרָבַת תְּמִידִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַתָּה בָאתִי״!
human_translation: teaches that he spent the night in the depths be’umeka of halakha , And Rav Shmuel bar Unya said: Torah study is greater than sacrificing the daily offerings, as it is stated: “I have come now”
llm_translation: The text reads: "It teaches us in the depth of the Halakha. And Rav Shmuel bar Unya said: Great is Torah study more than the offering of the daily sacrifices, as it is said: 'Now I have come'!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּרַבִּים, וְהָא דְּיָחִיד.
human_translation: not difficult. This by the masses, That by an individual,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this of the many, and this of the individual.

hebrew_text: וּדְיָחִיד קַל? וְהָתְנַן: נָשִׁים בַּמּוֹעֵד מְעַנּוֹת אֲבָל לֹא מְטַפְּחוֹת, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיוּ סְמוּכוֹת לַמִּטָּה — מְטַפְּחוֹת. בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים בַּחֲנוּכָּה וּבְפוּרִים, מְעַנּוֹת וּמְטַפְּחוֹת בָּזֶה וּבָזֶה, אֲבָל לֹא מְקוֹנְנוֹת.
human_translation: of an individual a light Didn’t we learn On a Festival, women may lament but they may not clap Rabbi Yishmael says: Those that are close to the bier may clap. On the New Moon, on Hanukkah, and on Purim, they may lament and clap on both they may not wail
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And an individual is lenient? And we learned in a Mishnah: Women may knead dough on a festival but may not clap hands. Rabbi Yishmael says: If they are accustomed to clap hands, they may do so. At the beginning of months, on Chanukah, and on Purim, they may clap hands and knead dough for this and for that, but they may not strike with a pestle." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר הוּנָא: אֵין מוֹעֵד בִּפְנֵי תַּלְמִיד חָכָם — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן חֲנוּכָּה וּפוּרִים.
human_translation: And Rabba bar Huna said: there are no a Festival in the presence of a Torah scholar. and all the more so on Hanukkah and Purim.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Huna said: There is no fixed time for a Torah scholar - all the more so for Hanukkah and Purim.

hebrew_text: כְּבוֹד תּוֹרָה קָאָמְרַתְּ. כְּבוֹד תּוֹרָה דְּיָחִיד — חָמוּר, תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה דְּיָחִיד — קַל.
human_translation: You speak of the honor to the Torah, the honor the Torah an individual is important; the Torah study of an individual is light
llm_translation: The honor of Torah is being stated. The honor of individual Torah study is stringent, the study of Torah by an individual is lenient.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, פְּשִׁיטָא לִי: עֲבוֹדָה וּמִקְרָא מְגִילָּה — מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה עֲדִיף, מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא. תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה וּמִקְרָא מְגִילָּה — מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה עֲדִיף, מִדְּסָמְכוּ שֶׁל בֵּית רַבִּי.
human_translation: Rava said: is obvious to me service and reading the Megilla, reading the Megilla precedence, based upon Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina Torah study and reading the Megilla, reading the Megilla precedence, based upon the house of Rabbi relied
llm_translation: Rava said, it is obvious to me: between Avodah (service) and Mikra Megillah (reading the Megillah) — Mikra Megillah is preferable, as stated by Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina. Between Talmud Torah (Torah study) and Mikra Megillah — Mikra Megillah is preferable, as stated by the associates of the House of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה וּמֵת מִצְוָה — מֵת מִצְוָה עֲדִיף, מִדְּתַנְיָא: מְבַטְּלִין תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה לְהוֹצָאַת מֵת, וּלְהַכְנָסַת כַּלָּה. עֲבוֹדָה וּמֵת מִצְוָה — מֵת מִצְוָה עֲדִיף, מִ״וּלְאַחוֹתוֹ״.
human_translation: Torah study and a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ], the met mitzva precedence. from that which is taught One cancels his Torah study to bring out a corpse and to bring in the bride. service and a met mitzva , met mitzva precedence, based upon “or for his sister”
llm_translation: Talmud Torah and the burial of a deceased — the burial of a deceased takes precedence, as it is taught: We interrupt Talmud Torah for the sake of burying a deceased and for bringing in a bride. Service in the Temple and the burial of a deceased — the burial of a deceased takes precedence, due to "his sister."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וּלְאַחוֹתוֹ״ מַה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה הוֹלֵךְ לִשְׁחוֹט אֶת פִּסְחוֹ וְלָמוּל אֶת בְּנוֹ, וְשָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּת לוֹ מֵת, יָכוֹל יִטַּמָּא —
human_translation: As it is taught What the verse states “or for his sister”? who was going to slaughter his Paschal or to circumcise his son, and he heard that of his died, might he become ritually impure
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'tanya: 'ul'achoto' mah talmud lomar? Harei shehayah holech lishchot et pischu velamul et bno, veshama shemet lo met, yakhol yitama —" English translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And to his sister" - what does the teaching come to say? If he was going to slaughter his Passover offering and circumcise his son, and he heard that one of them died, can he become ritually impure —

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ: ״לֹא יִטַּמָּא״. יָכוֹל כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא לַאֲחוֹתוֹ, כָּךְ אֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּלְאַחוֹתוֹ״. לַאֲחוֹתוֹ הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא, אֲבָל מִיטַּמֵּא לְמֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: You said: He shall not become impure; might Just as he does not become impure for his sister, so he does not become impure for a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ]. The verse states: “Or for his sister”; he may not become impure for his sister, but he does become impure for a met mitzva .
llm_translation: You said: "He shall not defile." I might have thought that just as he does not become impure for his sister, so too he does not become impure for a deceased relative out of obligation. Therefore, the verse teaches us: "And for his sister." It is specifically for his sister that he does not become impure, but he does become impure for a deceased relative out of obligation.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה וּמֵת מִצְוָה הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ עֲדִיף? מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה עֲדִיף מִשּׁוּם פַּרְסוֹמֵי נִיסָּא, אוֹ דִּלְמָא מֵת מִצְוָה עֲדִיף מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד הַבְּרִיּוֹת? בָּתַר דְּבַעְיָא הֲדַר פַּשְׁטַהּ: מֵת מִצְוָה עֲדִיף, דְּאָמַר מָר: גָּדוֹל כְּבוֹד הַבְּרִיּוֹת שֶׁדּוֹחֶה אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma: reading the Megilla and a met mitzva , which of them precedence? reading the Megilla precedence due to publicizing the miracle, or perhaps the met mitzva precedence due to human dignity? After he raised the dilemma, then resolved it met mitzva precedence, as the Master said: Great is human dignity, as it overrides a prohibition in the Torah.
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rava: Regarding the reading of the Megillah and burying the dead, which is preferable? Reading the Megillah is preferable due to the publicizing of the miracle, or perhaps burying the dead is preferable due to the honor of the creatures? After Rava inquired, he resolved it: Burying the dead is preferable, as the Master said: "Great is the honor of creatures, for it overrides a negative commandment in the Torah."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כְּרַךְ, וְכׇל הַסָּמוּךְ לוֹ, וְכׇל הַנִּרְאֶה עִמּוֹ — נִדּוֹן כִּכְרַךְ. תָּנָא: סָמוּךְ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִרְאֶה, נִרְאֶה — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ סָמוּךְ.
human_translation: the itself Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A city, and all adjacent to it, and all seen with it, considered like the city, taught adjacent although it cannot be seen can be seen although it is not adjacent
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: like a bundle, and all that is adjacent to it, and all that appears with it - is judged like the bundle. It was taught: adjacent - even though it is not seen, seen - even though it is not adjacent.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא נִרְאֶה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ סָמוּךְ, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּגוֹן דְּיָתְבָה בְּרֹאשׁ הָהָר. אֶלָּא סָמוּךְ אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִרְאֶה הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: שֶׁיּוֹשֶׁבֶת בַּנַּחַל.
human_translation: Granted can be seen although it is not adjacent you find it where is located on the top of a mountain, However, adjacent although it cannot be seen how can you find these Rabbi Yirmeya said: where is located in a valley,
llm_translation: In truth, it appears even though it is not adjacent, you find it like one who sits at the top of the mountain. But if it is adjacent, even though it is not visible, how do you find it? Rabbi Yirmiyah said: "She who sits in the valley."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כְּרַךְ שֶׁיָּשַׁב וּלְבַסּוֹף הוּקַּף — נִדּוֹן כִּכְפָר. מַאי טַעְמָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאִישׁ כִּי יִמְכּוֹר בֵּית מוֹשַׁב עִיר חוֹמָה״, שֶׁהוּקַּף וּלְבַסּוֹף יָשַׁב, וְלֹא שֶׁיָּשַׁב וּלְבַסּוֹף הוּקַּף.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A city that was settled and later surrounded is considered a village What is the reason? As it is written: “And if a man sells a residential house in a walled city” that was surrounded and later settled, and not that was settled and later surrounded
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A courtyard that was enclosed and then had a dwelling built within it - it is judged as a village. What is the reason? As it is written: "And if a man sells a dwelling house in a walled city," indicating that it was enclosed and then had a dwelling built within it, and not that it had a dwelling built within it and then was enclosed.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כְּרַךְ שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ עֲשָׂרָה בַּטְלָנִין — נִדּוֹן כִּכְפָר. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: אֵיזוֹ הִיא עִיר גְּדוֹלָה — כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ עֲשָׂרָה בַּטְלָנִין. פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן, הֲרֵי זֶה כְּפָר? כְּרַךְ אִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיקַּלְעִי לֵיהּ מֵעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A city that does not have ten idlers, is treated as a village. What is he teaching us? We learned What is a large city? Any in which there are ten idlers; fewer than that, it is a village. it was necessary city, even if happen to come there from elsewhere,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A city that does not have ten residents is judged like a village. What does this teach us? We learned: What is considered a large city? Any place that has ten residents. Less than this, it is considered a village. A city requires a wall, even though it is open to the world.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כְּרַךְ שֶׁחָרַב וּלְבַסּוֹף יָשַׁב נִדּוֹן כִּכְרַךְ. מַאי חָרַב? אִילֵּימָא חָרְבוּ חוֹמוֹתָיו: יָשַׁב — אִין, לֹא יָשַׁב — לָא? וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בַּר יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: ״אֲשֶׁר לוֹא חוֹמָה״, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ עַכְשָׁיו וְהָיָה לוֹ קוֹדֶם לָכֵן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A city that was destroyed and later settled is considered a city. What is destroyed? If we say walls were destroyed, settled, yes not settled, not Isn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer bar Yosei says: “Which has [ lo ] a wall even though does not have now, had before,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A city that was destroyed and in the end was resettled is judged like a newly built city. What is considered "destroyed"? If its walls were destroyed: if it was resettled - yes, if not - no? But it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer bar Yosei says: "which has no wall," even though it currently does not have one, but it had one previously.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי ״חָרַב״ — שֶׁחָרַב מֵעֲשָׂרָה בַּטְלָנִין.
human_translation: Rather, what is destroyed? That it was destroyed ten idlers,
llm_translation: Rather, what is the meaning of "charav" - that it nullifies from ten to nine.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי:
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said:
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said:

hebrew_text: לוֹד וְאוֹנוֹ וְגֵיא הַחֲרָשִׁים — מוּקָּפוֹת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן הֲווֹ.
human_translation: Lod, and Ono, and Gei HeḤarashim that have been surrounded since the days of Joshua, son of Nun.
llm_translation: Lod and Ono and the Valley of Craftsmen - surrounded by a wall since the days of Joshua son of Nun.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּנַנְהִי? וְהָא אֶלְפַּעַל בְּנַנְהִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״[וּ]בְנֵי אֶלְפַּעַל עֵבֶר וּמִשְׁעָם וָשָׁמֶר הוּא בָּנָה אֶת אוֹנוֹ וְאֶת לוֹד וּבְנוֹתֶיהָ״! וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, אָסָא בְּנַנְהִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּבֶן (אָסָא אֶת עָרֵי הַבְּצוּרוֹת אֲשֶׁר לִיהוּדָה)״.
human_translation: Did Joshua build these Didn’t Elpaal build them as it is written: “And the sons of Elpaal: Eber, and Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod, with its hamlets” According to your reasoning, Asa, built them, as it is written: “And he, built fortified cities in Judah”
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: And these are the descendants of Yehoshua in Nannhi? But this is Elpaal in Nannhi, as it is written: "And the sons of Elpaal: Eber, and Misham, and Shamed, who built Ono and Lod with its towns"! And according to your reasoning, Asa is in Nannhi, as it is written: "And Asa built (the fortified cities of Judah)".

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הָנֵי מוּקָּפוֹת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן הֲווֹ. חֲרוּב בִּימֵי פִּילֶגֶשׁ בְּגִבְעָה, וַאֲתָא אֶלְפַּעַל בְּנַנְהִי. הֲדוּר אִינְּפוּל, אֲתָא אָסָא שַׁפְּצִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: These were surrounded by a wall since the days of Joshua, son of Nun, were destroyed in the days of the concubine in Gibea, Elpaal came and built them They then fell Asa came and restored them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Those walls were from the days of Joshua son of Nun. A carob tree during the days of Philegesh in Gibeah, and Elpaal came and uprooted it. When it was replanted, Asa came and fixed it.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לִיהוּדָה נִבְנֶה אֶת הֶעָרִים הָאֵלֶּה״, מִכְּלָל דְּעָרִים הֲווֹ מֵעִיקָּרָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is also precise as it is written  “And he said to Judah: Let us build these cities” by inference that they had been cities at the outset, learn from this
llm_translation: It is precise, as it is written: "And he said to Judah, let us build these cities," from the general principle that cities were originally included. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת בְּמִקְרָא מְגִילָּה, שֶׁאַף הֵן הָיוּ בְּאוֹתוֹ הַנֵּס. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: פּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, שׁוֹאֲלִין וְדוֹרְשִׁין בְּעִנְיָנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Women are obligated in the reading of the Megilla, as they too were in that miracle. And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Purim occurs on Shabbat, one asks and expounds upon the subject of the day.
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Women are obligated in the reading of the Megillah, for they too were part of that miracle. And said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Regarding Purim that falls on Shabbat, one may inquire and expound on the matters of that day.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִרְיָא פּוּרִים? אֲפִילּוּ יוֹם טוֹב נָמֵי! דְּתַנְיָא: מֹשֶׁה תִּיקֵּן לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיְּהוּ שׁוֹאֲלִין וְדוֹרְשִׁין בְּעִנְיָנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹם: הִלְכוֹת פֶּסַח בַּפֶּסַח, הִלְכוֹת עֲצֶרֶת בָּעֲצֶרֶת, וְהִלְכוֹת חַג בֶּחָג!
human_translation: Why specify Purim? also to the Festivals, as it is taught Moses enacted for the Jewish people that they should ask and expound upon the subject of the day: the halakhot of Passover on Passover, the halakhot of Shavuot on Shavuot , and halakhot of the festival on the festival
llm_translation: What is the reading of Purim? Even on a festival day! As it was taught: Moses established for the Israelites that they may inquire and expound on the matter of the day: The laws of Passover on Passover, the laws of Shavuot on Shavuot, and the laws of Sukkot on Sukkot!

hebrew_text: פּוּרִים אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נִגְזוֹר מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבָּה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: It was necessary for Purim, lest you say we should decree due to Rabba, therefore teaches us
llm_translation: Purim is necessary for him, what you might say: it is decreed because of Rabah, he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: חַיָּיב אָדָם לִקְרוֹת אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה בַּלַּיְלָה וְלִשְׁנוֹתָהּ בַּיּוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֱלֹהַי אֶקְרָא יוֹמָם וְלֹא תַעֲנֶה וְלַיְלָה וְלֹא דוּמִיָּה לִי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said A person is obligated to read the Megilla at night and to repeat it lishnota during the day, as it is stated: “O my God, I call by day but You do not answer; and at night, and there is no surcease for me”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A person is obligated to read the Megillah at night and to repeat it during the day, as it is stated: "My God, I call out by day, and You do not answer, and at night, and there is no silence for me."

hebrew_text: סְבוּר מִינָּה לְמִקְרְיַיהּ בְּלֵילְיָא וּלְמִיתְנֵא מַתְנִיתִין דִּידַהּ בִּימָמָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לְדִידִי מִיפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, כְּגוֹן דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אֶעֱבוֹר פָּרַשְׁתָּא דָּא וְאֶתְנְיַיהּ.
human_translation: understood from it to read at night and to study its Mishna by day, Rabbi Yirmeya said to them: It was explained to me by Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba himself for example, as people say: I will conclude this section and repeat it,
llm_translation: He thought to read it in the night and to teach our Mishnah in the day. Rabbi Yirmeya said to them: In my opinion, the explanation of Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba's teaching is clear to me, such as when people say: "I will pass over this chapter and teach it."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ אָמַר עוּלָּא בִּירָאָה: חַיָּיב אָדָם לִקְרוֹת אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה בַּלַּיְלָה וְלִשְׁנוֹתָהּ בַּיּוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְמַעַן יְזַמֶּרְךָ כָבוֹד וְלֹא יִדּוֹם ה׳ אֱלֹהַי לְעוֹלָם אוֹדֶךָּ״.
human_translation: was also stated Rabbi Ḥelbo said Ulla Bira’a said: A person is obligated to read the Megilla at night and repeat it during the day, as it is stated: “So that my glory may sing praise to You and not be silent; O Lord, my God, I will give thanks to You forever”
llm_translation: It was stated similarly: Rabbi Helbo said Ulai in fear: A person is obligated to read the Megillah at night and to repeat it during the day, as it is stated: "So that my glory may sing praise to You and not be silent; Hashem, my God, I will thank You forever."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שֶׁהַכְּפָרִים מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: חֲכָמִים הֵקֵילּוּ עַל הַכְּפָרִים לִהְיוֹת מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּסַפְּקוּ מַיִם וּמָזוֹן לַאֲחֵיהֶם שֶׁבַּכְּרַכִּין.
human_translation: however, villages may advance to the day of assembly, Rabbi Ḥanina said: The Sages were lenient with the villages to advance to the day of assembly, so that they provide water and food to their brethren in the cities
llm_translation: Rather, the villages precede the day of entry. Rabbi Chanina said: The sages were lenient with the villages to precede the day of entry so that they may provide water and sustenance for their brethren in the cities.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּתַקַּנְתָּא דִכְרַכִּין הָוֵי? וְהָתְנַן: חָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשֵּׁנִי — כְּפָרִים וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם. וְאִם אִיתָא, לַיקְדְּמוּ לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה! הָווּ לְהוּ עֲשָׂרָה, וַעֲשָׂרָה לָא תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Is that to say that for the benefit of the cities? Didn’t we learn occurred on a Monday, the villages and large towns read it on that very day? If it is so, let advance to the day of assembly for them the tenth and the Sages did not establish the tenth
llm_translation: In the matter of the enactment of reading the Megillah in unwalled cities, what is the law? And we learned in a Mishnah: If it falls on the second day of Adar, villages and large towns read it on that day. And if it comes, let them advance it to the day of entry! They should be ten, and ten the Rabbis did not enact.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: חָל לִהְיוֹת בַּחֲמִישִׁי — כְּפָרִים וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם, וְאִם אִיתָא, לַיקְדְּמוּ לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה דְּאַחַד עָשָׂר הוּא! מִיּוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה לָא דָּחֵינַן.
human_translation: Come hear occurs on a Thursday, the villages and large towns read on that day, and the walled cities on the next day, If it is so, let advance to the day of assembly, the eleventh We do not defer from day of assembly to day of assembly.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If the fifteenth falls on a weekday, villages and large towns read it on that day. And if it happens to fall on the day of the new moon, which is the eleventh day, we do not postpone from one new moon to another.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי — בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנִּכְנָסִים בַּשֵּׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי, אֲבָל מְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין נִכְנָסִים בַּשֵּׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי — אֵין קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ תַּקַּנְתָּא דִכְרַכִּין הִיא — מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין נִכְנָסִים בַּשֵּׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי מַפְסְדִי לְהוּ לִכְרַכִּין?
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda said: When In a place where enter on Monday and Thursday. However, place where they do not enter on Monday and Thursday, one may read only in its time, If it enters your mind the benefit of the cities, because do not enter on Monday and Thursday the cities lose out
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Yehuda said: When? - In a place where they enter on Monday and Thursday, but in a place where they do not enter on Monday and Thursday - they only read it at its proper time. And if you think that it is a decree of the scribes - because they do not enter on Monday and Thursday, it would be a loss for the scribes?

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּסַפְּקוּ מַיִם וּמָזוֹן, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּסַפְּקִים מַיִם וּמָזוֹן לַאֲחֵיהֶם שֶׁבַּכְּרַכִּין.
human_translation: Do not say so that they provide water and food to their brethren in the cities Rather, say because supply water and food to their brethren in the cities.
llm_translation: Do not say, "enough for them to have water and food," rather say: "because they provide water and food for their brothers in the villages."

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? חָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשֵּׁנִי בַּשַּׁבָּת — כְּפָרִים וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם וְכוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא דְּנָקֵט סִידּוּרָא דְיַרְחָא, וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא דְּנָקֵט סִידּוּרָא דְיוֹמֵי?
human_translation: How so? occurs on Monday, the villages and large towns read on that day. What is different the first clause which employs the order of the month, and the latter clause, which employs the order of the days
llm_translation: How so? If it falls on the second day of Shabbat - villages and large towns read it on that day, etc. What is different about the beginning that it is called the arrangement of the month, and what is different about the end that it is called the arrangement of the days?

hebrew_text: אַיְּידֵי דְּמִיתְהַפְכִי לֵיהּ נָקֵט סִידּוּרָא דְיוֹמֵי.
human_translation: Since would be reversed employed the order of the days
llm_translation: By the fact that he overturned for him the order of the days.

hebrew_text: חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת וְכוּ׳. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? אִי רַבִּי, אִי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: occurs on Shabbat eve, Whose mishna? either Rabbi or Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: It happened to be on Erev Shabbat, etc. Mishnah: Who is the Tanna? Either Rabbi or Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי? דְּתַנְיָא: חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — כְּפָרִים וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה, וּמוּקָּפִין חוֹמָה קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר, אוֹמֵר אֲנִי: לֹא יִדָּחוּ עֲיָירוֹת מִמְּקוֹמָן, אֶלָּא אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם.
human_translation: What is Rabbi As it is taught occurs on Shabbat eve, villages and large towns advance to the day of assembly, and walled cities read it on the day Rabbi says: I say the towns should not be deferred from their date, Rather, both these, and those, read on the day
llm_translation: What is the ruling of Rabbi? For it was taught: If it is close to the eve of Shabbat - villages and large towns prioritize the day of entry, and they encircle it with a wall and read in it during the day. Rabbi says, I say: The towns should not be displaced from their place, rather both these and those read in it during the day.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״. מָה כׇּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה עֲיָירוֹת קוֹדְמוֹת לַמּוּקָּפִין, אַף כָּאן עֲיָירוֹת קוֹדְמוֹת לַמּוּקָּפִין.
human_translation: What is the reason of the first tanna ? as it is written: in every year” Just as every year towns precede the walled cities so too here the towns precede the walled cities
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna taught? For it is written: "Every year and year." Just as every year and year, the cities that are closer to the walls take precedence, so too here, the cities that are closer to the walls take precedence.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״, מָה כׇּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה אֵין נִדְחִין עֲיָירוֹת מִמְּקוֹמָן — אַף כָּאן לֹא יִדָּחוּ עֲיָירוֹת מִמְּקוֹמָן! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: Say “in every year” just as every year the the towns are not deferred from their date so too here the the towns should not be deferred from their date Here it is different, as it is not possible
llm_translation: And why? "Every year and year," what is the meaning of "every year and year" that cities are not pushed from their place - so too here, cities should not be pushed from their place! The case here is different because it is not possible.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי, מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ? ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״, מָה כׇּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה אֵין עֲיָירוֹת נִדְחִין מִמְּקוֹמָן — אַף כָּאן לֹא יִדָּחוּ עֲיָירוֹת מִמְּקוֹמָן.
human_translation: And Rabbi what is reason? “in every year”; just as every year the the towns are not deferred from their date so too here, the the towns are not deferred from their date,
llm_translation: Rabbi, what is his reasoning? "Every year," just as every year cities are not displaced from their place, so too here cities should not be displaced from their place.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״, מָה כׇּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה עֲיָירוֹת קוֹדְמוֹת לַמּוּקָּפִין — אַף כָּאן נָמֵי עֲיָירוֹת קוֹדְמוֹת לַמּוּקָּפִין! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: Say “in every year” just as every year the towns precede the walled cities so too here the towns precede the walled cities Here it is different, as it is not possible
llm_translation: "And why? 'Every year and year,' what is 'every year and year'? Towns that are east of the encircling walls. So too here, towns that are east of the encircling walls! The case here is different, as it is not possible."

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי? דְּתַנְיָא: חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מוּקָּפִין וּכְפָרִים מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה, וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין מוּקָּפִין קוֹדְמִין לַעֲיָירוֹת, אֶלָּא אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ קוֹרִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם.
human_translation: What is Rabbi Yosei? As it is taught occurs on Shabbat eve, the walled cities and villages advance to the day of assembly, and the large towns read on the day itself. Rabbi Yosei says: The walled cities never precede the towns; rather, both these, and those, read on that day,
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi Yosei? As it was taught: If Erev Shabbat coincides with Erev Yom Kippur, villages and cities precede the day of entry, and large cities read it on the day. Rabbi Yosei says: Villages do not precede the cities, rather both read it on the day.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא? דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״, מָה כׇּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה עֲיָירוֹת בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, וּזְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לֹא זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה — אַף כָּאן עֲיָירוֹת בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, וּזְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לֹא זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה.
human_translation: What is the reason of the first tanna ? As it is written: “In every year”; just as every year the towns on the fourteenth, and the time for this is not the time for that so too here, the towns on the fourteenth, and the time for this is not the time for that
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna taught? For it is written: "Every year," just as every year there are fourteen cities, and the time of this one is not the time of that one - so too here, there are fourteen cities, and the time of this one is not the time of that one.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״, מָה כׇּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה אֵין מוּקָּפִין קוֹדְמִין לָעֲיָירוֹת, אַף כָּאן אֵין מוּקָּפִין קוֹדְמִין לָעֲיָירוֹת! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: Say “in every year” just as every year the walled cities do not precede the towns, so too here, the walled cities do not precede the towns. Here it is different, as it is not possible
llm_translation: "And why? 'Every year and year,' what is the meaning of 'every year and year' that they do not encompass the boundaries before the cities, so too here they do not encompass the boundaries before the cities! The case here is different, as it is not possible."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״, מָה כׇּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה אֵין מוּקָּפִין קוֹדְמִין לָעֲיָירוֹת — אַף כָּאן אֵין מוּקָּפִין קוֹדְמִין לָעֲיָירוֹת.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei? “in every year”; just as every year the walled cities do not precede the so too here, the walled cities do not precede the towns.
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei? "Every year," just as every year they do not encompass the cities before the reading of the Megillah - so too here they do not encompass the cities before the reading of the Megillah.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״, מָה כׇּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לֹא זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה — אַף כָּאן זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לֹא זְמַנּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: Say “in every year” indicate just as every year, the time for this is not the time for that so too here, the time for this is not the time for that Here it is different, as it is not possible
llm_translation: "And why? 'Every year,' what is 'every year'? The time of this one is not the time of that one - so too here, the time of this one is not the time of that one! The case is different here, for it is not possible."

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי עֲיָירוֹת לָא דָּחִינַן לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — כְּפָרִים מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה, וַעֲיָירוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת קוֹרִין בָּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וּמוּקָּפוֹת חוֹמָה לְמָחָר. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר, אוֹמֵר אֲנִי: הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחוּ עֲיָירוֹת מִמְּקוֹמָן — יִדָּחוּ לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה.
human_translation: Does Rabbi hold that one does not defer to the day of assembly? Isn’t it taught occurs on Shabbat, the villages advance to the day of assembly, the large towns read on Shabbat eve, and the walled cities the next day, Rabbi says: I say since the the towns were deferred from their date, they are deferred to the day of assembly,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Ayyarot thought we do not push off to the day of the entrance? And it was taught: If it fell on Shabbat — villages precede the day of the entrance, and large cities read it on Friday evening, and walled cities read it the next day. Rabbi says, I say: Since the villages were pushed off from their place — they should be pushed off to the day of the entrance.

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא? הָתָם זְמַנָּם שַׁבָּת הִיא, וְהוֹאִיל דְּנִדְחוּ — יִדָּחוּ. וְהָכָא, זְמַנָּם עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת!
