human_translation: How can be compared? There, time for them is Shabbat, since deferred, they are deferred Here, their time is Shabbat eve,
llm_translation: So now? There, their time is the Sabbath, and since they are rejected, they shall be rejected. And here, their time is the eve of the Sabbath!

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: פּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — הַכֹּל נִדְחִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה. הַכֹּל נִדְחִין סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! וְהָא אִיכָּא מוּקָּפִין דְּעָבְדִי לִמְחַר! אֶלָּא: כׇּל הַנִּדְחֶה יִדָּחֶה לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rabbi Ḥelbo said Rav Huna said: Purim occurs on Shabbat, all deferred to the day of assembly? Can it enter your mind all Aren’t there walled cities that perform the next day, Rather, All that are deferred are deferred to the day of assembly. In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: As to where it goes, this is what Rabbi Helbo said in the name of Rav Huna: "If Purim falls on Shabbat - everything is pushed off to the following day." "Everything is pushed off? Is it really your opinion?" But there are those who make preparations for the next day! Rather, everything that is pushed off, shall be pushed off to the following day. As to where - like Rabbi.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהָא מְגִילָּה בְּשַׁבָּת לָא קָרִינַן. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבָּה: הַכֹּל חַיָּיבִין בִּקְרִיאַת מְגִילָּה (וּבִתְקִיעַת שׁוֹפָר), וְאֵין הַכֹּל בְּקִיאִין בְּמִקְרָא מְגִילָּה. גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִטְּלֶנָּה בְּיָדוֹ וְיֵלֵךְ אֵצֶל בָּקִי לִלְמוֹד, וְיַעֲבִירֶנָּה אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: In any case, everyone agrees that one does not read the on Shabbat. What is the reason Rabba said: Everyone is obligated reading the Megilla and blowing the shofar and not everyone is proficient in reading the Megilla. decree lest one take in his hand and go to an expert to learn and, carry it four cubits in the public domain,
llm_translation: The people of the world are not accustomed to reading the Megillah on Shabbat. What is the reason? Rabba said: Everyone is obligated in the reading of the Megillah (and in the blowing of the shofar), but not everyone is knowledgeable in the reading of the Megillah. It is a decree lest one take it in his hand and go to an expert to learn, and he will carry it four cubits in a public domain.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְשׁוֹפָר. וְהַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְלוּלָב.
human_translation: And this is the reason that the shofar And this is the reason the lulav
llm_translation: And this is the reason of the shofar. And this is the reason of the lulav.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעֵינֵיהֶן שֶׁל עֲנִיִּים נְשׂוּאוֹת בְּמִקְרָא מְגִילָּה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ כְּפָרִים מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה — גּוֹבִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם, וּמְחַלְּקִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said Because the eyes of the poor are raised to the reading of the Megilla. this is also taught Even though said that the villages advance to the day of assembly, they collect on that day, and they distribute on that day.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Because the eyes of the poor are uplifted in the Megillah reading. It was also taught likewise: Even though they said that villages may advance the day of collection, they collect on that day and distribute on that day.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ? אַדְּרַבָּה, מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרוּ הוּא! אֶלָּא: הוֹאִיל וְאָמְרוּ שֶׁכְּפָרִים מַקְדִּימִין לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה — גּוֹבִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם, וּמְחַלְּקִין בּוֹ בַיּוֹם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעֵינֵיהֶם שֶׁל עֲנִיִּים נְשׂוּאוֹת בְּמִקְרָא מְגִילָּה. אֲבָל
human_translation: Even though said? On the contrary, because they said Rather, Since said that the villages advance to the day of assembly, they collect on that day and they distribute on that day, because the eyes of the poor are raised to the reading of the Megilla, However,
llm_translation: Even though they said? On the contrary, because they said! Rather, since they said that villages precede the Day of Atonement - we collect charity on that day, and we distribute on that day, because the eyes of the poor are raised expectantly on the Megillah reading. But

hebrew_text: שִׂמְחָה, אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ.
human_translation: the rejoicing is practiced only in its time,
llm_translation: Joy, it is not customary except in its time.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מְגִילָּה בִּזְמַנָּהּ — קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ אֲפִילּוּ בְּיָחִיד, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ — בַּעֲשָׂרָה. רַב אַסִּי אָמַר: בֵּין בִּזְמַנָּהּ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ — בַּעֲשָׂרָה. הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא, וְחַשׁ לֵיהּ רַב לְהָא דְּרַב אַסִּי.
human_translation: Rav said: One may read the Megilla in its time, even privately. not at its time, with ten, Rav Asi said: Both at its time and not at its time, with ten. there was an incident Rav and he was concerned for this Rav Asi
llm_translation: Rav said: "If one reads the Megillah at its proper time - one may read it even individually; if not at its proper time - with a minyan of ten." Rav Assi said: "Whether at its proper time or not at its proper time - with a minyan of ten." There was an incident, and Rav was concerned for the opinion of Rav Assi.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַב הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: פּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת זְמַנָּם. עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת זְמַנָּם?! וְהָא שַׁבָּת זְמַנָּם הוּא! אֶלָּא לָאו הָכִי קָאָמַר: שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּם כִּזְמַנָּם. מָה זְמַנָּם — אֲפִילּוּ בְּיָחִיד, אַף שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּם — אֲפִילּוּ בְּיָחִיד?
human_translation: And did Rav say this, Didn’t Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, say in the name of Rav: Purim occurs on Shabbat, Shabbat eve is time Shabbat eve time Isn’t Shabbat its time? Rather, is it not that this is what said, not at its time is like at its time; just as at its time, even privately, so too, not at its time, even privately.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said it, Rav Haki? And Rav Yehudah son of Rav Shmuel bar Shilat said in the name of Rav: Purim that falls on Shabbat - their time is on Erev Shabbat. Their time is on Erev Shabbat?! But Shabbat is their time! Rather, this is what he is saying: Not at their time like their time. What is their time - even in private, not at their time - even in private?"

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעִנְיַן מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה בַּעֲשָׂרָה. אֶלָּא מַאי ״עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת זְמַנָּם״ — לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי, דְּאָמַר: הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחוּ עֲיָירוֹת מִמְּקוֹמָן — יִדָּחוּ לְיוֹם הַכְּנִיסָה, הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת זְמַנָּם הוּא.
human_translation: not with regard to reading the Megilla with ten. Rather, what Shabbat eve is time? to exclude Rabbi who said: Since the towns were deferred from their date they are deferred to the day of assembly. This teaches us that Shabbat eve is time
llm_translation: Not for the purpose of the reading of the Megillah on the tenth. Rather, what is "their appointed time on Friday" - to go out from Rabbi, for he said: Since the villages were pushed from their place, they should be pushed to the day of the gathering. This teaches us that "their appointed time on Friday" is it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אִי זוֹ הִיא עִיר גְּדוֹלָה — כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ עֲשָׂרָה בַּטְלָנִין. פָּחוֹת מִכָּאן — הֲרֵי זֶה כְּפָר.
human_translation: What is a large city, Any in which there are ten idlers. fewer than that, it is a village,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Which is a large city? — Any place that has ten Batlanim. Less than this — it is considered a village.

hebrew_text: בְּאֵלּוּ אָמְרוּ מַקְדִּימִין וְלֹא מְאַחֲרִין. אֲבָל זְמַן עֲצֵי כֹּהֲנִים, וְתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב, חֲגִיגָה, וְהַקְהֵל — מְאַחֲרִין וְלֹא מַקְדִּימִין.
human_translation: It was with regard to these said one advances and one does not postpone However, the time priests wood Ninth of Av; Festival and the assembly hakhel one postpones and does not advance
llm_translation: In these cases they said we precede and do not delay. But with regards to the time of the cutting of the priests, and the ninth of Av, the festival offering, and the assembly — we delay and do not precede.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ מַקְדִּימִין וְלֹא מְאַחֲרִין — מוּתָּרִין בְּהֶסְפֵּד וּבְתַעֲנִית, וּמַתָּנוֹת לָאֶבְיוֹנִים. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי? מְקוֹם שֶׁנִּכְנָסִין בְּשֵׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי. אֲבָל מְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין נִכְנָסִין לֹא בַּשֵּׁנִי וְלֹא בַּחֲמִישִׁי — אֵין קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ אֶלָּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ.
human_translation: Even though said one advances and one does not postpone permitted eulogize and fast gifts for the poor Rabbi Yehuda said: When a place where enter on Monday and Thursday. However, a place where they do not enter on Monday and Thursday, one may read only in its time,
llm_translation: Even though they said we advance and do not delay, they are permitted in eulogizing, fasting, and giving gifts to the poor. Rabbi Yehuda said: When? In a place where they enter on Monday and Thursday. But in a place where they do not enter neither on Monday nor on Thursday, it is not read except in its proper time.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: עֲשָׂרָה בַּטְלָנִין שֶׁבְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת.
human_translation: taught ten idlers that are in the synagogue,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Asarah batlanin shebeveit haknesset. English translation: Gemara: Ten idle men in the synagogue.

hebrew_text: בְּאֵלּוּ, אָמְרוּ מַקְדִּימִין וְלֹא מְאַחֲרִין. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אָמַר קְרָא ״וְלֹא יַעֲבוֹר״.
human_translation: It was with regard to these said one advances and one does not postpone What is the reason Rabbi Abba said Shmuel said: verse states: and it shall not pass,
llm_translation: In these cases, they said we advance and do not delay. What is the reason? Rabbi Abba said in the name of Shmuel: The verse said, "and they shall not pass."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין מוֹנִין יָמִים לַשָּׁנִים — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְחׇדְשֵׁי הַשָּׁנָה״ — חֳדָשִׁים אַתָּה מוֹנֶה לַשָּׁנִים, וְאִי אַתָּה מוֹנֶה יָמִים לַשָּׁנִים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Abba said Shmuel said: From where that one does not count days to years, As it is stated: “Of the months of the year” you count months to years, but you do not count days years.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Abba said in the name of Shmuel: From where do we derive that we do not count days for years? As it is stated: "For the months of the year" - you count months for years, but you do not count days for years.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן דְּקֵיסָרִי מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמְרוּ: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין מְחַשְּׁבִין שָׁעוֹת לֶחֳדָשִׁים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַד חֹדֶשׁ יָמִים״. יָמִים אַתָּה מְחַשֵּׁב לֶחֳדָשִׁים, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַשֵּׁב שָׁעוֹת לֶחֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: And the Sages of Caesarea said in the name of Rabbi Abba: From where that one does not calculate hours to months? As it is stated: “Until a month of days” you calculate days to months, but you do not calculate hours to months.
llm_translation: The sages of Caesarea in the name of Rabbi Abba said: From where do we derive that we do not calculate hours for months, as it is stated: "Until a month of days." Days you may calculate for months, but you may not calculate hours for months.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל זְמַן עֲצֵי כֹהֲנִים וְתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב וַחֲגִיגָה וְהַקְהֵל — מְאַחֲרִין וְלֹא מַקְדִּימִין. תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב — אַקְדּוֹמֵי פּוּרְעָנוּת לָא מַקְדְּמִי. חֲגִיגָה וְהַקְהֵל — מִשּׁוּם דְּאַכַּתִּי לָא מְטָא זְמַן חִיּוּבַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: However, the time priests wood the Ninth of Av, the Festival and the assembly [ hakhel ], one postpones and does not advance the Ninth of Av one does not advance calamity; The Festival and the assembly [ hakhel ] because the time of their obligation has not yet arrived,
llm_translation: But the time of the wood-offerings of the priests, and the ninth of Av, and the festival offering, and the assembly - they delay and do not advance. The ninth of Av - the precedence of affliction does not advance. The festival offering and the assembly - because they are alike, their obligation does not come at its appointed time.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: חֲגִיגָה וְכׇל זְמַן חֲגִיגָה מְאַחֲרִין. בִּשְׁלָמָא חֲגִיגָה, דְּאִי מִיקְּלַע בְּשַׁבְּתָא מְאַחֲרִינַן לַהּ לְבָתַר שַׁבְּתָא. אֶלָּא זְמַן חֲגִיגָה מַאי הִיא?
human_translation: It was taught One postpones the Festival and the entire time of the Festival Granted Festival that if occurs on Shabbat, one postpones it until after Shabbat However, what is The time of the Festival
llm_translation: The text states: It was taught: Regarding the festival offering and any time of the festival offering, we delay. Regarding the festival offering, it is understandable, for if it becomes mixed up on Shabbat, we delay it until after Shabbat. But what is the time of the festival offering?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: חֲגִיגָה בְּשַׁבָּת, וְעוֹלַת רְאִיָּיה אֲפִילּוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב, דִּזְמַן חֲגִיגָה — מְאַחֲרִין.
human_translation: Rav Oshaya said: This is what is saying: the Festival on Shabbat, and one postpones the of appearance even the Festival the time Festival
llm_translation: Rav Oshaya said, thus he said: A festival offering on Shabbat, and a burnt offering for sighting the new moon even on a festival day, when the time for the festival offering has passed, they delay.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא, דִּתְנַן, [בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים]: מְבִיאִין שְׁלָמִים בְּיוֹם טוֹב, וְאֵין סוֹמְכִין עֲלֵיהֶן,
human_translation: Whose It is Beit Shammai, as we learned Beit Shammai say: One may bring on a Festival And one may not place hands
llm_translation: Mani - Beit Shammai she, ditnan, Beit Shammai omrim: meviin shelamim beyom tov, ve'ein somchin aleihen.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא עוֹלוֹת. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְבִיאִין שְׁלָמִים וְעוֹלוֹת וְסוֹמְכִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: However, may not Beit Hillel say: One may bring and and one may place hands on them.
llm_translation: But not burnt offerings. And Beit Hillel says: One may bring peace offerings and burnt offerings and rely on them.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: חֲגִיגָה, כׇּל זְמַן חֲגִיגָה — מְאַחֲרִין, טְפֵי — לָא. דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁלֹּא חָג בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג — חוֹגֵג וְהוֹלֵךְ אֶת כָּל הָרֶגֶל כּוּלּוֹ, וְיוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג. עָבַר הָרֶגֶל וְלֹא חָג — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said One postpones the Festival for the entire time of the Festival not longer As we learned One who did not offer the Festival on the first Festival day of the festival may offer the Festival for the entire pilgrimage Festival, and the last day of the Festival. the pilgrimage Festival has passed and he did not bring the Festival he is not obligated restitution it.
llm_translation: Rava said: "Chagigah, as long as it is Chagigah - delay, Tefei - no." For it was taught: "One who did not celebrate on the first day of the festival - celebrates and observes the entire pilgrimage festival, and the last day of the festival. If the festival has passed and he did not celebrate - he is not obligated in its aftermath."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: חֲגִיגָה וְכׇל זְמַן חֲגִיגָה — מְאַחֲרִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ עֲצֶרֶת דְּחַד יוֹמָא — מְאַחֲרִין, דִּתְנַן: מוֹדִים שֶׁאִם חָל עֲצֶרֶת לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — שֶׁיּוֹם טְבוֹחַ אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said The Festival may be postponed for the entire time of a Festival even Shavuot , which is one day, one postpones As we learned concede that if Shavuot occurs on Shabbat, the day of slaughter is after Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: "Chagigah and any time of Chagigah - delay, and even Shemini Atzeret of one day - delay, as we learned: they agree that if Shemini Atzeret falls on Shabbat - the day of slaughter is after Shabbat."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: רַבִּי נָטַע נְטִיעָה בְּפוּרִים,
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: Rabbi He planted a sapling on Purim,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Chanina: Rabbi Nata planted a planting in Purim.

hebrew_text: וְרָחַץ בִּקְרוֹנָהּ שֶׁל צִפּוֹרִי בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר בְּתַמּוּז, וּבִקֵּשׁ לַעֲקוֹר תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב — וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: And he bathed wagons [ kerona ] Tzippori, on the seventeenth of Tammuz, And he sought to abolish the Ninth of Av. And did not agree with him.
llm_translation: And he shall wash the nest of a bird on the seventeenth of Tamuz, and he sought to uproot on the ninth of Av - and they did not acknowledge him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא: רַבִּי, לֹא כָּךְ הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה. אֶלָּא תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת הֲוָה, וּדְחִינוּהוּ לְאַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת. וְאָמַר רַבִּי: הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחָה — יִדָּחֶה, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ חֲכָמִים. קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ: ״טוֹבִים הַשְּׁנַיִם מִן הָאֶחָד״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Zavda said to My teacher, the incident did not this Rather, it was the Ninth of Av occurred on Shabbat, and they postponed it until after Shabbat. And Rabbi said Since it has been deferred let it be deferred And the Rabbis did not agree with him. read about “Two are better than one”
llm_translation: He said before him, Rabbi Abba bar Zavda: Rabbi, it was not so. Rather, on the ninth of Av, which fell on Shabbat, we postponed it to after Shabbat. And Rabbi said: Since it was postponed, let it be postponed, and the sages did not agree. He recited regarding it: "Two are better than one."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי הֵיכִי נָטַע נְטִיעָה בְּפוּרִים? וְהָתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״שִׂמְחָה וּמִשְׁתֶּה וְיוֹם טוֹב״, ״שִׂמְחָה״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאֲסוּרִים בְּהֶסְפֵּד, ״מִשְׁתֶּה״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאָסוּר בְּתַעֲנִית, ״וְיוֹם טוֹב״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה! אֶלָּא: רַבִּי, בַּר אַרְבֵּיסַר הֲוָה, וְכִי נְטַע — בַּחֲמֵיסַר נְטַע.
human_translation: And how Rabbi plant a sapling on Purim? Didn’t Rav Yosef teach gladness and feasting, and a good day [ yom tov ]” “gladness” teaches that prohibited eulogize “feasting” teaches that prohibited fast; and “good day” [ yom tov ] teaches that prohibited perform labor, Rather, Rabbi on the fourteenth, and when he planted he planted on the fifteenth.
llm_translation: Rabbi, how did he plant a sapling in Purim? And it was taught by Rav Yosef: "Joy, feasting, and a good day," "joy" - teaches that eulogies are forbidden, "feasting" - teaches that fasting is forbidden, "and a good day" - teaches that work is forbidden! Rather, Rabbi, it was in the month of Adar, and when he planted - he planted in chickpeas.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא רַבִּי בִּטְבֶרְיָא הֲוָה, וּטְבֶרְיָא מוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן הֲוַאי! אֶלָּא, רַבִּי בַּר חֲמֵיסָר הֲוָה, וְכִי נְטַע — בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר הֲוָה.
human_translation: Is that so? Wasn’t Rabbi in Tiberias, and Tiberias was surrounded by a wall since the days of Joshua, son of Nun. Rather, Rabbi on the fifteenth, and when he planted he planted on the fourteenth.
llm_translation: I? But wasn't Rabbi in Tiberias, and Tiberias was surrounded by a wall from the days of Joshua son of Nun! Rather, it was Rabbi Bar Ḥamisa, and when he planted — it was in the month of Av.

hebrew_text: וּמִי פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דִּטְבֶרְיָא מוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן? וְהָא חִזְקִיָּה קָרֵי בִּטְבֶרְיָא בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר וּבַחֲמֵיסַר? מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי מוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן הִיא אִי לָא. לְחִזְקִיָּה מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ, לְרַבִּי פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Was it obvious to that Tiberias was surrounded by a wall since the days of Joshua, son of Nun? Didn’t Hezekiah read in Tiberias on the fourteenth and on the fifteenth he was uncertain if surrounded by a wall since the days of Joshua, son of Nun, or not? Hezekiah was uncertain it was obvious to Rabbi
llm_translation: And who can definitively say that Tiberias was surrounded by a wall from the days of Joshua son of Nun? But Hezekiah called it Tiberias in the twelfth and thirteenth years of his reign. It is uncertain for him whether it was surrounded by a wall from the days of Joshua son of Nun or not. It is uncertain for Hezekiah, but it is definitive for Rabbi.

hebrew_text: וְכִי פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ, מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָכְתִיב בִּמְגִילַּת תַּעֲנִית: אֵת יוֹם אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר וְאֵת יוֹם חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר יוֹמֵי פּוּרַיָּא אִינּוּן, דְּלָא לְמִסְפַּד בְּהוֹן,
human_translation: And when it was obvious to was it permitted Isn’t it written in Megillat Ta’anit the fourteenth day and the fifteenth day of Adar are the days of Purim, one is not to eulogize on them?
llm_translation: And when it is obvious to him, is it permitted? But it is written in the Scroll of Fasting: "The fourteenth day and the fifteenth day of Adar are days of Purim, not for mourning."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָא, אֶלָּא לֶאֱסוֹר אֶת שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה וְאֶת שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה? הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּהֶסְפֵּד וּבְתַעֲנִית, אֲבָל מְלָאכָה — יוֹם אֶחָד וְתוּ לָא.
human_translation: And Rava said: is necessary only to prohibit on this on that and on that on this That applies eulogies and fasting. However, labor one day, and no more.
llm_translation: And Rava said: It is not necessary, except to prohibit this one's animal with that one's animal and that one's animal with this one's animal? These matters are permitted in eulogy and fasting, but performing labor - one day and no more.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא רַב חַזְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה קָא שָׁדֵי כִּיתָּנָא בְּפוּרַיָּא, וְלַטְיֵיהּ וְלָא צְמַח כִּיתָּנֵיהּ! הָתָם, בַּר יוֹמָא הֲוָה.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rav see a certain man planting flax on Purim, and cursed him, and flax never grew. There, was on that day
llm_translation: I am not? But didn't Rav see that man who was planting flax in the village, and he went and his flax did not grow! There, it was on a cloudy day.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּיוֹמֵיהּ — הֶסְפֵּד וְתַעֲנִית קַבִּילוּ עֲלַיְיהוּ, מְלָאכָה לָא קַבִּילוּ עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabba, son of Rava, said Even you say on his day accepted upon themselves eulogizing and fasting they did not accept upon themselves the prohibition labor.
llm_translation: Rabba, son of Rava, said: Even if you say during his lifetime — they accepted mourning and fasting upon him, but not labor.

hebrew_text: דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא כְּתִיב: ״שִׂמְחָה וּמִשְׁתֶּה וְיוֹם טוֹב״, וּלְבַסּוֹף כְּתִיב: ״לַעֲשׂוֹת אוֹתָם יְמֵי מִשְׁתֶּה וְשִׂמְחָה״, וְאִילּוּ ״יוֹם טוֹב״ לָא כְּתִיב.
human_translation: that initially, it is written: gladness and feasting and a good day [ yom tov ]” and at the end, it is written: make them days of feasting and gladness” whereas good day [ yom tov ], is not written.
llm_translation: From the outset it is written: "joy, feasting, and a good day," and in the end it is written: "to make them days of feasting and joy," but "a good day" is not written.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא רַב מַאי טַעְמָא לַטְיֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא? דְּבָרִים הַמּוּתָּרִין וַאֲחֵרִים נָהֲגוּ בָּהֶן אִיסּוּר הֲוָה. וּבְאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי לָא נְהוּג.
human_translation: what is the reason that Rav cursed that man It was matters that are permitted but others were accustomed to them as a prohibition, in Rabbi place, it was not the custom
llm_translation: And rather what is the reason for him to go to that man? Things that are permitted and others they practiced with them prohibition was. And in the place of Rabbi was not practiced.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם נְהוּג — וְרַבִּי נְטִיעָה שֶׁל שִׂמְחָה נָטַע. כְּדִתְנַן: עָבְרוּ אֵלּוּ וְלֹא נַעֲנוּ — מְמַעֲטִין בְּמַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן, בְּבִנְיָן וּבִנְטִיעָה, בְּאֵירוּסִין וּבְנִישּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, it was the custom and Rabbi joyful planting, As we learned these have passed and have not been answered, one decreases his business construction, planting, betrothals, and marriages.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always accustomed — and Rabbi Neti'ah of joy planted. As we learned: If these passed by and were not answered — they decrease in carrying and giving, in building and planting, in betrothal and marriage.

hebrew_text: וְתָנָא עֲלַהּ: בִּנְיָן — בִּנְיָן שֶׁל שִׂמְחָה, נְטִיעָה — נְטִיעָה שֶׁל שִׂמְחָה. אֵיזֶהוּ בִּנְיָן שֶׁל שִׂמְחָה? זֶה הַבּוֹנֶה בֵּית חַתְנוּת לִבְנוֹ. אֵיזוֹ הִיא נְטִיעָה שֶׁל שִׂמְחָה? זֶה הַנּוֹטֵעַ אַבְוָרַנְקֵי שֶׁל מְלָכִים.
human_translation: And it was taught about this construction joyful construction. planting joyful planting. What is joyful construction? This one who builds a wedding chamber for his son. What is joyful planting? This one who plants a royal garden avurneki
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Building - a building of joy, planting - a planting of joy. What is a building of joy? This is one who builds a bridal chamber for his son. What is a planting of joy? This is one who plants orchards of kings.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: חִזְקִיָּה קָרֵי בִּטְבֶרְיָא בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר וּבַחֲמֵיסַר, מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי מוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן הִיא אִי לָא. וּמִי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ מִלְּתָא דִטְבֶרְיָא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְעָרֵי מִבְצָר הַצִּדִּים צֵר וְחַמַּת רַקַּת וְכִנָּרֶת״, וְקַיְימָא לַן רַקַּת זוֹ טְבֶרְיָא! הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דִּמְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּחַד גִּיסָא שׁוּרָא דְיַמָּא הֲוָת.
human_translation: the itself Hezekiah read in Tiberias on the fourteenth and on the fifteenth he was uncertain if it surrounded by a wall since the days of Joshua, son of Nun, or not. Was he uncertain about the matter of Tiberias? Isn’t it written: “And the fortified cities were Ziddim-zer, and Hammath, Rakkath, and Chinnereth” , and we maintain Rakkath is Tiberias? This is the reason that he was uncertain: due to that one side, there was a wall of the sea,
llm_translation: Body: Hezekiah read in Tiberias on the fourteenth and fifteenth of the month, he was in doubt whether it was a wall that had been surrounded from the days of Joshua son of Nun or not. And who doubts to him the matter of Tiberias? And it is written: "And the fortified cities are Ziddim Zer and Hammath Rakat and Chinnereth," and we establish Rakat as Tiberias! That is the reason he was in doubt, because one side of it is in the sea.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ? וַדַּאי לָאו חוֹמָה הִיא! דְּתַנְיָא: ״אֲשֶׁר לוֹ חוֹמָה״ — וְלֹא שׁוּר אִיגַּר. ״סָבִיב״ — פְּרָט לִטְבֶרְיָא שֶׁיַּמָּהּ חוֹמָתָהּ.
human_translation: If so, why was he uncertain? certainly not a wall. As it is taught “Which has a wall” and not a wall of roofs. “round about excludes Tiberias as the sea is its wall
llm_translation: So, why is it a question for him? Surely it is not a wall! As it was taught: "which has a wall" - and not a fence. "Around" - excluding the area where its wall faces the sea.

hebrew_text: לְעִנְיַן בָּתֵּי עָרֵי חוֹמָה לָא מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ. כִּי קָא מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ לְעִנְיַן מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה, מַאי פְּרָזִים וּמַאי מוּקָּפִין דִּכְתִיבִי גַּבֵּי מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה? מִשּׁוּם דְּהָנֵי מִיגַּלּוּ וְהָנֵי לָא מִיגַּלּוּ — וְהָא נָמֵי מִיגַּלְּיָא, אוֹ דִּלְמָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָנֵי מִיגְּנוּ וְהָנֵי לָא מִיגְּנוּ — וְהָא נָמֵי מִיגַּנְיָא. מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: With regard to houses of walled cities, was not uncertain. Where he was uncertain was with regard to the reading of the Megilla: What are the unwalled towns and what are the walled cities that are written with regard to the reading of the Megilla? due to that these are exposed, whereas those are not exposed? is also exposed, Or perhaps due to that these are protected, whereas those are not protected, and is also protected due to that was uncertain
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of walled cities, there is no question. When it is in question regarding the matter of the Megillah, what are "open" and what are "enclosed" that are written in the Megillah? Because some are revealed and some are not revealed - and this one is revealed, or perhaps: because some are protected and some are not protected - and this one is protected. Therefore, there is a question regarding it.

hebrew_text: רַב אַסִּי קָרֵי מְגִילָּה בְּהוּצָל בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר וּבַחֲמֵיסַר. מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי מוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן הִיא, אִי לָא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמַר, אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: הַאי הוּצָל דְּבֵית בִּנְיָמִין, מוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא.
human_translation: Rav Asi read the Megilla in Huzal the fourteenth and the fifteenth he was uncertain if surrounded since the days of Joshua, son of Nun, or not. Some say Rav Asi said: This Huzal of the house of Benjamin was walled since the days of Joshua, son of Nun.
llm_translation: Rav Assi reads Megillah on the 15th and 14th of Adar. He is in doubt whether it the wall is surrounded from the days of Joshua son of Nun or not. There are those who say, Rav Assi said: This wall of the house of Benjamin is surrounded from the days of Joshua.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כִּי הֲוֵינָא טַלְיָא אָמֵינָא מִלְּתָא דִּשְׁאֵילְנָא לְסָבַיָּיא
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: When I was a child I said something that I asked the Elders
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: When I was a child, I used to say a matter that I heard from the elders.

hebrew_text: וְאִישְׁתְּכַח כְּווֹתִי. חַמַּת זוֹ טְבֶרְיָא, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ חַמַּת? עַל שׁוּם חַמֵּי טְבֶרְיָא. רַקַּת זוֹ צִיפּוֹרִי, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ רַקַּת? מִשּׁוּם דְּמִידַּלְיָיא כְּרַקְתָּא דְנַהְרָא. כִּינֶּרֶת זוֹ גִּינּוֹסַר, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ כִּינֶּרֶת? דִּמְתִיקִי פֵּירָא כְּקָלָא דְכִינָּרֵי.
human_translation: and it was found in accordance with my Hammath is Tiberias. And why was it called Hammath? On account of the hot springs of [ ḥammei ] Tiberias Rakkath is Tzippori. And why was it called Rakkath? Because it is raised like the bank [ rakta ] of a river. Chinnereth is Ginosar. And why was it called Chinnereth? Because its fruit are sweet like the sound of a harp [ kinnor ].
llm_translation: And she found her waist. What is the anger of Zevarya, and why is it called by the name of anger? Because of the hot springs of Zevarya. And the cormorant is a bird, and why is it called by the name of cormorant? Because it is similar to the cormorant of the river. The Ginosar is a garden, and why is it called by the name of Ginosar? Because its fruit is as sweet as the fruit of the Ginosar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רַקַּת לָאו טְבֶרְיָא הִיא? וְהָא כִּי שָׁכֵיב אִינִישׁ הָכָא, הָתָם סָפְדִי לֵיהּ הָכִי: ״גָּדוֹל הוּא בְּשֵׁשַׁךְ, וְשֵׁם לוֹ בְּרַקַּת״. וְכִי מַסְּקִי אֲרוֹנָא לְהָתָם, סָפְדִי לֵיהּ הָכִי: אוֹהֲבֵי שְׂרִידִים יוֹשְׁבֵי רַקַּת, צְאוּ וְקַבְּלוּ הֲרוּגֵי עוֹמֶק.
human_translation: Rava said: Is there anyone who says that Rakkath is not Tiberias? Isn’t when a man dies here, they lament his there, as follows: Great was he in Sheshakh, and he had a name in Rakkath? when they bring up the casket to there, they lament his as follows: lovers the remnants residents of Rakkath, go out and receive the dead from the deep,
llm_translation: Rava said: Who is it according to the one who says that a cup is not a utensil? But when a person lies down here, there, they eulogize him thus: "He is great in his six, and his name is Barakat." And when they bring a coffin there, they eulogize him thus: "Lovers of remnants, inhabitants of a cup, go and receive those slain by the deep."

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, פְּתַח עֲלֵיהּ הַהוּא סַפְדָנָא: אֶרֶץ שִׁנְעָר הָרָה וְיָלְדָה, אֶרֶץ צְבִי גִּידְּלָה שַׁעֲשׁוּעֶיהָ. אוֹי נָא לָהּ, אָמְרָה רַקַּת, כִּי אִבְּדָה כְּלִי חֶמְדָּתָהּ.
human_translation: when Rabbi Zeira died, a certain eulogizer opened for him The land of Shinar, conceived and bore the land of the deer, raised her delights. Woe unto her, said Rakkath, for she has lost her precious instrument.
llm_translation: When the soul of Rabbi Zeira was about to depart, that certain mourner opened with this lament: "The land of Shin'ar conceived and gave birth, the land of Tzvi raised her delights. Woe unto her," said Rakat, "for she has lost her precious vessel."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר (רַבָּה): חַמַּת זוֹ חַמֵּי גְרָר, רַקַּת זוֹ טְבֶרְיָא, כִּינֶּרֶת זוֹ גִּינּוֹסַר. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ רַקַּת? שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ רֵיקָנִין שֶׁבָּהּ מְלֵאִין מִצְוֹת כְּרִמּוֹן. רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר: רַקַּת שְׁמָהּ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ טְבֶרְיָא? שֶׁיּוֹשֶׁבֶת בְּטַבּוּרָהּ שֶׁל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. (רָבָא) אָמַר: רַקַּת שְׁמָהּ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ טְבֶרְיָא? שֶׁטּוֹבָה רְאִיָּיתָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rabba said: Hammath is the hot springs of Gerar Rakkath is Tiberias; Chinnereth is Ginosar. And why was called Rakkath? Because even the empty ones [ reikanin ] of are full of mitzvot as a pomegranate Rabbi Yirmeya said: Rakkath is its name; and why was it called Tiberias? Because it sits in the center tabbur of Eretz Yisrael. Rava said: Rakkath is its name, and why was it called Tiberias? Because its appearance is good [ tova re’iyyata
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, Rabah said: "Chamat is the heat of Gerar, Rakat is the fever of Teverya, Kinaret is the locust of Ginosar. And why is it called Rakat? Because even its empty ones are filled with mitzvot like a pomegranate." Rabbi Yirmeya said: "Its name is Rakat, and why is it called Teverya? Because it sits in the goodly hill of the land of Israel." Rava said: "Its name is Rakat, and why is it called Teverya? Because its sight is good."

hebrew_text: אָמַר זְעֵירָא: קִטְרוֹן זוֹ צִיפּוֹרִי. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ צִיפּוֹרִי? שֶׁיּוֹשֶׁבֶת בְּרֹאשׁ הָהָר כְּצִפּוֹר.
human_translation: Zeira said: Kitron is Tzippori. And why was it called Tzippori? Because it sits on top of a mountain like a bird [ tzippor ].
llm_translation: Zei'ra said: "Kitron is a bird. And why is it called by the name 'Tzipori'? Because it sits on the top of the mountain like a bird."

hebrew_text: וְקִטְרוֹן, צִיפּוֹרִי הִיא? וְהָא קִטְרוֹן בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל זְבוּלוּן הֲוַאי, דִּכְתִיב: ״זְבוּלוּן לֹא הוֹרִישׁ אֶת יוֹשְׁבֵי קִטְרוֹן וְאֶת יוֹשְׁבֵי נַהֲלוֹל״, וּזְבוּלוּן מִתְרַעֵם עַל מִדּוֹתָיו הֲוָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זְבוּלוּן עַם חֵרֵף נַפְשׁוֹ לָמוּת״, מַה טַּעַם? מִשּׁוּם דְּ״נַפְתָּלִי עַל מְרוֹמֵי שָׂדֶה״.
human_translation: Is Kitron Tzippori? Wasn’t Kitron in the territory of Zebulun, as it is written: “Neither did Zebulun drive out the inhabitants of Kitron, nor the inhabitants of Nahalol” And Zebulun was resentful of its portion, as it is stated: “Zebulun was a people that jeopardized their lives to the death” What is the reason Because “Naphtali was on the high places of the field”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is Ketron a type of bird? But Ketron is in the portion of Zebulun, as it is written: "Zebulun did not drive out the inhabitants of Ketron and the inhabitants of Nahalol." And Zebulun was criticized for his character traits, as it is stated: "Zebulun risked his life to the point of death." What is the reason? Because "Naphtali is full of favor and full of blessing."

hebrew_text: אָמַר זְבוּלוּן לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, לְאַחַיי נָתַתָּ לָהֶם שָׂדוֹת וּכְרָמִים, וְלִי נָתַתָּ הָרִים וְגִבְעוֹת! לְאַחַיי נָתַתָּ לָהֶם אֲרָצוֹת, וְלִי נָתַתָּ יַמִּים וּנְהָרוֹת! אָמַר לוֹ: כּוּלָּן צְרִיכִין לָךְ עַל יְדֵי חִלָּזוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״[עַמִּים הַר יִקְרָאוּ] וּשְׂפוּנֵי טְמוּנֵי חוֹל״.
human_translation: Zebulun said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe! To my brothers, You gave fields and vineyards, whereas to me You gave mountains and hills; to my brothers You gave lands, whereas to me You gave seas and rivers. said to him: all will need you due to the ḥilazon , As it is stated “They shall call the people to the mountain: and of the hidden treasures of the sand”
llm_translation: Zebulun said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the world, to my brothers You gave fields and vineyards, and to me You gave mountains and hills! To my brothers You gave lands, and to me You gave seas and rivers! He said to him: All of them need you through the medium of the snow, as it is stated: "Nations shall call on the mountain; there they will offer sacrifices of righteousness."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״שְׂפוּנֵי״ — זֶה חִלָּזוֹן, ״טְמוּנֵי״ — זוֹ טָרִית, ״חוֹל״ — זוֹ זְכוּכִית לְבָנָה. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם מִי מוֹדִיעֵנִי? אָמַר לוֹ: ״שָׁם יִזְבְּחוּ זִבְחֵי צֶדֶק״, סִימָן זֶה יְהֵא לְךָ: כׇּל הַנּוֹטֵל מִמְּךָ בְּלֹא דָּמִים — אֵינוֹ מוֹעִיל בִּפְרַקְמַטְיָא שֶׁלּוֹ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rav Yosef teaches “Treasures”; this is the ḥilazon , “Hidden”; this is tarit , “Sand”; this is white glass said to Him: Master of the Universe, who will inform me He said to “There they shall sacrifice offerings of righteousness.” This shall be a sign for you anyone who takes from you without payment will not prosper at all in his business.
llm_translation: It was taught by Rav Yosef: "Sefunei" - this is bile, "Temunei" - this is gall, "Chol" - this is white glass. He said before Him: Master of the Universe, who informs me? He said to him: "There they will offer sacrifices of righteousness," may this sign be for you: anyone who takes from you without blood - his partition is of no avail.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ קִטְרוֹן זוֹ צִיפּוֹרִי, אַמַּאי מִתְרַעֵם עַל מִדּוֹתָיו? וְהָא הָוְיָא צִיפּוֹרִי מִילְּתָא דַּעֲדִיפָא טוּבָא! וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּלֵית בַּהּ זָבַת חָלָב וּדְבָשׁ, וְהָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי זָבַת חָלָב וּדְבָשׁ דְּצִיפּוֹרִי, וְהָוְיָא שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר מִיל עַל שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר מִיל!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind Kitron is Tzippori, why was resentful of his portion? Wasn’t Tzippori vastly superior And if you would say that did not have flowing with milk and honey, didn’t Reish Lakish say: I myself have seen flowing with milk and honey Tzippori, and it was sixteen mil by sixteen mil ?
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind that this incense is like a bird, why does it become angry with its own qualities? But this is a matter of a bird, which is preferable! And if you say that it does not have in it the fat and honey, but Reish Lakish said: According to my opinion, I see the fat and honey of a bird, and it is sixteen mil by sixteen mil!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּלָא נְפִישָׁא דִּידֵיהּ כְּדַאֲחוּהּ, וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי זָבַת חָלָב וּדְבָשׁ דְּכׇל אַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְהָוְיָא כְּמִבֵּי כוּבֵּי עַד אַקְרָא דְתוּלְבַּקְנֵי, עֶשְׂרִין וְתַרְתֵּין פַּרְסֵי אוּרְכָּא, וּפוּתְיָא שִׁיתָּא פַּרְסֵי!
human_translation: And if you would say that his was not as vast as his brothers, didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: I myself have seen flowing with milk and honey all of Eretz Yisrael. And was like from Bei Kovei to the fortress of Tulbakni, twenty-two parasangs [ parsa ] in length and six parasangs in width.
llm_translation: And if you will say that his hand is not as strong as his brother's, as it was said: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: According to my opinion, I see a flow of milk and honey from all the land of Israel, and it would be like the rivers of Babylon, up to the call of the turtledoves, twenty-two parasangs in length, and six parasangs in width!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, שָׂדוֹת וּכְרָמִים עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנַפְתָּלִי עַל מְרוֹמֵי שָׂדֶה״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Even so, fields and vineyards were preferable to is also precise as it is written: “And Naphtali was on the high places of the field,” learn from here
llm_translation: Even so, fields and vineyards are preferable to it. Specifically, as it is written: "And Naphtali on the heights of the field." Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: ״וְעֶקְרוֹן תֵּעָקֵר״ — זוֹ קֵסָרִי בַּת אֱדוֹם, שֶׁהִיא יוֹשֶׁבֶת בֵּין הַחוֹלוֹת, וְהִיא הָיְתָה יָתֵד תְּקוּעָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בִּימֵי יְווֹנִים. וּכְשֶׁגָּבְרָה מַלְכוּת בֵּית חַשְׁמוֹנַאי וְנִצְּחוּם, הָיוּ קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ ״אַחִידַת מִגְדַּל שִׁיר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: “And Ekron shall be uprooted” This is Caesarea, daughter of Edom, which is situated among the sands. And it was a spike stuck in the Jewish people in the days of the Greeks, When the Hasmonean monarchy prevailed and triumphed over them, they called it: The captured tower of Shir.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: "And Ekron shall be uprooted" - this is Caesarea of Edom, which sits among the sands, and it was a support pillar for Israel in the days of the Greeks. And when the kingdom of the Hasmoneans prevailed over them, they would call it 'The unity of Migdal Shem'.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וַהֲסִירוֹתִי דָמָיו מִפִּיו וְשִׁקּוּצָיו מִבֵּין שִׁינָּיו וְנִשְׁאַר גַּם הוּא לֵאלֹהֵינוּ״. ״וַהֲסִירוֹתִי דָּמָיו מִפִּיו״ — זֶה בֵּית בָּמַיָּא שֶׁלָּהֶן. ״וְשִׁקּוּצָיו מִבֵּין שִׁינָּיו״ — זֶה בֵּית גַּלְיָא שֶׁלָּהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: What is which is written: “And I will take away his blood out of his mouth, and his detestable things from between his teeth, and he also shall be a remnant for our God; “And I will take away his blood out of his mouth”; this is their house of altars, “And his detestable things from between his teeth”; this is their house of piles,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina, what is the meaning of what is written: "And I will remove his blood from his mouth, and his abominations from between his teeth, and he too shall remain for our God." "And I will remove his blood from his mouth" - this refers to their altars. "And his abominations from between his teeth" - this refers to their idols.

hebrew_text: ״וְנִשְׁאַר גַּם הוּא לֵאלֹהֵינוּ״ — אֵלּוּ בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת שֶׁבֶּאֱדוֹם. ״וְהָיָה כְּאַלּוּף בִּיהוּדָה וְעֶקְרוֹן כִּיבוּסִי״ — אֵלּוּ תֵּרַאטְרָיוֹת וְקִרְקְסָיוֹת שֶׁבֶּאֱדוֹם, שֶׁעֲתִידִין שָׂרֵי יְהוּדָה לְלַמֵּד בָּהֶן תּוֹרָה בָּרַבִּים.
human_translation: “And he also shall be a remnant for our God,” these are the synagogues and study halls in Edom. “And he shall be as a chief aluf in Judah, and Ekron as a Jebusite,” these are the theaters [ tere’atrayot ] and the circuses [ kirkesayot ] in Edom where the officers of Judah are destined to teach Torah in public.
llm_translation: "And he shall remain for our God" — These are synagogues and study halls in Edom. "And it shall be as a leader in Judah, and Ekron as a Jebusite" — These are amphitheaters and circuses in Edom, for the leaders of Judah will teach Torah in them publicly.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: לֶשֶׁם זוֹ פַּמְיָיס, ״עֶקְרוֹן תֵּעָקֵר״ — זוֹ קֵסָרִי בַּת אֱדוֹם, שֶׁהִיא הָיְתָה מֶטְרוֹפּוֹלִין שֶׁל מְלָכִים. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דִּמְרַבִּי בָּהּ מַלְכֵי, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דְּמוֹקְמִי מִינָּה מַלְכֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Leshem” this is Pamyas. “Ekron shall be uprooted” this is Caesarea, the daughter of Edom, which was a metropolis [ metropolin ], of kings. There are who say that kings were raised there, and there are who say that kings were appointed from there,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: For the sake of this, Pamyais, "Ekeron will be uprooted" - this is the Caesar's daughter of Edom, who was the downfall of kings. Some say: Rabbi had relations with her, and some say: Kings arose from her.

hebrew_text: קֵסָרִי וִירוּשָׁלַיִם, אִם יֹאמַר לְךָ אָדָם: חָרְבוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן — אַל תַּאֲמֵן. יָשְׁבוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן — אַל תַּאֲמֵן. חָרְבָה קֵסָרִי וְיָשְׁבָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, חָרְבָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם וְיָשְׁבָה קֵסָרִי — תַּאֲמֵן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִמָּלְאָה הָחֳרָבָה״. אִם מְלֵיאָה זוֹ — חֲרֵבָה זוֹ, אִם מְלֵיאָה זוֹ — חֲרֵבָה זוֹ.
human_translation: Caesarea, and Jerusalem If, someone says to you both are destroyed, do not believe they are both settled do not believe Caesarea is destroyed and Jerusalem is settled, Jerusalem is destroyed and Caesarea is settled, believe As it is stated: I shall be filled with her that is laid waste” if this is filled, that one is laid waste, if is filled, this one is laid waste.
llm_translation: Caesarea and Jerusalem, if someone says to you: "Both have been destroyed" — do not believe. If someone says: "Both are inhabited" — do not believe. If Caesarea is destroyed and Jerusalem is inhabited, or if Jerusalem is destroyed and Caesarea is inhabited — believe, as it is stated: "If it is full of this destruction." If this one is full — this is the destruction, if this one is full — this is the destruction.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וּלְאוֹם מִלְאוֹם יֶאֱמָץ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: from here, “And the one people shall be stronger than the other people”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said from here: "And a nation shall be strengthened by a nation."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״יוּחַן רָשָׁע בַּל לָמַד צֶדֶק״. אָמַר יִצְחָק לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, יוּחַן עֵשָׂו. אָמַר לוֹ: רָשָׁע הוּא! אָמַר לוֹ: ״בַּל לָמַד צֶדֶק״. אָמַר לוֹ: ״בְּאֶרֶץ נְכוֹחוֹת יְעַוֵּל״. אָמַר לוֹ: אִם כֵּן, ״בַּל יִרְאֶה גֵּאוּת ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: What is which is written: “Let favor be shown to the wicked, yet will he not learn righteousness; Isaac said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, let favor be shown to Esau, said to him: is wicked. said to “Yet will he not learn righteousness,” said to him: “In the land of uprightness he will deal wrongfully,” said to If so “he will not behold the majesty of the Lord.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yitzchak said, what is the meaning of what is written: "The wicked man flatters himself in his own eyes, that his iniquity will not be found out"? Yitzchak said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the universe, let Esau find favor. He said to him: He is wicked! He said to him: "That his iniquity will not be found out." He said to him: "In his own eyes, he flatters himself." He said to him: If so, "He will not see the majesty of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אַל תִּתֵּן ה׳ מַאֲוַיֵּי רָשָׁע זְמָמוֹ אַל תָּפֵק יָרוּמוּ סֶלָה״ — אָמַר יַעֲקֹב לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אַל תִּתֵּן לְעֵשָׂו הָרָשָׁע תַּאֲוַת לִבּוֹ. ״זְמָמוֹ אַל תָּפֵק״ — זוֹ
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: What is which is written: “Grant not, O Lord, the desires of the wicked; further not his evil device, so that they not exalt themselves. Selah” Jacob said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, grant not to the wicked Esau the desires of his heart, Further not his evil device [ zemamo ]; This is
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said, what is the meaning of what is written: "Do not grant, O Lord, the desires of the wicked; do not further his evil plot, lest they exalt themselves, Selah"? Jacob said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the universe, do not grant Esau the wicked one the desire of his heart. "Do not further his evil plot" - this is...

hebrew_text: גֶּרְמַמְיָא שֶׁל אֱדוֹם, שֶׁאִלְמָלֵי הֵן יוֹצְאִין, מַחֲרִיבִין כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Germamya of Edom, As, if would go forth, they would destroy the entire world.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Germamya of Edom, that if they would have gone out, they would destroy the entire world."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: תְּלָת מְאָה קְטִירֵי תָגָא אִיכָּא בְּגֶרְמַמְיָא שֶׁל אֱדוֹם, וּתְלָת מְאָה וְשִׁיתִּין וְחַמְשָׁה מַרְזְבָּנֵי אִיכָּא בְּרוֹמִי, וּבְכׇל יוֹמָא נָפְקִי הָנֵי לְאַפֵּי הָנֵי וּמִקְּטִיל חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, וּמִיטַּרְדִי לְאוֹקֹמֵי מַלְכָּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥama Bar Ḥanina said: There are three hundred crowns tied in Germamya of Edom, and there are three hundred and sixty-five chieftains [ marzavnei ] in Rome. Every day these go out against those, and one of them is killed, and they are preoccupied with appointing a king
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ḥama son of Ḥanina said: There are three hundred barrels of wine in the wine cellar of Edom, and there are three hundred and sixty-five towers in Rome, and every day they take out these to bake bread, and one of them is destroyed, and they are rebuilt before the king rises.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, אִם יֹאמַר לְךָ אָדָם: יָגַעְתִּי וְלֹא מָצָאתִי — אַל תַּאֲמֵן. לֹא יָגַעְתִּי וּמָצָאתִי — אַל תַּאֲמֵן. יָגַעְתִּי וּמָצָאתִי — תַּאֲמֵן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said If a person says to you: I have labored and not found do not believe I have not labored but I have found do not believe I have labored and I have found believe
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said, if a person says to you: I have toiled and not found - do not believe. I have not toiled and found - do not believe. I have toiled and found - believe.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֲבָל בְּמַשָּׂא וּמַתָּן — סִיַּיעְתָּא הוּא מִן שְׁמַיָּא. וּלְדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא לְחַדּוֹדֵי, אֲבָל לְאוֹקֹמֵי גִּירְסָא — סִיַּיעְתָּא מִן שְׁמַיָּא הִיא.
human_translation: This applies to matters of Torah, But with regard to business, it assistance from Heaven, And with regard to matters of Torah, we said only with regard to sharpening However, to preserve what one has learned, is assistance from Heaven.
llm_translation: These are matters of Torah, but in business transactions - assistance is from Heaven. And regarding matters of Torah, we only say for conclusions, but for establishing the text - assistance is from Heaven.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אִם רָאִיתָ רָשָׁע שֶׁהַשָּׁעָה מְשַׂחֶקֶת לוֹ — אַל תִּתְגָּרֶה בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תִּתְחַר בַּמְּרֵעִים״. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁדְּרָכָיו מַצְלִיחִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יָחִילוּ דְּרָכָיו בְּכׇל עֵת״. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁזּוֹכֶה בַּדִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מָרוֹם מִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ מִנֶּגְדּוֹ״. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁרוֹאֶה בְּשׂוֹנְאָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל צוֹרְרָיו יָפִיחַ בָּהֶם״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: If you see a wicked man whom the hour is smiling upon, do not provoke him, as it is stated: “Contend not with evildoers” And not only that, but his undertakings will be successful, as it is stated: “His ways prosper at all times” And not only that, but he emerges victorious in judgment, as it is stated: “Your judgments are far above him” And not only that, but he will see his enemies as it is stated: “As for all his enemies, he hisses at them”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said: If you see a wicked person whom fortune favors, do not engage with him, as it is said: "Do not contend with evildoers." Moreover, his ways prosper, as it is said: "His ways are always firm." Furthermore, he will merit in judgment, as it is said: "Your judgments are on high from before him." And furthermore, he will see his enemies' downfall, as it is said: "All his adversaries he will blow away."

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מוּתָּר לְהִתְגָּרוֹת בָּרְשָׁעִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עוֹזְבֵי תוֹרָה יְהַלְלוּ רָשָׁע וְשׁוֹמְרֵי תוֹרָה יִתְגָּרוּ בָם״, וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי דּוֹסְתַּאי בַּר מָתוּן אָמַר: מוּתָּר לְהִתְגָּרוֹת בָּרְשָׁעִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, וְאִם לְחָשְׁךָ אָדָם לוֹמַר ״אַל תִּתְחַר בַּמְּרֵעִים וְאַל תְּקַנֵּא בְּעוֹשֵׂי עַוְלָה״ — מִי שֶׁלִּבּוֹ נוֹקְפוֹ אוֹמֵר כֵּן.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: It is permitted to provoke the wicked in this world, as it is stated: “They that forsake the Torah praise the wicked; but they who keep the Torah contend with them” And it is taught Rabbi Dostai bar Matun said: It is permitted to provoke the wicked in this world, and if a person whispers to you to say “Contend not with evildoers, nor be envious against the workers of iniquity” ( one whose heart strikes him says this.
llm_translation: I? And it was said by Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: It is permitted to provoke the wicked in this world, as it is stated: "Those who forsake the Torah praise the wicked, and those who keep the Torah contend with them." And it was taught, Rabbi Dostai bar Matun said: It is permitted to provoke the wicked in this world, and if a person tells you, "Do not contend with evildoers, and do not be envious of wrongdoers" — one whose heart is pained says so.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: ״אַל תִּתְחַר בַּמְּרֵעִים״ — לִהְיוֹת כַּמְּרֵעִים, ״וְאַל תְּקַנֵּא בְּעוֹשֵׂי עַוְלָה״ — לִהְיוֹת כְּעוֹשֵׂי עַוְלָה. וְאוֹמֵר: ״אַל יְקַנֵּא לִבְּךָ בַּחַטָּאִים וְגוֹ׳!
human_translation: Rather, “Contend not with evildoers,” to be like the evildoers; “nor be envious against the workers of iniquity,” to be like the workers of iniquity. And it says “Let not your heart envy sinners,
llm_translation: Rather: "Do not compete with evildoers" — to be like evildoers, "and do not be envious of wrongdoers" — to be like wrongdoers. And it says: "Let not your heart envy sinners, etc."

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּמִילֵּי דִידֵיהּ, הָא בְּמִילֵּי דִשְׁמַיָּא.
human_translation: not difficult, this, to his matters, that, to matters of Heaven,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this in matters of ours, that in matters of Heaven.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא בְּמִילֵּי דִידֵיהּ. וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּצַדִּיק גָּמוּר, הָא בְּצַדִּיק שֶׁאֵינוֹ גָּמוּר. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״לָמָּה תַבִּיט בּוֹגְדִים תַּחֲרִישׁ בְּבַלַּע רָשָׁע צַדִּיק מִמֶּנּוּ״, צַדִּיק מִמֶּנּוּ — בּוֹלֵעַ, צַדִּיק גָּמוּר — אֵינוֹ בּוֹלֵעַ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: this and that with regard to his own affairs, and not difficult. This applies to a completely righteous that applies to who is not completely righteous. As Rav Huna said: What is which is written: “Why do you look upon them that deal treacherously, and remain silent when the wicked devours the man that is more righteous than he” devours one who is more righteous than he; he does not devour one who is completely righteous.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this are in our matters. And it is not difficult: this is a completely righteous person, this is a not completely righteous person. As Rav Huna said, what is the meaning of what is written: "Why do you look at the treacherous, keep silent when the wicked swallows up the righteous?" - "the righteous from him" - he swallows, a completely righteous person - does not swallow.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: שָׁעָה מְשַׂחֶקֶת לוֹ שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say hour is smiling upon him, is different.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "A playful hour for him changes things."

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: אִיטַלְיָא שֶׁל יָוָן, זֶה כְּרַךְ גָּדוֹל שֶׁל רוֹמִי. וְהָוְיָא תְּלָת מְאָה פַּרְסָה עַל תְּלָת מְאָה פַּרְסָה. וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ שְׁלוֹשׁ מֵאוֹת שִׁשִּׁים וַחֲמִשָּׁה שְׁווֹקִים, כְּמִנְיַן יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה. וְקָטָן שֶׁבְּכוּלָּם שֶׁל מוֹכְרֵי עוֹפוֹת, וְהָוְיָא שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר מִיל עַל שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר מִיל. וּמֶלֶךְ סוֹעֵד בְּכׇל יוֹם בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן.
human_translation: Ulla said. Greek Italy, is the great city of Rome, and it is three hundred parasang [ parsa ] by three hundred parasang. It has three hundred and sixty-five markets, corresponding to the number of days in the solar and the smallest of them all is of poultry sellers, is sixteen mil by sixteen mil . And the king, dines every day in one of them.
llm_translation: Ula said: The province of Greece is like a large city of Rome. And it is three hundred parasangs by three hundred parasangs. And it contains three hundred and sixty-five marketplaces, corresponding to the number of days of the sun. And the smallest of all of them is that of the poultry merchants, and it is sixteen mil by sixteen mil. And the king dines in one of them every day.

hebrew_text: וְהַדָּר בָּהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ נוֹלָד בָּהּ — נוֹטֵל פְּרָס מִבֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ. וְהַנּוֹלָד בָּהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ דָּר בָּהּ — נוֹטֵל פְּרָס מִבֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ. וּשְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים בֵּי בָנֵי יֵשׁ בּוֹ, וַחֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת חַלּוֹנוֹת מַעֲלִין עָשָׁן חוּץ לַחוֹמָה. צִדּוֹ אֶחָד יָם וְצִדּוֹ אֶחָד הָרִים וּגְבָעוֹת, צִדּוֹ אֶחָד מְחִיצָה שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל וְצִדּוֹ אֶחָד חוֹלְסִית וּמְצוּלָה.
human_translation: And one who resides in even if he was not born there, receives an allowance from the king’s palace. And one who was born there, even if he does not reside there, receives an allowance from the king’s palace. And there are three thousand bathhouses in and five hundred apertures that let the smoke out beyond the walls One side sea, one side mountains and hills, one side a barrier of iron and one side gravel [ ḥulsit ] and swamp.
llm_translation: And one who dwells in it, even though he was not born in it - takes a portion from the king's house. And one who was born in it, even though he does not dwell in it - takes a portion from the king's house. And there are three thousand houses of the sons of Yesh in it, and five hundred windows emit smoke outside the wall. One side is the sea, and one side is mountains and hills, one side is an iron fence, and one side is sandy and rocky.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ קָרְאוּ אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה בַּאֲדָר הָרִאשׁוֹן וְנִתְעַבְּרָה הַשָּׁנָה — קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ בַּאֲדָר שֵׁנִי. אֵין בֵּין אֲדָר הָרִאשׁוֹן לַאֲדָר הַשֵּׁנִי אֶלָּא קְרִיאַת הַמְּגִילָּה וּמַתָּנוֹת לָאֶבְיוֹנִים.
human_translation: read the Megilla during the first Adar and the year was intercalated one reads during the second Adar. The difference between the first Adar and the second Adar is only the reading of the Megilla and gifts to the poor
llm_translation: They taught: They read the Megillah in the first Adar, and the year was intercalated - they read it in the second Adar. There is no difference between the first Adar and the second Adar except for the reading of the Megillah and gifts to the poor.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא לְעִנְיַן סֵדֶר פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת, זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין.
human_translation: that with regard to the matter of the sequence of portions this, and that, are equal,
llm_translation: The matter is regarding the order of the Torah portions, this and that are equal.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא תַּנָּא קַמָּא, וְלָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְלָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. דְּתַנְיָא: קָרְאוּ אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה בַּאֲדָר הָרִאשׁוֹן וְנִתְעַבְּרָה הַשָּׁנָה — קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ בַּאֲדָר הַשֵּׁנִי, שֶׁכׇּל מִצְוֹת שֶׁנּוֹהֲגוֹת בַּשֵּׁנִי נוֹהֲגוֹת בָּרִאשׁוֹן, חוּץ מִמִּקְרָא מְגִילָּה.
human_translation: whose the mishna? It is neither the first tanna nor Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, nor Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as it is taught they read the Megilla during the first Adar and the year was intercalated, they read it during the second Adar, as all mitzvot that are practiced during the second are practiced in the first except for the reading of the Megilla.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mani matnitin? La tana kama, v'la Rabbi Eliezer bar Rabbi Yosei, v'la Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Detanya: Karu et ha-megillah ba-Adar ha-rishon v'nit'abrah ha-shanah — korin otah ba-Adar ha-sheni, shekol mitzvot shenohagot ba-sheni nohagot ba-rishon, chutz mi-mikra megillah." English translation: "Who is the Tanna of the Mishnah? Not the first Tanna, not Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Yosei, and not Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. As it was taught: If they read the Megillah in the first Adar and the year was intercalated — they read it in the second Adar, for all the commandments that are customary in the second are also customary in the first, except for the reading of the Megillah."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ בַּאֲדָר הַשֵּׁנִי, שֶׁכׇּל מִצְוֹת שֶׁנּוֹהֲגוֹת בַּשֵּׁנִי נוֹהֲגוֹת בָּרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, says: They do not read it during the second Adar, as all mitzvot that are practiced during the second are practiced during the first
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, says: One does not read it in the second Adar, for all the commandments that are observed in the second are observed in the first.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אַף קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ בַּאֲדָר הַשֵּׁנִי, שֶׁכׇּל מִצְוֹת שֶׁנּוֹהֲגוֹת בַּשֵּׁנִי אֵין נוֹהֲגוֹת בָּרִאשׁוֹן. וְשָׁוִין בְּהֶסְפֵּד וּבְתַעֲנִית שֶׁאֲסוּרִין בָּזֶה וּבָזֶה.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yosei: They even read it during the second Adar, as all mitzvot that are practiced during the second are not practiced during the first And agree with regard to eulogy and with regard to fasting that they are prohibited on this and on that
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yosei: Also, we read it in the second Adar, for all the commandments that are observed in the second are not observed in the first. And they are equal in eulogy and fasting, that they are prohibited in both.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: סֵדֶר פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר לְכַתְּחִילָּה בַּשֵּׁנִי, וְאִי עֲבוּד בָּרִאשׁוֹן — עֲבוּד. בַּר מִמִּקְרָא מְגִילָּה, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּקָרוּ בָּרִאשׁוֹן — קָרוּ בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel is that the first tanna . Rav Pappa said: There is between them the sequence of portions, as the first tanna maintains: during the second ab initio . However, if they did during the first they did except for the reading of the Megilla, as even though they read during the first they read it during the second
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, was he the first Tanna? Rav Pappa said: There is a difference between them, for the first Tanna holds that ideally it should be done on the second day, and if it was done on the first — it is valid. This is similar to the case of the Megillah reading, for even though they read it on the first day — they can read it on the second.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה לְכַתְּחִילָּה בָּרִאשׁוֹן. וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: אֲפִילּוּ סֵדֶר פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת, אִי קָרוּ בָּרִאשׁוֹן קָרוּ בַּשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, maintains even the reading of the Megilla during the first ab initio , And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel maintains: Even the sequence of portions, if they read during the first they read during the second
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Yosei holds: Even the reading of the Megillah can be done initially on the first day. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: Even the order of the Torah portions, if they did not read it on the first day, they may read it on the second day.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִי תַּנָּא קַמָּא — קַשְׁיָא מַתָּנוֹת, אִי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — קַשְׁיָא נָמֵי מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה, אִי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל — קַשְׁיָא סֵדֶר פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת!
human_translation: whose If the first tanna , gifts difficult. if Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, the reading of the Megilla also difficult. if Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, the sequence of portions difficult.
llm_translation: Mani? If a Tanna in the first clause — the difficulty is in the Mishnah; if it is Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Yosei — the difficulty is also from the verse of Megillah; if it is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel — the difficulty is in the order of the Torah portions!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם תַּנָּא קַמָּא, וּתְנָא מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה וְהוּא הַדִּין מַתָּנוֹת לָאֶבְיוֹנִים, דְּהָא בְּהָא תַּלְיָא.
human_translation: Actually, the first tanna , and he taught the reading of the Megilla, and the same is true gifts to the poor, as this is dependent upon that
llm_translation: Always teach the first, and it was taught in a Baraita: the reading of the Megillah and the same law applies to gifts to the poor, for they are dependent on this time.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא, וּמַתְנִיתִין חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אֵין בֵּין אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שֶׁבַּאֲדָר הָרִאשׁוֹן לְאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר שֶׁבַּאֲדָר הַשֵּׁנִי אֶלָּא מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה וּמַתָּנוֹת. הָא לְעִנְיַן הֶסְפֵּד וְתַעֲנִית — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין, וְאִילּוּ סֵדֶר פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת לָא מַיְירֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually, is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and the mishna is incomplete and is teaching the following: The difference between the fourteenth of the first Adar and the fourteenth of the second Adar is only the reading of the Megilla and gifts that the matter of eulogy and fasting, this, and that, are equal, while the sequence of portions, does not speak
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Indeed, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel it is, and the Mishnah is lacking from the beginning of the month of Adar until the second Adar, and thus it teaches: There is no difference between the fourteenth of the first Adar and the fourteenth of the second Adar except for the reading of the Megillah and giving gifts. As for matters of eulogy and fasting - both this and that are equal, but the order of the Torah portions is not mentioned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said in the name of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Avin said Rabbi Yochanan: The halakha is like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who said in the name of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״, מָה כׇּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה — אֲדָר הַסָּמוּךְ לִשְׁבָט, אַף כָּאן — אֲדָר הַסָּמוּךְ לִשְׁבָט.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And both of them, interpreted the same verse in each and every year” Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, maintains: “In each and every year” Just as each and every year Adar that is adjacent to Shevat, so too here Adar that is adjacent to Shevat.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan, and both of them expounded one verse: "Every year," Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Yosei holds: "Every year," just as every year - the month adjacent to Adar, so too here - the month adjacent to Adar.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״, מָה כָּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה — אֲדָר הַסָּמוּךְ לְנִיסָן, אַף כָּאן — אֲדָר הַסָּמוּךְ לְנִיסָן.
human_translation: And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel maintains: “In each and every year” just as each and every year Adar that is adjacent to Nisan, so too here, Adar that is adjacent to Nisan.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: "In every year," what is "every year" - Adar adjacent to Nisan, so too here - Adar adjacent to Nisan.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִסְתַּבֵּר טַעְמָא, דְּאֵין מַעֲבִירִין עַל הַמִּצְוֹת. אֶלָּא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Granted, Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, the reason is logical, one does not forego the mitzvot; However, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, what is the reason
llm_translation: In truth, Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, expounds the reasoning, that one does not transgress the commandments. But Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, what is the reasoning?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי טָבִי: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, מִסְמָךְ גְּאוּלָּה לִגְאוּלָּה עָדִיף.
human_translation: Rabbi Tavi said: The reason of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel juxtaposing redemption, to redemption, is preferable.
llm_translation: Rabbi Tavi said: The reason of Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel, that connecting redemption to redemption is preferable.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מֵהָכָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְקַיֵּים אֵת אִגֶּרֶת הַפּוּרִים הַזֹּאת הַשֵּׁנִית״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: The reason of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel from here, as it is written: “To confirm this second letter of Purim”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: The reason for Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel is derived from here, as it is written: "to establish this second letter of Purim."

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב
human_translation: And it was necessary to write
llm_translation: And it is necessary to write.

hebrew_text: ״הַשֵּׁנִית״ וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״. דְּאִי מִ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא כִּי קוּשְׁיַן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן ״הַשֵּׁנִית״. וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן ״הַשֵּׁנִית״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא בַּתְּחִילָּה בָּרִאשׁוֹן וּבַשֵּׁנִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן ״בְּכׇל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה״.
human_translation: The second, and it was necessary to write In each and every year; As, if from In each and every year, I would have said according to our question Therefore, it teaches us The second. And had it taught us The second, I would have said in the first and in the second ab initio . Therefore, it teaches us: In each and every year,
llm_translation: "The second" and it was necessary to write "every year and year." For if "every year and year" I would say it is difficult, it teaches us "the second." And if we would hear "the second" I would say initially in the first and in the second, it teaches us "every year and year."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַאי ״הַשֵּׁנִית״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה: בַּתְּחִילָּה קְבָעוּהָ בְּשׁוּשַׁן, וּלְבַסּוֹף בְּכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, what does he do with this The second? He requires to that of Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda, as Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda said: Initially, they established in Shushan and ultimately throughout the world,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Yosei, this "the second," what does he do with it? He requires it according to Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah, for Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah said: Initially they established it in Shushan, and ultimately in the entire world.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה: שָׁלְחָה לָהֶם אֶסְתֵּר לַחֲכָמִים: קִבְעוּנִי לְדוֹרוֹת! שָׁלְחוּ לָהּ: קִנְאָה אַתְּ מְעוֹרֶרֶת עָלֵינוּ לְבֵין הָאוּמּוֹת. שָׁלְחָה לָהֶם: כְּבָר כְּתוּבָה אֲנִי עַל דִּבְרֵי הַיָּמִים לְמַלְכֵי מָדַי וּפָרָס.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda said: Esther sent to the Sages: Establish me for generations. They sent to her: You will arouse the wrath of the nations upon us, She sent to them: I am already written in the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia,
llm_translation: Said Rav Shmuel son of Yehuda: Esther sent to the sages: "Establish me for generations!" They sent to her: "You are stirring up jealousy among us between the nations." She sent to them: "It is already written in the chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia."

hebrew_text: רַב וְרַב חֲנִינָא וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַב חֲבִיבָא מַתְנוּ. בְּכוּלֵּיהּ סֵדֶר מוֹעֵד כָּל כִּי הַאי זוּגָא חַלּוֹפֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וּמְעַיֵּיל רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן. שָׁלְחָה לָהֶם אֶסְתֵּר לַחֲכָמִים: כִּתְבוּנִי לְדוֹרוֹת. שָׁלְחוּ לָהּ: ״הֲלֹא כָתַבְתִּי לְךָ שָׁלִישִׁים״, שִׁלֵּישִׁים וְלֹא רִבֵּעִים,
human_translation: Rav and Rabbi Ḥanina and Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rav Ḥaviva taught Throughout the order of Moed , wherever this pair exchange Rabbi Yoḥanan and insert Rabbi Yonatan Esther sent to the Sages: Write me for generations They sent to her “Have I not written for you three times” three times and not four times?
llm_translation: Rav and Rav Chanina and Rabbi Yochanan and Rav Chaviva taught: In all the order of the Moed, for this pair are the colleagues of Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yonatan. Esther sent to the sages: "Write me for the generations." They sent to her: "Have I not written to you thirds," thirds and not quarters.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁמָּצְאוּ לוֹ מִקְרָא כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״כְּתֹב זֹאת זִכָּרוֹן בַּסֵּפֶר״. ״כְּתֹב זֹאת״ — מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב כָּאן וּבְמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה. ״זִכָּרוֹן״ — מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּנְּבִיאִים, ״בַּסֵּפֶר״ — מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּמְּגִלָּה.
human_translation: until they found a verse written in the Torah: “Write this for a memorial in the book, “Write this,” that which is written here and in Deuteronomy; “a memorial,” that which is written in the Prophets, “in the book,” that which is written in the Megilla.
llm_translation: Until they found for him a verse written in the Torah: "Write this as a memorial in the book." "Write this" - what is written here and in the Mishnah Torah. "Memorial" - what is written in the Prophets. "In the book" - what is written in the Scroll.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״כְּתֹב זֹאת״ — מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב כָּאן, ״זִכָּרוֹן״ — מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה, ״בַּסֵּפֶר״ — מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּנְּבִיאִים. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַמּוֹדָעִי אוֹמֵר: ״כְּתֹב זֹאת״ — מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב כָּאן וּבְמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה, ״זִכָּרוֹן״ — מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּנְּבִיאִים, ״בְּסֵפֶר״ — מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בִּמְגִילָּה.
human_translation: parallel the tanna’im , “Write this,” that which is written here, “a memorial,” that which is written in Deuteronomy; “in the book,” that which is written in the Prophets; the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua. Rabbi Elazar HaModa’i says: “Write this,” that which is written here and in Deuteronomy; “a memorial,” that which is written in the Prophets “in the book,” that which is written in the Megilla.
llm_translation: Tannaim: "Write this" — what is written here, "remembrance" — what is written in the Torah, "in the book" — what is written in the Prophets. These are the words of Rabbi Yehoshua. Rabbi Eliezer HaModa'i says: "Write this" — what is written here and in the Torah, "remembrance" — what is written in the Prophets, "in the book" — what is written in the Scroll.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֶסְתֵּר אֵינָהּ מְטַמְּאָה אֶת הַיָּדַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Esther does not render the hands ritually impure.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Esther does not render the hands impure.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל אֶסְתֵּר לָאו בְּרוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ נֶאֶמְרָה? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֶסְתֵּר בְּרוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ נֶאֶמְרָה! נֶאֶמְרָה לִקְרוֹת, וְלֹא נֶאֶמְרָה לִיכְתּוֹב.
human_translation: Is this to say that Shmuel maintains Esther was not stated with the Divine Spirit? But didn’t Shmuel say Esther was stated with the Divine Spirit? It was stated to be read however, it was not stated to be written.
llm_translation: In the matter of the opinion of Shmuel, was Esther not spoken with the Holy Spirit? But Shmuel said: Esther was spoken with the Holy Spirit! It was spoken to be read, and not spoken to be written.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: קֹהֶלֶת אֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא אֶת הַיָּדַיִם, וּמַחְלוֹקֶת בְּשִׁיר הַשִּׁירִים. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שִׁיר הַשִּׁירִים מְטַמֵּא אֶת הַיָּדַיִם, וּמַחְלוֹקֶת בְּקֹהֶלֶת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: קֹהֶלֶת מִקּוּלֵּי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּמֵחוּמְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל, אֲבָל רוּת וְשִׁיר הַשִּׁירִים וְאֶסְתֵּר מְטַמְּאִין אֶת הַיָּדַיִם! הוּא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection Rabbi Meir says: Ecclesiastes does not render the hands ritually impure, however, there is a dispute with regard to the Song of Songs Rabbi Yosei says: The Song of Songs renders the hands ritually impure, but there is a dispute with regard to Ecclesiastes. Rabbi Shimon says: Ecclesiastes is among the leniencies of Beit Shammai and among the stringencies of Beit Hillel, However, Ruth, and the Song of Songs, and Esther render the hands ritually impure, who stated in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua
llm_translation: The question was raised: Rabbi Meir says: Ecclesiastes does not render the hands impure, and there is a dispute regarding the Song of Songs. Rabbi Yosei says: The Song of Songs renders the hands impure, and there is a dispute regarding Ecclesiastes. Rabbi Shimon says: Ecclesiastes follows the leniencies of Beit Shammai and the stringencies of Beit Hillel, but Ruth, Song of Songs, and Esther render the hands impure! This is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר: קֹהֶלֶת אֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא אֶת הַיָּדַיִם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁחׇכְמָתוֹ שֶׁל שְׁלֹמֹה הִיא. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: וְכִי זוֹ בִּלְבַד אָמַר? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וַיְדַבֵּר שְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים מָשָׁל״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״אַל תּוֹסְףְּ עַל דְּבָרָיו״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: Ecclesiastes does not render the hands ritually impure because it is the wisdom of Solomon, They said to him: as was it this alone that said? Wasn’t it already stated: “And he spoke three thousand proverbs, And it says: “Add you not unto his words”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: Ecclesiastes does not render the hands impure, because it is the wisdom of Solomon. They said to him: Did he say this alone? Has it not already been said: "He spoke three thousand proverbs," and it says: "Do not add to his words."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: מֵימָר טוּבָא אֲמַר, דְּאִי בָּעֵי — אִיכְּתִיב, וּדְאִי בָּעֵי — לָא אִיכְּתִיב. תָּא שְׁמַע: ״אַל תּוֹסְףְּ עַל דְּבָרָיו״.
human_translation: What And it says? And if you would say he said, he said a great deal, which, if he desired, it was written, and if he desired, it was not written; come hear: Add you not unto his words.
llm_translation: What is "and he says"? And if you say: A good saying he said, for if it is needed - write, and if it is not needed - do not write. Come and hear: "Do not add to His words."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֶסְתֵּר בְּרוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ נֶאֶמְרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הָמָן בְּלִבּוֹ״. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֶסְתֵּר בְּרוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ נֶאֶמְרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתְּהִי אֶסְתֵּר נֹשֵׂאת חֵן בְּעֵינֵי כׇּל רוֹאֶיהָ״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: Esther was said with the Divine Spirit, as it is stated: “And Haman thought in his heart” Rabbi Akiva says: Esther was said with the Divine Spirit, as it is stated: “And Esther obtained favor in the sight of all those who looked upon her”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: Esther was spoken with the Holy Spirit, as it is said: "And Haman said in his heart." Rabbi Akiva says: Esther was spoken with the Holy Spirit, as it is said: "And Esther found favor in the eyes of all who saw her."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אֶסְתֵּר בְּרוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ נֶאֶמְרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּוָּדַע הַדָּבָר לְמׇרְדֳּכַי״. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן דּוֹרְמַסְקִית אוֹמֵר: אֶסְתֵּר בְּרוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ נֶאֶמְרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבַבִּזָּה לֹא שָׁלְחוּ אֶת יָדָם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Esther was said with the Divine Spirit, as it is stated “And the thing became known to Mordecai” Rabbi Yosei ben Durmaskit says: Esther was said with the Divine Spirit, as it is stated: “But they did not lay their hands on the plunder”
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Esther was spoken with the Holy Spirit, as it is said: "And the matter was known to Mordecai." Rabbi Yosei ben Darmaskit says: Esther was spoken with the Holy Spirit, as it is said: "And they did not lay their hands on the plunder."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אִי הֲוַאי הָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מִלְּתָא דַּעֲדִיפָא מִכּוּלְּהוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קִיְּמוּ וְקִבְּלוּ״ — קִיְּמוּ לְמַעְלָה מַה שֶּׁקִּיבְּלוּ לְמַטָּה.
human_translation: Shmuel said: Had I been there I would have stated a matter that is superior to them all, as it is stated: “They confirmed, and took upon themselves” They confirmed above what they took upon themselves below
