llm_translation: Samuel said: If this one were there, I would say that the matter is preferable to all, as it is stated: "They confirmed and accepted" - they confirmed above what they accepted below.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְכוּלְּהוּ אִית לְהוּ פִּירְכָא, לְבַר מִדִּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּלֵית לֵיהּ פִּירְכָא: דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — סְבָרָא הוּא דְּלָא הֲוָה אִינִישׁ דַּחֲשִׁיב לְמַלְכָּא כְּווֹתֵיהּ, וְהַאי כִּי קָא מַפֵּישׁ טוּבָא וְאָמַר — אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rava said: There is a refutation for all except for Shmuel, for which there is no refutation. which Rabbi Eliezer it is logical reasoning There was no person as important to the king as he and that when he elaborated extensively and said: he said with himself in mind.
llm_translation: Rava said: To all of them there is a rebuttal, except for Bar Midashmuel who does not have a rebuttal: concerning Rabbi Eliezer — it is a thought that a person was not considered by the king like his own self, and this one, when he was appeasing and said — his own knowledge he was saying.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — דִּלְמָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נִדְמְתָה לוֹ כְּאוּמָּתוֹ.
human_translation: which Rabbi Akiva perhaps in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, who said: teaches that she appeared to each and every one as his nation,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva - perhaps like Rabbi Elazar, who said: "It teaches that each and every person is precious like a coin."

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר — דִּלְמָא כְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, דְּאָמַר: בִּגְתָן וָתֶרֶשׁ שְׁנֵי טַרְשִׂיִּים הָיוּ.
human_translation: And that which Rabbi Meir perhaps in accordance with Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, who said: Bigtan and Teresh were both Tarsi
llm_translation: And this that Rabbi Meir - perhaps like Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, who said: "In Gittan and Teresh there were two Tarshiyim."

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן דּוֹרְמַסְקִית — דִּלְמָא פְּרִיסְתָּקֵי שַׁדּוּר. דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וַדַּאי לֵית לֵיהּ פִּירְכָא. אָמַר רָבִינָא: הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: טָבָא חֲדָא פִּלְפַּלְתָּא חֲרִיפְתָּא מִמְּלֵי צַנֵּי קָרֵי.
human_translation: And that which Rabbi Yosei ben Durmaskit perhaps they dispatched messengers with regard to Shmuel’s there is certainly no refutation. Ravina said: This that people say: One sharp pepper is better than a basketful of pumpkins,
llm_translation: This is regarding Rabbi Yosei ben Dormaskit - perhaps he spread out the shadur partitions. Regarding Shmuel, and surely he does not have a Pircha. Ravina said: This is what people say: A single good turnip is more pungent than a basketful of gourds.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וִימֵי הַפּוּרִים הָאֵלֶּה לֹא יַעַבְרוּ מִתּוֹךְ הַיְּהוּדִים״. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר מֵהָכָא: ״וְזִכְרָם לֹא יָסוּף מִזַּרְעָם״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: from here: “And these days of Purim shall not cease from among the Jews” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: from here, “Nor the memorial of them perish from their seed”
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said from here: "And the days of Purim shall not pass from among the Jews." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said from here: "And their memory shall not cease from their seed."

hebrew_text: וּמַתָּנוֹת לָאֶבְיוֹנִים. תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: ״וּמִשְׁלוֹחַ מָנוֹת אִישׁ לְרֵעֵהוּ״ — שְׁתֵּי מָנוֹת לְאִישׁ אֶחָד. ״וּמַתָּנוֹת לָאֶבְיוֹנִים״ — שְׁתֵּי מַתָּנוֹת לִשְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: And gifts to the poor. Rav Yosef taught “And of sending portions one to another” two portions to one person. “And gifts to the poor” two gifts to two people.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And gifts to the poor." Rav Yosef taught: "And sending portions one man to another" - two portions to one man. "And gifts to the poor" - two gifts to two people.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה שַׁדַּר לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אַטְמָא דְּעִיגְלָא תִּלְתָּא וְגַרְבָּא דְחַמְרָא, שְׁלַח לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda Nesia sent to Rabbi Oshaya the leg of a third- calf and a jug of wine. sent him
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah, the Nasi, sent to Rabbi Oshaya a sealed barrel containing three se'ah of wine vinegar and a jar of wine.

hebrew_text: קִיַּימְתָּ בָּנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, ״וּמִשְׁלוֹחַ מָנוֹת אִישׁ לְרֵעֵהוּ וּמַתָּנוֹת לָאֶבְיוֹנִים״.
human_translation: You have fulfilled through us, our teacher: “And sending portions one to another,” “And gifts to the poor,”
llm_translation: You have fulfilled, our teacher, "and sending portions one to another, and gifts to the poor."

hebrew_text: רַבָּה שַׁדַּר לֵיהּ לְמָרֵי בַּר מָר בְּיַד אַבָּיֵי מְלֵא טַסְקָא דְקַשְׁבָּא וּמְלֵי כָּסָא קִמְחָא דַאֲבִשׁוּנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הַשְׁתָּא אָמַר מָרִי: אִי חַקְלָאָה מַלְכָּא לֶיהֱוֵי — דִּיקּוּלָא מִצַּוְּארֵיהּ לָא נָחֵית.
human_translation: Rabba sent to Marei bar Mar in the hands of Abaye, a sack [ taska ] full of dates [ kashva ] and a cupful of roasted flour [ kimḥa de’avshuna ]. Abaye said to him: Now, Mari will say if a farmer becomes the king, the basket does not descend from his neck.
llm_translation: Rabah sent to his master, Bar Mar, by the hand of Abbaye, a basket of fine bread and a cup filled with fine flour. Abbaye said to him: "Today my master said: If a king has no dignity, he will not be respected."

hebrew_text: הֲדַר שַׁדַּר לֵיהּ אִיהוּ מְלֵא טַסְקָא דְזַנְגְּבִילָא וּמְלֵא כָּסָא דְּפִלְפְּלָתָא אֲרִיכָתָא. אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַשְׁתָּא אָמַר מָר: אֲנָא שַׁדַּרִי לֵיהּ חוּלְיָא, וְאִיהוּ שַׁדַּר לִי חוּרְפָּא.
human_translation: sent back to him a sack full of ginger and a cupful of long peppers [ pilpalta arikha ], Abaye said The master, will now say: I sent him sweet and he sent me pungent
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hadar shadar lei ihu m'le taska d'zangbilah u'm'le kasa d'pilpelta arichata. Amar Abbaye: Hashta amar mar: Ana shadari lei chulya, v'ihu shadari li churpa." Translation: "He adorned him with a cloak of purple wool and a crown of fine linen. Abbaye said: Now Mar said: I adorned him with a cloak of blue wool, and he adorned me with a crown of fine linen."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי נְפַקִי מִבֵּי מָר, הֲוָה שָׂבַעְנָא. כִּי מְטַאי לְהָתָם, קָרִיבוּ לִי שִׁיתִּין צָעֵי דְּשִׁיתִּין מִינֵי קְדֵירָה, וַאֲכַלִי בְּהוּ שִׁיתִּין פְּלוּגֵי. וּבִישּׁוּלָא בָּתְרָיְיתָא הֲווֹ קָרוּ לֵיהּ צְלִי קֵדָר, וּבְעַאי לְמִיכַּס צָעָא אַבָּתְרֵהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: When I left house of the master, I was satiated. when I arrived there they served me sixty plates of sixty kinds of cooked dishes, and I ate sixty portions from them. The last dish was called pot roast, and I wanted to chew the plate afterward.
llm_translation: Abaye said: When I would leave the house of the Master, I would be satiated. When I would come there, they would bring me six se'ahs of various types of cooked dishes from the pot, and I would eat half of them. And after the meal, they would bring him a roasted dish, and he would want to cover the table with a cloth after it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: כָּפֵין עַנְיָא וְלָא יָדַע. אִי נָמֵי: רַוְוחָא לִבְסִימָא שְׁכִיחַ.
human_translation: Abaye said: This that people say: The poor is hungry and does not know Alternatively, Room for sweets found.
llm_translation: Abaye said, that is what people say: "He turns over the poor and does not know." Alternatively: "A heart at peace is a continual feast."

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר אָבִין מְחַלְּפִי סְעוֹדְתַּיְיהוּ לַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Abaye bar Avin and Rabbi Ḥanina bar Avin would exchange their meals with each other
llm_translation: Abbaye bar Avin and Rabbi Chanina bar Avin exchanged their meals with each other.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִיחַיַּיב אִינִישׁ לְבַסּוֹמֵי בְּפוּרַיָּא עַד דְּלָא יָדַע בֵּין אָרוּר הָמָן לְבָרוּךְ מָרְדֳּכַי.
human_translation: Rava said: A person is obligated to become intoxicated on Purim until he that he does not know between cursed is Haman and blessed is Mordecai.
llm_translation: Rava said: A person is obligated to become intoxicated on Purim until he does not know the difference between cursed be Haman and blessed be Mordechai.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה וְרַבִּי זֵירָא עֲבַדוּ סְעוּדַת פּוּרִים בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אִיבַּסּוּם. קָם רַבָּה שַׁחְטֵיהּ לְרַבִּי זֵירָא. לְמָחָר, בָּעֵי רַחֲמֵי וְאַחֲיֵיהּ. לְשָׁנָה, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נֵיתֵי מָר וְנַעֲבֵיד סְעוּדַת פּוּרִים בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא בְּכֹל שַׁעְתָּא וְשַׁעְתָּא מִתְרְחִישׁ נִיסָּא.
human_translation: Rabba and Rabbi Zeira prepared a Purim feast with each other, they became intoxicated Rabba arose and slaughtered Rabbi Zeira. The next day, asked for mercy, and revived him. The next year, said to Let Master come and let us prepare the Purim feast with each other. He said to him: Miracles do not happen each and every hour,
llm_translation: Rabba and Rabbi Zeira made a Purim feast together. They became intoxicated. Rabba arose and slaughtered Rabbi Zeira. The next day, he prayed for mercy and Rabbi Zeira came back to life. The following year, he said to him: "Come, my master, and let us make a Purim feast together." He said to him: "Not every moment does a miracle occur."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: סְעוּדַת פּוּרִים שֶׁאֲכָלָהּ בַּלַּיְלָה — לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא — ״יְמֵי מִשְׁתֶּה וְשִׂמְחָה״, כְּתִיב: רַב אָשֵׁי הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ (דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא), נְגַהּ וְלָא אֲתוֹ רַבָּנַן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אֲתוֹ רַבָּנַן? דִּלְמָא טְרִידִי בִּסְעוּדַת פּוּרִים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָא הֲוָה אֶפְשָׁר לְמֵיכְלַהּ בְּאוּרְתָּא? אָמַר לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ לְמָר הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא: סְעוּדַת פּוּרִים שֶׁאֲכָלָהּ בַּלַּיְלָה לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ? אָמַר לֵיהּ: (אָמַר רָבָא הָכִי?) [אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין]. תְּנָא מִינֵּיהּ אַרְבְּעִין זִימְנִין וְדָמֵי לֵיהּ כְּמַאן דְּמַנַּח בְּכִיסֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: A Purim feast that one ate at night did not fulfill his obligation. What is the reason? “Days of feasting and gladness” is written, Rav Ashi was sitting before Rav Kahana it grew dark and the Sages did not come. said to him: What is the reason that the Sages did not come Perhaps they are preoccupied with the Purim feast. said to him: Wasn’t it possible to eat at night said to him: Didn’t the master learn that which Rava said: A Purim feast that one ate at night did not fulfill his obligation? said to him: Did Rava say that? said to him: Yes. learned it from him forty times until it seemed to him as if it were placed in his purse.
llm_translation: Rava said: A Purim meal that one ate at night - he has not fulfilled his obligation. What is the reason? "Days of feasting and joy" is written. Rav Ashe was sitting before him (Rav Kahana), shining, and the Rabbis did not come. He said to him: What is the reason the Rabbis did not come? Perhaps they were busy with a Purim meal. He said to him: Was it not possible to eat it during the day? He said to him: Did the Master not hear what Rava said: A Purim meal that one ate at night, he has not fulfilled his obligation? He said to him: Did Rava really say this? He said to him: Yes. A Mishna supports him forty times, and his blood is upon him who puts it in his pocket.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין בֵּין יוֹם טוֹב לַשַּׁבָּת אֶלָּא אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: The difference between Festivals and Shabbat is only preparing food alone.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: There is no distinction between a festival and Shabbat except for food preparation alone.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא לְעִנְיַן מַכְשִׁירֵי אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין.
human_translation: that with regard to the matter of facilitate preparation of food, this, and that, are equal,
llm_translation: The matter of the requirements for food that sustains life - this and that are equal.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין בֵּין יוֹם טוֹב לַשַּׁבָּת אֶלָּא אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר אַף מַכְשִׁירֵי אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught The difference between Festivals and Shabbat is only preparing food. Rabbi Yehuda permits even facilitate preparation of food
llm_translation: Mishnaic teaching that is not like Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: There is no difference between a festival and Shabbat except for food preparation, Rabbi Yehuda permits even the preparation of food.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״הוּא״ — וְלֹא מַכְשִׁירָיו, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה (אָמַר): ״לָכֶם״ — לָכֶם לְכׇל צוֹרְכֵיכֶם.
human_translation: What is the reason of the first tanna ? verse states: “That” and not facilitate And Rabbi Yehuda says: “For you” for you, for all your needs.
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna taught? The verse says: "He" — and not his vessels, and Rabbi Yehuda said: "To you" — to you for all your needs.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב ״לָכֶם״? לָכֶם וְלֹא לְגוֹיִם, לָכֶם וְלֹא לִכְלָבִים.
human_translation: And the other, too, isn’t it written: “For you”? For you, and not for gentiles; for you, and not for dogs.
llm_translation: And the other one, it is written "to you"? To you and not to the nations, to you and not to the dogs.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב ״הוּא״? כְּתִיב ״הוּא״ וּכְתִיב ״לָכֶם״. כָּאן בְּמַכְשִׁירִין שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָן מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב, כָּאן בְּמַכְשִׁירִין שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָן מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: And the other too, isn’t it written: “That,” It is written: “That,” and it is written: “For you,” Here, to facilitate, which it is possible to perform them on the Festival eve there, to facilitate, which it is impossible to perform them on the Festival eve
llm_translation: And the other one says, is it not written "he"? It is written "he" and it is written "to you." Here, regarding items that can be prepared from Erev Yom Tov, and here, regarding items that cannot be prepared from Erev Yom Tov.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין בֵּין שַׁבָּת לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, אֶלָּא שֶׁזֶּה — זְדוֹנוֹ בִּידֵי אָדָם, וְזֶה — זְדוֹנוֹ בְּכָרֵת.
human_translation: The difference between Shabbat and Yom Kippur is only that this its intentional at the hand of Man, and that its intentional with karet .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There is no difference between Shabbat and Yom Kippur, except that this one - its intentional violation is subject to human agency, and that one - its intentional violation is subject to excision.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא לְעִנְיַן תַּשְׁלוּמִין — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין.
human_translation: that with regard to the matter of payment this, and that, are equal
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'mar ha le'inyan tashlumin - zeh vazeh shavin." Translation: The completion regarding payments - this and this are equal.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה אֶת יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים כַּשַּׁבָּת לְתַשְׁלוּמִין, מָה שַׁבָּת — מִתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ וּפָטוּר מִן הַתַּשְׁלוּמִין, אַף יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — מִתְחַיֵּיב בְּנַפְשׁוֹ וּפָטוּר מִן הַתַּשְׁלוּמִין.
human_translation: whose the mishna It is Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana, as it is taught Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana would render Yom Kippur like Shabbat with regard to payment Just as Shabbat he is liable to death and exempt from payment so too, Yom Kippur, he is liable to death and exempt from payment
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna of this Mishnah? It is Rabbi Neḥunia ben HaQana, as it was taught: Rabbi Neḥunia ben HaQana used to treat Yom Kippur like Shabbat regarding payment. Just as Shabbat—one is liable for his life and exempt from payment, so too Yom Kippur—one is liable for his life and exempt from payment.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת שֶׁלָּקוּ — נִפְטְרוּ מִידֵי כְּרִיתָתָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִקְלָה אָחִיךָ לְעֵינֶיךָ״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁלָּקָה — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּאָחִיךָ. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֲלוּקִין עָלָיו חֲבֵירָיו עַל רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: We learned there All liable to karet who were flogged were exempted from their karet , as it is stated “Then your brother shall be dishonored before you” once he was flogged he is like your brother, the statement of Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamliel. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamliel’s colleagues disagree with him
llm_translation: We learned there: all those liable to receive karet who were lashed - they are exempt from their karet, as it is stated: "And your brother shall be degraded in your eyes." Once he has been lashed - he is like your brother. These are the words of Rabbi Hananiah ben Gamliel. Rabbi Yochanan said: his colleagues disagreed with Rabbi Hananiah ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב, תְּנֵינָא: אֵין בֵּין יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לַשַּׁבָּת אֶלָּא שֶׁזֶּה — זְדוֹנוֹ בִּידֵי אָדָם, וְזֶה — זְדוֹנוֹ בְּהִיכָּרֵת. וְאִם אִיתָא — אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בִּידֵי אָדָם הִיא!
human_translation: Rava said the school of Rav said: We learned: The difference between Yom Kippur and Shabbat is only that this its intentional at the hand of Man; and that its intentional with karet . And if is so, this and that is at the hand of Man.
llm_translation: Rava said: The sages of the school of Rav taught: There is no difference between Yom Kippur and Shabbat except that this one – its preparation is in the hands of man, and that one – its preparation is by itself. And if it is necessary – both are in the hands of man!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי יִצְחָק הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מַלְקוֹת בְּחַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת לֵיכָּא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיבֵי כָרֵיתוֹת בַּכְּלָל הָיוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצָאת כָּרֵת בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ — לְדוּנָהּ בְּכָרֵת וְלֹא בְּמַלְקוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: whose is this It is Rabbi Yitzḥak, who said: There are no lashes in those liable karet , as it is taught Rabbi Yitzḥak says: those liable karet were included in And why was karet one’s sister excluded to sentence her to karet and not to lashes.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: This is the teaching of Rabbi Yitzchak, as he said: There are lashes for those liable to receive karet. As it was taught: Rabbi Yitzchak says: Those liable to receive karet were included in general, so why did karet come out specifically in its sister - to judge it with karet and not with lashes.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, זֶה — עִיקַּר זְדוֹנוֹ בִּידֵי אָדָם, וְזֶה — עִיקָּר זְדוֹנוֹ בְּהִיכָּרֵת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even you say the Rabbis this primary its intentional at the hand of Man; and that primary its intentional with karet .
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say they are scholars, this one - the main part of his arrogance is in the hands of man, and this one - the main part of his arrogance is in his recognition.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין בֵּין הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ לַמּוּדָּר מִמֶּנּוּ מַאֲכָל, אֶלָּא דְּרִיסַת הָרֶגֶל וְכֵלִים שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין בָּהֶן אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: The difference between one for whom benefit from another is forbidden by vow and one for whom benefit from food is forbidden by vow is only stepping foot and utensils that one does not use preparation of food,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There is no enjoyment between one consecrated item and another consecrated item from it in terms of food, except for trampling with the foot and vessels that are not used for food.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא לְעִנְיַן כֵּלִים שֶׁעוֹשִׂין בָּהֶן אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין.
human_translation: that with regard to the matter of utensils that one uses preparation of food, this, and that, are equal.
llm_translation: The matter of utensils that are used for preparing food - both this and that are equal.

hebrew_text: דְּרִיסַת הָרֶגֶל? הָא לָא קָפְדִי אִינָשֵׁי! אֲמַר רָבָא: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר: וִיתּוּר אָסוּר בְּמוּדַּר הֲנָאָה.
human_translation: stepping foot Aren’t people not particular Rava said: whose is this Rabbi Eliezer, who said: Overlooking is prohibited of one for whom benefit is forbidden by vow.
llm_translation: Tractate: Nedarim Translation: "Trampling with the foot? Is it not a form of disrespect! Rava said: This is the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer, who said: 'A surplus is prohibited in a vow of benefit.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין בֵּין נְדָרִים לִנְדָבוֹת, אֶלָּא שֶׁהַנְּדָרִים חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן, וּנְדָבוֹת אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן.
human_translation: The difference between vow and gift is only that vow is obligated in responsibility them, and gift is not obligated in responsibility them.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: There is no difference between vows and freewill offerings, except that vows require fulfillment, while freewill offerings do not require fulfillment.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא לְעִנְיַן ״בַּל תְּאַחֵר״ — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין.
human_translation: that with regard to the matter of Do not be slack this, and that, are equal.
llm_translation: Gemara: Regarding the matter of "do not delay" - both this and that are equal.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אֵי זֶהוּ נֶדֶר? הָאוֹמֵר: ״הֲרֵי עָלַי עוֹלָה״. אֵיזוֹ הִיא נְדָבָה? הָאוֹמֵר: ״הֲרֵי זוֹ עוֹלָה״, וּמָה בֵּין נְדָרִים לִנְדָבוֹת? נְדָרִים, מֵתוּ אוֹ נִגְנְבוּ אוֹ אָבְדוּ — חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן, נְדָבוֹת, מֵתוּ אוֹ נִגְנְבוּ אוֹ אָבְדוּ — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן.
human_translation: We learned there: Which is a vow one who says: upon me a burnt-offering. Which is a gift one who says: This burnt-offering. And what is between a vow and a gift vow died or were stolen or were lost, is obligated in responsibility them, gift died or were stolen or were lost, is not obligated in responsibility them.
llm_translation: We learned there: What is a vow? One who says, "Behold, upon me is an offering." What is a freewill offering? One who says, "Behold, this is an offering." And what is the difference between vows and freewill offerings? Vows, if they died, were stolen, or were lost - one is obligated in their replacement. Freewill offerings, if they died, were stolen, or were lost - one is not obligated in their replacement.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְנִרְצָה לוֹ לְכַפֵּר עָלָיו״, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֶת שֶׁעָלָיו — חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ, וְאֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ עָלָיו — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ.
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught “And it shall be accepted for him to make atonement upon him” Rabbi Shimon says: That which is upon him, he bears responsibility it however, that which is not upon him, does not bear responsibility it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are the particulars? For the Rabbis taught: "And he shall be forgiven," Rabbi Shimon says: That which is upon him - he is liable for its consequences, and that which is not upon him - he is not liable for its consequences.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״עָלַי״ — כְּמַאן דִּטְעִין אַכַּתְפֵּיהּ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: From where may be inferred Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said: Since he said upon me considered as one who bears upon his shoulders.
llm_translation: What is implied? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi said: Since it says "upon me" - it is as if one has placed his hand upon him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין בֵּין זָב הָרוֹאֶה שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת לָרוֹאֶה שָׁלֹשׁ אֶלָּא קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: The difference between a zav who experiences two emissions and one who experiences three is only an offering
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There is no difference between a Zav who sees two emissions and one who sees three, except for the offering.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא לְעִנְיַן מִשְׁכָּב וּמוֹשָׁב וּסְפִירַת שִׁבְעָה — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין.
human_translation: that with regard to the matter of lying and sitting, and the counting of seven this, and that, are equal.
llm_translation: The matter of lying down, sitting, and counting seven - this and that are equal.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: רַבִּי סִימַאי אוֹמֵר: מָנָה הַכָּתוּב שְׁתַּיִם, וּקְרָאוֹ ״טָמֵא״. שָׁלֹשׁ, וּקְרָאוֹ ״טָמֵא״. הָא כֵּיצַד? שְׁתַּיִם לַטּוּמְאָה וְשָׁלֹשׁ לַקׇּרְבָּן.
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught Rabbi Simai says: The verse enumerated two and it called impure. three and it called him impure. How so? Two to impurity and three to an offering.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: What are the types of words? For the Rabbis taught: Rabbi Simai says: The Scripture counted two, and it called it "unclean." Three, and it called it "unclean." How so? Two for impurity and three for sacrifice.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימַר: שְׁתַּיִם לְטוּמְאָה וְלֹא לְקׇרְבָּן, שָׁלֹשׁ לְקׇרְבָּן וְלֹא לְטוּמְאָה! אָמְרַתְּ: עַד שֶׁלֹּא רָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ רָאָה שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: And say Two to impurity but not to an offering; three to an offering, but not to impurity. you say until he experienced three he experienced two,
llm_translation: And say: Two for impurity and not for sacrifice, three for sacrifice and not for impurity! You say: Until he has not seen three, he has seen two.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימַר: שְׁתַּיִם לְקׇרְבָּן וְלֹא לְטוּמְאָה, שָׁלֹשׁ אַף לְטוּמְאָה! לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְכִפֶּר עָלָיו הַכֹּהֵן לִפְנֵי ה׳ מִזּוֹבוֹ״, מִקְצָת זָבִין מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן וּמִקְצָת זָבִין אֵין מְבִיאִין קׇרְבָּן. הָא כֵּיצַד? רָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ — מֵבִיא, שְׁתַּיִם — אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא.
human_translation: And say Two to an offering, but not to impurity; three to impurity as well. cannot enter your mind, as it is taught “And the priest shall make atonement for him before the Lord from his emission” some zav bring an offering and some zav do not bring an offering. How so? he experienced three he brings two he does not bring
llm_translation: And say: two for offering and not for impurity, three also for impurity! It is not as you think, for it was taught: "And the priest shall make atonement for him before the Lord from his discharge," some discharges bring an offering and some discharges do not bring an offering. How so? If he saw three - he brings, if he saw two - he does not bring.

hebrew_text: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא: רָאָה שְׁתַּיִם — מֵבִיא, רָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ — אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא, אָמְרַתְּ: עַד שֶׁלֹּא רָאָה שָׁלֹשׁ רָאָה שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: Or it nothing other one experienced two he brings he experienced three he does not bring you say until he experienced three he experienced two,
llm_translation: Or, if not: he saw two - he brings, he saw three - he does not bring, you said: until he saw three, he saw two.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ דְּרַבִּי סִימַאי וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ ״מִזּוֹבוֹ״, דְּאִי מִדְּרַבִּי סִימַאי — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא כִּי קוּשְׁיַין, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן ״מִזּוֹבוֹ״. וְאִי ״מִזּוֹבוֹ״ — לָא יָדַעְנָא כַּמָּה רְאִיּוֹת, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דְּרַבִּי סִימַאי.
human_translation: It was necessary of Rabbi Simai and it was necessary From his emission. As if from of Rabbi Simai, I would have said in accordance with our question: it teaches us: From his emission. And if From his emission, I would not have known how many emissions it teaches us by Rabbi Simai.
llm_translation: And it was necessary for Rabbi Simlai, and it was necessary "mizovo," for if from Rabbi Simlai - I would have said that they are difficult, it teaches us "mizovo." And if "mizovo" - we would not have known how many proofs, it teaches us of Rabbi Simlai.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ ״מִזּוֹבוֹ״ לִדְרָשָׁא, ״וְכִי יִטְהַר הַזָּב מִזּוֹבוֹ״ מַאי דָּרְשַׁתְּ בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: And now that you said From his emission, for derivation, what do you derive from “And when the zav is cleansed from his emission”
llm_translation: And now, as you have said "from his discharge" for interpretation, "and if the discharge of the discharge shall be clean," what do you interpret in it?

hebrew_text: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״וְכִי יִטְהַר הַזָּב״ — לִכְשֶׁיִּפְסוֹק מִזּוֹבוֹ, [״מִזּוֹבוֹ״ —] וְלֹא מִזּוֹבוֹ וְנִגְעוֹ. ״מִזּוֹבוֹ וְסָפַר״ — לִימֵּד עַל זָב בַּעַל שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת שֶׁטָּעוּן סְפִירַת שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: That is needed to that which was taught “And when the zav is cleansed when cease. From his emission, from his emission, but not from his emission and his leprosy. “From his emission, then he shall count”: This teaches concerning a zav who experienced two emissions, that he requires a count of seven
llm_translation: That one asked him according to the teaching: "And if the discharge of the zav shall cease" — when his flow ceases, "his flow" — not his flow and his touch. "His flow and he shall count" — it teaches regarding a zav with two sightings that are laden with the counting of seven.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דִּין הוּא, אִם מְטַמֵּא מִשְׁכָּב וּמוֹשָׁב לֹא יְהֵא טָעוּן סְפִירַת שִׁבְעָה?
human_translation: But isn’t it logical? renders lying and sitting ritually impure wouldn’t he require a count of seven
llm_translation: And isn't it the same law, if one defiles a bed or seat, does it not require counting seven?

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם תּוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁמְּטַמְּאָה מִשְׁכָּב וּמוֹשָׁב, וְאֵינָהּ טְעוּנָה סְפִירַת שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: A woman who observes a day for day will prove because she renders lying and sitting ritually impure, and she does not require a count of seven
llm_translation: Guarding the day against the day, she shall reprove, for she defiles through lying and sitting, yet she is not obligated to count seven clean days.

hebrew_text: וְאַף אַתָּה אַל תִּתְמַהּ עַל זֶה, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמְּטַמֵּא מִשְׁכָּב וּמוֹשָׁב לֹא יְהֵא טָעוּן סְפִירַת שִׁבְעָה, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִזּוֹבוֹ וְסָפַר״, מִקְצָת זוֹבוֹ וְסָפַר — לִימֵּד עַל זָב בַּעַל שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת שֶׁטָּעוּן סְפִירַת שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: And you too should not be surprised that this although he renders lying and sitting ritually impure, he does not require a count of seven the verse states: “From his emission, then he shall count,” a partial zav Then he shall count. This teaches concerning a zav who experienced two emissions, that he requires a count of seven
llm_translation: And you too do not wonder about this, that even though one who becomes impure through seminal emission or bodily discharge does not require counting seven clean days, the Scripture says: "from his discharge and he counts," teaching about a man with two appearances who requires counting seven clean days.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: מַאי שְׁנָא הַאי ״מִזּוֹבוֹ״ דִּמְרַבֵּי בֵּיהּ זָב בַּעַל שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הַאי ״מִזּוֹבוֹ״ דִּמְמַעֵט בֵּיהּ זָב בַּעַל שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: What is different this From his emission,” which include a zav who experienced two emissions and what is different that From his emission,” which exclude a zav who experienced two emissions
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abbaye: What is the difference between this "mizovo" that increases in it a zav with two sightings, and what is the difference between this "mizovo" that decreases in it a zav with two sightings?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ הַאי לְמַעוֹטֵי הוּא דַּאֲתָא — לִישְׁתּוֹק קְרָא מִינֵּיהּ, וְכִי תֵּימָא: אָתְיָא מִדִּינָא, שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם תּוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: said to him: If it enters your mind this comes to exclude let the verse remain silent And if you would say can be inferred logically, a woman who observes a day for a day will prove
llm_translation: He said to him: If it is according to your opinion that this is a case of diminishing, let the verse be uprooted from it, and if you will say: It comes from the law, "Day shall testify against day" (Psalms 19:3).

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ ״מִזּוֹבוֹ״ וְלֹא מִנִּגְעוֹ, אִם כֵּן לִיכְתּוֹב קְרָא ״וְכִי יִטְהַר הַזָּב״ וְלִישְׁתּוֹק. ״מִזּוֹבוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? לִימֵּד עַל זָב בַּעַל שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת שֶׁטָּעוּן סְפִירַת שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: And if you would say this is needed from his emission and not from his leprosy if so, let the verse write: “And when the zav is cleansed” and let remain silent Why do I From his emission? teaches concerning a zav who experienced two emissions, that he requires a count of seven
llm_translation: And if you will say: This phrase is needed to include "his discharge" and not his affliction, if so, let it be written in the verse "and when the discharge ceases," and it will be clear. "His discharge" - why do I need it? To teach about a discharge that has two appearances, which is laden with a count of seven.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין בֵּין מְצוֹרָע מוּסְגָּר לִמְצוֹרָע מוּחְלָט אֶלָּא פְּרִיעָה וּפְרִימָה.
human_translation: The difference between a quarantined leper, and a confirmed leper, is only letting wild and rending
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There is no difference between a leper who is quarantined and a leper who is declared clean, except for covering and uncovering.

hebrew_text: אֵין בֵּין טָהוֹר מִתּוֹךְ הֶסְגֵּר לְטָהוֹר מִתּוֹךְ הֶחְלֵט אֶלָּא תִּגְלַחַת וְצִפֳּרִים.
human_translation: The difference between purified from quarantine, and purified from confirmed is only shaving and birds
llm_translation: There is no difference between pure from within a barrier to pure from within a partition except shaving and birds.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא לְעִנְיַן שִׁילּוּחַ [וְטוּמְאָה] — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין.
human_translation: that with regard to the matter of expulsion, and ritual impurity this, and that, are equal.
llm_translation: Gemara: Regarding the matter of shiluach ve'tum'ah - this and that are equal.

hebrew_text: מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנֵי רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: ״וְטִהֲרוֹ הַכֹּהֵן מִסְפַּחַת הִיא וְכִבֶּס בְּגָדָיו וְטָהֵר״, טָהוֹר מִפְּרִיעָה וּפְרִימָה דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: From where are these matters as Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak taught before Rav Huna. “The priest shall pronounce him clean: It is but a scab, and he shall wash his clothes and be purified [ vetaher ]” that at the outset, he was pure from letting wild and rending
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are the details? For Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak taught before Rav Huna: "And the priest shall pronounce him clean; and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean." Clean from the primary impurity and secondary impurity from the outset.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, גַּבֵּי זָב דִּכְתִיב ״וְכִבֶּס בְּגָדָיו וְטָהֵר״, הָתָם מַאי ״וְטָהֵר״ מֵעִיקָּרָא אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Rava said to him: However, if so, with regard to a zav , as it is written: “And he shall wash his clothes, and he shall be clean [ vetaher ]” there, what of: And he shall be clean, at the outset is there
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Rather, from now on, regarding a Zav, as it is written "and he shall wash his clothes and be clean," what is the meaning of "and be clean" there from the outset?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: טָהוֹר הַשְׁתָּא מִלְּטַמֵּא כְּלִי חֶרֶס בְּהֶיסֵּט, אַף עַל גַּב דַּהֲדַר חָזֵי — לָא מְטַמֵּא לְמַפְרֵעַ.
human_translation: Rather, he is now pure from rendering earthenware vessels impure through movement. even if he then experiences another he does not render impure retroactively.
llm_translation: Rather: pure now from becoming impure vessel of earthenware in vinegar, even though it will later see - does not become impure to negate.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי טָהוֹר [הַשְׁתָּא מִלְּטַמֵּא בְּבִיאָה לְמַפְרֵעַ].
human_translation: Here too, is now pure from retroactively rendering impure by entrance
llm_translation: Here, we say "pure" meaning, it is different to become impure through intercourse for the purpose of rebellion.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, מֵהָכָא: ״וְהַצָּרוּעַ אֲשֶׁר בּוֹ הַנֶּגַע״, מִי שֶׁצָּרַעְתּוֹ תְּלוּיָה בְּגוּפוֹ — יָצָא זֶה שֶׁאֵין צָרַעְתּוֹ תְּלוּיָה בְּגוּפוֹ אֶלָּא בְּיָמִים.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said from here. “And the leper in whom [ bo ] the plague is, one whose leprosy is dependent on his body, excludes that whose leprosy is not dependent on his body, but rather on days,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said, from here: "And the leper in whom the affliction is," one whose affliction is dependent on his body — this one has gone out, that his affliction is not dependent on his body but on garments.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה ״כָּל יְמֵי אֲשֶׁר הַנֶּגַע בּוֹ יִטְמָא״, מִי שֶׁצָּרַעְתּוֹ תְּלוּיָה בְּגוּפוֹ — הוּא דְּטָעוּן שִׁילּוּחַ, וְשֶׁאֵין צָרַעְתּוֹ תְּלוּיָה בְּגוּפוֹ — אֵין טָעוּן שִׁילּוּחַ,
human_translation: Abaye said to him: However, if so, “All the days during which the plague shall be in him [ bo ] he shall be impure” one whose leprosy is dependent on his body requires expulsion and one whose leprosy is not dependent on his body, does not require expulsion.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather, from now on, "all the days that the affliction is upon him, he shall be unclean," if his leprosy is dependent on his body - he requires shaving, but if his leprosy is not dependent on his body - he does not require shaving.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָא קָתָנֵי: אֵין בֵּין מְצוֹרָע מוּסְגָּר לִמְצוֹרָע מוּחְלָט אֶלָּא פְּרִיעָה וּפְרִימָה, הָא לְעִנְיַן שִׁילּוּחַ וּלְטַמּוֹיֵי בְּבִיאָה — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין!
human_translation: And if you would say: Indeed so, but isn’t it taught The difference between a quarantined leper and a confirmed leper is only letting wild and rending that with regard to the matter of expulsion and to render impure by entry this, and that, are equal.
llm_translation: And if you will say: So it is indeed, but isn't it taught: There is no difference between a leper who is isolated and a leper who is free, except for covering and uncovering, this is regarding sending away and regarding immersion in coming — this and that are equal!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״יְמֵי״ ״כׇּל יְמֵי״ — לְרַבּוֹת מְצוֹרָע מוּסְגָּר לְשִׁילּוּחַ.
human_translation: said to him: The days All the days, to include a quarantined leper of expulsion
llm_translation: He said to him: "Days" "all the days" - to include a leper who is completely closed off for sending away.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תִּגְלַחַת וְצִפֳּרִים מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? דְּקָתָנֵי: אֵין בֵּין טָהוֹר מִתּוֹךְ הֶסְגֵּר לַטָּהוֹר מִתּוֹךְ הֶחְלֵט — אֶלָּא תִּגְלַחַת וְצִפֳּרִים!
human_translation: If that is so, what is the reason is not shaving and birds As it teaches The difference between purified from quarantine, and purified from confirmed is only shaving and birds
llm_translation: So, regarding shaving and birds, what is the reason that it is not allowed? Because it is taught: There is no difference between a pure animal from within a fence to a pure animal from within a partition - except for shaving and birds!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְיָצָא הַכֹּהֵן אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה וְהִנֵּה נִרְפָּא נֶגַע הַצָּרַעַת״, מִי שֶׁצָּרַעְתּוֹ תְּלוּיָה בִּרְפוּאוֹת. יָצָא זֶה שֶׁאֵין צָרַעְתּוֹ תְּלוּיָה בִּרְפוּאוֹת אֶלָּא בְּיָמִים.
human_translation: Abaye said verse states: “And the priest shall go out of the camp, and behold, if the plague of leprosy is healed whose leprosy is dependent on healing, to exclude that whose leprosy is not dependent on healing but rather on days.
llm_translation: Abaye said: The verse states: "And the kohen shall go out to the outside of the camp, and behold, the affliction of tzara'at has healed." This teaches that if his tzara'at is dependent on healings, this one goes out, whose tzara'at is not dependent on healings, only on days.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין בֵּין סְפָרִים לִתְפִלִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת, אֶלָּא שֶׁהַסְּפָרִים נִכְתָּבִין בְּכׇל לָשׁוֹן, וּתְפִלִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת אֵינָן נִכְתָּבוֹת אֶלָּא אַשּׁוּרִית.
human_translation: The difference between scrolls, and phylacteries and mezuzot , is only that scrolls are written in any language, whereas phylacteries and mezuzot are written only in Ashurit ,
llm_translation: It was taught: There is no difference between scrolls, tefillin, and mezuzot, except that scrolls are written in any language, while tefillin and mezuzot are written only in Assyrian script.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף בִּסְפָרִים לֹא הִתִּירוּ שֶׁיִּכָּתְבוּ אֶלָּא יְווֹנִית.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even with regard to scrolls, permitted them to be written only Greek.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even in books they did not permit that they should be written except in Greek.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא לְתוֹפְרָן בְּגִידִין וּלְטַמֵּא אֶת הַיָּדַיִם — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין.
human_translation: that to the matter of stitching with sinews, and to rendering the hands impure, this, and that, equal.
llm_translation: The text says: "If one comes to sew with sinews and to render the hands impure - both are equal."

hebrew_text: וּסְפָרִים נִכְתָּבִין בְּכׇל לָשׁוֹן וְכוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: מִקְרָא שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ תַּרְגּוּם, וְתַרְגּוּם שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ מִקְרָא, וּכְתָב עִבְרִי — אֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא אֶת הַיָּדַיִם עַד שֶׁיִּכְתְּבֶנּוּ בִּכְתָב אַשּׁוּרִית, עַל הַסֵּפֶר, וּבִדְיוֹ.
human_translation: scrolls are written in any language. And raises a contradiction Bible that one wrote in translation, translation that one wrote Bible, in Hebrew script renders the hands impure only if one writes it in Ashurit script, on a scroll, and in ink.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And books are written in every language, etc. And they raised a dilemma: If one wrote a verse in translation, and the translation in the original, and he wrote in Hebrew — it does not render the hands impure until it is written in Assyrian script, on a scroll, and with ink.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא
human_translation: Rava said: not difficult.
llm_translation: Rava said: Not difficult.

hebrew_text: כָּאן בְּגּוֹפָן שֶׁלָּנוּ, כָּאן בְּגּוֹפָן שֶׁלָּהֶן.
human_translation: Here, in our script, There, in their script,
llm_translation: Here in our body, here in their body.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתָּא לְהַהִיא? בְּגּוֹפָן שֶׁלָּהֶן, מַאי אִירְיָא מִקְרָא שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ תַּרְגּוּם וְתַרְגּוּם שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ מִקְרָא? אֲפִילּוּ מִקְרָא שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ מִקְרָא וְתַרְגּוּם שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ תַּרְגּוּם נָמֵי. דְּהָא קָתָנֵי: עַד שֶׁיִּכְתְּבֶנּוּ אַשּׁוּרִית עַל הַסֵּפֶר בִּדְיוֹ!
human_translation: Abaye said to How did you establish that in their script? why specifically teach Bible that one wrote translation, or translation that one wrote Bible, even Bible that one wrote Bible and translation that one wrote in translation also as it is taught only if one writes it in Ashurit on a scroll, in ink.
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: With what did you establish that? With their own body. What is the meaning of a verse that its translation is written, and a translation that its verse is written? Even a verse that its translation is written, and a translation that its verse is written is also called a translation. As it was taught: Until it is written in Assyrian on the scroll with ink!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבָּנַן, הָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rather, not difficult. This the Rabbis, that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult: this is the Rabbanan, this is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: אִי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָא אִיכָּא יְוָנִית! אֶלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּסְפָרִים, כָּאן בִּתְפִלִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, isn’t there Greek Rather, not difficult. Here, scrolls, there,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Is there a Greek woman here! Rather, it is not difficult: here in books, here in phylacteries and mezuzot.

hebrew_text: תְּפִלִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ: ״וְהָיוּ״ — בַּהֲוָיָיתָן יְהוּ, מַאי תַּרְגּוּם שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ מִקְרָא אִיכָּא? בִּשְׁלָמָא תּוֹרָה — אִיכָּא ״יְגַר שָׂהֲדוּתָא״, אֶלָּא הָכָא מַאי תַּרְגּוּם אִיכָּא?
human_translation: phylacteries and mezuzot , what is the reason because it is written with regard to them: “And shall be” as they are so shall they be, what translation that one wrote Bible is there? Granted, Torah there is “ Yegar sahaduta ” however, here, what translation are there
llm_translation: Tefillin and mezuzot, what is the reason? Because it is written in them: "And they shall be" - in their being they shall be. What is the translation of the verse that is written in the Scripture? In the case of the Torah - there is "yegar sahaduta," but here what is the translation that is there?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּמְגִילָּה, כָּאן בִּסְפָרִים. מְגִילָּה מַאי טַעְמָא, דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ: ״כִּכְתָבָם וְכִלְשׁוֹנָם״. מַאי תַּרְגּוּם שֶׁכְּתָבוֹ מִקְרָא אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Rather, not difficult. Here, is referring to Megilla, there, is referring to scrolls, What is the reason Megilla that it is written with regard to “According to their writing, and according to their language” what translation that one wrote Bible is there?
llm_translation: Rather, it is not difficult: here in Megillah, here in Sifrei. What is the reason for Megillah, as it is written in it: "as their writing and as their language." What is the translation that there is a verse that he wrote?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: ״וְנִשְׁמַע פִּתְגָם הַמֶּלֶךְ״. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: ״וְכׇל הַנָּשִׁים יִתְּנוּ יְקָר לְבַעְלֵיהֶן״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said “And when the king’s decree [ pitgam ] shall be publicized” Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said “And all the wives will give honor [ yekar ] to their husbands”
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "And the decree of the king shall be heard." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "And all women shall give honor to their husbands."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא בִּשְׁאָר סְפָרִים, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: תְּפִלִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת אֵין נִכְתָּבִין אֶלָּא אַשּׁוּרִית, וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ הִתִּירוּ יְוָנִית.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: When that is taught with regard to the rest of books And it is Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Phylacteries and mezuzot are written only in Ashurit ; and our Rabbis permitted Greek
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: When that was taught in other books, and it is Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: Phylacteries and mezuzot are written only in Assyrian script, and our Rabbis permitted Greek.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב ״וְהָיוּ״! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: סְפָרִים נִכְתָּבִים בְּכׇל לָשׁוֹן, וְרַבּוֹתֵינוּ הִתִּירוּ יְוָנִית. הִתִּירוּ?! מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא אָסַר!
human_translation: Isn’t it written “And shall be” Rather, say scrolls are written in any language; and our Rabbis permitted in Greek permitted? By inference, the first tanna prohibits
llm_translation: And it is written "and they shall be"! Rather say: Books are written in every language, and our Rabbis permitted Greek. They permitted?! From the general principle as the first Tanna taught, he prohibited!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: רַבּוֹתֵינוּ לֹא הִתִּירוּ שֶׁיִּכָּתְבוּ אֶלָּא יְוָנִית. וְתַנְיָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אַף כְּשֶׁהִתִּירוּ רַבּוֹתֵינוּ יְוָנִית — לֹא הִתִּירוּ אֶלָּא בְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרָה,
human_translation: Rather, say And our Rabbis permitted them to be written only in Greek. And it is taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Even when our Rabbis permitted Greek, they permitted it only in a Torah scroll,
llm_translation: Rather say: Our Rabbis did not permit that they be written except in Greek. And it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: Even when our Rabbis permitted Greek, they only permitted it in the Torah scroll.

hebrew_text: וּמִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה דְּתַלְמַי הַמֶּלֶךְ. דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּתַלְמַי הַמֶּלֶךְ שֶׁכִּינֵּס שִׁבְעִים וּשְׁנַיִם זְקֵנִים וְהִכְנִיסָן בְּשִׁבְעִים וּשְׁנַיִם בָּתִּים וְלֹא גִּילָּה לָהֶם עַל מָה כִּינְסָן. וְנִכְנַס אֵצֶל כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, וְאָמַר לָהֶם: כִּתְבוּ לִי תּוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה רַבְּכֶם. נָתַן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּלֵב כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד עֵצָה וְהִסְכִּימוּ כּוּלָּן לְדַעַת אַחַת.
human_translation: And due to the incident of King Ptolemy, as it is taught an incident involving King Ptolemy who assembled seventy-two Elders and put them into seventy-two rooms, and did not reveal to them for what he assembled them, He entered approached each and every one, and said to them: Write for me the Torah of Moses your teacher. The Holy One, Blessed be He, placed wisdom in the heart of each and every one, and they all agreed to one understanding.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And because of the incident involving King Ptolemy. For it was taught: There was an incident with King Ptolemy who gathered seventy-two elders and placed them in seventy-two houses, and did not reveal to them why he had gathered them. And he went to each one individually and said to them: Write for me the Torah of Moses your teacher. The Holy One, blessed be He, placed in the heart of each and every one of them counsel, and they all agreed to the same opinion.

hebrew_text: וְכָתְבוּ לוֹ: ״אֱלֹהִים בָּרָא בְּרֵאשִׁית״. ״אֶעֱשֶׂה אָדָם בְּצֶלֶם וּבִדְמוּת״.
human_translation: And they wrote for him: God created in the beginning [ bereshit ], I shall make man in image and in likeness,
llm_translation: And they wrote for him: "Elohim created in the beginning." "I will make man in image and likeness."

hebrew_text: ״וַיְכַל בְּיוֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁי וַיִּשְׁבּוֹת בְּיוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״. ״זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה בְּרָאוֹ״, וְלֹא כָּתְבוּ ״בְּרָאָם״.
human_translation: And on the sixth day He concluded and He rested on the seventh day. Male and female He created him, and they did not write He created them”
llm_translation: "And He finished on the sixth day, and rested on the seventh day." "Male and female He created them," and it did not write "created them."

hebrew_text: ״הָבָה אֵרְדָה וְאָבְלָה שָׁם שְׂפָתָם״. ״וַתִּצְחַק שָׂרָה בִּקְרוֹבֶיהָ״.
human_translation: Come, let me go down, and there confound their language. And Sarah laughed among her relatives [ bikroveha ].
llm_translation: "Come, let us go down and confuse their language." "And Sarah laughed within herself."

hebrew_text: ״כִּי בְאַפָּם הָרְגוּ שׁוֹר וּבִרְצוֹנָם עִקְּרוּ אֵבוּס״. ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְאֶת בָּנָיו וַיַּרְכִּיבֵם עַל נוֹשֵׂא בְּנֵי אָדָם״.
human_translation: For in their anger they slew an ox and in their self-will they uprooted a trough, And Moses took his wife and his sons, and set them upon a carrier of people,
llm_translation: "When in their anger they killed an ox, and at their will they uprooted a wall." "And Moses took his wife and his sons and mounted them on a donkey."

hebrew_text: ״וּמוֹשַׁב בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר יָשְׁבוּ בְּמִצְרָיִם וּבִשְׁאָר אֲרָצוֹת אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה״. ״וַיִּשְׁלַח אֶת זַאֲטוּטֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״. ״וְאֶל זַאֲטוּטֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא שָׁלַח יָדוֹ״.
human_translation: And the residence of the children of Israel, who resided in Egypt and in other lands, was four hundred years. And he sent the elect [ za’atutei ] of the children of Israel. And upon the elect of the children of Israel He laid not His hand.
llm_translation: "And the dwelling of the children of Israel who dwelt in Egypt and in the other lands was four hundred years." "And he sent Zatutai the children of Israel." "And to Zatutai the children of Israel, his hand did not reach."

hebrew_text: ״לֹא חֶמֶד אֶחָד מֵהֶם נָשָׂאתִי״. ״אֲשֶׁר חָלַק ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ אֹתָם לְהָאִיר לְכׇל הָעַמִּים״.
human_translation: “I have not taken one item of value [ ḥemed ] from them,” “Which the Lord your God has allotted to give light to all the nations,”
llm_translation: "Not desired one of them I have taken." "Which divided the Lord your God them to illuminate to all the nations."

hebrew_text: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיַּעֲבוֹד אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים אֲשֶׁר לֹא צִוִּיתִי לְעוֹבְדָם״.
human_translation: “And has gone and served other gods, which I have not commanded” to serve them.
llm_translation: "And he went and served other gods that I did not command to serve."

hebrew_text: וְכָתְבוּ לוֹ: ״אֶת צְעִירַת הָרַגְלַיִם״, וְלֹא כָּתְבוּ לוֹ ״אֶת הָאַרְנֶבֶת״, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל תַּלְמַי אַרְנֶבֶת שְׁמָהּ, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר שָׂחֲקוּ בִּי הַיְּהוּדִים וְהֵטִילוּ שֵׁם אִשְׁתִּי בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: And they wrote for him: The short-legged beast [ tze’irat haraglayim ]. And they did not write for him: “And the hare [ arnevet ]” since the name of Ptolemy’s wife Arnevet, so that he would not say: The Jews have mocked me and inserted my wife’s name in the Torah.
llm_translation: And they shall write to him: "The youngest of the legs," and they did not write to him "the hare," because the wife of Talmi is called Hare, so that it should not be said, "The Jews mocked me and cast the name of my wife in the Torah."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף בַּסְּפָרִים לֹא הִתִּירוּ שֶׁיִּכָּתְבוּ אֶלָּא יְוָנִית. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אָמַר קְרָא: ״יַפְתְּ אֱלֹהִים לְיֶפֶת וְיִשְׁכֹּן בְּאׇהֳלֵי שֵׁם״, דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל יֶפֶת יִהְיוּ בְּאׇהֳלֵי שֵׁם.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even with regard to scrolls, permitted them to be written only Greek. Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the reason of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? verse states: “God shall enlarge Japheth, and He shall dwell in the tents of Shem” the words of Japheth shall be in the tents of Shem.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even in books they did not permit that they be written except in Greek. Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The halakha is like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. And Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the reason for Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel's statement? He said a verse: "God shall enlarge Japheth, and he shall dwell in the tents of Shem," the words of Japheth shall be in the tents of Shem.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא גּוֹמֶר וּמָגוֹג? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״יַפְתְּ אֱלֹהִים לְיֶפֶת״, יַפְיוּתוֹ שֶׁל יֶפֶת יְהֵא בְּאׇהֳלֵי שֵׁם.
human_translation: And say Gomer and Magog Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: This is the reason, as it is written: “God shall enlarge [ yaft ] Japheth [ Yefet ].” the beauty of Japheth shall be in the tents of Shem,
llm_translation: And why mention Gomer and Magog? Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said: This is the reason, as it is written: "God shall enlarge Japheth, and he shall dwell in the tents of Shem."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין בֵּין כֹּהֵן מָשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה לִמְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים אֶלָּא פַּר הַבָּא עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת.
human_translation: The difference between a Priest anointed with the oil of anointing, and multiple garments is only bull that comes for any of the mitzvot.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There is no difference between a Kohen anointed with the anointing oil to wear many garments, except for the bull that comes for all the commandments.

hebrew_text: אֵין בֵּין כֹּהֵן מְשַׁמֵּשׁ לְכֹהֵן שֶׁעָבַר אֶלָּא פַּר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים וַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה.
human_translation: The difference between a Priest serving and a former Priest, is only the bull Yom Kippur, and the tenth of an ephah
llm_translation: There is no difference between a serving priest and a priest who has transgressed, except for the bull of Yom Kippur and a tenth of an ephah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא לְעִנְיַן פַּר יוֹם כִּפּוּרִים וַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין.
human_translation: that to the matter of the bull Yom Kippur, and the tenth of an ephah this, and that, equal.
llm_translation: The matter is regarding the bull of Yom Kippur and the tenth of the ephah - this and that are equal.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, [הָא תַּנְיָא]: מְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים מֵבִיא פַּר הַבָּא עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Meir, as if it Rabbi Meir, Isn’t it taught multiple garments brings the bull brought for any of the mitzvot; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: He does not bring
llm_translation: Mishnaic teaching that is not like Rabbi Meir, for if it were like Rabbi Meir, here is a teaching: If one brings many garments, the bull brought for all the commandments, the words of Rabbi Meir, and the sages say: he does not bring.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר — דְּתַנְיָא: ״מָשִׁיחַ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא מָשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה, מְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הַמָּשִׁיחַ״.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir? as it is taught anointed, I have only anointed with the oil of anointing. From where multiple garments The verse states: “The anointed,”
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir? - For it was taught: "Anointed," I have nothing except one anointed with the anointing oil, how do I know that it refers to one who is clothed in many garments? The Torah teaches: "The anointed one."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְנָא — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אֵין בֵּין כֹּהֵן מְשַׁמֵּשׁ לְכֹהֵן שֶׁעָבַר אֶלָּא פַּר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים וַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה. הָא לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶן — זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִין, אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵירַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל וּמִינּוּ כֹּהֵן אַחֵר תַּחְתָּיו, רִאשׁוֹן — חוֹזֵר לַעֲבוֹדָתוֹ, שֵׁנִי — כׇּל מִצְוֹת כְּהוּנָּה גְּדוֹלָה עָלָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: רִאשׁוֹן — חוֹזֵר לַעֲבוֹדָתוֹ, שֵׁנִי — אֵינוֹ רָאוּי לֹא לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל וְלֹא לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: How did we establish that not in accordance with Rabbi Meir. Say the latter clause The difference between a Priest serving and a former Priest is only the bull on Yom Kippur, and the tenth of an ephah that to all matters, this, and that, equal. we have arrived at Rabbi Meir, as it is taught disqualification befell and they appointed another priest in his stead, the first returns to his service the second all of the mitzvot of the High Priest upon him; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: The first returns to his service; the second is fit neither as a High Priest nor as a common priest.
llm_translation: With what are we establishing this case? — That it is not like Rabbi Meir. Say the latter clause: There is no difference between a serving priest and a priest who has passed, except for the bull of Yom Kippur and a tenth of an ephah. This applies to all their matters — both are equal. They came to Rabbi Meir, for it was taught: If a blemish occurred in him, and his substitute is another priest, the first one returns to his service, the second one takes on all the commandments of the great priesthood, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: The first one returns to his service, the second one is not fit for either the high priest or an ordinary priest.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵף בֶּן אִלֵּם מִצִּיפּוֹרִי שֶׁאֵירַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל וּמִינּוּהוּ תַּחְתָּיו, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים, וְאָמְרוּ: רִאשׁוֹן — חוֹזֵר לַעֲבוֹדָתוֹ, שֵׁנִי — אֵינוֹ רָאוּי לֹא לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל וְלֹא לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei said: an incident involving Rabbi Yosef ben Elem of Tzippori, when disqualification befell a High Priest, appointed him in his stead. And the incident came before the Sages And said: original returns to his service, second is fit neither as High Priest nor as a common priest.
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Yosei: There was an incident with Rabbi Yosef ben Illem of Zippori, where a blemish was found in him unfitting for the High Priesthood, yet his lineage was beneath it. The matter came before the sages, and they said: The first — he returns to his service, the second — he is not fitting for either the High Priest or the ordinary priest.

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל — מִשּׁוּם אֵיבָה, כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט — מִשּׁוּם מַעֲלִין בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ וְלֹא מוֹרִידִין. רֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן, וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר!
human_translation: High Priest, due to hatred, common priest, because One elevates in sanctity and one does not downgrade. the first clause the Rabbis, and the latter clause Rabbi Meir?
llm_translation: High Priest — because of enmity, ordinary priest — because of elevating in holiness and not lowering. The beginning is according to the Rabbis, and the end is according to Rabbi Meir!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, אִין: רֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: רַבִּי הִיא, וְנָסֵיב לַהּ אַלִּיבָּא דְתַנָּאֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Indeed, the first clause the Rabbis, and the latter clause Rabbi Meir. Rav Yosef said: is Rabbi and he formulates it according to of tanna’im ,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: No. The beginning is the Rabbis, and the end is Rabbi Meir. Rav Yosef said: It is Rabbi, and he married her according to the opinion of the Tannaim.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין בֵּין בָּמָה גְּדוֹלָה לַבָּמָה קְטַנָּה אֶלָּא פְּסָחִים. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא נִידָּר וְנִידָּב — קָרֵב בְּבָמָה, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ לֹא נִידָּר וְלֹא נִידָּב — אֵינוֹ קָרֵב בְּבָמָה.
human_translation: The difference between a great, altar, and a small, altar is only Paschal lambs, This is the principle: Any that is vowed or contributed is sacrificed on a altar, and any that is neither vowed nor contributed is not sacrificed on a altar.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There is no difference between a large altar and a small altar except for the Passover sacrifices. This is the principle: Anything that is vowed or pledged is brought on the altar, and anything that is neither vowed nor pledged is not brought on the altar.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּסָחִים וְתוּ לָא? אֵימָא כְּעֵין פְּסָחִים.
human_translation: Paschal lambs and nothing more? Say similar to Paschal lambs.
llm_translation: Gemara: "Gemar Pesachim ve'tu la? Eima ke'ein Pesachim."

hebrew_text: מַנִּי — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף צִבּוּר לֹא הִקְרִיבוּ אֶלָּא פְּסָחִים וְחוֹבוֹת שֶׁקָּבוּעַ לָהֶם זְמַן, אֲבָל חוֹבוֹת שֶׁאֵין קָבוּעַ לָהֶם זְמַן — הָכָא וְהָכָא לָא קְרוּב.
human_translation: whose It is Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: Even the public sacrificed only Paschal lambs and compulsory for which there is a set time, However, compulsory for which there is not a set time, are sacrificed neither here nor here
llm_translation: Mani - Rabbi Shimon hi. Detanya, Rabbi Shimon omer: Af tzibbur lo hikrivu ela Pesachim veChovot shekavua lahem zman, aval Chovot she'ein kavua lahem zman - hacha ve'hacha lo keruv.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין בֵּין שִׁילֹה לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, אֶלָּא שֶׁבְּשִׁילֹה אוֹכְלִין קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי בְּכׇל הָרוֹאֶה, וּבִירוּשָׁלַיִם לִפְנִים מִן הַחוֹמָה.
human_translation: The difference between Shilo and Jerusalem is only that in Shiloh one eats offerings of lesser sanctity, and the second tithe, in any place that overlooks And in Jerusalem within the walls.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: There is no difference between Shiloh and Jerusalem, except that in Shiloh one may eat light holy offerings and the second tithe anywhere one sees fit, while in Jerusalem only within the wall.

hebrew_text: וְכָאן וְכָאן, קׇדְשֵׁי קֳדָשִׁים נֶאֱכָלִין לִפְנִים מִן הַקְּלָעִים. קְדוּשַּׁת שִׁילֹה —
human_translation: And here, and there, offerings of the most sacred order are eaten within the hangings. the sanctity of Shiloh,
llm_translation: Here and here, holy of holies are eaten before the curtains. The sanctity of Shiloh —

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ הֶיתֵּר, וּקְדוּשַּׁת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם — אֵין אַחֲרֶיהָ הֶיתֵּר.
human_translation: after there is permission But the sanctity of Jerusalem, after there is no permission
llm_translation: There is an additional stringency after it, and the holiness of Jerusalem - there is no additional stringency after it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁמַּקְרִיבִין בְּבֵית חוֹנְיוֹ בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה. קָסָבַר: בֵּית חוֹנְיוֹ לָאו בֵּית עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הִיא, וְקָא סָבַר: קְדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה — קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְלֹא קִידְּשָׁה לְעָתִיד לָבוֹא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: I heard that one sacrifices in the temple of Onias at the present time. He maintains the temple of Onias is not a house of idol worship and he maintains the initial consecration sanctified for its time and did not sanctify forever.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yitzchak said: I heard that they bring offerings in Beit Chonyo in this time. He holds: Beit Chonyo is not a foreign place of worship, and he holds: The original sanctification — it was sanctified for its time and not sanctified for the future.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי לֹא בָּאתֶם עַד עָתָּה אֶל הַמְּנוּחָה וְאֶל הַנַּחֲלָה״. ״מְנוּחָה״ — זוֹ שִׁילֹה, ״נַחֲלָה״ — זוֹ יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, מַקִּישׁ נַחֲלָה לִמְנוּחָה: מָה ״מְנוּחָה״ יֵשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ הֶיתֵּר, אַף ״נַחֲלָה״ יֵשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ הֶיתֵּר.
human_translation: as it is written: “For you are not as yet come to the rest and to the inheritance” Rest,” this is Shiloh; “inheritance,” this is Jerusalem. juxtaposes inheritance to rest: Just as rest, after there is permission so too inheritance, after there is permission
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written: "For you have not yet come to the resting place and the inheritance." "Resting place" - this is Shiloh, "inheritance" - this is Jerusalem. It compares inheritance to resting place: just as after "resting place" there is further land, so too after "inheritance" there is further land.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אָמַרְתָּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא. אֲמַר רָבָא: הָאֱלֹהִים! אַמְרַהּ, וּגְמִירְנָא לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: said to Did you say He said to them: No, Rava said, By God! did say this, and I learned it from him,
llm_translation: They said to him: Did you say it? He said to them: No. Rava said: By God! She said it, and we have learned it from her.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי טַעְמָא קָא הָדַר בֵּיהּ? מִשּׁוּם קֻשְׁיָא דְּרַב מָרִי. דְּמוֹתֵיב רַב מָרִי: קְדוּשַּׁת שִׁילֹה — יֵשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ הֶיתֵּר. קְדוּשַּׁת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם — אֵין אַחֲרֶיהָ הֶיתֵּר. וְעוֹד תְּנַן: מִשֶּׁבָּאוּ לִירוּשָׁלַיִם נֶאֶסְרוּ הַבָּמוֹת, וְלֹא הָיָה לָהֶם עוֹד הֶיתֵּר, וְהִיא הָיְתָה נַחֲלָה.
human_translation: And what is the reason he retracted due to the difficulty by Rav Mari, as Rav Mari raised an objection the sanctity of Shiloh, after there is permission the sanctity of Jerusalem, after there is no permission And furthermore, we learned Once they came to Jerusalem, were prohibited, and they did not again have permission and became the inheritance.
llm_translation: And what is the reason that he returned to it? Because of the difficulty of Rav Mari. For Rav Mari raised an objection: The sanctity of Shiloh - there is something additional after it. The sanctity of Jerusalem - there is nothing additional after it. And we further learned: When they came to Jerusalem, the altars were prohibited, and they had no further permission, and it was an inheritance.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. (דְּתַנְיָא) אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: שָׁמַעְתִּי כְּשֶׁהָיוּ בּוֹנִין בַּהֵיכָל, עוֹשִׂין קְלָעִים לַהֵיכָל וּקְלָעִים לָעֲזָרָה. אֶלָּא שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל בּוֹנִין מִבַּחוּץ, וּבָעֲזָרָה בּוֹנִין מִבִּפְנִים.
human_translation: This is tanna’im , as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer said: I heard that when they were building the Sanctuary they fashioned hangings for the Sanctuary and hangings for the courtyard only that in the Sanctuary, built outside and in the courtyard, built inside
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita. Rabbi Eliezer said: I heard that when they were building the Temple, they made curtains for the Temple and curtains for the Courtyard. However, for the Temple, they built from the outside, and for the Courtyard, they built from the inside.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁמַּקְרִיבִין אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בַּיִת, אוֹכְלִין קׇדְשֵׁי קָדָשִׁים אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין קְלָעִים, קָדָשִׁים קַלִּים וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין חוֹמָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקְּדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְקִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא. מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר לֹא קִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that one sacrifices even though there is no Temple, one eats offerings of the most sacred order even if there are no hangings, offerings of lesser sanctity and second tithe even if there is no wall due to that the initial consecration sanctified for its time and sanctified forever. by inference that Rabbi Eliezer holds: It did not sanctify forever.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that they bring sacrifices even though there is no Temple, they eat holy of holies even though there are no curtains, light holy items and second tithe even though there is no wall, because the original sanctity sanctified it for its time and sanctified it for the future. From the principle of Rabbi Eliezer, he holds that it did not sanctify for the future.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא קְדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְקִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא, וּמָר — מַאי דִּשְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ קָאָמַר, וּמָר — מַאי דִּשְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ קָאָמַר. וְכִי תֵּימָא: קְלָעִים לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְמָה לִי? לִצְנִיעוּתָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: From where Perhaps everyone maintains that the initial consecration sanctified for its time and sanctified forever. And Sage, stated that which he heard and Sage, stated that which he heard And if you would say: Why do I hangings according to Rabbi Eliezer? merely for seclusion,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: From what? Perhaps the entire world was sanctified initially for its time, and will be sanctified for the future, and the Master—what is it that he is teaching him, and the Master—what is it that he is teaching him. And if you say: Why do I need curtains for Rabbi Eliezer? For modesty in the world.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כִּי הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לָמָּה מָנוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת אֵלּוּ? שֶׁכְּשֶׁעָלוּ בְּנֵי הַגּוֹלָה מָצְאוּ אֶת אֵלּוּ וְקִידְּשׁוּם, אֲבָל הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת בָּטְלוּ מִשֶּׁבָּטְלָה הָאָרֶץ. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: קְדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְלֹא קִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא.
human_translation: Rather, these tanna’im , as it is taught Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: Why did the Sages enumerate these As, when the exiles ascended they discovered these and consecrated them but the first was negated when the land was negated Apparently, maintains: The initial consecration sanctified for its time and did not sanctify forever.
llm_translation: Rather, these Tannaim, as it was taught: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: Why did the sages count these? Because when the children of the exile came up, they found these and sanctified them, but the earlier ones were nullified since the land was nullified. This implies that he holds: The initial sanctification was for its time and was not sanctified for the future.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ, אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: וְכִי אֵלּוּ בִּלְבַד הָיוּ? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״שִׁשִּׁים עִיר כׇּל חֶבֶל אַרְגּוֹב״, וּכְתִיב: ״כָּל אֵלֶּה עָרִים בְּצוּרוֹת חוֹמָה גְבוֹהָה״. אֶלָּא לָמָּה מָנוּ חֲכָמִים אֶת אֵלּוּ? שֶׁכְּשֶׁעָלוּ בְּנֵי הַגּוֹלָה מָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ וְקִידְּשׁוּם.
human_translation: raises a contradiction Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: Were these the only Wasn’t it already stated: “Sixty cities, all the region of Argov” and it is written: “All these cities were fortified with high walls, Rather, why then did the Sages enumerate these that when the exiles ascended they discovered these and consecrated them
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: "Were these alone?" But hasn't it already been stated: "Sixty cities, all the region of Argob," and it is written: "All these were fortified cities with high walls." Rather, why did the Sages count these? Because when the exiles returned, they found these and sanctified them.

hebrew_text: קִידְּשׁוּם?!
human_translation: Consecrated them?
llm_translation: Sanctify them?!

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא [הָא] אָמְרִי לָא צְרִיכָא לְקַדּוֹשֵׁי! אֶלָּא: מָצְאוּ אֶת אֵלּוּ וּמְנָאוּם.
human_translation: Now, didn’t they say it is not necessary to consecrate Rather, they discovered these and enumerated them.
llm_translation: The Gemara: "This one said: It is not necessary for the holy ones!" Rather, they found these and counted them.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא אֵלּוּ בִּלְבַד, אֶלָּא כׇּל שֶׁתַּעֲלֶה לְךָ מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדְךָ מֵאֲבוֹתֶיךָ שֶׁמּוּקֶּפֶת חוֹמָה מִימוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן — כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת הַלָּלוּ נוֹהֲגִין בָּהּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקְּדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה קִידְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ וְקִידְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא. קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אַדְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: And not only these, but any which you receive a tradition from your ancestors that it was surrounded by a wall from the days of Joshua, son of Nun, all these mitzvot are observed in it, due to that the initial consecration sanctified for its time and sanctified forever. difficult, of Rabbi Yishmael and of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: And not these alone, but all that tradition that comes to you from your fathers, which encircles a wall from the days of Joshua son of Nun— all these commandments are practiced in it, because the first holiness sanctified it for its time and sanctified it for the future. A difficulty of Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: תְּרֵי תַנָּאֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, הָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר יוֹסֵי אַמְרַהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר לוֹא חוֹמָה״, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ עַכְשָׁיו וְהָיָה לוֹ קוֹדֶם לָכֵן.
human_translation: two tanna’im , according to Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei. And if you wish, say this Rabbi Elazar bar Yosei said it, as it is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said “Which has [ lo ] a wall” even though it does not presently have but it had a wall previously,
llm_translation: Two Tannaim in the school of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei. And if you wish, say: Rabbi Elazar, son of Yosei, said, as it was taught: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: "Who has no wall," even though he does not have one now, and he had one before that.

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ״, אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאַנְשֵׁי כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה, כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיְהִי״ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן צַעַר.
human_translation: “And it came to pass [ vayhi ] in the days of Ahasuerus” Rabbi Levi said, and some say Rabbi Yonatan This matter is a tradition we from the members of the Great Assembly. Anywhere that vayhi is stated, it is term nothing other grief,
llm_translation: "And it came to pass in the days of Ahasuerus," Rabbi Levi said, and some say Rabbi Jonathan: This matter is a tradition in our hands from the men of the Great Assembly, wherever it says 'and it came to pass' it is only an expression of distress."

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ״ — הֲוָה הָמָן. ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי שְׁפוֹט הַשּׁוֹפְטִים״ — הֲוָה רָעָב. ״וַיְהִי כִּי הֵחֵל הָאָדָם לָרוֹב״ — ״וַיַּרְא ה׳ כִּי רַבָּה רָעַת הָאָדָם״.
human_translation: “And it came to pass [ vayhi ] in the days of Ahasuerus” was Haman. “And it came to pass [ vayhi ] in the days when the judges ruled” was famine. “And it came to pass [ vayhi ], when men began to multiply” “And the Lord saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth”
llm_translation: "And it was in the days of Achashverosh" — it was Haman. "And it was in the days of the judging of the judges" — there was famine. "And it was when man began to multiply" — "And the Lord saw that the evil of man was great."

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי בְּנׇסְעָם מִקֶּדֶם״ — ״הָבָה נִבְנֶה לָּנוּ עִיר״. ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי אַמְרָפֶל״ — ״עָשׂוּ מִלְחָמָה״. ״וַיְהִי בִּהְיוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּירִיחוֹ״ — ״וְחַרְבּוֹ שְׁלוּפָה בְּיָדוֹ״. ״וַיְהִי ה׳ אֶת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ״ — ״וַיִּמְעֲלוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״. ״וַיְהִי אִישׁ אֶחָד מִן הָרָמָתַיִם״ — ״כִּי אֶת חַנָּה אָהֵב וַה׳ סָגַר רַחְמָהּ״.
human_translation: “And it came to pass [ vayhi ] as they journeyed from the east” “Come, let us build us a city” “And it came to pass in the days of Amraphel” “These made war” “And it came to pass, when Joshua was by Jericho” “with his sword drawn in his hand” “And the Lord was [ vayhi ] with Joshua” “But the children of Israel committed a trespass” “And it came to pass that there was a certain man of Ramathaim” “For he loved Hannah, but the Lord had closed up her womb”
llm_translation: "And it was when they journeyed from the east" — "Come, let us build for ourselves a city." "And it was in the days of Amraphel" — "They made war." "And it was when Joshua was in Jericho" — "And his sword was drawn in his hand." "And the Lord was with Joshua" — "And the children of Israel went up." "And there was a certain man from Ramathaim" — "For he loved Hannah, but the Lord had closed her womb."

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי (כִּי) זָקֵן שְׁמוּאֵל״ — ״וְלֹא הָלְכוּ בָנָיו בִּדְרָכָיו״. ״וַיְהִי דָוִד לְכׇל דְּרָכָיו מַשְׂכִּיל [וַה׳ עִמּוֹ]״ — ״וַיְהִי שָׁאוּל עוֹיֵן אֶת דָּוִד״. ״וַיְהִי כִּי יָשַׁב הַמֶּלֶךְ בְּבֵיתוֹ״ — ״רַק אַתָּה לֹא תִבְנֶה הַבָּיִת״.
human_translation: “And it came to pass, when Samuel was old” “And his sons did not walk in his ways” “And it came to pass that David was successful in all his ways, and the Lord was with him” “And Saul viewed David with suspicion” “And it came to pass, when the king dwelt in his house” “Yet you shall not build the house”
llm_translation: "And it was when old, was his name Samuel" — "And his sons did not walk in his ways." "And it was, David in all his ways was prudent and the Lord was with him" — "And Saul eyed David." "And it was, when the king dwelt in his house" — "Only you shall not build the house."

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי״, וְתַנְיָא: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם הָיְתָה שִׂמְחָה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא כְּיוֹם שֶׁנִּבְרְאוּ בּוֹ שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וַיְהִי בְּיוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וַיְהִי (בֹקֶר) יוֹם אֶחָד״!
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “And it came to pass [ vayhi ] on the eighth day” And it is taught On that day there was joy before the Holy One, Blessed be He, similar to day on which the heavens and earth were created. It is written here, “And it came to pass [ vayhi ] on the eighth day,” and it is written there, “And it was [ vayhi ] morning, one day”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And it was on the eighth day," and it was taught: On that day there was joy before the Holy One, blessed be He, like the day on which heaven and earth were created. It is written here: "And it was on the eighth day," and it is written there: "And it was (morning) one day"!

hebrew_text: הָא שְׁכֵיב נָדָב וַאֲבִיהוּא.
human_translation: as Nadav and Avihu died.
llm_translation: The one who laid down Nadav and Avihu.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בִשְׁמוֹנִים שָׁנָה וְאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת שָׁנָה״! וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי כַּאֲשֶׁר רָאָה יַעֲקֹב אֶת רָחֵל״! וְהָכְתִיב ״וַיְהִי עֶרֶב וַיְהִי בֹקֶר יוֹם אֶחָד״! וְהָאִיכָּא שֵׁנִי! וְהָאִיכָּא שְׁלִישִׁי! וְהָאִיכָּא טוּבָא!
