human_translation: But isn’t it written: “And it came to pass [ vayhi ] in the four hundred and eightieth year” And isn’t it written: “And it came to pass [ vayhi ] when Jacob saw Rachel” And isn’t it written: “And it was [ vayhi ] evening, and it was [ vayhi ] morning, one day” And isn’t there the second and isn’t there the third And aren’t there many
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And it came to pass after eighty years and four hundred years"! And it is written: "And it came to pass when Jacob saw Rachel"! And it is written: "And there was evening and there was morning, one day"! And where is the second instance? And where is the third instance? And where is the good conclusion!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: כׇּל ״וַיְהִי״ — אִיכָּא הָכִי וְאִיכָּא הָכִי, ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי״ — אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן צַעַר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: every vayhi there are this, and there are that, “and it came to pass in the days of [ vayhi bimei ]” it is nothing other a term of grief.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Every "and it was" - there is this way and there is that way, "and it was in the days" - it is only an expression of distress.

hebrew_text: חַמְשָׁה ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי״ הָווּ: ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ״, ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי שְׁפוֹט הַשּׁוֹפְטִים״, ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי אַמְרָפֶל״, ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי אָחָז״, ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי יְהוֹיָקִים״.
human_translation: there are five vayhi bimei “And it came to pass in the days of [ vayhi bimei ] Ahasuerus”; “And it came to pass in the days [ vayhi bimei ] when the judges ruled”; “And it came to pass in the days of [ vayhi bimei ] Amraphel”; “And it came to pass in the days of [ vayhi bimei ] Ahaz” “And it came to pass in the days of [ vayhi bimei ] Jehoiakim”
llm_translation: Five "And it came to pass in the days" were: "And it came to pass in the days of Ahasuerus," "And it came to pass in the days of the judging of the judges," "And it came to pass in the days of Amraphel," "And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz," "And it came to pass in the days of Jehoiakim."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי, דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: אָמוֹץ וַאֲמַצְיָה — אֲחֵי הָווּ. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן?
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said: This matter is a tradition we from our ancestors: Amoz, and Amaziah, were brothers. What is this teaching us?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Levi said, this matter is a tradition in our hands from our ancestors: Amotz and Amatzyah were brothers. What does this teach us?

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: כׇּל כַּלָּה שֶׁהִיא צְנוּעָה בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ — זוֹכָה וְיוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים. מְנָלַן? מִתָּמָר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּרְאֶהָ יְהוּדָה וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ לְזוֹנָה כִּי כִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ״, מִשּׁוּם דְּכִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ ״וַיַּחְשְׁבֶהָ לְזוֹנָה״?
human_translation: in accordance with that which Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: Any bride who is modest in the house of her father-in-law merits that kings and prophets emerge from her. From where do we From Tamar, as it is written: “When Judah saw her, he thought her to be a prostitute; for she had covered her face” because covered her face he thought her to be a prostitute?
llm_translation: The one that Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: Any bride who is modest in her father-in-law's house - she merits and kings and prophets come from her. From where do we derive this? From a date palm, as it is written: "Judah saw her and he thought her to be a harlot, for she had covered her face," because she covered her face, "he thought her to be a harlot."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּכִסְּתָה פָּנֶיהָ בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ, וְלָא הֲוָה יָדַע לַהּ, זָכְתָה וְיָצְאוּ מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים. מְלָכִים — מִדָּוִד, נְבִיאִים — דְּאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי, מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: אָמוֹץ וַאֲמַצְיָה אַחִים הָיוּ, וּכְתִיב: ״חֲזוֹן יְשַׁעְיָהוּ בֶן אָמוֹץ״.
human_translation: Rather, because she covered her face in the house of her father-in-law and he was not familiar with her she merited that kings and prophets emerged from her. Kings through David, prophets. which Rabbi Levi said: This matter is a tradition we from our ancestors. Amoz, and Amaziah, were brothers, and it is written: “The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz”
llm_translation: Rather, because she covered her face in her father-in-law's house, and he did not recognize her, she merited and kings and prophets emerged from her. Kings - from David, prophets - as Rabbi Levi said, it is a tradition in our hands from our ancestors: Amoz and Amatziah were brothers, and it is written: "The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי, דָּבָר זֶה מָסוֹרֶת בְּיָדֵינוּ מֵאֲבוֹתֵינוּ: מְקוֹם אָרוֹן אֵינוֹ מִן הַמִּדָּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Levi said: This matter is a tradition we from our ancestors: The place of the Ark is not in the measurement
llm_translation: And Rabbi Levi said, this matter is a tradition in our hands from our ancestors: the place of the Ark is not from the measurement.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אָרוֹן שֶׁעָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה יֵשׁ לוֹ עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת לְכׇל רוּחַ, וּכְתִיב: ״וְלִפְנֵי הַדְּבִיר עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה אוֹרֶךְ״, וּכְתִיב: ״כְּנַף הַכְּרוּב הָאֶחָד עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת וּכְנַף הַכְּרוּב הָאֶחָד עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת״, אָרוֹן גּוּפֵיהּ הֵיכָא הֲוָה קָאֵי? אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בְּנֵס הָיָה עוֹמֵד.
human_translation: This is also taught The Ark crafted by Moses had ten cubits on each side. And it is written “And before the Sanctuary, which was twenty cubits in length, And it is written: And the wing of one of the cherubs was ten cubits and the wing of the other cherub was ten cubits; where was the Ark itself standing? Rather, not conclude from it stood by means of a miracle
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in the name of the school of Hillel: The Ark that Moses made had ten cubits for every spirit, as it is written: "And before the Debir there were twenty cubits in length." And it is written: "The wing of one cherub was ten cubits, and the wing of one cherub was ten cubits." Where was the Ark itself standing? Rather, it is not to be understood literally; it was standing through a miracle.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן פָּתַח לַהּ פִּיתְחָא לְהַאי פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וְקַמְתִּי עֲלֵיהֶם וְגוֹ׳ וְהִכְרַתִּי לְבָבֶל שֵׁם וּשְׁאָר וְנִין וָנֶכֶד נְאֻם ה׳״. ״שֵׁם״ — זֶה הַכְּתָב, ״שְׁאָר״ — זֶה לְשׁוֹן, ״נִין״ — זֶה מַלְכוּת, ״וָנֶכֶד״ — זוֹ וַשְׁתִּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan introduced this passage, with an introduction from here: “For I will rise up against them, and cut off from Babylonia name, and remnant, and offspring [ nin ], and posterity, says the Lord” “Name,” this is writing “Remnant,” this is language “Offspring,” this is kingdom. And “posterity,” this is Vashti,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan began the discussion of this portion from here: "And I will rise against them, and I will cut off from Babylon name and remnant, and progeny and offspring, says the Lord." "Name" - this refers to the Scripture, "remnant" - this is language, "progeny" - this is kingdom, "and offspring" - this is Vashti.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי, פָּתַח לַהּ פִּיתְחָא לְהַאי פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״תַּחַת הַנַּעֲצוּץ יַעֲלֶה בְרוֹשׁ וְתַחַת הַסִּרְפַּד יַעֲלֶה הֲדַס״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani introduced this passage with an introduction from here: “Instead of the thorn shall the cypress come up, and instead of the nettle shall the myrtle come up;
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani opened for her a discourse from here: "Instead of the thorn shall come up the cypress tree, and instead of the brier shall come up the myrtle."

hebrew_text: ״תַּחַת הַנַּעֲצוּץ״ — תַּחַת הָמָן הָרָשָׁע שֶׁעָשָׂה עַצְמוֹ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְכֹל הַנַּעֲצוּצִים וּבְכֹל הַנַּהֲלוֹלִים״.
human_translation: “Instead of the thorn”; instead of the wicked Haman. because he turned himself into an object of idol worship, as it is written: “And upon all thorns, and upon all brambles”
llm_translation: "Under the thornbush" - under Haman the wicked who made himself foreign worship, as it is written: "And in all the thornbushes and in all the nettles."

hebrew_text: ״יַעֲלֶה בְּרוֹשׁ״ — זֶה מָרְדֳּכַי שֶׁנִּקְרָא רֹאשׁ לְכׇל הַבְּשָׂמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה קַח לְךָ בְּשָׂמִים רֹאשׁ מׇר דְּרוֹר״, וּמְתַרְגְּמִינַן: ״מֹר דְּכֵי״.
human_translation: “Shall the cypress [ berosh ] come up”; this is Mordecai. Because he was called the chief rosh of all the spices, as it is stated: “Take you also to yourself the chief spices, of pure myrrh [ mar deror ]” and we translate mari dakhei .
llm_translation: "Yaleh berosh" - this is Mordecai who is called the head of all spices, as it is stated: "And you take for yourself the head of pure myrrh," and we translate: "myrrh of Mordecai."

hebrew_text: ״תַּחַת הַסִּרְפַּד״ — תַּחַת וַשְׁתִּי הָרְשָׁעָה בַּת בְּנוֹ שֶׁל נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הָרָשָׁע שֶׁשָּׂרַף רְפִידַת בֵּית ה׳, דִּכְתִיב: ״רְפִידָתוֹ זָהָב״.
human_translation: instead of the nettle [ sirpad ],” instead of the wicked Vashti. the daughter of the son of the wicked Nebuchadnezzar, who burned the ceiling [ saraf refidat ] of the House of God, as it is written: “Its top [ refidato ] of gold”
llm_translation: "Under the ashes" — under and drink the wicked daughter of Nebuchadnezzar the wicked who burned the porch of the Lord, as it is written: "Its pavement is of gold."

hebrew_text: ״יַעֲלֶה הֲדַס״ — זוֹ אֶסְתֵּר הַצַּדֶּקֶת שֶׁנִּקְרֵאת הֲדַסָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי אוֹמֵן אֶת הֲדַסָּה״. ״וְהָיָה לַה׳ לְשֵׁם״ — זוֹ מִקְרָא מְגִילָּה. ״לְאוֹת עוֹלָם לֹא יִכָּרֵת״ — אֵלּוּ יְמֵי פוּרִים.
human_translation: “Shall the myrtle [ hadas ] come up”; this is the righteous Esther, who was called Hadassah as it is stated: “And he had brought up Hadassah; “And it shall be to the Lord for a name”; this is the reading of the Megilla. “For an everlasting sign that shall not be cut off”; these are the days of Purim.
llm_translation: "Yaleh Hadass" - this is Esther the righteous, who is called Hadassah, as it is said: "And he brought up Hadassah." "And it shall be for the Lord for a name" - this is the verse from the Megillah. "For an everlasting sign that shall not be cut off" - these are the days of Purim.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי פָּתַח לַהּ פִּיתְחָא לְהַאי פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וְהָיָה כַּאֲשֶׁר שָׂשׂ ה׳ עֲלֵיכֶם לְהֵיטִיב אֶתְכֶם כֵּן יָשִׂישׂ... לְהָרַע אֶתְכֶם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi introduced this passage with an introduction from here: “And it shall come to pass, that as the Lord rejoiced over you to do you good, will rejoice to cause you harm.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi opened the discussion with this verse from here: "And it shall be when the Lord has rejoiced over you to do good to you, so shall He rejoice... to do evil to you."

hebrew_text: וּמִי חָדֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בְּמַפַּלְתָּן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״בְּצֵאת לִפְנֵי הֶחָלוּץ וְאוֹמְרִים הוֹדוּ לַה׳ כִּי לְעוֹלָם חַסְדּוֹ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נֶאֱמַר ״כִּי טוֹב״ בְּהוֹדָאָה זוֹ? לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שָׂמֵחַ בְּמַפַּלְתָּן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים.
human_translation: Does the Holy One, Blessed be He, rejoice over the downfall of the wicked? But it is written: “As they went out before the army, and say: Give thanks to the Lord, for His kindness endures forever” and Rabbi Yoḥanan said: For what “for He is good” not stated in this thanksgiving, Because the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not rejoice over the downfall of the wicked.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who is like the Holy One, blessed be He, in their downfall of the wicked? But isn't it written: "When they go out before the Chalutz and say, 'Give thanks to the Lord, for His kindness is eternal'"? And Rabbi Yochanan said: Why is it not said "for He is good" in this thanksgiving? Because the Holy One, blessed be He, does not rejoice in the downfall of the wicked.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא קָרַב זֶה אֶל זֶה כׇּל הַלָּיְלָה״ — בִּקְּשׁוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לוֹמַר שִׁירָה, אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַי טוֹבְעִין בַּיָּם, וְאַתֶּם אוֹמְרִים שִׁירָה?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is that which is written: “And the one came not near the other all the night” The ministering angels wanted to sing song, the Holy One, Blessed be He, said: The work of My hands, drowning at sea, and you say songs?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said, what is the meaning of what is written: "And they did not approach one another all night"? The ministering angels sought to sing a song, but the Holy One, blessed be He, said: "My handiwork is drowning in the sea, and you wish to sing?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הוּא אֵינוֹ שָׂשׂ, אֲבָל אֲחֵרִים מֵשִׂישׂ. וְדַיְקָא נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֵּן יָשִׂישׂ״, וְלָא כְּתִיב ״יָשׂוּשׂ״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said does not rejoice but He causes others to rejoice. learn from as well, as it is written: “So will rejoice [ ken yasis ]” And it is not written yasus , learn from
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: He is not happy, but others make him happy. And specifically it is stated, "So he will make him happy," and it is not written "he will be happy." Learn from this.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא פָּתַח לַהּ פִּיתְחָא לְהַאי פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״לְאָדָם שֶׁטּוֹב לְפָנָיו נָתַן חׇכְמָה וְדַעַת וְשִׂמְחָה״ — זֶה מָרְדֳּכַי הַצַּדִּיק, ״וְלַחוֹטֶא נָתַן עִנְיָן לֶאֱסוֹף וְלִכְנוֹס״ — זֶה הָמָן, ״לָתֵת לְטוֹב לִפְנֵי הָאֱלֹהִים״ — זֶה מָרְדְּכַי וְאֶסְתֵּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתָּשֶׂם אֶסְתֵּר אֶת מׇרְדֳּכַי עַל בֵּית הָמָן״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Kahana introduced this passage with an introduction from here. “He gives to a man that is good in His sight wisdom, and knowledge, and joy” this is the righteous Mordecai. “But to the sinner He gives the task of gathering and heaping up,” this is Haman. “That he may give it to one who is good before God” This is Mordecai and Esther, as it is written: “And Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman”
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Kahana opened for her the verse from here: "For to a man who is good before Him, He has given wisdom, knowledge, and joy" — this is Mordecai the Righteous, "and to the sinner He has given the task of gathering and collecting" — this is Haman, "to give good before God" — this is Mordecai and Esther, as it is written: "And Esther set Mordecai over the house of Haman."

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר עוֹפְרָן פָּתַח לַהּ פִּיתְחָא לְהַאי פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וְשַׂמְתִּי כִסְאִי בְּעֵילָם וְהַאֲבַדְתִּי מִשָּׁם מֶלֶךְ וְשָׂרִים״. ״מֶלֶךְ״ — זוֹ וַשְׁתִּי, ״וְשָׂרִים״ — זֶה הָמָן וַעֲשֶׂרֶת בָּנָיו.
human_translation: Rabba bar Oferan introduced this passage with an introduction from here: “And I will set my throne in Elam, and destroy from there the king and the princes, says the Lord” “The king” this is Vashti. “And the princes”; this is Haman and his ten sons.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Ofra opened for her a discourse from here: "And I will set My throne in Elam, and I will destroy from there king and princes." "King" - this is Vashti, "princes" - this is Haman and his ten sons.

hebrew_text: רַב דִּימִי בַּר יִצְחָק פָּתַח לַהּ פִּיתְחָא לְהַאי פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא,
human_translation: Rav Dimi bar Yitzḥak introduced this passage with an introduction from here:
llm_translation: Rav Dimi bar Yitzchak opened to her a passage from here,

hebrew_text: ״כִּי עֲבָדִים אֲנַחְנוּ וּבְעַבְדוּתֵנוּ לֹא עֲזָבָנוּ אֱלֹהֵינוּ וַיַּט עָלֵינוּ חֶסֶד לִפְנֵי מַלְכֵי פָרַס״, אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן הָמָן.
human_translation: “For we are bondmen; yet our God has not forsaken us in our bondage, but has extended mercy unto us in the sight of the kings of Persia” When In the time of Haman.
llm_translation: "When slaves we are, and in our servitude our God has not forsaken us, and He has extended kindness to us before the kings of Persia." When? - At the time of Haman.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא פָּתַח לַהּ פִּתְחָא לְהָא פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״הִרְכַּבְתָּ אֱנוֹשׁ לְרֹאשֵׁנוּ בָּאנוּ בָאֵשׁ וּבַמַּיִם״, ״בָּאֵשׁ״ — בִּימֵי נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הָרָשָׁע. ״וּבַמַּיִם״ — בִּימֵי פַרְעֹה, ״וַתּוֹצִיאֵנוּ לָרְוָיָה״ — בִּימֵי הָמָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa introduced this passage with an introduction from here: “You have caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water; “Through fire”; in the days of the wicked Nebuchadnezzar, “And through water”; in the days of Pharaoh, “But You brought us out into abundance”; in the days of Haman,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa opened for her a discourse from here: "You have made man ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water." "Through fire" - in the days of the wicked Nebuchadnezzar. "And through water" - in the days of Pharaoh. "But You brought us out to abundance" - in the days of Haman.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן פָּתַח לֵהּ פִּתְחָא לְהָא פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״זָכַר חַסְדּוֹ וֶאֱמוּנָתוֹ לְבֵית יִשְׂרָאֵל רָאוּ כׇל אַפְסֵי אָרֶץ אֵת יְשׁוּעַת אֱלֹהֵינוּ״, אֵימָתַי ״רָאוּ כׇל אַפְסֵי אָרֶץ אֵת יְשׁוּעַת אֱלֹהֵינוּ״ — בִּימֵי מׇרְדֳּכַי וְאֶסְתֵּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan introduced this passage with an introduction from here: “He has remembered His mercy and His faithfulness toward the house of Israel: All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God” When did all the ends of the earth see the salvation of our God? In the days of Mordecai and Esther,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan began with the opening of this portion from here: "They remembered His kindness and His faithfulness to the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth saw the salvation of our God." When did "all the ends of the earth see the salvation of our God"? — In the days of Mordecai and Esther.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ פָּתַח לַהּ פִּתְחָא לְהָא פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״אֲרִי נוֹהֵם וְדוֹב שׁוֹקֵק מוֹשֵׁל רָשָׁע עַל עַם דָּל״, ״אֲרִי נוֹהֵם״ — זֶה נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הָרָשָׁע, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״עָלָה אַרְיֵה מִסּוּבְּכוֹ״. ״דּוֹב שׁוֹקֵק״ — זֶה אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״וַאֲרוּ חֵיוָה אׇחֳרִי תִנְיָינָה דָּמְיָה לְדוֹב״, וְתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: אֵלּוּ פַּרְסִיִּים, שֶׁאוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין כְּדוֹב, וּמְסוּרְבָּלִין בָּשָׂר כְּדוֹב, וּמְגַדְּלִין שֵׂעָר כְּדוֹב, וְאֵין לָהֶם מְנוּחָה כְּדוֹב.
human_translation: Reish Lakish introduced this passage with an introduction from here: “As a roaring lion, and a ravenous bear, so is a wicked ruler over a poor people” “A roaring lion”; this is the wicked Nebuchadnezzar, as it is written about him: “The lion has come up from his thicket” “A hungry bear”; this is Ahasuerus, as it is written about him: “And behold, another beast, a second one, like a bear” And Rav Yosef taught these are the Persians. as they eat and drink like a bear; and they are coated with flesh like a bear; and they grow their hair like a bear; and they never rest like a bear,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish opened with this verse to explain the matter: "A roaring lion and a ranging bear is a wicked ruler over a poor people." "A roaring lion" - this is Nebuchadnezzar the wicked, as it is written about him: "The lion has come up from his thicket." "A ranging bear" - this is Achashverosh, as it is written about him: "And behold another beast, a second, like a bear." And Rav Yosef taught: These are the Persians, who eat and drink like a bear, and are insatiable for meat like a bear, and grow hair like a bear, and have no rest like a bear.

hebrew_text: ״מוֹשֵׁל רָשָׁע״ — זֶה הָמָן. ״עַל עַם דָּל״ — אֵלּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁהֵם דַּלִּים מִן הַמִּצְוֹת.
human_translation: “A wicked ruler”; this is Haman. “Over a poor people”; this is the Jewish people, because they are poor in the mitzvot.
llm_translation: "Ruler of the wicked" — this is Haman. "Over a poor people" — these are the Israelites, who are poor in commandments.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר פָּתַח לֵהּ פִּתְחָא לְהָא פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״בַּעֲצַלְתַּיִם יִמַּךְ הַמְּקָרֶה וּבְשִׁפְלוּת יָדַיִם יִדְלוֹף הַבָּיִת״, בִּשְׁבִיל עַצְלוּת שֶׁהָיָה לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא עָסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה, נַעֲשָׂה שׂוֹנְאוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מָךְ. וְאֵין ״מָךְ״ אֶלָּא עָנִי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם מָךְ הוּא מֵעֶרְכֶּךָ״, וְאֵין ״מְקָרֶה״ אֶלָּא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַמְקָרֶה בַמַּיִם עֲלִיּוֹתָיו״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar introduced this passage with an introduction from here: “Through laziness the rafters [ hamekare ] sink in [ yimakh ]; and through idleness of the hands the house leaks” Through the laziness of the Jewish people, who did not occupy themselves with Torah the enemy of the Holy One, Blessed be He, became poor [ makh ], as makh nothing other than poor, as it is stated: “But if he be too poor [ makh ] for the valuation” And mekare is referring no other than the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “Who lays the beams [ hamekare ] of His chambers in the waters”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar opened with this verse to expound from here: "Through sloth the roof sinks in, and through idleness of the hands the house leaks" (Ecclesiastes 10:18). Because of the laziness that the Israelites had in not engaging in Torah study, they became enemies of the Holy One, blessed be He. And "sinks in" means nothing but poverty, as it is stated: "And if he is poor, your valuation of him shall be" (Leviticus 27:8). And "the roof" means nothing but the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated: "The roof rises on the water."

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק פָּתַח לַהּ פִּתְחָא לְהָא פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״שִׁיר הַמַּעֲלוֹת לוּלֵי ה׳ שֶׁהָיָה לָנוּ יֹאמַר נָא יִשְׂרָאֵל. לוּלֵי ה׳ שֶׁהָיָה לָנוּ בְּקוּם עָלֵינוּ אָדָם״. ״אָדָם״ — וְלֹא מֶלֶךְ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak introduced this passage with an introduction from here: “A song of ascents If not for the Lord Who was with us, let Israel now say; if not for the Lord who was with us, when a man rose up against us” “a man” and not a king.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak opened for her a discourse from here: "A song of ascents. If it had not been the Lord who was for us, let Israel now say. If it had not been the Lord who was for us, when men rose up against us." "Men" - and not a king.

hebrew_text: רָבָא פָּתַח לַהּ פִּתְחָא לְהָא פָּרַשְׁתָּא מֵהָכָא: ״בִּרְבוֹת צַדִּיקִים יִשְׂמַח הָעָם וּבִמְשׁוֹל רָשָׁע יֵאָנַח עָם״, ״בִּרְבוֹת צַדִּיקִים יִשְׂמַח הָעָם״ — זֶה מׇרְדֳּכַי וְאֶסְתֵּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָעִיר שׁוּשָׁן צָהֲלָה וְשָׂמֵחָה״. ״וּבִמְשׁוֹל רָשָׁע יֵאָנַח עָם״ — זֶה הָמָן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָעִיר שׁוּשָׁן נָבוֹכָה״.
human_translation: Rava introduced this passage with an introduction from here: “When the righteous are on the increase, the people rejoice; but when the wicked man rules, the people mourn” “When the righteous are on the increase, the people rejoice”; this is Mordecai and Esther, as it is written: “And the city of Shushan rejoiced and was glad” “But when the wicked man rules, the people mourn”; this is Haman, as it is written: “But the city of Shushan was perplexed”
llm_translation: Rava opened for her the opening of this portion from here: "When the righteous are increased, the people rejoice, but when the wicked rule, the people sigh." "When the righteous are increased, the people rejoice" — this refers to Mordecai and Esther, as it is written: "And the city of Shushan rejoiced and was glad." "But when the wicked rule, the people sigh" — this refers to Haman, as it is written: "And the city of Shushan was perplexed."

hebrew_text: רַב מַתְנָה אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״כִּי מִי גוֹי גָּדוֹל אֲשֶׁר לוֹ אֱלֹהִים קְרוֹבִים אֵלָיו״. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״אוֹ הֲנִסָּה אֱלֹהִים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rav Mattana said from here: “For what nation is there so great, that has God so near to them” Rav Ashi said from here: “Or has God ventured
llm_translation: Rav Matnah said from here: "For what great nation is there that has God so near to them." Rav Ashe said from here: "Or has God tried..."

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי בִּימֵי אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ״, אָמַר רַב: וַיי וְהֵי, הָדָא דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִתְמַכַּרְתֶּם שָׁם לְאוֹיְבֶיךָ לַעֲבָדִים וְלִשְׁפָחוֹת וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: “And it came to pass [ vayhi ] in the days of Ahasuerus” Rav said: vai and hi , woe and mourning. This is as it is written: “And there you shall sell yourselves to your enemies for bondsmen and bondswomen,
llm_translation: "And it came to pass in the days of Ahasuerus," Rav said: "And God and be, this that is written: 'And you shall be sold there to your enemies as bondmen and bondwomen, etc.'"

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: ״לֹא מְאַסְתִּים וְלֹא גְעַלְתִּים לְכַלּוֹתָם״. ״לֹא מְאַסְתִּים״ — בִּימֵי יְווֹנִים. ״וְלֹא גְעַלְתִּים״ — בִּימֵי נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר. ״לְכַלּוֹתָם״ — בִּימֵי הָמָן. ״לְהָפֵר בְּרִיתִי אִתָּם״ — בִּימֵי פָרְסִיִּים. ״כִּי אֲנִי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיהֶם״ — בִּימֵי גוֹג וּמָגוֹג.
human_translation: And Shmuel said I will not reject them, nor will I abhor them, “I will not reject them”; in the days of the Greeks. “Nor will I abhor them”; in the days of “To destroy them utterly”; in the days of Haman. “To break My covenant with them”; in the days of the Persians. “For I am the Lord their God”; in the days of Gog and Magog.
llm_translation: Samuel said: "I have not rejected them, nor have I abhorred them to destroy them." "I have not rejected them" - in the days of the Greeks. "Nor have I abhorred them" - in the days of Nebuchadnezzar. "To destroy them" - in the days of Haman. "To break My covenant with them" - in the days of the Persians. "For I am the Lord their God" - in the days of Gog and Magog.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: ״לֹא מְאַסְתִּים״ — בִּימֵי כַּשְׂדִּים, שֶׁהֶעֱמַדְתִּי לָהֶם דָּנִיֵּאל חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה. ״וְלֹא גְעַלְתִּים״ — בִּימֵי יְווֹנִים, שֶׁהֶעֱמַדְתִּי לָהֶם שִׁמְעוֹן הַצַּדִּיק, וְחַשְׁמוֹנַאי וּבָנָיו, וּמַתִּתְיָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל. ״לְכַלּוֹתָם״ — בִּימֵי הָמָן, שֶׁהֶעֱמַדְתִּי לָהֶם מׇרְדֳּכַי וְאֶסְתֵּר. ״לְהָפֵר בְּרִיתִי אִתָּם״ — בִּימֵי רוֹמִיִּים, שֶׁהֶעֱמַדְתִּי לָהֶם שֶׁל בֵּית רַבִּי וְחַכְמֵי דוֹרוֹת. ״כִּי אֲנִי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיהֶם״ — לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא, שֶׁאֵין כׇּל אוּמָּה וְלָשׁוֹן יְכוֹלָה לִשְׁלוֹט בָּהֶם.
human_translation: was taught in a baraita : “I will not reject them”; in the days of the Chaldeans, when I appointed for them Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah “Nor will I abhor them”; in the days of the Greeks, when I appointed Shimon HaTzaddik for them, and Hasmonean and his sons, and Mattithiah the High Priest. “To destroy them utterly”; in the days of Haman, when I appointed for them Mordecai and Esther. “To break My covenant with them”; in the days of the Romans, when I appointed for them the house of Rabbi and the Sages of generations. “For I am the Lord their God”; in the future, when no nation or tongue will be able subjugate them
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: "I did not reject them" — in the days of the Chaldeans, when I established for them Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah. "And I did not abhor them" — in the days of the Greeks, when I established for them Shimon the Righteous, and the Hasmonean family, and Mattityahu the High Priest. "To consume them" — in the days of Haman, when I established for them Mordechai and Esther. "To break My covenant with them" — in the days of the Romans, when I established for them the House of Rabbi and the sages of the generations. "For I am the Lord their God" — in the future to come, when no nation or language will be able to rule over them.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי לֵוִי אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְאִם לֹא תוֹרִישׁוּ אֶת יוֹשְׁבֵי הָאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said from here: “But if you will not drive out the inhabitants of the land
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said from here: "And if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְהָיָה כַּאֲשֶׁר דִּמִּיתִי לַעֲשׂוֹת לָהֶם אֶעֱשֶׂה לָכֶם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya said from here, “And it shall come to pass, that as I thought to do unto them, so I shall do unto you”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya said from here: "And it shall come to pass, that as I thought to do unto them, so will I do to you."

hebrew_text: ״אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ״, אָמַר רַב: אָחִיו שֶׁל רֹאשׁ, וּבֶן גִּילוֹ שֶׁל רֹאשׁ. אָחִיו שֶׁל רֹאשׁ, אָחִיו שֶׁל נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר הָרָשָׁע שֶׁנִּקְרָא ״רֹאשׁ״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַנְתְּ הוּא רֵישָׁא דִּי דַהֲבָא״. בֶּן גִּילוֹ שֶׁל רֹאשׁ, הוּא הָרַג — הוּא בִּיקֵּשׁ לַהֲרוֹג, הוּא הֶחְרִיב — הוּא בִּיקֵּשׁ לְהַחְרִיב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְמַלְכוּת אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ בִּתְחִלַּת מַלְכוּתוֹ כָּתְבוּ שִׂטְנָה עַל יוֹשְׁבֵי יְהוּדָה וִירוּשָׁלִָם״.
human_translation: Ahasuerus. Rav said: The brother of the head [ aḥiv shel rosh ] and of the same character as the head [ ben gilo shel rosh ]. The brother of the head, the brother of the wicked Nebuchadnezzar, who is called “head,” as it is stated: “You are the head of gold” Of the same character as the head, for he, killed he, sought to kill He destroyed he sought to destroy as it is stated: “And in the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign, they wrote to him an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem”
llm_translation: "Talmudic text: 'Achashverosh,' said Rav: the brother of the head, and the son of his age. The brother of the head, the brother of Nevuchadnezzar the wicked who was called 'head,' as it is said: 'You are the head of gold.' The son of his age, he killed — he sought to kill, he destroyed — he sought to destroy, as it is said: 'In the reign of Achashverosh, at the beginning of his reign, they wrote an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.'"

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שֶׁהוּשְׁחֲרוּ פְּנֵיהֶם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּיָמָיו כְּשׁוּלֵי קְדֵרָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁזּוֹכְרוֹ אֹמֵר ״אָח לְרֹאשׁוֹ״. וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: שֶׁהַכֹּל נַעֲשׂוּ רָשִׁין בְּיָמָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּשֶׂם הַמֶּלֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ מַס״.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: the face of the Jewish people was blackened in his days like the bottom of a pot. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said Everyone who recalled him said: “Woe upon his head” [ aḥ lerosho ]. And Rabbi Ḥanina said: that everyone became poor rash ] in his days, as it is stated: “And the king Ahasuerus laid a tribute
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Samuel said: The countenances of the Israelites in his days were like the inhabitants of Kedar. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who remembers him says, "Woe to his head." And Rabbi Chanina said: All became impoverished in his days, as it is said: "And King Ahasuerus imposed a tax." English translation:

hebrew_text: ״הוּא אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ״ — הוּא בְּרִשְׁעוֹ מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ וְעַד סוֹפוֹ. ״הוּא עֵשָׂו״ — הוּא בְּרִשְׁעוֹ מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ וְעַד סוֹפוֹ. ״הוּא דָּתָן וַאֲבִירָם״ — הֵן בְּרִשְׁעָן מִתְּחִילָּתָן וְעַד סוֹפָן. ״הוּא הַמֶּלֶךְ אָחָז״ — הוּא בְּרִשְׁעוֹ מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ וְעַד סוֹפוֹ.
human_translation: “This is [ hu ] Ahasuerus” he in his wickedness from beginning to end. “This is [ hu ] Esau” he in his wickedness from beginning to end. “This is [ hu ] Dathan and Abiram” they in their wickedness from beginning to end. “This is [ hu ] the king Ahaz” he in his wickedness from beginning to end.
llm_translation: "He is Ahasuerus" - he in his wickedness from beginning to end. "He is Esau" - he in his wickedness from beginning to end. "They are Dathan and Abiram" - they in their wickedness from their beginning to their end. "He is King Ahaz" - he in his wickedness from beginning to end.

hebrew_text: ״אַבְרָם הוּא אַבְרָהָם״ — הוּא בְּצִדְקוֹ מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ וְעַד סוֹפוֹ. ״הוּא אַהֲרֹן וּמֹשֶׁה״ — הֵן בְּצִדְקָן מִתְּחִילָּתָן וְעַד סוֹפָן. ״וְדָוִד הוּא הַקָּטָן״ — הוּא בְּקַטְנוּתוֹ מִתְּחִילָּתוֹ עַד סוֹפוֹ, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבְּקַטְנוּתוֹ הִקְטִין עַצְמוֹ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ בַּתּוֹרָה, כָּךְ בְּמַלְכוּתוֹ הִקְטִין עַצְמוֹ אֵצֶל מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ בְּחָכְמָה.
human_translation: “Abram, this is [ hu ] Abraham” he in his righteousness from beginning to end. “This is [ hu ] Aaron and Moses” they remained in their righteousness from beginning to end “And David, this was [ hu ] the youngest” he remained in his humility from beginning to end. Just as in his youth, he humbled himself before anyone who was greater than him in Torah, so too, in his kingship, he humbled himself before anyone who was greater than him in wisdom.
llm_translation: "Avram is Avraham" - he in his righteousness from his beginning until his end. "He is Aharon and Moshe" - they in their righteousness from their beginning until their end. "And David is the youngest" - he in his youth from his beginning until his end, just as in his youth he humbled himself before one greater than him in Torah, so too in his kingship he humbled himself before one greater than him in wisdom.

hebrew_text: ״הַמּוֹלֵךְ״, אָמַר רַב: שֶׁמָּלַךְ מֵעַצְמוֹ. אָמְרִי לַהּ לְשֶׁבַח וְאָמְרִי לַהּ לִגְנַאי. אָמְרִי לַהּ לְשֶׁבַח — דְּלָא הֲוָה אִינִישׁ דַּחֲשִׁיב לְמַלְכָּא כְּווֹתֵיהּ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ לִגְנַאי — דְּלָא הֲוָה חֲזֵי לְמַלְכוּתָא, וּמָמוֹנָא יַתִּירָא הוּא דִּיהַב וְקָם.
human_translation: “Who reigned” Rav said: that he reigned on his own, Some say to credit, and some say it to disgrace. Some say to credit, that there was no man as fit as him to be king. And some say it to disgrace, that he was not fit to be king, but he distributed large amounts of money, and rose
llm_translation: "The one who anoints," Rav said: that he anointed himself. Some say it is for praise, and some say it is for disgrace. Some say it is for praise - because no one considered the king like himself, and some say it is for disgrace - because he did not see the kingdom, and it is the money that he gave that stood up."

hebrew_text: ״מֵהוֹדּוּ וְעַד כּוּשׁ״, רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל חַד אָמַר: הוֹדּוּ בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְכוּשׁ בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם, וְחַד אָמַר: הוֹדּוּ וְכוּשׁ גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי הֲווֹ קָיְימִי; כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמָּלַךְ עַל הוֹדּוּ וְכוּשׁ, כָּךְ מָלַךְ מִסּוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְעַד סוֹפוֹ.
human_translation: “from Hodu to Cush.” Rav and Shmuel One said: Hodu at one end of the world, and Cush at the end of the world. And one said: Hodu and Cush are situated next to each other, Just as reigned over Hodu and Cush, so too, he reigned from one end of the world to the other.
llm_translation: "From Hodu to Cush," Rav and Shmuel, one said: Hodu is at the end of the world and Cush is at the end of the world, and one said: Hodu and Cush are among the sons of Haddad; just as he ruled over Hodu and Cush, so he ruled from the end of the world to its end.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי הוּא רוֹדֶה בְּכׇל עֵבֶר הַנָּהָר מִתִּפְסַח וְעַד עַזָּה״, רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל חַד אָמַר: תִּפְסַח בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְעַזָּה בְּסוֹף הָעוֹלָם, וְחַד אָמַר: תִּפְסַח וְעַזָּה בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי הֲווֹ קָיְימִי; כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמָּלַךְ עַל תִּפְסַח וְעַל עַזָּה, כָּךְ מָלַךְ עַל כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: On a similar you say “For he had dominion over all the region on this side of the river, from Tiphsah even to Gaza” Rav and Shmuel One said: Tiphsah is at one end of the world, whereas Gaza is at the other end of the world. And one said: Tiphsah and Gaza are situated next to each other, Just as reigned over Tiphsah and Gaza, so too, he reigned over the entire world.
llm_translation: As an example in the matter, you say: "For he ruled over all the region beyond the river, from Tiphsah to Gaza." Rav and Shmuel, one said: Tiphsah is at the end of the world, and Gaza is at the end of the world. And one said: Tiphsah and Gaza were like two cheeks of a single face; just as he ruled over Tiphsah and Gaza, so he ruled over the entire world.

hebrew_text: ״שֶׁבַע וְעֶשְׂרִים וּמֵאָה מְדִינָה״, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בַּתְּחִילָּה מָלַךְ עַל שֶׁבַע, וּלְבַסּוֹף מָלַךְ עַל עֶשְׂרִים, וּלְבַסּוֹף מָלַךְ עַל מֵאָה. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״וּשְׁנֵי חַיֵּי עַמְרָם שֶׁבַע וּשְׁלֹשִׁים וּמְאַת שָׁנָה״, מַאי דָּרְשַׁתְּ בֵּיהּ? שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דִּקְרָא יַתִּירָא הוּא: מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב ״מֵהוֹדּוּ וְעַד כּוּשׁ״, ״שֶׁבַע וְעֶשְׂרִים וּמֵאָה מְדִינָה״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לִדְרָשָׁה.
human_translation: seven and twenty and a hundred provinces” Rav Ḥisda said: At first he reigned over seven and then he reigned over twenty and finally he reigned over hundred. However, if so, “And the years of the life of Amram were seven and thirty and a hundred years” what would you expound it? It is different here, as the verse is superfluous. Since it is written: “From Hodu to Cush,” why do I need “Seven and twenty and a hundred provinces”? learn from here for exposition,
llm_translation: "Twenty and seven and one hundred provinces," Rav Ḥisdah said: Initially he ruled over seven, and in the end he ruled over twenty, and in the end he ruled over one hundred. Rather, from now on: "And the years of the life of Amram were seven and thirty and one hundred years," what do you derive from it? It is different here, for the verse is superfluous: since it is written "from Hodu to Kush," why do I need "twenty and seven and one hundred provinces"? Learn from it to expound.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה מָלְכוּ בַּכִּיפָּה, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: אַחְאָב וַאֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ וּנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר. אַחְאָב, דִּכְתִיב: ״חַי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ אִם יֶשׁ גּוֹי וּמַמְלָכָה אֲשֶׁר לֹא שָׁלַח אֲדוֹנִי שָׁם לְבַקֶּשְׁךָ וְגוֹ׳״. וְאִי לָא דַּהֲוָה מָלֵיךְ עֲלַיְיהוּ, הֵיכִי מָצֵי מַשְׁבַּע לְהוּ?
human_translation: the Sages taught: Three ruled over the world, and they were Ahab, and Ahasuerus, and Nebuchadnezzar. Ahab, as it is written “As the Lord your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom where my master has not sent to seek you, And if he did not reign over them, how could he have made them swear?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Three ruled in the circle, and they are: Ahab, Achashverosh, and Nebuchadnezzar. Ahab, as it is written: "As the Lord your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom where my lord has not sent to seek you." And if he did not rule over them, how could he make them swear?

hebrew_text: נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה הַגּוֹי וְהַמַּמְלָכָה אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִתֵּן אֶת צַוָּארוֹ בְּעוֹל מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל״. אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ, הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Nebuchadnezzar as it is written: “And it shall come to pass, that the nation and the kingdom will not put their neck under the yoke of the king of Babylonia, Ahasuerus as we have said
llm_translation: Nebuchadnezzar, as it is written: "And the nation and kingdom that will not serve the same Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, that nation will I punish, saith the Lord, with the sword, and with the famine, and with the pestilence, until I have consumed them by his hand." Ahasuerus, this is what we said.

hebrew_text: (סִימָן: שסד״‎ך) וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָא אִיכָּא שְׁלֹמֹה! לָא סְלִיק מַלְכוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: a mnemonic Shin , samekh , dalet , kaf , But is there no other But there is Solomon did not complete his kingship,
llm_translation: Tractate: (Siman: ShSD"K) And is there not here? But there is Solomon! His kingdom did not last.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מֶלֶךְ וְהֶדְיוֹט. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מֶלֶךְ וְהֶדְיוֹט וּמֶלֶךְ — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? שְׁלֹמֹה מִילְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי הֲוָה בֵּיהּ — שֶׁמָּלַךְ עַל הָעֶלְיוֹנִים וְעַל הַתַּחְתּוֹנִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֵּשֶׁב שְׁלֹמֹה עַל כִּסֵּא ה׳״.
human_translation: well according to the one who said a king and a commoner, But according to the one who said that he was a king and a commoner, and a king, what can be said There was something else about Solomon for he ruled over the heavenly worlds, as well as the earthly worlds, as it is stated: “Then Solomon sat upon the throne of the Lord as king”
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says "king and commoner." Rather, for the one who says "king and commoner and king" — what can be said? There was another final matter in it — that Solomon ruled over the upper and lower, as it is said: "And Solomon sat on the throne of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְהָא הֲוָה סַנְחֵרִיב, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִי בְּכׇל אֱלֹהֵי הָאֲרָצוֹת הָאֵלֶּה אֲשֶׁר הִצִּילוּ אֶת אַרְצָם מִיָּדִי״! הָא אִיכָּא יְרוּשָׁלַיִם דְּלָא כַּבְשַׁהּ!
human_translation: But there was Sennacherib, as it is written: “Who are they among all the gods of these countries, that have delivered their country out of my hand There is Jerusalem that he did not conquer,
llm_translation: And this was Sancheirev, as it is written: "Who among all the gods of these lands that have saved their land from my hand!" Is there a Jerusalem that he did not conquer!

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא דָּרְיָוֶשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״דָּרְיָוֶשׁ מַלְכָּא כְּתַב לְכׇל עַמְמַיָּא אוּמַיָּא וְלִשָּׁנַיָּא דִּי דָיְירִין בְּכׇל אַרְעָא שְׁלָמְכוֹן יִסְגֵּא״! הָא אִיכָּא שְׁבַע דְּלָא מְלַךְ עֲלַיְיהוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״שְׁפַר קֳדָם דָּרְיָוֶשׁ וַהֲקִים עַל מַלְכוּתָא לַאֲחַשְׁדַּרְפְּנַיָּא מְאָה וְעֶשְׂרִין״!
human_translation: But there is Darius, as it is stated: “Then King Darius wrote to all the peoples, nations, and languages that dwell in all the earth: Peace be multiplied to you” There are the seven over which he did not rule, as it is written: “It pleased Darius to set over the kingdom a hundred and twenty satraps”
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But is there not the case of Daryavesh, as it is written: "Daryavesh the king wrote to all the peoples, nations, and languages that dwell in all the earth: 'May your peace be increased'" (Ezra 6:26)! But there are seven who did not reign over them, as it is written: "In the reign of Ahashverosh, who reigned from India to Cush, one hundred and twenty-seven provinces" (Esther 1:1)!

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא כּוֹרֶשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר כּוֹרֶשׁ מֶלֶךְ פָּרַס כֹּל מַמְלְכוֹת הָאָרֶץ נָתַן לִי ה׳״! הָתָם אִשְׁתַּבּוֹחֵי הוּא דְּקָא מִשְׁתַּבַּח בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: But there is Cyrus, as it is written: “Thus says Cyrus, king of Persia: The Lord, has given me all the kingdoms of the earth” there he was boasting about himself,
llm_translation: And there is a case like Cyrus, as it is written: "Thus says Cyrus, king of Persia: 'All the kingdoms of the earth the Lord has given to me!'" There, he was boasting about himself.

hebrew_text: ״בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם כְּשֶׁבֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״בִּשְׁנַת שָׁלֹשׁ לְמׇלְכוֹ״! אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי ״כְּשֶׁבֶת״, לְאַחַר שֶׁנִּתְיַישְּׁבָה דַּעְתּוֹ. אָמַר: בֵּלְשַׁצַּר חַשֵּׁב וּטְעָה, אֲנָא חָשֵׁיבְנָא וְלָא טָעֵינָא.
human_translation: “In those days when the king sat and afterward it is written: “In the third year of his reign” Rava said: What is “when he sat” [ keshevet ]? after his mind was settled [ shenityasheva ], He said Belshazzar, calculated and erred I will calculate, but I will not err.
llm_translation: "In those days, 'when the king sat,' and it is written afterwards: 'in the third year of his reign'! Rava said: What is 'when he sat'? After his mind was settled. He said: Belshazzar calculated and erred, I calculate and do not err."

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא — דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי לְפִי מְלֹאת לְבָבֶל שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה אֶפְקוֹד אֶתְכֶם״, וּכְתִיב: ״לְמַלֹּאות לְחׇרְבוֹת יְרוּשָׁלִַם שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה״. חַשֵּׁוב: אַרְבְּעִין וַחֲמֵשׁ דִּנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר, וְעֶשְׂרִים וּתְלָת דֶּאֱוִיל מְרוֹדַךְ, וְתַרְתֵּי דִּידֵיהּ — הָא שִׁבְעִים. אַפֵּיק מָאנֵי דְּבֵי מַקְדְּשָׁא וְאִשְׁתַּמַּשׁ בְּהוּ.
human_translation: What is As it is written “After seventy years are accomplished for Babylonia I will remember you and it is written that He would accomplish for the desolations of Jerusalem seventy years” He, calculated Forty-five of Nebuchadnezzar, and twenty-three of Evil-merodach, and two of his seventy I will take out the vessels of the Holy Temple and use them.
llm_translation: What is it? — As it is written: "For thus says the Lord: When seventy years are completed for Babylon, I will visit you," and it is also written: "For the completion of Jerusalem's desolation seventy years." Consider: forty-five of Nebuchadnezzar, and twenty-three of Evil-merodach, and two of his own — there are seventy. He went out from the Temple and engaged in it.

hebrew_text: וּנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר, מְנָלַן דְּאַרְבְּעִין וַחֲמֵשׁ שְׁנִין מְלַךְ? דְּאָמַר מָר: גָּלוּ בְּשֶׁבַע, גָּלוּ בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה, גָּלוּ בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה, גָּלוּ בִּתְשַׁע עֶשְׂרֵה.
human_translation: From where do we that Nebuchadnezzar reigned for forty-five years? As the Master said: They were exiled in the seventh they were exiled in the eighth they were exiled in the eighteenth they were exiled in the nineteenth
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Nebuchadnezzar, where are the forty-five years of his reign? For Mar said: They were revealed in seven, revealed in eight, revealed in eighteen, revealed in nineteen. English translation: And Nebuchadnezzar, where are the forty-five years of his reign? For Mar said: They were revealed in seven, revealed in eight, revealed in eighteen, revealed in nineteen.

hebrew_text: גָּלוּ בְּשֶׁבַע — לְכִיבּוּשׁ יְהוֹיָקִים גָּלוּת יְהוֹיָכִין, שֶׁהִיא שְׁמוֹנֶה לִנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר. גָּלוּ בִּשְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה — לְכִיבּוּשׁ יְהוֹיָקִים גָּלוּת צִדְקִיָּהוּ שֶׁהִיא תְּשַׁע עֶשְׂרֵה לִנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר, דְּאָמַר מָר: שָׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה כִּיבֵּשׁ נִינְוֵה, שְׁנִיָּה כִּיבֵּשׁ יְהוֹיָקִים. וּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בִשְׁלֹשִׁים וָשֶׁבַע שָׁנָה לְגָלוּת יְהוֹיָכִין מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה בִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ בְּעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה לַחֹדֶשׁ נָשָׂא אֱוִיל מְרוֹדַךְ מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל [בִּשְׁנַת מַלְכוּתוֹ] אֶת רֹאשׁ יְהוֹיָכִין מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה וַיּוֹצֵא אוֹתוֹ מִבֵּית הַכֶּלֶא״.
human_translation: They were exiled in the seventh after subjugation of Jehoiakim, the exile of Jehoiachin, which was the eighth of Nebuchadnezzar’s they were exiled in the eighteenth after the subjugation of Jehoiakim, the exile of Zedekiah, which was the nineteenth of Nebuchadnezzar’s as the Master said: In the first year conquered Nineveh; in second he conquered Jehoiakim. And it is written: “And it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin, king of Judea, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-fifth day of the month, that Evil-merodach, king of Babylonia, in the first year of his reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin, king of Judea, and brought him out of prison”
llm_translation: They were exiled in the seventh — for the subjugation of Jehoiachin, the exile of Jehoiachin, which is the eighth to Nebuchadnezzar. They were exiled in the eighteenth — for the subjugation of Jehoiachin, the exile of Zedekiah, which is the nineteenth to Nebuchadnezzar, as the Master said: "In the first year, Nineveh was dried up, in the second year, Jehoiachin was dried up." And it is written: "And it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin, king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-fifth of the month, Evil-merodach, king of Babylon, in the year of his reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin, king of Judah, and brought him out of prison."

hebrew_text: תַּמְנֵי וּתְלָתִין וּשְׁבַע — הֲרֵי אַרְבְּעִין וַחֲמֵשׁ דִּנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר. וְעֶשְׂרִין וּתְלָת דֶּאֱוִיל מְרוֹדַךְ — גְּמָרָא, וְתַרְתֵּי דִּידֵיהּ — הָא שִׁבְעִין. אֲמַר: הַשְׁתָּא וַדַּאי תּוּ לָא מִיפַּרְקִי, אַפֵּיק מָאנֵי דְּבֵי מַקְדְּשָׁא וְאִשְׁתַּמַּשׁ בְּהוּ.
human_translation: eight and thirty-seven This forty-five of Nebuchadnezzar. And the twenty-three of Evil-merodach tradition. And two years this seventy. said Now for sure they will not be redeemed. I will take out the vessels of the Holy Temple and use them.
llm_translation: Eighty and thirty and seven - behold forty-five of Nebuchadnezzar. And twenty-three of Evil-merodach - Gemara, and two of his own - these are seven. He said: Now, surely you will not be exempt, go out from the Temple and make use of them.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ דָּנִיאֵל: ״וְעַל מָרֵי שְׁמַיָּא הִתְרוֹמַמְתָּ וּלְמָאנַיָּא דִי בַיְיתֵיהּ הַיְתִיו קׇדָמָךְ״, וּכְתִיב: ״בֵּיהּ בְּלֵילְיָא קְטִיל בֵּלְשַׁאצַּר מַלְכָּא [כַּשְׂדָּאָה]״. וּכְתִיב: ״וְדָרְיָוֶשׁ מָדָאָה קַבֵּל מַלְכוּתָא כְּבַר שְׁנִין שִׁתִּין וְתַרְתֵּין״.
human_translation: This is that Daniel said to him “But you have lifted yourself up against the Lord of heaven; and they have brought the vessels of His House before you” And it is written “In that night Belshazzar, the king of the Chaldeans, was slain” And it states “And Darius the Mede received the kingdom, being about sixty-two years old”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: This is what Daniel said to him: "And you have lifted yourself up against the Lord of heaven, and the vessels of His house have been brought before you, and you and your nobles, your wives and your concubines have been drinking wine from them." And it is written: "In that night Belshazzar, the king of the Chaldeans, was slain." And it is written: "And Darius the Mede received the kingdom at the age of sixty-two."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר: אִיהוּ מִיטְעָא טָעֵי, אֲנָא חָשֵׁיבְנָא וְלָא טָעֵינָא. מִי כְּתִיב ״לְמַלְכוּת בָּבֶל״? ״לְבָבֶל״ כְּתִיב, מַאי ״לְבָבֶל״? לְגָלוּת בָּבֶל, כַּמָּה בְּצִירָן — תַּמְנֵי, חַשֵּׁיב וְעַיֵּיל חִילּוּפַיְיהוּ חֲדָא דְּבֵלְשַׁצַּר, וַחֲמֵשׁ דְּדָרְיָוֶשׁ וְכוֹרֶשׁ, וְתַרְתֵּי דִּידֵיהּ — הָא שִׁבְעִין. כֵּיוָן דְּחָזֵי דִּמְלוֹ שִׁבְעִין וְלָא אִיפְּרוּק — אֲמַר: הַשְׁתָּא וַדַּאי תּוּ לָא מִיפַּרְקִי, אַפֵּיק מָאנֵי דְּבֵי מַקְדְּשָׁא וְאִשְׁתַּמַּשׁ בְּהוּ. בָּא שָׂטָן וְרִיקֵּד בֵּינֵיהֶן וְהָרַג אֶת וַשְׁתִּי.
human_translation: said: He, erred. I will calculate, but I will not err, Is it written: for the kingdom of Babylonia”? It is written: for Babylonia.” What is “for Babylonia”? for the exile of Babylonia. How many are lacking Eight He calculated, and inserted in their stead one of Belshazzar, and five of Darius and Cyrus, and two of his own, seventy. Once he saw that seventy had been completed, and were not redeemed, he said: Now for sure they will not be redeemed. I will take out the vessels of the Temple and use them. the Satan came and danced among them, and he killed Vashti.
llm_translation: He said: "He who plants is mistaken, but I am considered and not mistaken. Where is it written 'for the kingdom of Babylon'? 'For Babylon' is written. What is 'for Babylon'? For the Babylonian exile. How many in Tzirun? Eight, he considered and brought the forces of the Chaldeans, and five of the Persians and Cyrus, and two of his own — that makes seventy. Once he saw that they were not successful, he said: 'Now for sure you will not succeed, go out from the Temple and make use of them.' The Satan came, danced among them, and killed Vashti.

hebrew_text: וְהָא שַׁפִּיר חַשֵּׁיב? אִיהוּ נָמֵי מִיטְעָא טָעֵי, דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִימְנֵי מֵחׇרְבוֹת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: But he calculated properly; He too erred for he should have counted from the destruction of Jerusalem
llm_translation: And is this considered significant? He also eats dates, for it is beneficial for him against the destruction of Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף כַּמָּה בְּצִירָן? חֲדֵיסַר. אִיהוּ כַּמָּה מְלַךְ? אַרְבֵּיסַר, בְּאַרְבֵּיסַר דִּידֵיהּ אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִיבְנֵי בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, אַלְּמָה כְּתִיב: ״בֵּאדַיִן בְּטֵילַת עֲבִידַת בֵּית אֱלָהָא דִּי בִּירוּשְׁלֶם״, אָמַר רָבָא: שָׁנִים מְקוּטָּעוֹת הֲווֹ.
human_translation: Ultimately, how many were lacking? Eleven, How many did reign Fourteen. in his fourteenth year, the Temple should have been built. why is it written: “Then the work of the House of God, which is in Jerusalem, ceased; Rava said: The years were partial
llm_translation: At the end, how many in Tziran? Eleven. How many kings? Twelve. In the twelfth year of his reign, he wanted to build the Temple. Why is it written: "Then ceased the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem"? Rava said: They were two severed years.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: וְעוֹד שָׁנָה אַחֶרֶת לְבָבֶל וְעָמַד דָּרְיָוֶשׁ וְהִשְׁלִימָהּ.
human_translation: This is also taught And there was still another year for Babylonia And Darius arose and completed it.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Nami the Elder said: "And yet another year for Babylon, and Darius arose and completed it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַף דָּנִיאֵל טְעָה בְּהַאי חוּשְׁבָּנָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״בִּשְׁנַת אַחַת לְמׇלְכוֹ אֲנִי דָּנִיֵּאל בִּינוֹתִי בַּסְּפָרִים״. מִדְּקָאָמַר ״בִּינוֹתִי״ — מִכְּלָל דִּטְעָה.
human_translation: Rava said: Daniel also erred in this calculation, as it is written: “In the first year of his reign, I, Daniel, meditated in the books From that he said “I meditated,” it can be inferred that he had erred.
llm_translation: Rava said: Even Daniel erred in this calculation, as it is written: "In the first year of his reign, I, Daniel, perceived in the books." From the fact that it says "I perceived" - this implies that he erred.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי, כְּתִיב: ״מְלֹאות לְבָבֶל״, וּכְתִיב: ״לְחׇרְבוֹת יְרוּשָׁלַםִ״!
human_translation: In any case, the verses contradict each other it is written: are accomplished for Babylonia And it is written: for the desolations of Jerusalem
llm_translation: From every place, the verses of Ahadadei are difficult. It is written: "Full of Babylon," and it is written: "For the swords of Jerusalem!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לִפְקִידָה בְּעָלְמָא. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר כּוֹרֶשׁ מֶלֶךְ פָּרַס כֹּל מַמְלְכוֹת הָאָרֶץ נָתַן לִי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי הַשָּׁמָיִם וְהוּא פָקַד עָלַי לִבְנוֹת לוֹ בַיִת בִּירוּשָׁלִַם״.
human_translation: Rava said only for being remembered [ lifekida ], And this is as it is written “Thus says Cyrus king of Persia: The Lord, God of heaven, has given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and He has charged [ pakad ] me to build Him a house in Jerusalem”
llm_translation: Rava said: For a commission in the world. And this is what is written: "So said Koresh, king of Persia: All the kingdoms of the earth, Hashem, the God of the heavens, has given to me, and He has commanded me to build Him a house in Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ לִמְשִׁיחוֹ לְכוֹרֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר הֶחֱזַקְתִּי בִימִינוֹ״, וְכִי כּוֹרֶשׁ מָשִׁיחַ הָיָה? אֶלָּא אָמַר לֵיהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמָשִׁיחַ: קוֹבֵל אֲנִי לְךָ עַל כּוֹרֶשׁ. אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי: הוּא יִבְנֶה בֵּיתִי וִיקַבֵּץ גָּלִיּוֹתַי, וְהוּא אָמַר: ״מִי בָכֶם מִכׇּל עַמּוֹ וְיַעַל״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Rav Ḥisda interpreted homiletically What is which is written: “Thus says the Lord to His anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I have held” Now was Cyrus Messiah, Rather, The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to the Messiah: I am complaining to you about Cyrus, I had said: “He shall build My House and gather My exiles” Rather, he said: “Whoever is among you of all His people…let him go up
llm_translation: Rav Nahman son of Rav Hisda expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "So said the Lord to His anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I have grasped"? Was Cyrus the anointed one? Rather, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to the anointed one: I have taken hold of Cyrus for your sake. I said: He will build My house and gather My exiles, and He said: "Who among you of all His people, may his God be with him, and let him go up."

hebrew_text: ״חֵיל פָּרַס וּמָדַי הַפַּרְתְּמִים״, וּכְתִיב: ״לְמַלְכֵי מָדַי וּפָרָס״. אָמַר רָבָא: אַתְנוֹיֵי אַתְנוֹ בַּהֲדָדֵי, אִי מִינַּן מַלְכֵי — מִינַּיְיכוּ אִיפַּרְכֵי וְאִי מִינַּיְיכוּ מַלְכֵי — מִינַּן אִיפַּרְכֵי.
human_translation: “The army of Persia and Media, the nobles and it is written of the kings of Media and Persia” Rava said stipulated with each other, If the kings from us, the ministers from you; and if the kings from you, the ministers from us.
llm_translation: "The army of Persia and Media," and it is written: "to the kings of Media and Persia." Rava said: If we are talking about kings - we are talking about Achaemenides, and if we are talking about Achaemenides - we are talking about kings.

hebrew_text: ״בְּהַרְאוֹתוֹ אֶת עוֹשֶׁר כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁלָּבַשׁ בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״יְקָר תִּפְאֶרֶת גְּדוּלָּתוֹ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״לְכָבוֹד וּלְתִפְאֶרֶת״.
human_translation: “When he showed the riches of his glorious [ kevod ] kingdom Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: This teaches that wore the priestly vestments. it is written here: the honor of his majestic [ tiferet ] greatness.” And it is written there, “For glory [ kavod ] and for majesty [ tiferet ]”
llm_translation: "In displaying his wealth, the honor of his kingdom," Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: It teaches that he wore the garments of the priesthood. It is written here: "Splendid in his grandeur," and it is written there: "For glory and for beauty."

hebrew_text: ״וּבִמְלֹאות הַיָּמִים הָאֵלֶּה וְגוֹ׳״. רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, חַד אָמַר: מֶלֶךְ פִּיקֵּחַ הָיָה, וְחַד אָמַר: מֶלֶךְ טִיפֵּשׁ הָיָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר מֶלֶךְ פִּיקֵּחַ הָיָה — שַׁפִּיר עֲבַד דְּקָרֵיב רַחִיקָא בְּרֵישָׁא, דִּבְנֵי מָאתֵיהּ כׇּל אֵימַת דְּבָעֵי מְפַיֵּיס לְהוּ. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר טִיפֵּשׁ הָיָה — דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְקָרוֹבֵי בְּנֵי מָאתֵיהּ בְּרֵישָׁא, דְּאִי מָרְדוּ בֵּיהּ הָנָךְ, הָנֵי הֲווֹ קָיְימִי בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: “And when these days were fulfilled, Rav and Shmuel One said: he was a clever king. And one said: he was a foolish king. The one who said he was a clever king that he acted well when he first brought close those distant as he could appease the residents of his city whenever he wished. And the one who said he was foolish that he should have invited the residents of his city first, so that if those rebelled against him, these would have stood with him.
llm_translation: "And in the fullness of these days, etc." Rav and Shmuel, one said: King Pekach was, and one said: King Tipesh was. The one who said King Pekach was - he did well, he would bring a distant relative close at the beginning, for the sons of his mother, whenever he wanted, he would appease them. And the one who said he was foolish - he would bring close the sons of his mother at the beginning, for if they rebelled against him, those others were standing by his side.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: מִפְּנֵי מָה נִתְחַיְּיבוּ שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁבְּאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר כְּלָיָה? אָמַר לָהֶם: אִמְרוּ אַתֶּם. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנֶּהֱנוּ מִסְּעוּדָתוֹ שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע. אִם כֵּן שֶׁבְּשׁוּשַׁן יֵהָרְגוּ, שֶׁבְּכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ אַל יֵהָרְגוּ! אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֱמוֹר אַתָּה! אָמַר לָהֶם: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִשְׁתַּחֲווּ לַצֶּלֶם.
human_translation: The students of Rabbi Shimon bar Yoḥai asked him: For what were the enemies of Jewish people, in that generation deserving of annihilation? He, said to them: Say yourselves. They said to him: It is because they partook of the feast of that wicked one, If so, those in Shushan should have been killed those in the rest of the world, should not have been killed. They said to him: you say He said to them: It is because they prostrated before the idol
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: "Why were the enemies of the Jewish people in that generation destroyed?" He said to them: "You say." They said to him: "Because they benefited from the feast of that wicked one." If so, should the people of Shushan also be killed, that the entire world should not be destroyed? They said to him: "Say it yourself!" He said to them: "Because they bowed down to the image."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: וְכִי מַשּׂוֹא פָּנִים יֵשׁ בַּדָּבָר? אָמַר לָהֶם: הֵם לֹא עָשׂוּ אֶלָּא לִפְנִים — אַף הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לֹא עָשָׂה עִמָּהֶן אֶלָּא לִפְנִים. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי לֹא עִנָּה מִלִּבּוֹ״.
human_translation: They said to him: Is there favoritism here? He said to them: They did not do only for appearance, So too, the Holy One, Blessed be He, did not did with them only for appearance. And this is as it is written: “For He does not afflict from His heart
llm_translation: They said to him: Is there favoritism in this matter? He said to them: They only did it for the sake of appearances — so too the Holy One, blessed be He, only did it for the sake of appearances with them. And this is what is written: "For he did not answer from his heart."

hebrew_text: ״בַּחֲצַר גִּנַּת בִּיתַן הַמֶּלֶךְ״. רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, חַד אָמַר: הָרָאוּי לֶחָצֵר — לֶחָצֵר, הָרָאוּי לַגִּינָּה — לַגִּינָּה, הָרָאוּי לַבִּיתָן — לַבִּיתָן. וְחַד אָמַר: הוֹשִׁיבָן בֶּחָצֵר וְלֹא הֶחְזִיקָתַן, בַּגִּינָּה וְלֹא הֶחְזִיקָתַן, עַד שֶׁהִכְנִיסָן לַבִּיתָן וְהֶחְזִיקָתַן. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: הוֹשִׁיבָן בֶּחָצֵר וּפָתַח לָהֶם שְׁנֵי פְתָחִים, אֶחָד לַגִּינָּה וְאֶחָד לַבִּיתָן.
human_translation: “In the court of the garden of the king’s palace” Rav and Shmuel One said: One fit for the courtyard to the courtyard; one fit for the garden to the garden; one fit for the palace to the palace. And one said: He sat them in the courtyard, but it did not hold them, in the garden, but it did not hold them until he brought them into the palace and it held them. was taught in a baraita : He sat them in the courtyard and opened two entranceways for them, one to the garden and one to the palace.
llm_translation: "In the courtyard of the garden of the king." Rav and Shmuel, one said: what is fitting for a courtyard - for a courtyard, what is fitting for a garden - for a garden, what is fitting for a palace - for a palace. And one said: if they placed them in the courtyard and did not establish them, in the garden and did not establish them, until they brought them into the palace and established them. In a Mishnah it was taught: if they placed them in the courtyard and opened for them two entrances, one to the garden and one to the palace."

hebrew_text: ״חוּר כַּרְפַּס וּתְכֵלֶת״. מַאי חוּר? רַב אָמַר: חָרֵי חָרֵי, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מֵילָת לְבָנָה הִצִּיעַ לָהֶם. ״כַּרְפַּס״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: כָּרִים שֶׁל פַּסִּים.
human_translation: ḥur , karpas , and sky blue” What is ḥur ? Rav said: many holes [ ḥarei ḥarei ], And Shmuel said: He spread out for them white wool, karpas ? Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: Cushions [ karim ] of velvet [ pasim ].
llm_translation: "Chur karpass u'techelet." Ma'ai chur? Rav amar: charei charei, u'Shmuel amar: meilat l'vanah hitzi'a lahem. "Karpass," amar Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina: karim shel pasim.

hebrew_text: ״עַל גְּלִילֵי כֶסֶף וְעַמּוּדֵי שֵׁשׁ מִטּוֹת זָהָב וָכֶסֶף״, תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הָרָאוּי לְכֶסֶף — לְכֶסֶף, הָרָאוּי לְזָהָב — לְזָהָב. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: אִם כֵּן, אַתָּה מֵטִיל קִנְאָה בַּסְּעוּדָה. אֶלָּא: הֵם שֶׁל כֶּסֶף, וְרַגְלֵיהֶן שֶׁל זָהָב.
human_translation: “On silver rods and pillars of marble; the couches were of gold and silver” It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: One fit for silver silver, one fit for gold gold. Rabbi Neḥemya said to him: If so, you cast jealousy into the feast, Rather, themselves of silver, and their feet of gold.
llm_translation: "On the rims of silver and pillars of marble, rods of gold and silver," it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: What is fitting for silver - for silver, what is fitting for gold - for gold. Rabbi Nechemiah said to him: If so, you are casting jealousy at the feast. Rather, they are of silver, and their feet are of gold.

hebrew_text: ״בַּהַט וָשֵׁשׁ״. אֲמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: אֲבָנִים שֶׁמִּתְחוֹטְטוֹת עַל בַּעֲלֵיהֶן. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אַבְנֵי נֵזֶר מִתְנוֹסְסוֹת עַל אַדְמָתוֹ״.
human_translation: bahat and marble” Rabbi Asi said stones that ingratiate themselves with their owners, And similarly, it states “the stones of a crown, glittering over His land”
llm_translation: "In the hot and dry season." Rabbi Assi said: Stones that roll on their owners. And similarly, it says: "The stones of a crown are scattered on his land."

hebrew_text: ״וְדַר וְסוֹחָרֶת״, רַב אָמַר: דָּרֵי דָּרֵי. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֶבֶן טוֹבָה יֵשׁ בִּכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם וְ״דָרָה״ שְׁמָהּ, הוֹשִׁיבָהּ בְּאֶמְצַע סְעוּדָה וּמְאִירָה לָהֶם כַּצׇּהֳרַיִם. דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: שֶׁקָּרָא דְּרוֹר לְכׇל בַּעֲלֵי סְחוֹרָה.
human_translation: “And dar and soḥaret ” Rav said: many rows [ darei darei ] And Shmuel said: a precious stone in the seaports, and its name is dara , placed it in the center of feast, and it illuminated for them as at midday. the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught that he proclaimed a remission for all the merchants,
llm_translation: "V'dar v'socharet," Rav said: "Darei darei." And Shmuel said: "There is a good stone in the depths of the sea, and its name is 'Dara.' Place it in the middle of the meal and it will illuminate for them like midday." The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "For all merchants, freedom is called 'dror.'"

hebrew_text: ״וְהַשְׁקוֹת בִּכְלֵי זָהָב וְכֵלִים מִכֵּלִים שׁוֹנִים״. ״מְשׁוּנִּים״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רָבָא, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לָהֶם: רִאשׁוֹנִים כָּלוּ מִפְּנֵי כֵלַי, וְאַתֶּם שׁוֹנִים בָּהֶם! ״וְיֵין מַלְכוּת רָב״, אָמַר רַב: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הִשְׁקָהוּ יַיִן שֶׁגָּדוֹל הֵימֶנּוּ בְּשָׁנִים.
human_translation: “And they gave them drink in vessels of gold, the vessels being diverse [ shonim ] from one another” It should have said meshunim . Rava said: A Divine Voice issued forth and said to them: The early ones, were destroyed because these vessels, and you use them again [ shonim ]? “And royal wine in abundance [ rav ]” Rav said: This teaches that each and every was poured wine that was older [ rav ] than himself in years.
llm_translation: "And they poured into vessels of gold and vessels from different vessels." "From different vessels" - what does it mean? Rava said, a Bat Kol (heavenly voice) came out and said to them: The first ones were consumed because of vessels, and you are different in them! "And wine of the kingdom is abundant," Rav said: This teaches that each and every one of them was given wine that was greater than him by two years.

hebrew_text: ״וְהַשְּׁתִיָּה כַדָּת (אֵין אוֹנֵס)״, מַאי ״כַּדָּת״? אָמַר רַבִּי חָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: כְּדָת שֶׁל תּוֹרָה, מָה דָּת שֶׁל תּוֹרָה אֲכִילָה מְרוּבָּה מִשְּׁתִיָּה — אַף סְעוּדָּתוֹ שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע אֲכִילָה מְרוּבָּה מִשְּׁתִיָּה.
human_translation: “And the drinking was according to the law; none did compel” What is “according to the law”? Rabbi Ḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Meir: according to the law of the Torah. Just as, the law of the Torah, the food is greater than the drink, so too, feast of that wicked man, the food was greater than the drink.
llm_translation: "And the drinking is like the law (there is no compulsion)," what is "like the law"? Rabbi Hanan said in the name of Rabbi Meir: Just as the law of the Torah, just as the law of the Torah has more eating than drinking - so too, the meal of that wicked person has more eating than drinking.

hebrew_text: ״אֵין אוֹנֵס״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הִשְׁקָהוּ מִיֵּין מְדִינָתוֹ. ״לַעֲשׂוֹת כִּרְצוֹן אִישׁ וָאִישׁ״, אָמַר רָבָא: לַעֲשׂוֹת כִּרְצוֹן מָרְדֳּכַי וְהָמָן. מָרְדֳּכַי — דִּכְתִיב: ״אִישׁ יְהוּדִי״, הָמָן — ״אִישׁ צַר וְאוֹיֵב״.
human_translation: “None did compel” Rabbi Elazar said: This teaches that each and every was poured from wine of his country, “That they should do according to every man’s pleasure” Rava said: that they should do according to the wishes of Mordecai and Haman. Mordecai as it is written: Jewish man [ ish ] And Haman “A man [ ish ] who is an adversary and an enemy,
llm_translation: "אֵין אוֹנֵס״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד הִשְׁקָהוּ מִיֵּין מְדִינָתוֹ. ״לַעֲשׂוֹת כִּרְצוֹן אִישׁ וָאִישׁ״, אָמַר רָבָא: לַעֲשׂוֹת כִּרְצוֹן מָרְדֳּכַי וְהָמָן. מָרְדֳּכַי — דִּכְתִיב: ״אִישׁ יְהוּדִי״, הָמָן — ״אִישׁ צַר וְאוֹיֵב״." Translation: "'There is no compulsion,'" Rabbi Elazar said: It teaches that each and every one should be given to drink according to his own country's wine. "'To do according to the will of each man,'" Rava said: To do according to the will of Mordecai and Haman. Mordecai — as it is written: 'a Jewish man,' Haman — 'an adversary and enemy.'"

hebrew_text: ״גַּם וַשְׁתִּי הַמַּלְכָּה עָשְׂתָה מִשְׁתֵּה נָשִׁים בֵּית הַמַּלְכוּת״. ״בֵּית הַנָּשִׁים״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁנֵיהֶן לִדְבַר עֲבֵירָה נִתְכַּוְּונוּ, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אִיהוּ בְּקָרֵי, וְאִתְּתֵיהּ
human_translation: “Also Vashti the queen made a feast for the women, in the royal house, the women’s house, should have been. Rava said The two of them had sinful intentions. This that people say: He with pumpkins and his wife
llm_translation: "The queen Vashti also made a feast for the women in the royal palace." "The women's quarters" - what does it come to include? Rava said: Both of them intended for a sinful matter, meaning that people say: 'He with his male, and his wife.'"

hebrew_text: בְּבוּצִינֵי.
human_translation: with zucchinis,
llm_translation: In the courts.

hebrew_text: ״בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי כְּטוֹב לֵב הַמֶּלֶךְ בַּיָּיִן״. אַטּוּ עַד הַשְׁתָּא לָא טָב לִבֵּיהּ בְּחַמְרָא? אֲמַר רָבָא: יוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי שַׁבָּת הָיָה. שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין — מַתְחִילִין בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה וּבְדִבְרֵי תִשְׁבָּחוֹת. אֲבָל אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם שֶׁאוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין — אֵין מַתְחִילִין אֶלָּא בְּדִבְרֵי תִיפְלוּת.
human_translation: “On the seventh day, when the heart of the king was merry with wine” Is that to say until now his heart was not merry with wine? Rava said: The seventh day was Shabbat, when the Jewish people eat and drink, they begin with words of Torah and words of praise But the nations of the world, when they eat and drink, they begin only with words of licentiousness.
llm_translation: "On the seventh day, when the king's heart was merry with wine." Why until now his heart was not merry with wine? Rava said: It was the Sabbath day. When Israelites eat and drink, they begin with words of Torah and words of praise. But the nations of the world, when they eat and drink, they only begin with words of vanity."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בִּסְעוּדָּתוֹ שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע, הַלָּלוּ אוֹמְרִים: מָדִיּוֹת נָאוֹת, וְהַלָּלוּ אוֹמְרִים: פָּרְסִיּוֹת נָאוֹת. אָמַר לָהֶם אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ: כְּלִי שֶׁאֲנִי מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בּוֹ, אֵינוֹ לֹא מָדִיִּי וְלֹא פָּרְסִי אֶלָּא כַּשְׂדִּיִּי, רְצוֹנְכֶם לִרְאוֹתָהּ? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִין, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא עֲרוּמָּה.
human_translation: So too, at the feast of that wicked man, some said: The Median women are beautiful, while others said: The Persian women are beautiful. Ahasuerus said to them: The vessel that I use, is neither Median nor Persian, but Chaldean. Do you wish to see her? They said to him: Yes, provided that she be naked,
llm_translation: And so in his feast, that wicked one, these say: "Median dishes are pleasing," and those say: "Persian dishes are pleasing." Ahasuerus said to them: "The vessel that I use is neither Median nor Persian but Chaldean. Do you wish to see it?" They said to him: "No, only if it is naked."

hebrew_text: שֶׁבַּמִּדָּה שֶׁאָדָם מוֹדֵד — בָּהּ מוֹדְדִין לוֹ, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה וַשְׁתִּי הָרְשָׁעָה מְבִיאָה בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל וּמַפְשִׁיטָתָן עֲרוּמּוֹת וְעוֹשָׂה בָּהֶן מְלָאכָה בְּשַׁבָּת. הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״אַחַר הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה כְּשׁוֹךְ חֲמַת הַמֶּלֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ זָכַר אֶת וַשְׁתִּי וְאֵת אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂתָה וְאֵת אֲשֶׁר נִגְזַר עָלֶיהָ״, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁעָשָׂתָה — כָּךְ נִגְזַר עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: for it is with the measure that a man measures that he is measured. This teaches that the wicked Vashti would take the daughters of Israel, and strip them naked, and make them work on Shabbat. as it is written: “After these things, when the wrath of King Ahasuerus was appeased, he remembered Vashti, and what she had done, and what was decreed against her” just as she had done so it was decreed upon her.
llm_translation: In the measure that a person measures - they measure for him, teaching that Vashti and Shetsi would bring the daughters of Israel and strip them naked and make them work on Shabbat. This is as it is written: "After these things, when the anger of King Ahasuerus had abated, he remembered Vashti and what she had done and what had been decreed against her," just as she did - so was decreed against her.

hebrew_text: ״וַתְּמָאֵן הַמַּלְכָּה וַשְׁתִּי״. מִכְּדֵי פְּרִיצְתָּא הֲוַאי, דְּאָמַר מָר: שְׁנֵיהֶן לִדְבַר עֲבֵירָה נִתְכַּוְּונוּ, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אֲתַאי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁפָּרְחָה בָּהּ צָרַעַת. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: [בָּא גַּבְרִיאֵל וְעָשָׂה לָהּ זָנָב].
human_translation: “But the queen Vashti refused Since she was immodest, as the Master said The two of them had sinful intentions, what is the reason she did not come? Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: This teaches that she broke out in leprosy, was taught in a baraita : Gabriel came and fashioned her a tail.
llm_translation: "And the queen Vashti refused." Because of the incident that occurred, as the Master said: "Both of them intended for a sinful matter, what is the reason that she did not come?" Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: It teaches that leprosy broke out on her. In a Baraita it was taught: "Gabriel came and made a tail for her."

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּקְצֹף הַמֶּלֶךְ מְאֹד״. אַמַּאי דְּלַקָה בֵּיהּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אָמַר רָבָא, שְׁלַחָה לֵיהּ: בַּר אַהוּרְיָירֵיהּ דְּאַבָּא, אַבָּא לָקֳבֵל אַלְפָּא חַמְרָא שָׁתֵי וְלָא רָוֵי, וְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא אִשְׁתַּטִּי בְּחַמְרֵיהּ, מִיָּד: ״וַחֲמָתוֹ בָּעֲרָה בוֹ״.
human_translation: “Therefore the king was very wrathful, Why did burn in him so greatly Rava said: sent him son of my father’s stableman [ ahuriyyarei ]. my father, drank wine against a thousand and did not become inebriated, and that man, has become senseless from his wine. immediately “his anger burned in him”
llm_translation: "And the king was very angry." Why did he get so angry at this? Rava said, he sent to him: "Son of the free men of Abba, Abba, receive a thousand barrels of wine and do not be satisfied, and that man indulged in his wine, immediately: 'And his anger burned within him.'"

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ לַחֲכָמִים״, מַאן חֲכָמִים — רַבָּנַן. ״יוֹדְעֵי הָעִתִּים״ — שֶׁיּוֹדְעִין לְעַבֵּר שָׁנִים וְלִקְבּוֹעַ חֳדָשִׁים. אֲמַר לְהוּ: דַּיְּינוּהָ לִי. אֲמַרוּ: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? נֵימָא לֵיהּ: קִטְלַהּ, לִמְחַר פָּסֵיק לֵיהּ חַמְרֵיהּ וּבָעֵי לַהּ מִינַּן. נֵימָא לֵיהּ: שִׁבְקַהּ — קָא מְזַלְזְלָה בְּמַלְכוּתָא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִיּוֹם שֶׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ וְגָלִינוּ מֵאַרְצֵנוּ, נִיטְּלָה עֵצָה מִמֶּנּוּ וְאֵין אָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לָדוּן דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת. זִיל לְגַבֵּי עַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב דְּיָתְבִי בְּדוּכְתַּיְיהוּ כְּחַמְרָא דְּיָתֵיב עַל דּוּרְדְּיֵיהּ.
human_translation: “Then the king said to the wise men, Who are these wise men? the Sages “who knew the times,” for they know how to intercalate years and fix the months said to them: Judge her for me. said What should we do? we say to him: Kill her, tomorrow he will become sober and demand her from us. we say to him: Let her be, she has scorned royalty, they said to him From the day that the Temple was destroyed and we have been exiled from our land, counsel have been removed from us, and we do not know how to judge capital cases, Go to Ammon and Moab, who have remained settled in their places like wine that is settled on its lees,
llm_translation: "And the king said to the wise men," Who are the wise men? — the sages. "Who know the times" — who know to intercalate years and establish months. He said to them: "Solve it for me." They said: "How shall we do it?" Let us say to him: "Kill it, tomorrow cut off its mother and see if it wants from us." Let us say to him: "Leave it" — it is belittling the kingdom, they said to him: "Since the day the Temple was destroyed and we were exiled from our land, counsel has been taken from us and we do not know how to judge matters of life and death. Go to the people of Ammon and Moab who sit in their own filth like a donkey sitting on its dung."

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״שַׁאֲנַן מוֹאָב מִנְּעוּרָיו וְשׁוֹקֵט הוּא אֶל שְׁמָרָיו וְלֹא הוּרַק מִכְּלִי אֶל כֶּלִי וּבַגּוֹלָה לֹא הָלָךְ עַל כֵּן עָמַד טַעְמוֹ בּוֹ וְרֵיחוֹ לֹא נָמָר״, מִיָּד: ״וְהַקָּרוֹב אֵלָיו כַּרְשְׁנָא שֵׁתָר אַדְמָתָא תַרְשִׁישׁ״.
human_translation: And reason they spoke to him, For it is written: “Moab has been at ease from his youth, and he has settled on his lees, and has not been emptied from vessel to vessel, neither has he gone into exile; therefore his taste has remained in him, and his scent is not changed” immediately “And next to him was Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish,
llm_translation: And the reason they said to him, as it is written: "Moab has been at ease from his youth, settled like wine on its dregs; he has not been poured from vessel to vessel, nor has he gone into exile; therefore his flavor has remained, and his aroma has not changed." Immediately: "And those close to him, Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: כׇּל פָּסוּק זֶה עַל שׁוּם קׇרְבָּנוֹת נֶאֱמַר.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said: This entire verse is stated on account of offerings.
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said: Every verse mentioned here is in reference to the sacrifices.

hebrew_text: ״כַּרְשְׁנָא״ — אָמְרוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, כְּלוּם הִקְרִיבוּ לְפָנֶיךָ כָּרִים בְּנֵי שָׁנָה כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לְפָנֶיךָ? ״שֵׁתָר״ — כְּלוּם הִקְרִיבוּ לְפָנֶיךָ שְׁתֵּי תוֹרִין? ״אַדְמָתָא״ — כְּלוּם בָּנוּ לְפָנֶיךָ מִזְבֵּחַ אֲדָמָה? ״תַּרְשִׁישׁ״ — כְּלוּם שִׁימְּשׁוּ לְפָנֶיךָ בְּבִגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ ״תַּרְשִׁישׁ וְשֹׁהַם וְיָשְׁפֵה״? ״מֶרֶס״ — כְּלוּם מֵירְסוּ בְּדָם לְפָנֶיךָ? ״מַרְסְנָא״ — כְּלוּם מֵירְסוּ בִּמְנָחוֹת לְפָנֶיךָ? ״מְמוּכָן״ — כְּלוּם הֵכִינוּ שֻׁלְחָן לְפָנֶיךָ?
human_translation: “Carshena”; the ministering angels said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, did ever offer before You lambs [ karim ] of the first year [ shana ], as the Jewish people have offered before You? “Shethar”; have they ever offered before You two turtledoves [ shetei torim ]? “Admatha”; have they ever built before You an altar of earth [ adama ]? “Tarshish”; have they ever ministered before You in the priestly vestments, as it is written “A beryl [ tarshish ], an onyx, and a jasper” “Meres”; have they ever stirred [ meirsu ] the blood of the offerings before You? “Marsena”; have they ever stirred [ meirsu ] the meal-offering before You? “Memucan”; have they ever prepared [ hekhinu ] table before You,
llm_translation: "Karsheina" — The ministering angels said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, have the nations brought before You yearling lambs as the children of Israel brought before You? "Shetar" — Have they brought before You two Torah scrolls? "Admata" — Have they built before You an altar of earth? "Tarshish" — Have they served before You in priestly garments, as it is written: "Tarshish, Shoham, and Yashfeh"? "Meres" — Have they smeared before You with blood? "Marsena" — Have they smeared before You with meal offerings? "Memuchan" — Have they prepared a table before You?

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר מְמוּכָן״. תָּנָא: מְמוּכָן זֶה הָמָן, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ מְמוּכָן? שֶׁמּוּכָן לְפוּרְעָנוּת. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: מִכָּאן שֶׁהַהֶדְיוֹט קוֹפֵץ בָּרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: “And Memucan said” taught Memucan is Haman. And why is referred to as Memucan? Because he was prepared [ mukhan ] to calamity Rav Kahana said: From here that the common man jumps to the front
llm_translation: "And he said Memuchan." It was taught: Memuchan, this is Haman. And why was his name called Memuchan? Because he was prepared for punishment. Rav Kahana said: From here we learn that the commoner may jump upon the head.

hebrew_text: ״לִהְיוֹת כׇּל אִישׁ שׂוֹרֵר בְּבֵיתוֹ״. אָמַר רָבָא: אִלְמָלֵא אִגְּרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת לֹא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר מִשּׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל שָׂרִיד וּפָלִיט.
