human_translation: “That every man shall wield authority in his own house Rava said: Were it not for the first letters there would not have been left among the enemies of the Jewish people, a remnant or a refugee.
llm_translation: "To be every man a ruler in his own house." Rava said: Were it not for the first letters that remained from the hatred of the Israelites, a remnant and an escapee would have been left.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: מַאי הַאי דְּשַׁדַּיר לַן ״לִהְיוֹת כׇּל אִישׁ שׂוֹרֵר בְּבֵיתוֹ״? פְּשִׁיטָא, אֲפִילּוּ קָרָחָה — בְּבֵיתֵיהּ פַּרְדַּשְׁכָּא לֶיהֱוֵי!
human_translation: they say: What is this that he has sent us: “That every man shall wield authority in his own house”? obvious; even weaver is commander [ paredashekha ] in his house.
llm_translation: They said: What is this that is arranged for us "that every man should be a ruler in his own house"? Obviously, even a beam — in his house it should be a partition for him!

hebrew_text: ״וְיַפְקֵד הַמֶּלֶךְ פְּקִידִים״. אָמַר רַבִּי, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל עָרוּם יַעֲשֶׂה בְדָעַת וּכְסִיל יִפְרֹשׂ אִוֶּלֶת״ —
human_translation: “And let the king appoint officers Rabbi said: What is that which is written: “In everything a prudent man acts with knowledge, but a fool unfolds his folly”
llm_translation: "And the king will appoint officers." Rabbi said, what is the meaning of what is written: "Every prudent man acts with knowledge, but a fool flaunts folly" —

hebrew_text: ״כׇּל עָרוּם יַעֲשֶׂה בְדָעַת״ — זֶה דָּוִד, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמְרוּ לוֹ עֲבָדָיו יְבַקְשׁוּ לַאדֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ נַעֲרָה בְתוּלָה״; כֹּל מַאן דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ בְּרַתָּא — אַיָּיתַהּ נִיהֲלֵיהּ. ״וּכְסִיל יִפְרוֹשׁ אִוֶּלֶת״ — זֶה אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיַפְקֵד הַמֶּלֶךְ פְּקִידִים״; כֹּל מַאן דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ בְּרַתָּא — אַיטְמְרַהּ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: “In everything a prudent man acts with knowledge”; this David, as it is written: “And his servants said to him, Let there be sought for my lord the king a young virgin” whoever had a daughter brought her to him, “But a fool unfolds his folly” this is Ahasuerus, as it is written: “And let the king appoint officers” whoever had a daughter hid her from him.
llm_translation: "Every prudent man acts with knowledge" - this is David, as it is written: "And his servants said to him, 'Let them seek for my lord the king a young virgin.'" Whoever had a daughter, he brought her to him. "But a fool flaunts his folly" - this is Achashverosh, as it is written: "And let the king appoint officers." Whoever had a daughter, he hid her from him.

hebrew_text: ״אִישׁ יְהוּדִי הָיָה בְּשׁוּשַׁן הַבִּירָה וְגוֹ׳ אִישׁ יְמִינִי״. מַאי קָאָמַר: אִי לְיַחוֹסֵיהּ קָאָתֵי — לְיַחֲסֵיהּ וְלֵיזִיל עַד בִּנְיָמִין! אֶלָּא מַאי שְׁנָא הָנֵי?
human_translation: “There was a certain Jew in Shushan the castle, Benjamite” What is it saying If comes to ancestry, it should continue tracing back to Benjamin, Rather, what is different
llm_translation: "A Jewish man was in Shushan the capital, etc., 'a man of Benjamin.' What is it saying: if to trace his lineage - let him trace it and go up to Benjamin! Rather, what is different about these?"

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: כּוּלָּן עַל שְׁמוֹ נִקְרְאוּ. ״בֶּן יָאִיר״ — בֵּן שֶׁהֵאִיר עֵינֵיהֶם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ. ״בֶּן שִׁמְעִי״ — בֵּן שֶׁשָּׁמַע אֵל תְּפִלָּתוֹ. ״בֶּן קִישׁ״ — שֶׁהִקִּישׁ עַל שַׁעֲרֵי רַחֲמִים וְנִפְתְּחוּ לוֹ.
human_translation: taught All of them are names by which was called. “the son of Jair” the son who enlightened [ heir ] the eyes of the Jewish people with his prayers; “the son of Shimei” the son whom God heard [ shama ] his prayers; “the son of Kish” because he knocked [ hikish ] on the gates of mercy and they were opened to him.
llm_translation: Mishnah: All of them were called by his name. "Ben Yair" - a son who illuminated the eyes of the Israelites with his prayer. "Ben Shimei" - a son who listened to his prayer. "Ben Kish" - who knocked on the gates of mercy and they were opened for him.

hebrew_text: קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״יְהוּדִי״ — אַלְמָא מִיהוּדָה קָאָתֵי, וְקָרֵי לֵיהּ ״יְמִינִי״ — אַלְמָא מִבִּנְיָמִין קָאָתֵי! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מָרְדֳּכַי מוּכְתָּר בְּנִימוּסוֹ הָיָה.
human_translation: is referred to as a “Jew [ Yehudi ],” apparently he came from Judah, he is called “Benjamite” [ Yemini ], which indicates that he came from Benjamin. Rav Naḥman said: Mordecai was crowned with names.
llm_translation: He is called "Yehudi" - this means he is from Judah, and he is called "Yemini" - this means he is from Benjamin! Rav Nachman said: Mordechai was adorned with his prophecy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: אָבִיו מִבִּנְיָמִין, וְאִמּוֹ מִיהוּדָה. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: מִשְׁפָּחוֹת מִתְגָּרוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ. מִשְׁפַּחַת יְהוּדָה אוֹמֶרֶת: אֲנָא גְּרַמִי דְּמִתְיְלִיד מָרְדֳּכַי, דְּלָא קַטְלֵיהּ דָּוִד לְשִׁמְעִי בֶּן גֵּרָא. וּמִשְׁפַּחַת בִּנְיָמִין אָמְרָה: מִינַּאי קָאָתֵי.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said father was from Benjamin, and his mother was from Judah. And the Rabbis say The families competed each other The family of Judah say: I caused the birth of Mordecai, because David did not kill Shimei, the son of Gera, And the family of Benjamin said he came from me,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: His father was from Benjamin, and his mother was from Judah. And the Rabbis say: The families are conflicting with one another. The family of Judah says: I am descended from Mordecai, who did not kill Shimei son of Gera. And the family of Benjamin says: We are the elite.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כְּנֶסֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל אָמְרָה לְאִידַּךְ גִּיסָא: רְאוּ מָה עָשָׂה לִי יְהוּדִי וּמָה שִׁילֵּם לִי יְמִינִי. מָה עָשָׂה לִי יְהוּדִי —
human_translation: Rava said: The Congregation of Israel said from the opposite perspective, See what a Judean has done to me and how a Benjamite has repaid me. What a Judean has done to me
llm_translation: Rava said: The congregation of Israel said to the other nation: "See what the Jew did to me, and what he paid me for my right hand. What did the Jew do to me—"

hebrew_text: דְּלָא קַטְלֵיהּ דָּוִד לְשִׁמְעִי, דְּאִתְיְלִיד מִינֵּיהּ מָרְדֳּכַי דְּמִיקַּנֵּי בֵּיהּ הָמָן. וּמָה שִׁילֵּם לִי יְמִינִי — דְּלָא קַטְלֵיהּ שָׁאוּל לַאֲגָג, דְּאִתְיְלִיד מִינֵּיהּ הָמָן דִּמְצַעַר לְיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: as David did not kill Shimei, that Mordecai was born from him, against whom Haman was jealous, And how a Benjamite has repaid me that Saul, did not kill Agag from whom Haman was born, and he caused suffering to the Jewish people.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: David did not kill Shimei, for from him descended Mordecai who would bring about the downfall of Haman. And what did my right hand accomplish for me? Saul did not kill Agag, for from him descended Haman who would bring distress upon Israel.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם מִבִּנְיָמִן קָאָתֵי, וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״יְהוּדִי״? עַל שׁוּם שֶׁכָּפַר בָּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. שֶׁכׇּל הַכּוֹפֵר בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה נִקְרָא ״יְהוּדִי״, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״אִיתַי גּוּבְרִין יְהוּדָאיִן וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said Actually, came from Benjamin. Why, was he referred to as Yehudi ? On account of that he repudiated idol worship, for anyone who repudiates idolatry is called Yehudi . as it is written: “There are certain Jews [ Yehuda’in ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Always from Benjamin he comes, and why is he called "Yehudi"? Because he atoned for idolatry. For anyone who atones for idolatry is called "Yehudi," as it is written: "There came certain of the Jews."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי, כִּי הֲוָה פָּתַח בְּדִבְרֵי הַיָּמִים, אָמַר הָכִי: כׇּל דְּבָרֶיךָ אֶחָד הֵם, וְאָנוּ יוֹדְעִין לְדוֹרְשָׁן. ״וְאִשְׁתּוֹ הַיְהוּדִיָּה יָלְדָה אֶת יֶרֶד אֲבִי גְדוֹר וְאֶת חֶבֶר אֲבִי שׂוֹכוֹ וְאֶת יְקוּתִיאֵל אֲבִי זָנוֹחַ וְאֵלֶּה בְּנֵי בִּתְיָה בַת פַּרְעֹה אֲשֶׁר לָקַח מָרֶד״.
human_translation: when Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi introduced the book of Chronicles, he said as follows: All of your words are one, and we know how to expound them. “And his wife HaYehudiyya bore Jered the father of Gedor, and Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. And these are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi, when he began discussing matters of the days, said thus: "All Your words are one, and we know to interpret them." "And his Jewish wife bore Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Socho, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. And these are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took."

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי קָרֵי לַהּ ״יְהוּדִיָּה״ — עַל שׁוּם שֶׁכָּפְרָה בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּרֶד בַּת פַּרְעֹה לִרְחוֹץ עַל הַיְאוֹר״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁיָּרְדָה לִרְחוֹץ מִגִּילּוּלֵי בֵּית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: Why is she, referred to as Yehudiyya ? Because she repudiated idol worship, as it is written: “And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to wash herself in the river” and Rabbi Yoḥanan said: She went down to wash herself from the idols of her father’s house.
llm_translation: "Why is she called 'Yehudiyah'? — Because she atoned through idol worship, as it is written: 'And the daughter of Pharaoh went down to bathe in the river,' and Rabbi Yochanan said: She went down to bathe from the idols of her father's house."

hebrew_text: ״יָלְדָה״? וְהָא רַבּוֹיֵי רַבִּיתֵיהּ! לוֹמַר לְךָ שֶׁכׇּל הַמְגַדֵּל יָתוֹם וִיתוֹמָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ יְלָדוֹ.
human_translation: bore But didn’t she raise him? it is telling you that anyone who raises an orphan boy or girl in his house, the verse ascribes him credit as if he gave birth to him.
llm_translation: "Yalda"? And this is a surplus of her greatness! To tell you that whoever raises an orphan boy and girl in his house - the Scripture credits him as if he had begotten them.

hebrew_text: ״יֶרֶד״ זֶה מֹשֶׁה, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ ״יֶרֶד״? שֶׁיָּרַד לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מָן בְּיָמָיו. ״גְּדוֹר״ — שֶׁגָּדַר פִּרְצוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל. ״חֶבֶר״ — שֶׁחִיבֵּר אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לַאֲבִיהֶן שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם. ״סוֹכוֹ״ — שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל כְּסוּכָּה. ״יְקוּתִיאֵל״ — שֶׁקִּוּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָאֵל בְּיָמָיו. ״זָנוֹחַ״ — שֶׁהִזְנִיחַ עֲוֹנוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: “Jered”; this is Moses, and why was he called Jered? Because manna came down [ yarad ] for the Jewish people in his days. “Gedor” because he fenced in [ gadar ] the breaches of the Jewish people. “Heber” because he connected [ ḥibber ] the Jewish people to their Father in Heaven. “Soco” because he was for the Jewish people like a shelter [ sukka ] “Jekuthiel” because the Jewish people trusted in God [ kivu laEl in his days. “Zanoah” because he caused the iniquities of the Jewish people to be disregarded [ hizniaḥ ].
llm_translation: "Yered" - this is Moses, and why was his name called "Yered"? Because he brought down to the Israelites manna in his days. "Gedor" - that he fenced in the breaches of the Israelites. "Chever" - that he connected Israel to their Father in Heaven. "Soko" - that he made for the Israelites a shelter. "Yekutiel" - that Israel hoped to God in his days. "Zanoach" - that he caused the sins of the Israelites to be abandoned.

hebrew_text: ״אֲבִי״ ״אֲבִי״ ״אֲבִי״ — אָב בַּתּוֹרָה, אָב בְּחׇכְמָה, אָב בִּנְבִיאוּת.
human_translation: father of father of father of A father in Torah, a father in wisdom, a father in prophecy.
llm_translation: "Abi, Abi, Abi" - Father in Torah, father in wisdom, father in prophecy.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֵלֶּה בְּנֵי בִּתְיָה אֲשֶׁר לָקַח מָרֶד״, וְכִי מֶרֶד שְׁמוֹ? וַהֲלֹא כָּלֵב שְׁמוֹ! אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: יָבֹא כָּלֵב שֶׁמָּרַד בַּעֲצַת מְרַגְּלִים, וְיִשָּׂא אֶת בַּת פַּרְעֹה שֶׁמָּרְדָה בְּגִלּוּלֵי בֵּית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: “And these are the sons of Bithiah whom Mered took.” Was name Mered? Wasn’t his name Caleb? The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Let Caleb, who rebelled [ marad ] against the advice of the spies, come and marry the daughter of Pharaoh, who rebelled against the idols of her father’s home.
llm_translation: "And these are the sons of Bitya whom Mered took," and is Mered his name? Is it not Caleb his name! The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Let Caleb, whose name is Mered in the counsel of the spies, come and marry the daughter of Pharaoh who rebelled against the idols of her father's house."

hebrew_text: ״אֲשֶׁר הׇגְלָה מִירוּשָׁלַיִם״, אָמַר רָבָא: שֶׁגָּלָה מֵעַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: “Who had been exiled from Jerusalem” Rava said: that he went into exile on his own,
llm_translation: "‘Asher hagaláh miYerushalayim,’ amar Rava: shegálah me'atzmo."

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי אוֹמֵן אֶת הֲדַסָּה״, קָרֵי לַהּ ״הֲדַסָּה״ וְקָרֵי לַהּ ״אֶסְתֵּר״? תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אֶסְתֵּר שְׁמָהּ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ הֲדַסָּה — עַל שֵׁם הַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁנִּקְרְאוּ הֲדַסִּים. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהוּא עוֹמֵד בֵּין הַהֲדַסִּים״.
human_translation: “And he had brought up Hadassah, She is referred to as “Hadassah” and she is referred to as “Esther.” It is taught Rabbi Meir says: Esther was her name. Why was she called Hadassah? On account of the righteous, who are called myrtles [ hadassim ], and so it states: “And he stood among the myrtles [ hahadassim ]”
llm_translation: "And he was raising Hadassah," it calls her "Hadassah" and it calls her "Esther"? It was taught: Rabbi Meir says: Esther is her name, and why was she called Hadassah? Because of the righteous ones who were called myrtle branches. And so it says: "And he was standing among the myrtle branches."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הֲדַסָּה שְׁמָהּ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרֵאת שְׁמָהּ אֶסְתֵּר? עַל שֵׁם שֶׁהָיְתָה מַסְתֶּרֶת דְּבָרֶיהָ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֵין אֶסְתֵּר מַגֶּדֶת אֶת עַמָּהּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Hadassah was her name. Why was she called Esther? Because she concealed [ masteret ] the truth as it is stated: “Esther had not yet made known her people”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Hadassah is her name, and why was she called by the name Esther? Because she was concealing her words, as it is stated: "Esther did not reveal her people or her kindred."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: הֲדַסָּה שְׁמָהּ, וְלָמָּה נִקְרֵאת אֶסְתֵּר? שֶׁהָיוּ אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ עַל שׁוּם אִסְתַּהַר. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: אֶסְתֵּר, לֹא אֲרוּכָּה וְלֹא קְצָרָה הָיְתָה, אֶלָּא בֵּינוֹנִית כַּהֲדַסָּה. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אָמַר: אֶסְתֵּר — יְרַקְרוֹקֶת הָיְתָה, וְחוּט שֶׁל חֶסֶד מָשׁוּךְ עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya says: Hadassah was her name. Why was she called Esther? for the nations of the world called her after Istahar, Ben Azzai says: Esther was neither tall nor short, but of average size like a myrtle Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa said: Esther was greenish, a cord of grace was strung around her,
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah says: Hadassah is her name, and why was she called Esther? Because the nations of the world would call her by the name Ishtahar. Ben Azzai says: Esther was neither tall nor short, but of medium height like a myrtle. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: Esther was greenish in color, and a thread of kindness was drawn upon her.

hebrew_text: ״כִּי אֵין לָהּ אָב וָאֵם״ — ״וּבְמוֹת אָבִיהָ וְאִמָּהּ״ לְמָה לִי? אָמַר רַב אַחָא: עִיבְּרַתָּה — מֵת אָבִיהָ, יְלָדַתָּה — מֵתָה אִמָּהּ.
human_translation: “For she had neither father nor mother” Why do I need “And when her father and mother were dead, Rav Aḥa said: when became pregnant her father died, when she gave birth her mother died,
llm_translation: "‘For she has no father or mother’ — ‘and in the death of her father and mother’ why do I need it? Rav Acha said: She was impregnated — her father died, she gave birth — her mother died."

hebrew_text: ״וּבְמוֹת אָבִיהָ וְאִמָּהּ לְקָחָהּ מׇרְדֳּכַי לוֹ לְבַת״, תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״לְבַת״ אֶלָּא לְבַיִת. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְלָרָשׁ אֵין כֹּל כִּי אִם כִּבְשָׂה אַחַת קְטַנָּה אֲשֶׁר קָנָה וַיְחַיֶּהָ וַתִּגְדַּל עִמּוֹ וְעִם בָּנָיו יַחְדָּו מִפִּתּוֹ תֹאכַל וּמִכּוֹסוֹ תִשְׁתֶּה וּבְחֵיקוֹ תִשְׁכָּב וַתְּהִי לוֹ כְּבַת״, מִשּׁוּם דִּבְחֵיקוֹ תִשְׁכָּב הֲווֹת לֵיהּ (לְבַת)? אֶלָּא — (לְבַיִת) הָכִי נָמֵי לְבַיִת.
human_translation: “And when her father and mother were dead, Mordecai took her for his own daughter” taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: Do not read for a daughter [ bat ], rather for a home [ bayit ]. And so it states: “But the poor man had nothing, except one little ewe lamb, which he had bought and reared: And it grew up together with him, and with his children; it did eat of his bread, and drank of his own cup, and lay in his bosom, and was like a daughter [ kevat ] to him” Because it lay in his bosom, it “was like a daughter to him”? Rather, Like a home [ bayit ] So too, here, for a home,
llm_translation: "And in the death of her father and mother, Mordecai took her as a daughter," It was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: Do not read "as a daughter" but rather "as a house." And so he also says: "And for the wicked there is nothing but a small ewe lamb that he bought and nurtured, and it grew up with him and his children, ate of his morsel, drank from his cup, and lay in his bosom, and was to him as a daughter," because she lay in his bosom, should she be considered (as a daughter)? Rather — (as a house) so indeed, as a house.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֵת שֶׁבַע הַנְּעָרוֹת וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רָבָא: שֶׁהָיְתָה מוֹנָה בָּהֶן יְמֵי שַׁבָּת. ״וַיְשַׁנֶּהָ וְאֶת נַעֲרוֹתֶיהָ וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַב: שֶׁהֶאֱכִילָהּ מַאֲכָל יְהוּדִי.
human_translation: “And the seven maids Rava said: She would count the days of the week by them, “And he advanced her and her maids Rav said: that he fed her food of Jews,
llm_translation: "And the seven maidens, etc." Rava said: She would count with them the days of the Sabbath. "And he changed her and her maidens, etc." Rav said: He fed her Jewish food.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שֶׁהֶאֱכִילָהּ קְדָלֵי דַחֲזִירֵי.
human_translation: And Shmuel said that he fed her pig hinds,
llm_translation: And Samuel said: "For feeding it is like feeding pigs."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: זֵרְעוֹנִים, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיְהִי הַמֶּלְצַר נוֹשֵׂא אֶת פַּת בָּגָם וְנוֹתֵן לָהֶם זֵרְעוֹנִים״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said vegetables, And so it states “So the steward took away their food and gave them vegetables”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Zerzonim," and so it says: "And the steward took away their ration of bread and gave them Zerzonim."

hebrew_text: ״שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמּוֹר״. מַאי ״שֶׁמֶן הַמּוֹר״? רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: סְטָכַת, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: שֶׁמֶן זַיִת שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיא שְׁלִישׁ. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַנְפָּקִינוֹן — שֶׁמֶן זַיִת שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיא שְׁלִישׁ, וְלָמָּה סָכִין אוֹתוֹ — שֶׁמַּשִּׁיר אֶת הַשֵּׂיעָר וּמְעַדֵּן אֶת הַבָּשָׂר.
human_translation: “Six months with oil of myrrh” What is “oil of myrrh”? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: setakt . Rav Huna said: oil from olives that have not reached one-third It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: Anpakinon the oil of olives that have not reached one-third And why is it smeared it removes the hair and softens the skin.
llm_translation: "Six months with 'Shemen Hamor'." What is 'Shemen Hamor'? Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said: Stacte. Rav Huna said: Olive oil that did not bring a third. It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: Anpakinon - olive oil that did not bring a third, and why do we anoint with it? To make the hair smooth and to beautify the skin.

hebrew_text: ״בָּעֶרֶב הִיא בָאָה וּבַבֹּקֶר הִיא שָׁבָה״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִגְּנוּתוֹ שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע לָמַדְנוּ שִׁבְחוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה מְשַׁמֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: “In the evening she went, and in the morning she returned” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: From the criticism of that wicked man, we have learned his praise that he would not engage in sexual relations during the day,
llm_translation: "At evening she comes, and in the morning she returns," Rabbi Yochanan said: From the modesty of that wicked one we learned his praise, that he did not engage in marital relations during the day."

hebrew_text: ״וַתְּהִי אֶסְתֵּר נֹשֵׂאת חֵן״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁלְּכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נִדְמְתָה לוֹ כְּאוּמָּתוֹ. ״וַתִּלָּקַח אֶסְתֵּר אֶל הַמֶּלֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ אֶל בֵּית מַלְכוּתוֹ בַּחֹדֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִי הוּא חֹדֶשׁ טֵבֵת״, יֶרַח שֶׁנֶּהֱנֶה גּוּף מִן הַגּוּף.
human_translation: “And Esther obtained favor Rabbi Elazar said: This teaches that she appeared to each and every one as if his nation, “So Esther was taken to King Ahasuerus into his royal house in the tenth month, which is the month Tevet” month, in which the body takes pleasure in another body,
llm_translation: "And Esther found favor," Rabbi Elazar said: It teaches that she appeared pleasing to each and every one like his own nation. "And Esther was taken to King Ahasuerus into his royal palace in the tenth month, which is the month of Tevet," a month that draws sustenance from the body.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֶּאֱהַב הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת אֶסְתֵּר מִכׇּל הַנָּשִׁים וַתִּשָּׂא חֵן וָחֶסֶד לְפָנָיו מִכׇּל הַבְּתוּלוֹת״, אָמַר רַב: בִּיקֵּשׁ לִטְעוֹם טַעַם בְּתוּלָה — טָעַם, טַעַם בְּעוּלָה — טָעַם.
human_translation: “And the king loved Esther more than all the women, and she obtained grace and favor in his sight more than all the virgins” Rav said: he wanted to taste the taste of a virgin he tasted the taste of a non-virgin, he tasted
llm_translation: "And the king loved Esther from all the women, and she found favor and kindness in his eyes more than all the virgins," Rav said: "He sought to taste the taste of a virgin - taste, taste of a married woman - taste."

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּעַשׂ הַמֶּלֶךְ מִשְׁתֶּה גָדוֹל״. עֲבַד מִשְׁתְּיָא וְלָא גַּלְּיָא לֵיהּ, דַּלִּי כְּרָגָא וְלָא גַּלְּיָא לֵיהּ, שַׁדַּר פַּרְדִּישְׁנֵי וְלָא גַּלְּיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: “Then the king made a great feast He made feast but she did not reveal to him. He lowered the taxes [ karga ] but she did not reveal to him. He sent gifts [ pardishenei ] but she did not reveal to him.
llm_translation: "And the king made a great feast." He made a feast and did not reveal it, he poured a cup and did not reveal it, he sent out dishes and did not reveal them.

hebrew_text: ״וּבְהִקָּבֵץ בְּתוּלוֹת שֵׁנִית וְגוֹ׳״. אֲזַיל שְׁקַל עֵצָה מִמָּרְדֳּכַי, אֲמַר: אֵין אִשָּׁה מִתְקַנְּאָה אֶלָּא בְּיֶרֶךְ חֲבֶירְתָּהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא גַּלְּיָא לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֵין אֶסְתֵּר מַגֶּדֶת מוֹלַדְתָּהּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: “And when the virgins were gathered together the second time he went took advice from Mordecai said a woman is jealous only of the thigh of another But even so she did not reveal to him, as it is written: “Esther had not yet made known her kindred
llm_translation: "And in the gathering of the virgins a second time, etc." He went to seek advice from Mordecai, who said: A woman only becomes jealous of her friend's thigh, and even so, it was not revealed to him, as it is written: "No Esther revealed her birthplace, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב:
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: What is which is written:
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, what is the meaning of what is written:

hebrew_text: ״לֹא יִגְרַע מִצַּדִּיק עֵינָיו״ — בִּשְׂכַר צְנִיעוּת שֶׁהָיְתָה בָּהּ בְּרָחֵל זָכְתָה וְיָצָא מִמֶּנָּה שָׁאוּל, וּבִשְׂכַר צְנִיעוּת שֶׁהָיָה בּוֹ בְּשָׁאוּל זָכָה וְיָצָאת מִמֶּנּוּ אֶסְתֵּר.
human_translation: “He withdraws not His eyes from the righteous; in reward for the modesty shown by Rachel she merited that Saul, should descend from her, and in reward for the modesty shown by Saul, he merited that Esther should descend from him.
llm_translation: "לֹא יִגְרַע מִצַּדִּיק עֵינָיו" — in reward of the modesty that was in Rachel, she merited and Saul descended from her, and in reward of the modesty that was in Saul, Esther descended from him.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי צְנִיעוּת הָיְתָה בָּהּ בְּרָחֵל? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּגֵּד יַעֲקֹב לְרָחֵל כִּי אֲחִי אָבִיהָ הוּא״. וְכִי אֲחִי אָבִיהָ הוּא? וַהֲלֹא בֶּן אֲחוֹת אָבִיהָ הוּא?
human_translation: What was the modesty shown by Rachel? as it is written: “And Jacob told Rachel that he was her father’s brother, Was he, her father’s brother? But wasn’t he the son of her father’s sister?
llm_translation: And what modesty was there in Rachel? As it is written: "And Jacob told Rachel that he was her father's brother." But was he her father's brother? Is he not the son of her father's sister?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אֲמַר לַהּ: מִינַּסְבָא לִי? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִין, מִיהוּ אַבָּא רַמָּאָה הוּא וְלָא יָכְלַתְּ לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: אָחִיו אֲנָא בְּרַמָּאוּת. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: וּמִי שְׁרֵי לְצַדִּיקֵי לְסַגּוֹיֵי בְּרַמָּיוּתָא? אֲמַר לַהּ, אִין: ״עִם נָבָר תִּתָּבָר וְעִם עִקֵּשׁ תִּתַּפָּל״.
human_translation: Rather, he said to her: Will you marry me? She said to him: Yes, but my father, is a swindler, and you will not be able to him. he said to her I am his brother in deception. She said to him: But is it permitted for the righteous to be involved in deception? He said to her: Yes, “With the pure you will show yourself pure, and with the perverse you will show yourself subtle”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, he said to her: "Did Minasva come to me?" She said to him: "No, but it was Abba Ramaha and you could not handle him." He said to her: "I am his brother in trickery." She said to him: "Is it permitted for the righteous to engage in trickery?" He said to her: "No, 'With the pure, You show Yourself pure, and with the crooked, You show Yourself twisted.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לַהּ: וּמַאי רַמָּיוּתָא? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִית לִי אֲחָתָא דְּקַשִּׁישָׁא מִינַּאי וְלָא מַנְסֵיב לִי מִקַּמַּהּ. מְסַר לַהּ סִימָנִים.
human_translation: said to her: What is the deception said to him: I have a sister who is older than I, and he will not marry me off before her, gave her distinguishing signs
llm_translation: He said to her: And what is the sign? She said to him: I have a jug of fine flour from you, and you did not propose to me from it. He gave her signs.

hebrew_text: כִּי מְטָא לֵילְיָא, אֲמַרָה: הַשְׁתָּא מִיכַּסְפָא אֲחָתַאי. מְסַרְתִּינְהוּ נִיהֲלַהּ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בַבֹּקֶר וְהִנֵּה הִיא לֵאָה״, מִכְּלָל דְּעַד הַשְׁתָּא לָאו לֵאָה הִיא? אֶלָּא: מִתּוֹךְ סִימָנִין שֶׁמָּסְרָה רָחֵל לְלֵאָה — לָא הֲוָה יָדַע עַד הַשְׁתָּא. לְפִיכָךְ זָכְתָה וְיָצָא מִמֶּנָּה שָׁאוּל.
human_translation: When the night arrived, said Now my sister will be embarassed, she gave them to her. And this is as it is written: “And it came to pass, that in the morning, behold, it was Leah” by inference that until now she was not Leah? Rather, due to the distinguishing signs that Rachel had given to Leah, he did not know until now, Therefore, merited that Saul should descend from her,
llm_translation: When it came to the night, she said: "This time, my husband will be attached to me." She handed him over to her. And that is what is written: "And it came to pass in the morning, and behold, it was Leah." From which it is inferred that until now, was she not Leah? Rather, through the signs that Rachel transmitted to Leah - he did not know until now. Therefore, she merited, and Saul came out of her.

hebrew_text: וּמָה צְנִיעוּת הָיְתָה בְּשָׁאוּל? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת דְּבַר הַמְּלוּכָה לֹא הִגִּיד לוֹ אֲשֶׁר אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל״, זָכָה וְיָצָאת מִמֶּנּוּ אֶסְתֵּר. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כְּשֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא פּוֹסֵק גְּדוּלָּה לְאָדָם — פּוֹסֵק לְבָנָיו וְלִבְנֵי בָנָיו עַד סוֹף כׇּל הַדּוֹרוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיּוֹשִׁיבֵם לָנֶצַח וַיִּגְבָּהוּ (וְגוֹ׳)״. וְאִם הֵגִיס דַּעְתּוֹ — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַשְׁפִּילוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם אֲסוּרִים בַּזִּקִּים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And what was the modesty shown by Saul? As it is written: “But of the matter of the kingdom, of which Samuel spoke, he did not tell him” merited that Esther would descend from him. Rabbi Elazar said: When the Holy One, Blessed be He, assigns greatness to a person, He assigns it to his sons and to his son’s sons for all generations, as it is stated: He establishes them forever, and they are exalted” And if he becomes arrogant the Holy One, Blessed be He, lowers him as it is stated “And if they are bound in chains,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What was the modesty in Saul? As it is written: "And he did not tell him the matter of the kingdom, which Samuel had said." She merited and Esther came out from him. And Rabbi Elazar said: When the Holy One, blessed be He, decrees greatness for a person, He decrees it for his children and his children's children until the end of all generations, as it is said: "And He established them forever and exalted them." And if he makes his mind stubborn, the Holy One, blessed be He, lowers him, as it is said: "And if they are bound in fetters."

hebrew_text: ״וְאֶת מַאֲמַר מׇרְדֳּכַי אֶסְתֵּר עוֹשָׂה״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: שֶׁהָיְתָה מַרְאָה דַּם נִדָּה לַחֲכָמִים. ״כַּאֲשֶׁר הָיְתָה בְאׇמְנָה אִתּוֹ״, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר לִימָא (מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב): שֶׁהָיְתָה עוֹמֶדֶת מֵחֵיקוֹ שֶׁל אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ וְטוֹבֶלֶת וְיוֹשֶׁבֶת בְּחֵיקוֹ שֶׁל מָרְדֳּכַי.
human_translation: “For Esther adhered to the words of Mordecai, Rabbi Yirmeya said: that she would show menstrual blood to the Sages “As she did when she was brought up with him” Rabba bar Lima said in the name of Rav: that she would arise from the lap of Ahasuerus, immerse herself and sit in the lap of Mordecai.
llm_translation: "And the statement of Mordecai Esther was doing," Rabbi Yirmeya said: that she appeared to the sages as menstruating. "As she was in his trust," Rabba bar Lema (in the name of Rav) said: that she would stand up from the lap of Ahasuerus, immerse, and sit in the lap of Mordecai.

hebrew_text: ״בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם וּמׇרְדֳּכַי יוֹשֵׁב בְּשַׁעַר הַמֶּלֶךְ קָצַף בִּגְתָן וָתֶרֶשׁ״, אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הִקְצִיף הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אָדוֹן עַל עֲבָדָיו לַעֲשׂוֹת רְצוֹן צַדִּיק. וּמַנּוּ? יוֹסֵף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁם אִתָּנוּ נַעַר עִבְרִי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: “In those days, while Mordecai sat in the king’s gate, Bigthan and Teresh, became angry, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, caused a master to become angry with his servants to fulfill the will of a righteous man. And who is this? Joseph, as it is stated “And there was with us there a young man, a Hebrew”
llm_translation: "In those days, while Mordecai was sitting at the king's gate, Bigthan and Teresh became angry." Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: The Holy One, blessed be He, became angry with His servants to fulfill the will of the righteous. And who are they? Joseph, as it is said: 'And there was with us a Hebrew youth.'"

hebrew_text: עֲבָדִים עַל אֲדוֹנֵיהֶן לַעֲשׂוֹת נֵס לַצַּדִּיק, וּמַנּוּ? מָרְדֳּכַי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּוָּדַע הַדָּבָר לְמׇרְדֳּכַי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: servants with their master in order to perform a miracle for righteous man. And who is he? Mordecai, as it is written: “And the matter became known to Mordecai”
llm_translation: Slaves upon their masters to do a miracle for the righteous, and who? Mordecai, as it is written: "And the matter became known to Mordecai, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּגְתָן וָתֶרֶשׁ שְׁנֵי טַרְסִיִּים הֲווֹ, וְהָיוּ מְסַפְּרִין בְּלָשׁוֹן טוּרְסִי, וְאוֹמְרִים: מִיּוֹם שֶׁבָּאת זוֹ לֹא רָאִינוּ שֵׁינָה בְּעֵינֵינוּ, בֹּא וְנַטִּיל אֶרֶס בַּסֵּפֶל כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּמוּת. וְהֵן לֹא הָיוּ יוֹדְעִין כִּי מָרְדֳּכַי מִיּוֹשְׁבֵי לִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית הָיָה, וְהָיָה יוֹדֵעַ בְּשִׁבְעִים לָשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Bigthan and Teresh were two Tarsians, and they would talk Tarsian language. They said: From the day that we have not slept, Come, let us cast poison in the goblet so that he will die. But they did not know that Mordecai was of those who sat in the Chamber of Hewn Stone, and that he knew seventy languages,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Bigthan and Teresh were two eunuchs, and they would speak in the language of Tursi, saying: "Since this one came, we have not seen sleep in our eyes; come, let us put poison in the goblet so that he may die." And they did not know that Mordecai was one of the residents of the chamber of the harem, and he knew seventy languages.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: וַהֲלֹא אֵין מִשְׁמַרְתִּי וּמִשְׁמַרְתְּךָ שָׁוָה? אָמַר לוֹ: אֲנִי אֶשְׁמוֹר מִשְׁמַרְתִּי וּמִשְׁמַרְתְּךָ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְבֻקַּשׁ הַדָּבָר וַיִּמָּצֵא״ — שֶׁלֹּא נִמְצְאוּ בְּמִשְׁמַרְתָּן.
human_translation: said to But my post and your post are not identical. said to him: I will guard my post and your post. And this is as it is written “And when inquiry was made of the matter, it was found to be so” that they were not found at their posts.
llm_translation: He said to him: "But isn't my watch and your watch equal?" He said to him: "I will keep my watch and your watch." And this is what is written: "And the matter was investigated and found" - that they were not found in their watch.

hebrew_text: ״אַחַר הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה״. (אַחַר מַאי?) אָמַר רָבָא: אַחַר שֶׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רְפוּאָה לַמַּכָּה.
human_translation: “After these events After what Rava said: after the Holy One, Blessed be He, created a remedy for the blow
llm_translation: "After these matters." (After what?) Rava said: After the Holy One, blessed be He, created the wound, He created the healing.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַכֶּה אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן בּוֹרֵא לָהֶם רְפוּאָה תְּחִילָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּרׇפְאִי לְיִשְׂרָאֵל וְנִגְלָה עֲוֹן אֶפְרַיִם״. אֲבָל אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ כֵּן — מַכֶּה אוֹתָן וְאַחַר כָּךְ בּוֹרֵא לָהֶם רְפוּאָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָגַף ה׳ אֶת מִצְרַיִם נָגוֹף וְרָפוֹא״.
human_translation: As Reish Lakish said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, does not strike at the Jewish people unless He has created a remedy for them beforehand, as it is stated: “When I would have healed Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim was uncovered” But not so the nations of the world. strikes them and afterward does He create a remedy, as it is stated: “And the Lord shall smite Egypt, smiting and healing”
llm_translation: The head of the academy, Resh Lakish, said: The Holy One, blessed be He, does not strike Israel unless He first creates a cure for them, as it is stated: "I will heal their waywardness and love them freely" (Hosea 14:5). But with regard to the nations of the world, it is not so — He strikes them and only afterwards creates a cure for them, as it is stated: "And the Lord will strike Egypt, striking and healing" (Isaiah 19:22).

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּבֶז בְּעֵינָיו לִשְׁלוֹחַ יָד בְּמׇרְדֳּכַי לְבַדּוֹ״. אָמַר רָבָא: בַּתְּחִילָּה בְּמָרְדְּכַי לְבַדּוֹ, וּלְבַסּוֹף בְּעַם מָרְדֳּכַי, וּמַנּוּ — רַבָּנַן, וּלְבַסּוֹף בְּכׇל הַיְּהוּדִים.
human_translation: “But it seemed contemptible in his eyes to lay his hand on Mordecai alone; Rava said: At first Mordecai alone, and in the end on the people of Mordecai. And who were the Sages, And ultimately on all the Jews.
llm_translation: "And it was despicable in his eyes to lay hands on Mordecai alone." Rava said: Initially, it was Mordecai alone, and in the end, it was the people of Mordecai. And they counted - the Sages, and in the end, it was all the Jews.

hebrew_text: ״הִפִּיל פּוּר הוּא הַגּוֹרָל״, תָּנָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנָּפַל פּוּר בְּחוֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר שָׂמַח שִׂמְחָה גְּדוֹלָה, אָמַר: נָפַל לִי פּוּר בְּיֶרַח שֶׁמֵּת בּוֹ מֹשֶׁה. וְלֹא הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁבְּשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר מֵת, וּבְשִׁבְעָה בַּאֲדָר נוֹלָד.
human_translation: “They cast pur , that is, the lot” taught Once the lot fell on the month of Adar, he, greatly rejoiced, He said: The lot has fallen for me in the month that Moses died, But he did not know that did die on the seventh of Adar, he was born on the seventh of Adar,
llm_translation: "The lot fell," it was taught: Once the lot fell in the month of Adar, he rejoiced with great joy, saying: "The lot fell for me in the month in which Moses died." And he did not know that on the seventh of Adar Moses died, and on the seventh of Adar he was born.

hebrew_text: ״יֶשְׁנוֹ עַם אֶחָד״, אָמַר רָבָא: לֵיכָּא דְּיָדַע לִישָּׁנָא בִּישָׁא כְּהָמָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּא נִיכַלִּינְהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִסְתְּפֵינָא מֵאֱלָהַיְהוּ דְּלָא לֶיעְבֵּיד בִּי כְּדַעֲבַד בְּקַמָּאֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: [״יֶשְׁנוֹ״ —] יָשְׁנוּ מִן הַמִּצְוֹת.
human_translation: “There is [ yeshno ] one Rava said: There was none who knew how to slander like Haman, He said to Let us destroy them. said to him: I am afraid of their God, lest He do to me as He did to those before me. said to him: They have been asleep [ yashnu ] with respect to the mitzvot,
llm_translation: "There is one nation," Rava said: It is not like Haman who knew how to interpret dreams. He said to him: Come, let us destroy them. He said to him: I am afraid of the God who does not neglect me as He did with our predecessors. He said to him: "There is one nation" - They are exempt from the commandments.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִית בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַם אֶחָד הֵן.
human_translation: said to him: There are the Sages among them said to him: They are one people,
llm_translation: He said to him: There are many rabbis. He said to him: They are one people.

hebrew_text: שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר, קָרְחָה אֲנִי עוֹשֶׂה בְּמַלְכוּתֶךָ — מְפוּזָּרִין הֵם בֵּין הָעַמִּים. שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר: אִית הֲנָאָה מִינַּיְיהוּ — ״מְפוֹרָד״, כִּפְרֵידָה זוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ עוֹשָׂה פֵּירוֹת. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר, אִיכָּא מְדִינְתָּא מִינַּיְיהוּ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּכׇל מְדִינוֹת מַלְכוּתֶךָ״.
human_translation: Perhaps you will say I am making a bald spot in your kingdom, they are scattered [ mefuzarin ] among the peoples, perhaps you will say there is benefit from them; meforad , like this mule [ pereida ] that cannot bear offspring, perhaps you will say there is a province with them. Therefore the verse states “in all the provinces of your kingdom”
llm_translation: Perhaps you will say, "I will make a rebellion in your kingdom" - they are scattered among the nations. Perhaps you will say: Is there any benefit from them? "Separated," like this separation that does not produce fruits. And perhaps you will say, is there a province from them? The Talmud teaches: "In all the provinces of your kingdom."

hebrew_text: ״וְדָתֵיהֶם שׁוֹנוֹת מִכׇּל עָם״, דְּלָא אָכְלִי מִינַּן וְלָא נָסְבִי מִינַּן וְלָא מִנַּסְבִי לַן. ״וְאֶת דָּתֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ אֵינָם עוֹשִׂים״, דְּמַפְּקִי לְכוּלָּא שַׁתָּא בְּשִׁהֵי פִּהֵי. ״וְלַמֶּלֶךְ אֵין שֹׁוֶה לְהַנִּיחָם״, דְּאָכְלוּ וְשָׁתוּ וּמְבַזּוּ לֵיהּ לְמַלְכָּא, וַאֲפִילּוּ נוֹפֵל זְבוּב בְּכוֹסוֹ שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן — זוֹרְקוֹ וְשׁוֹתֵהוּ, וְאִם אֲדוֹנִי הַמֶּלֶךְ נוֹגֵעַ בְּכוֹסוֹ שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן — חוֹבְטוֹ בַּקַּרְקַע וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹתֵהוּ.
human_translation: “And their laws are diverse from those of every people” as they do not eat from our nor do they marry from our nor do they marry off to us. “Nor do they keep the king’s laws” They spend the entire year Shehi pehi , “Therefore it does not profit the king to tolerate them,” as they eat and drink and scorn the throne. even if a fly falls into the cup of one of them, he will throw out and drink it but if my master the king were to touch the glass of one of them, he would throw it to the ground, and would not drink it,
llm_translation: "And their laws are different from all people," for they do not eat from us, and we do not intermarry with them, and they do not intermarry with us. "And they do not observe the king's laws," for they overturn the entire flask at the time of the feast. "And it is not fitting for the king to tolerate them," for they eat and drink and insult the king, and even if a fly falls into the cup of one of them - he removes it and drinks, but if the king's master touches the cup of one of them - he smashes it on the ground and does not drink it.

hebrew_text: ״אִם עַל הַמֶּלֶךְ טוֹב יִכָּתֵב לְאַבְּדָם וַעֲשֶׂרֶת אֲלָפִים כִּכַּר כֶּסֶף וְגוֹ׳״, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: גָּלוּי וְיָדוּעַ לִפְנֵי מִי שֶׁאָמַר וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם שֶׁעָתִיד הָמָן לִשְׁקוֹל שְׁקָלִים עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל, לְפִיכָךְ הִקְדִּים שִׁקְלֵיהֶן לִשְׁקָלָיו.
human_translation: “If it please the king, let it be written that they be destroyed, and ten thousand talents of silver Reish Lakish said: It is revealed and known to the One Who spoke and the world came into being, that in the future Haman was going to weigh out shekels against the Jewish people; therefore, He shekels preceded shekels.
llm_translation: "If it pleases the king, let it be written to destroy them, and ten thousand talents of silver, etc." Resh Lakish said: It is revealed and known before Whom it was said and came to be, the world, that Haman, who was destined to weigh shekels against Israel, therefore hastened their shekels to his shekels.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דִּתְנַן: בְּאֶחָד בַּאֲדָר מַשְׁמִיעִין עַל הַשְּׁקָלִים וְעַל הַכִּלְאַיִם.
human_translation: And this is as we learned On the first of Adar makes a announcement about shekels and about diverse kinds
llm_translation: And this is what we learned: On the first of Adar, we announce concerning the shekels and concerning the kilayim.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ לְהָמָן הַכֶּסֶף נָתוּן לָךְ וְהָעָם לַעֲשׂוֹת בּוֹ כַּטּוֹב בְּעֵינֶיךָ״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא:
human_translation: “And the king said to Haman: The silver is given to you; the people also, to do with them as it seems good to you” Rabbi Abba said:
llm_translation: "And the king said to Haman, 'The silver is given to you, and the people, to do with them as it seems good in your eyes.'" Rabbi Abba said:

hebrew_text: מָשָׁל דַּאֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ וְהָמָן לָמָּה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לִשְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם, לְאֶחָד הָיָה לוֹ תֵּל בְּתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ וּלְאֶחָד הָיָה לוֹ חָרִיץ בְּתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ. בַּעַל חָרִיץ אָמַר: מִי יִתֵּן לִי תֵּל זֶה בְּדָמִים! בַּעַל הַתֵּל אָמַר: מִי יִתֵּן לִי חָרִיץ זֶה בְּדָמִים!
human_translation: Ahasuerus and Haman a parable; to what may they be compared? To two individuals, one had a mound in the middle of his field and the other had a ditch in the middle of his field, The owner of the ditch, said Who will give me this mound for money, the owner of the mound, said Who will give me this ditch for money,
llm_translation: Parable of Ahasuerus and Haman, what is the matter similar to? To two sons of man, to one there was a hill in the midst of his field and to one there was a furrow in the midst of his field. The owner of the furrow said: "Who will give me this hill in exchange for blood!" The owner of the hill said: "Who will give me this furrow in exchange for blood!"

hebrew_text: לְיָמִים נִזְדַּוְּוגוּ זֶה אֵצֶל זֶה. אָמַר לוֹ בַּעַל חָרִיץ לְבַעַל הַתֵּל: מְכוֹר לִי תִּילְּךָ! אָמַר לוֹ: טוֹל אוֹתוֹ בְּחִנָּם, וְהַלְוַאי!
human_translation: one day, they met one another. The owner of the ditch said to the owner of the mound: Sell me your mound said to him: Take it for free; if only
llm_translation: Days mingled with each other. The owner of the jar said to the owner of the mound: "Sell me your mound!" He said to him: "Take it for free, and may it be a loan!"

hebrew_text: ״וַיָּסַר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת טַבַּעְתּוֹ״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא: גְּדוֹלָה הֲסָרַת טַבַּעַת יוֹתֵר מֵאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה נְבִיאִים וְשֶׁבַע נְבִיאוֹת שֶׁנִּתְנַבְּאוּ לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁכּוּלָּן לֹא הֶחֱזִירוּם לְמוּטָב, וְאִילּוּ הֲסָרַת טַבַּעַת הֶחְזִירָתַן לְמוּטָב.
human_translation: “And the king removed his ring Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: The removal of ring was more effective than the forty-eight prophets and the seven prophetesses who prophesied on behalf of the Jewish people. As, they were all unable to return to the right way, but the removal of ring returned them to the right way,
llm_translation: "And the king removed his signet ring," Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: Great is the removal of a ring more than forty-eight prophets and seven prophetesses who prophesied for Israel, for all of them did not return them to good, but if the ring had been removed, it would have returned them to good."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה נְבִיאִים וְשֶׁבַע נְבִיאוֹת נִתְנַבְּאוּ לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְלֹא פִּחֲתוּ וְלֹא הוֹתִירוּ עַל מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה, חוּץ מִמִּקְרָא מְגִילָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught Forty-eight prophets and seven prophetesses prophesied on behalf of the Jewish people, and they neither subtracted from nor added onto what is written in the Torah, except for the reading of the Megilla,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Forty-eight male prophets and seven prophetesses prophesied for the Jewish people, and they did not detract or add anything to what is written in the Torah, except for the reading of the Scroll of Esther.

hebrew_text: מַאי דְּרוּשׁ? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה: וּמָה מֵעַבְדוּת לְחֵירוּת אָמְרִינַן שִׁירָה — מִמִּיתָה לְחַיִּים לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן.
human_translation: What exposition Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa said If, from slavery to freedom, we recite songs from death to life, not all the more so
llm_translation: What is the meaning of the verse? Rabbi Hiyya bar Avin said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha: And regarding the service of freedom to servitude, we say regarding song — if from death to life, surely.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַלֵּל נָמֵי נֵימָא! לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אוֹמְרִים הַלֵּל עַל נֵס שֶׁבַּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ. יְצִיאַת מִצְרַיִם, דְּנֵס שֶׁבְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ, הֵיכִי אָמְרִינַן שִׁירָה?
human_translation: If so, let us also recite hallel because hallel is not recited on a miracle outside Eretz the exodus from Egypt which was a miracle outside Eretz how are we able to recite songs
llm_translation: So it is, Hillel the son of Neima said! Because they do not say Hallel on a miracle that occurred outside of the Land. The Exodus from Egypt, a miracle that occurred outside of the Land, how do we say the song?

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: עַד שֶׁלֹּא נִכְנְסוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָאָרֶץ — הוּכְשְׁרוּ כׇּל אֲרָצוֹת לוֹמַר שִׁירָה. מִשֶּׁנִּכְנְסוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָאָרֶץ — לֹא הוּכְשְׁרוּ כׇּל הָאֲרָצוֹת לוֹמַר שִׁירָה.
human_translation: As it is taught Prior to the Jewish people entered Eretz all lands were fit songs to be recited after the Jewish people entered Eretz and all the lands were no longer fit songs to be recited
llm_translation: As it was taught: Until the Israelites entered the land, all lands were qualified to say a song. Once the Israelites entered the land, not all lands were qualified to say a song.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: קְרִיָּיתָהּ זוֹ הַלֵּילָהּ. רָבָא אָמַר, בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם: ״הַלְלוּ עַבְדֵי ה׳״ — וְלֹא עַבְדֵי פַרְעֹה, אֶלָּא הָכָא: ״הַלְלוּ עַבְדֵי ה׳״ — וְלֹא עַבְדֵי אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ? אַכַּתִּי עַבְדֵי אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ אֲנַן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said The reading of is hallel . Rava said Granted there, “Give praise, O servants of the Lord” and not servants of Pharaoh. But here, “Give praise, O servants of the Lord,” and not servants of Ahasuerus? we were still the servants of Ahasuerus,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: "Kriyatah this is its night." Rava said, "Granted there: 'Praise the servants of Hashem' - and not the servants of Pharaoh, but here: 'Praise the servants of Hashem' - and not the servants of Achashverosh? Indeed, we are the servants of Achashverosh."

hebrew_text: בֵּין לְרָבָא בֵּין לְרַב נַחְמָן קַשְׁיָא, וְהָא תַּנְיָא: מִשֶּׁנִּכְנְסוּ לָאָרֶץ — לֹא הוּכְשְׁרוּ כׇּל הָאֲרָצוֹת לוֹמַר שִׁירָה! כֵּיוָן שֶׁגָּלוּ, חָזְרוּ לְהֶכְשֵׁירָן הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Both according to Rava and according to Rav Naḥman, difficult. Isn’t it taught After the Jewish people entered Eretz and all the lands were no longer fit songs to be recited when were exiled returned to their initial suitability,
llm_translation: Between Rava and Rav Nachman is a difficulty, and this is what was taught: "When they entered the land - not all the lands were fit for singing!" Once they were exiled, they returned to their original fitness.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לֵיכָּא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי אִישׁ אֶחָד מִן הָרָמָתַיִם צוֹפִים״, אֶחָד מִמָּאתַיִם צוֹפִים שֶׁנִּתְנַבְּאוּ לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Is there no one else? Isn’t it written “And there was a certain [ eḥad ] man from Ramathaim-zophim” one [ eḥad ] of two hundred [ mata’im ] prophets [ tzofim ] who prophesied on behalf of the Jewish people.
llm_translation: And is there a place? And it is written: "And there was a certain man from Ramathaim-zophim," one of the two hundred seers who prophesied to Israel.

hebrew_text: מִיהְוֵה טוּבָא הֲווֹ, כִּדְתַנְיָא: הַרְבֵּה נְבִיאִים עָמְדוּ לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, כִּפְלַיִם כְּיוֹצְאֵי מִצְרַיִם. אֶלָּא נְבוּאָה שֶׁהוּצְרְכָה לְדוֹרוֹת — נִכְתְּבָה, וְשֶׁלֹּא הוּצְרְכָה — לֹא נִכְתְּבָה.
human_translation: there were more as it is taught Many prophets arose for the Jewish people, double the who left Egypt. However, prophecy that was needed for generations was written but that which was not needed, was not written.
llm_translation: The good who were they, as it was taught: Many prophets arose for Israel, double the number of those who left Egypt. Rather, prophecy that was necessary for its generations—was written, and that which was not necessary—was not written.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: אָדָם הַבָּא מִשְׁתֵּי רָמוֹת שֶׁצּוֹפוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ. רַבִּי חָנִין אָמַר: אָדָם הַבָּא מִבְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁעוֹמְדִין בְּרוּמוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם. וּמַאן נִינְהוּ? בְּנֵי קֹרַח, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְנֵי קֹרַח לֹא מֵתוּ״, תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ: מָקוֹם נִתְבַּצֵּר לָהֶם בְּגֵיהִנָּם, וְעָמְדוּ עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said A man who comes from two heights [ ramot ] that face [ tzofot ] one another. Rabbi Ḥanin said A man who descends from people who stood at the height of [ rumo ] the world. And who are these sons of Korah, as it is written: “But the sons of Korah did not die” it is taught in the name of our teacher, place was set aside for them in Gehenna, and they stood on
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: A person who comes from two heights that overlook each other. Rabbi Chanin said: A person who comes from the sons of men who stand in the exalted height of the world. And who are they? The sons of Korach, as it is written: "But the sons of Korach did not die." It was taught in the name of our Rabbi: A place was set aside for them in Gehenna, and they stood upon it.

hebrew_text: שֶׁבַע נְבִיאוֹת מַאן נִינְהוּ? שָׂרָה, מִרְיָם, דְּבוֹרָה, חַנָּה, אֲבִיגַיִל, חוּלְדָּה וְאֶסְתֵּר. שָׂרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲבִי מִלְכָּה וַאֲבִי יִסְכָּה״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: ״יִסְכָּה״ זוֹ שָׂרָה, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ יִסְכָּה — שֶׁסָּכְתָה בְּרוּחַ הַקֹּדֶשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּל אֲשֶׁר תֹּאמַר אֵלֶיךָ שָׂרָה שְׁמַע בְּקוֹלָהּ״. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״יִסְכָּה״ — שֶׁהַכֹּל סוֹכִין בְּיוֹפְיָהּ.
human_translation: Who were the seven prophetesses? Sarah, Miriam, Deborah, Hannah, Abigail, Huldah, and Esther. Sarah, as it is written: the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah” And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Iscah is Sarah. And why was she called Iscah? For she saw [ sakhta ] by means of divine inspiration, as it is stated: “In all that Sarah has said to you, hearken to her voice” Alternatively, Iscah, for all gazed [ sokhin ] upon her beauty.
llm_translation: Seven prophetesses, who are they? Sarah, Miriam, Deborah, Hannah, Abigail, Huldah, and Esther. Sarah, as it is written: "The father of Milcah and the father of Iscah." And Rabbi Yitzchak said: "Iscah" refers to Sarah. And why was she called Iscah? Because she beheld sakhta with the Holy Spirit, as it is said: "All that Sarah tells you, listen to her voice." Another explanation: "Iscah" - because everyone gazed at her beauty.

hebrew_text: מִרְיָם — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתִּקַּח מִרְיָם הַנְּבִיאָה אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן״, וְלֹא אֲחוֹת מֹשֶׁה, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַב: שֶׁהָיְתָה מִתְנַבְּאָה כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת אַהֲרֹן, וְאוֹמֶרֶת: עֲתִידָה אִמִּי שֶׁתֵּלֵד בֵּן שֶׁיּוֹשִׁיעַ אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל. וּבְשָׁעָה שֶׁנּוֹלַד נִתְמַלֵּא כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ אוֹרָה, עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּנְשָׁקָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי נִתְקַיְּימָה נְבוּאָתִיךְ.
human_translation: Miriam as it is written “And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took and not the sister of Moses? Rav Naḥman said Rav said: For she prophesied when she was the sister of Aaron, and she would say: My mother is destined to bear a son who will deliver the Jewish people And at the time when was born the entire house was filled with light, her father stood and kissed her on the head, said to her: My daughter, your prophecy has been fulfilled.
llm_translation: Miriam — as it is written: "And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron," and not the sister of Moses. Rav Nachman said in the name of Rav: that she prophesied when she was the sister of Aaron, and she said: "My mother is destined to give birth to a son who will save Israel." And at the moment he was born, the entire house was filled with light, her father stood up and kissed her on her head, and said to her: "My daughter, your prophecy has been fulfilled."

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִשְׁלִיכוּהוּ לַיְאוֹר, עָמַד אָבִיהָ וּטְפָחָהּ עַל רֹאשָׁהּ, וְאָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי הֵיכָן נְבוּאָתִיךְ? הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּתַצַּב אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵרָחוֹק לְדֵעָה״. לָדַעַת מָה יְהֵא בְּסוֹף נְבוּאָתָהּ.
human_translation: But once was cast into the river, her father arose and rapped her on the head, saying to her: My daughter, where is your prophecy This is that is written “And his sister stood at a distance to know ( to know what would be with the end of her prophecy,
llm_translation: And when they threw him into the river, her father stood and slapped her on her head, and said to her: "My daughter, where is your prophecy?" That is as it is written: "And his sister stood from afar to know." To know what would be the end of her prophecy.

hebrew_text: דְּבוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּדְבוֹרָה אִשָּׁה נְבִיאָה אֵשֶׁת לַפִּידוֹת״, מַאי ״אֵשֶׁת לַפִּידוֹת״? שֶׁהָיְתָה עוֹשָׂה פְּתִילוֹת לַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: Deborah as it is written “And Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lappidoth” What is “the wife of Lappidoth”? For she used to make wicks for the Sanctuary,
llm_translation: Deborah, as it is written: "Now Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lappidoth." What is "the wife of Lappidoth"? That she used to make wicks for the Sanctuary.

hebrew_text: ״וְהִיא יוֹשֶׁבֶת תַּחַת תּוֹמֶר״. מַאי שְׁנָא תַּחַת תּוֹמֶר? אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אַבְשָׁלוֹם: מִשּׁוּם יִחוּד. דָּבָר אַחֵר: מָה תָּמָר זֶה אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא לֵב אֶחָד — אַף יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁבְּאוֹתוֹ הַדּוֹר לֹא הָיָה לָהֶם אֶלָּא לֵב אֶחָד לַאֲבִיהֶן שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: “And she sat under a palm tree” What is different “under a palm tree” Rabbi Shimon ben Avshalom said: due to being alone together Alternatively, Just as a palm tree has only one heart, so too, the Jewish people in that generation had only one heart, to their Father in Heaven.
llm_translation: "And she sits beneath a palm tree." What is different about sitting beneath a palm tree? Rabbi Shimon ben Avshalom said: Because of unity. Another explanation: Just as this palm tree has only one heart, so too the Israelites of that generation had only one heart towards their Father in Heaven.

hebrew_text: חַנָּה — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתִּתְפַּלֵּל חַנָּה וַתֹּאמַר עָלַץ לִבִּי בַּה׳ רָמָה קַרְנִי בַּה׳״. ״רָמָה קַרְנִי״, וְלֹא רָמָה פַּכִּי. דָּוִד וּשְׁלֹמֹה שֶׁנִּמְשְׁחוּ בְּקֶרֶן — נִמְשְׁכָה מַלְכוּתָן, שָׁאוּל וְיֵהוּא שֶׁנִּמְשְׁחוּ בְּפַךְ — לֹא נִמְשְׁכָה מַלְכוּתָן.
human_translation: Hannah as it is written: “And Hannah prayed and said, My heart rejoices in the Lord, my horn is exalted in the Lord” “My horn is exalted,” and not: My pitcher is exalted. David and Solomon, who were anointed from a horn, their kingship continued, Saul and Jehu, who were anointed from a pitcher, their kingship did not continue.
llm_translation: Hannah — as it is written: "And Hannah prayed and said, 'My heart exults in the Lord; my horn is exalted in the Lord.'" "My horn is exalted," and not "my horn is emptied." David and Solomon, who were anointed with oil on the horn — their kingdom endured, while Saul and Jehu, who were anointed with a flask — their kingdom did not endure.

hebrew_text: ״אֵין קָדוֹשׁ כַּה׳ כִּי אֵין בִּלְתֶּךָ״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר מְנַשְּׁיָא: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״בִּלְתֶּךָ״, אֶלָּא ״לְבַלּוֹתֶךָ״. שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וְדָם. מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וְדָם — מַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו מְבַלִּין אוֹתוֹ, אֲבָל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — מְבַלֶּה מַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו.
human_translation: “There is none sacred as the Lord; for there is none beside You [ biltekha ]” Rav Yehuda bar Menashya said: Do not read biltekha , but rather levalotekha , As the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He, is unlike the attribute of flesh and blood. his handiwork outlasts him but the Holy One, Blessed be He, outlasts His handiwork,
llm_translation: "There is none holy as the Lord, for there is none beside You," said Rav Yehudah bar Menashya: Do not read "beside You," but "to swallow You." Not like the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood - his handiwork swallows him, but the Holy One, blessed be He - His handiwork swallows.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֵין צוּר כֵּאלֹהֵינוּ״, אֵין צַיָּיר כֵּאלֹהֵינוּ. אָדָם צָר צוּרָה עַל גַּבֵּי הַכּוֹתֶל וְאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהַטִּיל בָּהּ רוּחַ וּנְשָׁמָה, קְרָבַיִם וּבְנֵי מֵעַיִם. אֲבָל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא צָר צוּרָה בְּתוֹךְ צוּרָה, וּמֵטִיל בָּהּ רוּחַ וּנְשָׁמָה, קְרָבַיִם וּבְנֵי מֵעַיִם.
human_translation: “Neither is there any rock [ tzur ] like our God” there is no artist [ tzayyar ] like our God. Man fashions a form upon a wall, but is unable to endow it with breath and a soul, innards and intestines, whereas the Holy One, Blessed be He, fashions a form inside the form and endows it with breath and a soul innards and intestines.
llm_translation: "And there is no rock like our God," there is no artist like our God. A person forms a shape on the wall and cannot breathe into it spirit and soul, intestines and bowels. But the Holy One, blessed be He, forms a shape within a shape, and breathes into it spirit and soul, intestines and bowels.

hebrew_text: אֲבִיגַיִל, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה הִיא רוֹכֶבֶת עַל הַחֲמוֹר וְיוֹרֶדֶת בְּסֵתֶר הָהָר״. ״בְּסֵתֶר הָהָר״? ״מִן הָהָר״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Abigail as it is written: “And it was so, as she rode on the donkey, and came down by the covert of the mountain” “By the covert [ beseter ] of the mountain”? It should have said: From the mountain.
llm_translation: Abigail, as it is written: "And she was riding on the donkey and coming down by the hidden part of the mountain." "By the hidden part of the mountain"? "From the mountain" is what it requires!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: עַל עִסְקֵי דָם הַבָּא מִן הַסְּתָרִים. נָטְלָה דָּם וְהֶרְאֲתָה לוֹ. אָמַר לָהּ: וְכִי מַרְאִין דָּם בַּלַּיְלָה? אָמְרָה לוֹ: וְכִי דָּנִין דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת בַּלַּיְלָה? אָמַר לָהּ:
human_translation: Rabba bar Shmuel said: Abigail, on account of blood that comes from the hidden parts [ setarim ] She took and showed it to him, He said to her: Is blood shown at night? She said to him: Are capital law tried at night? said to her:
llm_translation: Rabba bar Shmuel said: Regarding matters of blood that come from hidden places. She took the blood and showed it to him. He said to her: Do we inspect blood at night? She said to him: Do we judge matters of life at night? He said to her:

hebrew_text: מוֹרֵד בַּמַּלְכוּת הוּא, וְלָא צְרִיךְ לְמֵידַּיְינֵיהּ. אָמְרָה לוֹ: עֲדַיִין שָׁאוּל קַיָּים וְלֹא יָצָא טִבְעֲךָ בָּעוֹלָם. אָמַר לָהּ: ״בָּרוּךְ טַעְמֵךְ וּבְרוּכָה אָתְּ אֲשֶׁר כְּלִיתִנִי [הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה] מִבֹּא בְדָמִים״.
human_translation: is a rebel against the throne, And there is no need to try him, said to him: Saul is still alive. your seal [ tivakha ] has not spread across the world, said to her: blessed be your discretion and blessed be you who have kept me this day from coming to bloodguiltiness [ damim ]”
llm_translation: He is a rebel against the kingdom, and does not need my teachings. She said to him: "Saul is still alive, and your destiny has not yet come into the world." He said to her: "Blessed is your reasoning, and blessed are you for sparing me today from coming with blood."

hebrew_text: ״דָּמִים״ — תַּרְתֵּי מַשְׁמַע! אֶלָּא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁגִּילְּתָה אֶת שׁוֹקָהּ וְהָלַךְ לְאוֹרָהּ שָׁלֹשׁ פַּרְסָאוֹת, אָמַר לַהּ: הִשָּׁמְעִי לִי! אָמְרָה לוֹ: ״לֹא תִהְיֶה זֹאת לְךָ לְפוּקָה״. ״זֹאת״ — מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא אַחֲרִיתִי, וּמַאי נִיהוּ? מַעֲשֶׂה דְּבַת שֶׁבַע. וּמַסְּקָנָא הָכִי הֲוַאי.
human_translation: damim , indicates two. Rather, this teaches that revealed her thigh, and he went three parasangs by the fire said to her: Listen to me, said to him: “Let this not be a stumbling block for you” By inference, “this,” there is someone else and what is The incident involving Bathsheba. And in the end this is what was,
llm_translation: "DAMIM" - Tartei mashma! Ela melamed shegilata et shokaha vehalach leoraha shalosh parsaiot, amar la: hishma'i li! Amarah lo: "Lo tiheyeh zot lekha lefuka." "Zot" - mikelal de'ikka achariti, umai nihu? Ma'aseh de'vat sheva. Umasikna hachi hava'i.

hebrew_text: ״וְהָיְתָה נֶפֶשׁ אֲדוֹנִי צְרוּרָה בִּצְרוֹר הַחַיִּים״, כִּי הֲווֹת מִיפַּטְרָא מִינֵּיהּ אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: ״וְהֵטִיב ה׳ לַאדוֹנִי וְזָכַרְתָּ אֶת אֲמָתֶךָ״.
human_translation: “Yet the soul of my lord shall be bound in the bond of life when she parted from him she said to him: “And when the Lord shall have dealt well with my lord, and you shall remember your handmaid”
llm_translation: "And the soul of my lord shall be bound in the bundle of life," for when it was about to depart from him, it said to him: "And may the Lord do good to my lord, and you shall remember your maidservant."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אִיתְּתָא בַּהֲדֵי שׁוּתָא פִּילְכָּא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: שָׁפֵיל וְאָזֵיל בַּר אֲווֹזָא וְעֵינוֹהִי מִיטַּיְיפִי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said this that people say: While a woman is engaged in conversation the spindle, Some say The goose stoops as it goes but its eyes look on from afar
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, this is what people say: "A woman with a pitcher of vinegar." Some say: "She is lowly and goes to the son of Avuza, and her eyes are raised."

hebrew_text: חוּלְדָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּלֶךְ חִלְקִיָּהוּ הַכֹּהֵן וַאֲחִיקָם וְעַכְבּוֹר וְגוֹ׳״. וּבְמָקוֹם דְּקָאֵי יִרְמְיָה הֵיכִי מִתְנַבְּיָא אִיהִי? אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: חוּלְדָּה קְרוֹבַת יִרְמְיָה הָיְתָה, וְלֹא הֲוָה מַקְפִּיד עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Huldah as it is written: “So Hilkiah the priest and Ahikam and Achbor But if Jeremiah was found there, how could she prophesy? the school of Rav say in the name of Rav: Huldah was a relative of Jeremiah, and he did not object to her
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Chuldah, dikhtiv: "vayelekh Chilkiyahu hakohen va'achikam ve'achbor ve'go." uve'makom de'kaei Yirmeyah heichi mitnabeya ihi? amri bei Rav mi'shmeih de'Rav: Chuldah k'rovat Yirmeyah haytah, velo havah makpid aleiha. English translation: Chuldah, as it is written: "And Chilkiyahu the priest, and Achikam, and Achbor, etc." And in the place where Jeremiah was standing, how did prophecy come to her? The House of Rav said in the name of Rav: Chuldah was a relative of Jeremiah, and he did not object to her.

hebrew_text: וְיֹאשִׁיָּה גּוּפֵיהּ הֵיכִי שָׁבֵיק יִרְמְיָה וּמְשַׁדַּר לְגַבַּהּ? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַנָּשִׁים רַחֲמָנִיּוֹת הֵן.
human_translation: But how could Josiah himself ignore Jeremiah and send to the school of Rabbi Sheila say: Because women are compassionate,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And how did Josiah remove Jeremiah's body and send it up? The school of Rabbi Sheila said: Because women are compassionate.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: יִרְמְיָה לָא הֲוָה הָתָם, שֶׁהָלַךְ לְהַחֲזִיר עֲשֶׂרֶת הַשְּׁבָטִים. וּמְנָלַן דְּאִהֲדוּר? דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי הַמּוֹכֵר אֶל הַמִּמְכָּר לֹא יָשׁוּב״, אֶפְשָׁר יוֹבֵל בָּטֵל, וְנָבִיא מִתְנַבֵּא עָלָיו שֶׁיִּבָּטֵל? אֶלָּא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיִּרְמְיָה הֶחְזִירָן,
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said Jeremiah was not there he went to bring back the ten tribes And from where do we derive that he brought them back? As it is written: “For the seller shall not return to that which he has sold” is it possible that the Jubilee had annulled? but the prophet is prophesying that it will cease Rather, this teaches that Jeremiah brought back
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Jeremiah was not there, to go and return the ten tribes. And from where do we know that he will return them? As it is written: "For the seller shall not return to that which is sold," is it possible that the Jubilee will be annulled, and a prophet prophesies that it will be annulled? Rather, it teaches that Jeremiah will return them.

hebrew_text: וְיֹאשִׁיָּהוּ בֶּן אָמוֹן מָלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר מָה הַצִּיּוּן הַלָּז אֲשֶׁר אֲנִי רוֹאֶה וַיֹּאמְרוּ אֵלָיו אַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר הַקֶּבֶר אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים אֲשֶׁר בָּא מִיהוּדָה וַיִּקְרָא אֶת הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה אֲשֶׁר עָשִׂיתָ עַל הַמִּזְבַּח בְּבֵית אֵל״, וְכִי מָה טִיבוֹ שֶׁל יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ בְּבֵית אֵל? אֶלָּא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיֹּאשִׁיָּהוּ מָלַךְ עֲלֵיהֶן. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״גַּם יְהוּדָה שָׁת קָצִיר לָךְ בְּשׁוּבִי שְׁבוּת עַמִּי״.
human_translation: And Josiah the son of Amon ruled over the as it is written: “Then he said: What monument is that which I see? And the men of the city told him, It is the tomb of the man of God who came from Judah and proclaimed these things that you have done against the altar of Bethel” Now what connection did Josiah, have with the altar at Bethel, Rather, this teaches that Josiah ruled over the Rav Naḥman said: from here: “Also, O Judah, there is a harvest appointed for you, when I would return the captivity of My people”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And Josiah son of Ammon reigned over them, as it is written: 'And he said, 'What is this monument that I see?' And the men of the city said to him, 'It is the tomb of the man of God who came from Judah and proclaimed these things that you have done against the altar at Bethel.' And what was the merit of Josiah regarding the altar at Bethel? Rather, it teaches that Josiah reigned over them. Rav Nahman said, from here: 'Even Judah shall reap for you when you return the captivity of my people.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: אֶסְתֵּר — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי וַתִּלְבַּשׁ אֶסְתֵּר מַלְכוּת״, בִּגְדֵי מַלְכוּת מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא שֶׁלְּבָשַׁתָּה רוּחַ הַקֹּדֶשׁ, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וַתִּלְבַּשׁ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְרוּחַ לָבְשָׁה אֶת עֲמָשַׂי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Esther as it is written: “And it came to pass on the third day that Esther clothed herself in royalty” It should have said: royal garments. Rather, that she clothed herself with a divine inspiration. It is written here: “And she clothed herself,” and it is written elsewhere: “And the spirit clothed Amasai”
llm_translation: Esther — as it is written: "And it was on the third day, and Esther put on royalty," does royalty garments come to her! Rather, she clothed herself with the Holy Spirit, as it is written here: "And she put on," and it is written there: "And the spirit clothed Amasai, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לָא יָאָה יְהִירוּתָא לִנְשֵׁי. תַּרְתֵּי נְשֵׁי יְהִירָן הָוְיָין, וְסַנְיִין שְׁמַיְיהוּ: חֲדָא שְׁמַהּ זִיבּוּרְתָּא, וַחֲדָא שְׁמָהּ כַּרְכּוּשְׁתָּא. זִיבּוּרְתָּא כְּתִיב בַּהּ: ״וַתִּשְׁלַח וַתִּקְרָא לְבָרָק״, וְאִילּוּ אִיהִי לָא אֲזַלָה לְגַבֵּיהּ. כַּרְכּוּשְׁתָּא כְּתִיב בַּהּ: ״אִמְרוּ לָאִישׁ״, וְלָא אָמְרָה ״אִמְרוּ לַמֶּלֶךְ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Haughtiness is not befitting a woman. there were two haughty women, whose names were loathsome One, was called a hornet, and one, was called a marten, With regard to the hornet, it is written: “And she sent and called Barak” but she herself did not go to him. with regard to the marten, it is written: “Say to the man but she did not say: Say to the king.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Arrogance is not fitting for women. There were two arrogant women, and they were called by names: one was called Zibburta, and the other was called Karkushta. Zibburta is written about her: "She sent and summoned Barak," but she did not go to him. Karkushta is written about her: "Say to the man," but she did not say "Say to the king."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: חוּלְדָּה מִבְּנֵי בָנָיו שֶׁל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הָיְתָה — כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״בֶּן חַרְחַס״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״בְּתִמְנַת חֶרֶס״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Huldah was a descendant of Joshua. is written here: the son of Harhas [ ḥarḥas ]” and it says elsewhere in Timnath-heres [ ḥeres ]”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Chuldah, from the descendants of the sons of Yehoshua, was - it is written here: "Ben Charhas," and it is written there: "Betimnat Cheres."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב עֵינָא סָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: שְׁמוֹנָה נְבִיאִים וְהֵם כֹּהֲנִים יָצְאוּ מֵרָחָב הַזּוֹנָה, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: נֵרִיָּה, בָּרוּךְ, וּשְׂרָיָה, מַחְסֵיָה, יִרְמְיָה, חִלְקִיָּה, חֲנַמְאֵל, וְשַׁלּוּם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף חוּלְדָּה הַנְּבִיאָה מִבְּנֵי בָנֶיהָ שֶׁל רָחָב הַזּוֹנָה הָיְתָה. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״בֶּן תִּקְוָה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״אֶת תִּקְוַת חוּט הַשָּׁנִי״.
human_translation: Rav Eina the Elder raised an objection to Rav Naḥman’s Eight prophets, who were priests, descended from Rahab the prostitute, and they are: Neriah; Baruch; Seraiah; Mahseiah; Jeremiah; Hilkiah; Hanamel; and Shallum. Rabbi Yehuda said: So too, Huldah the prophetess was a descendant of Rahab the prostitute, it is written here “The son of Tikvah,” and it is written elsewhere “This cord of [ tikvat ] scarlet thread”
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Rav Einah the Elder raised an objection to Rav Nachman: Eight prophets who were also priests emerged from the chamber of the harlot, and they are: Neriah, Baruch, Serayah, Maaseiah, Jeremiah, Hilkiah, Hanamel, and Shallum. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even Huldah the prophetess was from the descendants of the harlot. It is written here: "Ben Tikvah," and it is written there: "The second thread of hope."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עֵינָא סָבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: פַּתְיָא אוּכָּמָא, מִינִּי וּמִינָּךְ תִּסְתַּיֵּים שְׁמַעְתָּא: דְּאִיגַּיַּירָא וְנַסְבַהּ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. וּמִי הֲווֹ לֵיהּ זַרְעָא לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״נוֹן בְּנוֹ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּנוֹ״! בְּנֵי לָא הֲווֹ לֵיהּ, בְּנָתָא הֲווֹ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: Eina the Elder, and some say Blackened pot, from me and from you the matter may be concluded, For converted and married Joshua, But did Joshua have any descendants? But isn’t it written “Nun his son, Joshua his son” he did not have sons, he did have daughters.
llm_translation: He said to him: "An old eye," and they said to him: "A simpleton and a fool, from me and from you the matter will be concluded. You have heard: that he feared and he served Joshua. But was there any offspring to Joshua? And it is written: 'Non his son, Joshua his son!' They were not his sons, they were his daughters.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא אִינְהוּ — מִיפָּרְשִׁי, אֶלָּא אֲבָהָתַיְיהוּ מְנָלַן?
human_translation: Granted, them, it is explicit, But as for their fathers, from where do we derive
llm_translation: In peace they are — they are separated, but from where do their fathers come?

hebrew_text: כִּדְעוּלָּא. דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁשְּׁמוֹ וְשֵׁם אָבִיו בִּנְבִיאוּת — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהוּא נָבִיא בֶּן נָבִיא. שְׁמוֹ וְלֹא שֵׁם אָבִיו — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהוּא נָבִיא וְלֹא בֶּן נָבִיא, שְׁמוֹ וְשֵׁם עִירוֹ מְפוֹרָשׁ — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהוּא מֵאוֹתָהּ הָעִיר, שְׁמוֹ וְלֹא שֵׁם עִירוֹ — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהוּא מִירוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: As Ulla, as Ulla said: Wherever one’s name and his father’s name with regard to prophecy, it is known that he was a prophet the son of a prophet, his name but not his father’s name, it is known that he was a prophet but not the son of a prophet. his name and the name of his city are specified, it is known that he was from that city, his name but not the name of his city, it is known that he was from Jerusalem.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Kid'ulah. D'amar Ulah: Kol makom she'shmo v'shem aviv binvi'uto - beyadua shehu navi ben navi. Shmo v'lo shem aviv - beyadua shehu navi v'lo ben navi, shmo v'shem iro m'forash - beyadua shehu me'otah ha'ir, shmo v'lo shem iro - beyadua shehu miYerushalayim. English translation: As Ulah said: In every place where his name and the name of his father are mentioned explicitly - it is known that he is a prophet, son of a prophet. His name and not his father's name - it is known that he is a prophet, but not a son of a prophet. His name and the name of his city are specified - it is known that he is from that city. His name and not the name of his city - it is known that he is from Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: כׇּל שֶׁמַּעֲשָׂיו וּמַעֲשֵׂה אֲבוֹתָיו סְתוּמִין, וּפָרַט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן לְשֶׁבַח, כְּגוֹן: ״דְּבַר ה׳ אֲשֶׁר הָיָה אֶל צְפַנְיָה בֶּן כּוּשִׁי בֶן גְּדַלְיָה״ — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהוּא צַדִּיק בֶּן צַדִּיק. וְכֹל שֶׁפָּרַט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן לִגְנַאי, כְּגוֹן: ״וַיְהִי בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי בָּא יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן נְתַנְיָה בֶּן אֱלִישָׁמָע״ — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהוּא רָשָׁע בֶּן רָשָׁע.
human_translation: It was taught in a baraita : anyone whose actions and the actions of his ancestors are obscured and the verse mentioned one of them favorably, for example, “The word of the Lord which came to Zephaniah the son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah” it is known that was he a righteous man, the son of a righteous man. And whenever the verse mentioned one of them unfavorably, for example, “And it came to pass in the seventh month that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama” it is known that was he a wicked man, the son of a wicked man.
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: Anyone whose actions and the actions of his ancestors are sealed, and the Scripture singled out one of them for praise, such as: "The word of the Lord that came to Zephaniah son of Cushi son of Gedaliah" — it is known that he is a righteous son of a righteous ancestor. And anyone whom the Scripture singled out for disgrace, such as: "In the seventh month, Ishmael son of Nethaniah son of Elishama came" — it is known that he is a wicked son of a wicked ancestor.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַלְאָכִי — זֶה מָרְדֳּכַי, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ מַלְאָכִי? שֶׁהָיָה מִשְׁנֶה לַמֶּלֶךְ. מֵיתִיבִי: בָּרוּךְ בֶּן נֵרִיָּה וּשְׂרָיָה בֶּן מַעֲשֵׂיָה, וְדָנִיֵּאל וּמׇרְדֳּכַי בִּלְשָׁן וְחַגַּי, זְכַרְיָה וּמַלְאָכִי — כּוּלָּן נִתְנַבְּאוּ בִּשְׁנַת שְׁתַּיִם לְדָרְיָוֶשׁ. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Malachi is Mordecai, and why was he called Malachi? that he was second to the king [ melekh ], raises an objection Baruch, the son of Neriah; Seraiah, the son of Mahseiah; Daniel; Mordecai; Bilshan; Haggai; Zechariah; and Malachi; all prophesied in the second year of Darius. a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Malachi - this is Mordechai, and why is his name called Malachi? Because he was a messenger to the king. It was raised: Baruch son of Neriyah and Serayah son of Maaseiah, and Daniel and Mordechai in Lashon and Chaggai, Zechariah and Malachi - all prophesied in the second year of Darius. Good.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה: מַלְאָכִי זֶה עֶזְרָא, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מַלְאָכִי שְׁמוֹ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר מַלְאָכִי זֶה עֶזְרָא, דִּכְתִיב בִּנְבִיאוּת מַלְאָכִי: ״בָּגְדָה יְהוּדָה וְתוֹעֵבָה נֶעֶשְׂתָה בְיִשְׂרָאֵל וּבִירוּשָׁלִָם כִּי חִלֵּל יְהוּדָה קֹדֶשׁ ה׳ אֲשֶׁר אָהֵב וּבָעַל בַּת אֵל נֵכָר״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa said: Malachi is Ezra. And the Rabbis say Malachi was his name, Rav Naḥman said: stands to reason like the one who said that Malachi is Ezra, as it is stated in Malachi’s prophecy: “Judah has dealt treacherously, and a disgusting thing has been done in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah has profaned the sanctity of the Lord which he loved, and has married the daughter of a strange god”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said: This angel is Ezra, and the sages say: His name is Malachi. Rav Nachman said: It makes sense like the one who said this angel is Ezra, as it is written in the prophecy of Malachi: "Judah has dealt treacherously, and an abomination has been committed in Israel and in Jerusalem, for Judah has profaned the holy place of the Lord which He loves, and has married the daughter of a foreign god."

hebrew_text: וּמַאן אַפְרֵישׁ נָשִׁים גּוֹיוֹת — עֶזְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַן שְׁכַנְיָה בֶן יְחִיאֵל מִבְּנֵי עֵילָם וַיֹּאמֶר לְעֶזְרָא אֲנַחְנוּ מָעַלְנוּ בֵאלֹהֵינוּ וַנּוֹשֶׁב נָשִׁים נׇכְרִיּוֹת״.
human_translation: And who removed the foreign women Ezra, as it is written: “And Shecaniah the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, answered and said unto Ezra: We have broken faith with our God, and have married foreign women
llm_translation: And who separated foreign women? - Ezra, as it is written: "And Shecaniah the son of Jehiel, of the sons of Elam, answered and said to Ezra, 'We have trespassed against our God, and have taken foreign wives.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַרְבַּע נָשִׁים יְפֵיפִיּוֹת הָיוּ בָּעוֹלָם: שָׂרָה (וַאֲבִיגַיִל, רָחָב) וְאֶסְתֵּר, וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֶסְתֵּר יְרַקְרוֹקֶת הָיְתָה — מַפֵּיק אֶסְתֵּר וּמְעַיֵּיל וַשְׁתִּי.
human_translation: the Sages taught: There were four women of extraordinary beauty in the world: Sarah, and Abigail, Rahab, and Esther. And according to the one who said Esther was greenish remove Esther and insert Vashti
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There were four beautiful women in the world: Sarah, (and Abigail, Rahab,) and Esther. And for one who says Esther was like a green myrtle — Esther adorned herself and went in and drank.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רָחָב בִּשְׁמָהּ זִינְּתָה, יָעֵל — בְּקוֹלָהּ, אֲבִיגַיִל — בִּזְכִירָתָהּ, מִיכַל בַּת שָׁאוּל — בִּרְאִיָּיתָהּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר ״רָחָב״ ״רָחָב״ — מִיָּד נִיקְרֵי. אָמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: אֲנָא אָמֵינָא ״רָחָב״ ״רָחָב״ וְלָא אִיכְפַּת לִי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי קָאָמֵינָא בְּיוֹדְעָהּ וּבְמַכִּירָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught Rahab aroused impure thoughts by her name, Yael, by her voice; Abigail, by remembering her; Michal, the daughter of Saul, by her appearance. Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Anyone who says Rahab, Rahab, immediately experiences a seminal emission Rav Naḥman said to him: I say: Rahab, Rahab, and it does not affect me. said to When I said this, to one who knows her and recognizes her
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If she is broad in her name, she is lascivious; if she is loud in her voice, she is Yael; if she is remembered, she is Avigayil; if she is the daughter of Shaul, she is beautiful. Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who says "broad, broad" is immediately torn. Rav Nachman said to him: I say "broad, broad" and it does not bother me! He said to him: Because I am speaking based on knowing and recognizing her.

hebrew_text: ״וּמׇרְדֳּכַי יָדַע אֶת כׇּל אֲשֶׁר נַעֲשָׂה״. מַאי אָמַר? רַב אָמַר: גָּבַהּ הָמָן מֵאֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: גְּבַר מַלְכָּא עִילָּאָה מִמַּלְכָּא תַּתָּאָה.
