human_translation: “When Mordecai perceived all that was done, What did say Rav said: Haman has risen above Ahasuerus, And Shmuel said: The upper King has prevailed over the lower king,
llm_translation: "And Mordecai knew all that was done." What did he say? Rav said: Haman was higher than Achashverosh, and Shmuel said: A king's greatness is higher than a lower king's greatness."

hebrew_text: ״וַתִּתְחַלְחַל הַמַּלְכָּה״. מַאי ״וַתִּתְחַלְחַל״? אָמַר רַב: שֶׁפֵּירְסָה נִדָּה, וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר: שֶׁהוּצְרְכָה לִנְקָבֶיהָ.
human_translation: “Then the queen was exceedingly distressed” [ vatitḥalḥal ] What is vatitḥalḥal ? Rav said: that she began to menstruate And Rabbi Yirmeya said: Her bowels were loosened,
llm_translation: "And the queen became agitated." What is "became agitated"? Rav said: she saw a menstrual discharge, and Rabbi Yirmeya said: she needed to defecate.

hebrew_text: ״וַתִּקְרָא אֶסְתֵּר לַהֲתָךְ״, אָמַר רַב: הֲתָךְ זֶה דָּנִיאֵל, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ הֲתָךְ — שֶׁחֲתָכוּהוּ מִגְּדוּלָּתוֹ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שֶׁכׇּל דִּבְרֵי מַלְכוּת נֶחְתָּכִין עַל פִּיו.
human_translation: “Then Esther called for Hathach, Rav said: Hathach is Daniel. And why was he called Hathach? Because he was cut down [ ḥatakh ] from his greatness And Shmuel said: because all the affairs of the kingdom were decided [ neḥtakhin ] by his word.
llm_translation: "And Esther called Hathach," Rav said: Hathach is Daniel, and why was his name called Hathach? Because they cut him from his greatness. And Samuel said: For all matters of the kingdom were decided by him."

hebrew_text: ״לָדַעַת מַה זֶּה וְעַל מַה זֶּה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, שָׁלְחָה לוֹ: שֶׁמָּא עָבְרוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל חֲמִשָּׁה חוּמְשֵׁי תוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב בָּהֶן: ״מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה הֵם כְּתוּבִים״.
human_translation: “To know what this [ zeh ] was, and why it [ zeh ] was” Rabbi Yitzḥak said sent to Perhaps the Jews have transgressed the five books of the Torah, as it is written “On this [ zeh ] side and on the other [ zeh ] side were they written”
llm_translation: "To know what this and on what this." Rabbi Yitzchak said, she sent to him: perhaps the Israelites transgressed on five fifths of the Torah, as it is written in them: 'From this and from this they are written.'"

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּגִּידוּ לְמׇרְדֳּכָי אֵת דִּבְרֵי אֶסְתֵּר״, וְאִילּוּ אִיהוּ לָא אֲזַל לְגַבֵּיהּ. מִכָּאן שֶׁאֵין מְשִׁיבִין עַל הַקַּלְקָלָה.
human_translation: “And they told Esther’s words to Mordecai” but he, did not go to him From here one does not bring back a sad report.
llm_translation: "They told Mordecai the words of Esther," but he did not go to meet her. From here we learn that one does not respond to a disgrace.

hebrew_text: ״לֵךְ כְּנוֹס אֶת כׇּל הַיְּהוּדִים״ וְגוֹ׳ עַד ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא כַדָּת״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: שֶׁלֹּא כַּדָּת הָיָה, שֶׁבְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם עַד עַכְשָׁיו — בְּאוֹנֶס, וְעַכְשָׁיו — בְּרָצוֹן. ״וְכַאֲשֶׁר אָבַדְתִּי אָבָדְתִּי״ — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאָבַדְתִּי מִבֵּית אַבָּא, כָּךְ אוֹבַד מִמְּךָ.
human_translation: “Go, gather together all the Jews not according to the custom” Rabbi Abba said: It will not be according to custom, for every day until now under compulsion, but now of my will. “And if I perish, I perish” Just as I was lost to my father’s house so too, shall I be lost to you,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Go, gather all the Jews" etc. until "that is not according to the law," Rabbi Abba said: It was not according to the law, that every day until now - by force, and now - willingly. "And when I perish, I perish" - just as I perished from my father's house, so will I perish from you.

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּעֲבוֹר מָרְדֳּכָי״. אָמַר רַב: שֶׁהֶעֱבִיר יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל פֶּסַח בְּתַעֲנִית. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: דַּעֲבַר עַרְקוּמָא דְמַיָּא.
human_translation: “So Mordecai passed [ vaya’avor ]” Rav said: that he passed the first day of Passover as a fast day, And Shmuel said: that he crossed over [ avar ] a stream
llm_translation: "And Mordecai passed over." Rav said: that he passed over the first day of Passover with fasting. And Shmuel said: that he passed over the roof of the water.

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי וַתִּלְבַּשׁ אֶסְתֵּר מַלְכוּת״. ״בִּגְדֵי מַלְכוּת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁלְּבָשַׁתָּה רוּחַ הַקֹּדֶשׁ. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וַתִּלְבַּשׁ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְרוּחַ לָבְשָׁה אֶת עֲמָשַׂי״.
human_translation: “And it came to pass on the third day, that Esther clothed herself in royalty” It should have said: royal garments. Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: This teaches that she clothed herself with divine inspiration, it is written here: “And she clothed herself,” and it is written elsewhere: “And the spirit clothed Amasai”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was on the third day, and Esther put on royalty." "Royalty garments" - does it need it? Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Hanina: It teaches that she clothed herself with the Holy Spirit. It is written here: "And she put on," and it is written there: "And the spirit clothed Amasai."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לְעוֹלָם אַל תְּהִי בִּרְכַּת הֶדְיוֹט קַלָּה בְּעֵינֶיךָ, שֶׁהֲרֵי שְׁנֵי גְּדוֹלֵי הַדּוֹר בֵּרְכוּם שְׁנֵי הֶדְיוֹטוֹת, וְנִתְקַיְּימָה בָּהֶן, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: דָּוִד וְדָנִיֵּאל. דָּוִד — דְּבָרְכֵיהּ אֲרַוְנָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֲרַוְנָה אֶל הַמֶּלֶךְ וְגוֹ׳״. דָּנִיאֵל — דְּבָרְכֵיהּ דָּרְיָוֶשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֱלָהָךְ דִּי אַנְתְּ פָּלַח לֵיהּ בִּתְדִירָא הוּא יְשֵׁיזְבִינָּךְ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: One should never regard the blessing of an ordinary person [ hedyot ] as light in your eyes, as two great men of generations received blessings from ordinary people and were fulfilled in them. And they were David and Daniel. David, for Araunah blessed him, as it is written: “And Araunah said to the king, Daniel, for Darius blessed him, as it is written: “Your God Whom you serve continually, He will rescue you” (
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said: Always let not the blessing of a commoner be light in your eyes, for behold, two great men of the generation blessed two commoners, and it was fulfilled in them, and they are: David and Daniel. David - his blessing was Araunah, as it is written: "And Araunah said to the king, etc." Daniel - his blessing was Darius, as it is written: "Your God whom you serve continually, He will deliver you."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אֵל תְּהִי קִלְלַת הֶדְיוֹט קַלָּה בְּעֵינֶיךָ, שֶׁהֲרֵי אֲבִימֶלֶךְ קִלֵּל אֶת שָׂרָה ״הִנֵּה הוּא לָךְ כְּסוּת עֵינַיִם״, וְנִתְקַיֵּים בְּזַרְעָהּ: ״וַיְהִי כִּי זָקֵן יִצְחָק וַתִּכְהֶיןָ עֵינָיו״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: One should not regard the curse of an ordinary person as light in your eyes, for Abimelech cursed Sarah, “Behold, it is to you a covering of the eyes and this was fulfilled in her descendant, “And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said: Do not take the curse of a commoner lightly in your eyes, for Abimelech cursed Sarah, "Behold, he is to you a covering of the eyes," and it was fulfilled in her offspring: "And it came to pass, when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בֹּא וּרְאֵה שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וְדָם. מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם — אָדָם שׁוֹפֵת קְדֵרָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹתֵן לְתוֹכָהּ מַיִם, אֲבָל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — נוֹתֵן מַיִם וְאַחַר כָּךְ שׁוֹפֵת הַקְּדֵרָה, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְקוֹל תִּתּוֹ הֲמוֹן מַיִם בַּשָּׁמַיִם״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: Come and see that the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He, is unlike the attribute of flesh and blood; for the attribute of flesh and blood a man places the pot on the fire and then puts in the water. However, the Holy One, Blessed be He, puts in the water and then places the pot on the fire, to fulfill that which is stated: “At the sound of His giving a multitude of waters in the heavens”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said: Come and see that the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood - a person first heats the pot and then puts water into it, but the Holy One, blessed be He - puts water first and then heats the pot, in order to fulfill what is said: "At the sound of a multitude of water in the heavens."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר דָּבָר בְּשֵׁם אוֹמְרוֹ מֵבִיא גְּאוּלָּה לָעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתֹּאמֶר אֶסְתֵּר לַמֶּלֶךְ בְּשֵׁם מׇרְדֳּכָי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: Whoever reports a saying in the name of he who said it brings redemption to the world. As it is stated “And Esther reported it to the king in the name of Mordecai”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Chanina: Anyone who says something in the name of the one who said it brings redemption to the world, as it is said: "And Esther said to the king in the name of Mordecai."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: צַדִּיק אָבָד — לְדוֹרוֹ אָבַד. מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁאָבְדָה לוֹ מַרְגָּלִית, כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהִיא — מַרְגָּלִית שְׁמָהּ, לֹא אָבְדָה אֶלָּא לְבַעְלָהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: a righteous man lost, is lost for his generation, similar to a man who has lost a pearl. wherever it is it is a pearl; it is lost only to its owner.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said: A righteous person who is lost — is lost to his generation. A parable to a person who lost a coin, wherever it is — its name is "coin," it is not lost except to its owner.

hebrew_text: ״וְכׇל זֶה אֵינֶנּוּ שֹׁוֶה לִי״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁרָאָה הָמָן אֶת מׇרְדֳּכַי יוֹשֵׁב בְּשַׁעַר הַמֶּלֶךְ, אָמַר: ״כׇּל זֶה אֵינוֹ שֹׁוֶה לִי״. כִּדְרַב חִסְדָּא, דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זֶה בָּא בִּפְרוֹזְבּוּלֵי וְזֶה בָּא
human_translation: “Yet all this avails me nothing” Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: When Haman saw Mordecai sitting at the king’s gate he said: Yet all this avails me nothing. as by Rav Ḥisda, for Rav Ḥisda said: This one, came as a rich man [ perozebuli ], that one, came
llm_translation: "And all this is not worth to me." Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Chanina: When Haman saw Mordecai sitting at the king's gate, he said, "All this is not worth to me." As Rav Chisda said: This one came with his breaches and this one came.

hebrew_text: בִּפְרוֹזְבּוּטֵי. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וְקָרוּ לֵיהּ עַבְדָּא דְּמִזְדַּבַּן בְּטֻלְמֵי.
human_translation: as a poor man [ perozeboti ], Rav Pappa said: And he was called: The slave who was sold for bread.
llm_translation: In the marketplace. Rav Papa said: And they will call him the servant of those who engage in idle chatter.

hebrew_text: ״וְכׇל זֶה אֵינֶנּוּ שֹׁוֶה לִי״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל גְּנָזָיו שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע חֲקוּקִין עַל לִבּוֹ, וּבְשָׁעָה שֶׁרוֹאֶה אֶת מׇרְדֳּכַי יוֹשֵׁב בְּשַׁעַר הַמֶּלֶךְ, אָמַר: כׇּל זֶה אֵינֶנּוּ שֹׁוֶה לִי.
human_translation: “Yet all this avails me nothing” teaches that all the treasures of that wicked one were engraved on his heart, and when he saw Mordecai sitting at the king’s gate, he said: all this avails me nothing.
llm_translation: "And all this is of no avail to me" - teaches that all the treasuries of that wicked one are engraved on his heart, and at the moment he saw Mordecai sitting at the king's gate, he said: "All this is of no avail to me."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: עָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִהְיוֹת עֲטָרָה בְּרֹאשׁ כׇּל צַדִּיק וְצַדִּיק, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִהְיֶה ה׳ צְבָאוֹת לַעֲטֶרֶת צְבִי [וְגוֹ׳]״. מַאי ״לַעֲטֶרֶת צְבִי וְלִצְפִירַת תִּפְאָרָה״ — לָעוֹשִׂין צִבְיוֹנוֹ וְלַמְצַפִּין תִּפְאַרְתּוֹ. יָכוֹל לַכֹּל — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לִשְׁאָר עַמּוֹ״, לְמִי שֶׁמֵּשִׂים עַצְמוֹ כְּשִׁירַיִם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: In the future, the Holy One, Blessed be He, will be a crown on the head of each and every righteous man. As it is stated: “In that day shall the Lord of hosts be for a crown of glory, What is “for a crown of glory [ tzevi ], and for a diadem [ velitzefirat ] of beauty”? for those that do His will [ tzivyono ] and for those that await [ velamtzapin ] His glory. might to all the verse states: “To the residue of his people,” to whoever regards himself as a remainder,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Chanina said: The Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to be a crown on the head of every righteous person, as it is stated: "In that day shall the Lord of hosts be for a crown of glory and so forth." What is meant by "a crown of glory and a diadem of beauty"? — To those who make His glory and to those who make His beauty. Could this apply to everyone? The verse teaches: "For the residue of His people," to those who make themselves like princes.

hebrew_text: ״וּלְרוּחַ מִשְׁפָּט״ — זֶה הַדָּן אֶת יִצְרוֹ. ״וְלַיּוֹשֵׁב עַל הַמִּשְׁפָּט״ — זֶה הַדָּן דִּין אֱמֶת לַאֲמִתּוֹ. ״וְלִגְבוּרָה״ — זֶה הַמִּתְגַּבֵּר עַל יִצְרוֹ. ״מְשִׁיבֵי מִלְחָמָה״ — שֶׁנּוֹשְׂאִין וְנוֹתְנִין בְּמִלְחַמְתָּהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה. ״שָׁעְרָה״ — [אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים] שֶׁמַּשְׁכִּימִין וּמַעֲרִיבִין בְּבָתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבְבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת.
human_translation: “And for a spirit of justice”; this one who brings his inclination to trial “To him that sits in judgment”; this one who judges an absolutely true judgment. “And for strength”; this one who triumphs over his inclination. “Them that turn back the battle”; that give and take in the battle of the Torah. “To the gate”; the Torah scholars who arrive early and stay late of the synagogues and study halls.
llm_translation: "and for the spirit of judgment" — this refers to one who judges his inclination. "and for those who sit at the judgment" — this refers to one who judges true judgment to its truth. "and for strength" — this refers to one who overcomes his inclination. "those who return from war" — those who engage in and involve themselves in the war of Torah. "her gates" — these are the Torah scholars who rise early and stay late in the synagogues and study halls.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה מִדַּת הַדִּין לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, מָה נִשְׁתַּנּוּ אֵלּוּ מֵאֵלּוּ? אָמַר לָהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: יִשְׂרָאֵל עָסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה, אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם לֹא עָסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: The Attribute of Justice said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, how are these, different from those, The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to The Jewish people occupied themselves with Torah, the nations of the world did not occupy themselves with Torah.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates into English as follows: Said the attribute of justice before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the World, how do these differ from those? The Holy One, blessed be He, said to it: Israel engaged in the Torah, while the nations of the world did not engage in the Torah.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״גַּם אֵלֶּה בַּיַּיִן שָׁגוּ וּבַשֵּׁכָר תָּעוּ פָּקוּ פְּלִילִיָּה״, אֵין ״פָּקוּ״ אֶלָּא גֵּיהִנָּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא תִהְיֶה זֹאת לְךָ לְפוּקָה״, וְאֵין ״פְּלִילִיָּה״ אֶלָּא דַּיָּינִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָתַן בִּפְלִילִים״.
human_translation: said to Him: “These also reel through wine, and stagger through strong drink; they stumble [ paku ] in judgment [ peliliyya ]” paku only to Gehenna, as it is stated: “That this shall not be a cause of stumbling [ puka ] to you” and peliliyya only to judges, as it is stated: “And he shall pay as the judges determine [ bifelilim ]”
llm_translation: He said to him: "These also have erred through wine, and through strong drink have gone astray; the priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink, they are swallowed up of wine, they are gone astray through strong drink; they err in vision, they stumble in judgment." "Swallowed up" refers to Gehinnom, as it is said: "And this shall be unto you a fullness of scorn." And "wine" refers to judges, as it is said: "And He will give them up to the wine."

hebrew_text: ״וַתַּעֲמֹד בַּחֲצַר בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ הַפְּנִימִית״. אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעָה לְבֵית הַצְּלָמִים, נִסְתַּלְּקָה הֵימֶנָּה שְׁכִינָה. אָמְרָה: ״אֵלִי אֵלִי לָמָה עֲזַבְתָּנִי״?! שֶׁמָּא אַתָּה דָּן עַל שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד וְעַל אוֹנֶס כְּרָצוֹן?
human_translation: “And she stood in the inner court of the king’s house” Rabbi Levi said: Once she reached the chamber of the idols, the Divine Presence left her. She said: “My God, my God, why have You forsaken me?” Perhaps You judge an unintentional sin as one intentionally, and done due to beyond one’s control as willingly.
llm_translation: "And she stood in the courtyard of the king's inner house." Rabbi Levi said: Once she reached the idolatrous temple, the Divine Presence departed from her. She said: "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?!" Perhaps you judge unintentional sins as intentional, and violations as willful?

hebrew_text: אוֹ שֶׁמָּא עַל שֶׁקְּרָאתִיו ״כֶּלֶב״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַצִּילָה מֵחֶרֶב נַפְשִׁי מִיַּד כֶּלֶב יְחִידָתִי״. חָזְרָה וּקְרָאַתּוּ ״אַרְיֵה״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הוֹשִׁיעֵנִי מִפִּי אַרְיֵה״.
human_translation: Or perhaps because I called a dog, as it is stated: “Deliver my soul from the sword; my only one from the hand of the dog” She retracted and called him a lion, as it is stated “Save me from the lion’s mouth”
llm_translation: Or perhaps because it is written "like a dog," as it says: "Save my soul from the sword, my only one from the power of the dog." She returned and called him "lion," as it says: "Save me from the mouth of the lion."

hebrew_text: ״וַיְהִי כִרְאוֹת הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת אֶסְתֵּר הַמַּלְכָּה״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁלֹשָׁה מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת נִזְדַּמְּנוּ לָהּ בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה, אֶחָד שֶׁהִגְבִּיהַּ אֶת צַוָּארָהּ, וְאֶחָד שֶׁמָּשַׁךְ חוּט שֶׁל חֶסֶד עָלֶיהָ, וְאֶחָד שֶׁמָּתַח אֶת הַשַּׁרְבִיט.
human_translation: “And so it was, that when the king saw Esther the queen Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Three ministering angels happened to join her at that time: One that raised up her neck, one that strung a cord grace around her, and one that stretched the scepter.
llm_translation: "And it came to pass, when the king saw Queen Esther." Rabbi Yochanan said: Three ministering angels appeared to her at that moment, one who raised her neck, one who drew a thread of kindness upon her, and one who stretched out the scepter."

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת הָיָה, וְהֶעֱמִידוֹ עַל שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ עַל שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ עַל עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: עַל שִׁשִּׁים, וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּאַמָּתָהּ שֶׁל בַּת פַּרְעֹה, וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּשִׁינֵּי רְשָׁעִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁינֵּי רְשָׁעִים שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״שִׁבַּרְתָּ״ אֶלָּא ״שִׁרְיבַּבְתָּ״. רַבָּה בַּר עוֹפְרָן אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר שֶׁשָּׁמַע מֵרַבּוֹ וְרַבּוֹ מֵרַבּוֹ: מָאתַיִם.
human_translation: How much Rabbi Yirmeya said: was two cubits, and he made it twelve And some say sixteen and others say twenty-four It was taught in a baraita : sixty And similarly you find with the arm of Pharaoh’s daughter, And so too, you find with the teeth of the wicked, as it is written: “You have broken the teeth of the wicked” Reish Lakish said: Do not read “You have broken [ shibbarta ],” but You have enlarged [ sheribavta ]. Rabba bar Oferan said in the name of Rabbi Elazar, who heard it from his teacher, who from his teacher: two hundred
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much? Rabbi Yirmiyah said: It was two cubits, and they established it on twelve, and some say on sixteen, and some say on twenty-four. In the Mishnah it was taught: on sixty. And so you find in the cubit of the daughter of Pharaoh, and so you find in the teeth of the wicked, as it is written: 'You broke the teeth of the wicked.' And Reish Lakish said: Do not read 'You broke' but rather 'You shattered.' Rabba bar Ofra said in the name of Rabbi Elazar who heard it from his teacher and his teacher from his teacher: two hundred."

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לָהּ הַמֶּלֶךְ לְאֶסְתֵּר הַמַּלְכָּה מַה בַּקָּשָׁתֵךְ עַד חֲצִי הַמַּלְכוּת וְתֵעָשׂ״. חֲצִי הַמַּלְכוּת וְלֹא כׇּל הַמַּלְכוּת, וְלֹא דָּבָר שֶׁחוֹצֵץ לַמַּלְכוּת, וּמַאי נִיהוּ — בִּנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: “Then the king said to her” (Esther 5:3), to Esther the queen, “What is your wish, even to half the kingdom, it shall be performed” half the kingdom, but not the whole kingdom, and not something that would serve as a barrier to the kingdom, And what is that? The building of the Temple;
llm_translation: "And the king said to Esther the queen, 'What is your request until half the kingdom, and it shall be done.' Half the kingdom, and not the entire kingdom, and not something that infringes upon the kingdom. And what is it? — The building of the Temple."

hebrew_text: ״יָבֹא הַמֶּלֶךְ וְהָמָן אֶל הַמִּשְׁתֶּה״. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָה רָאֲתָה אֶסְתֵּר שֶׁזִּימְּנָה אֶת הָמָן? רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: פַּחִים טָמְנָה לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְהִי שֻׁלְחָנָם לִפְנֵיהֶם לְפָח״.
human_translation: let the king and Haman come this day to the banquet The Sages taught What did Esther see to invite Haman Rabbi Elazar says: She hid a snare for him, as it is stated: “Let their table become a snare before them”
llm_translation: "The king and Haman came to the feast." The Rabbis taught: What did Esther see that she invited Haman? Rabbi Elazar says: She prepared snares for him, as it is said: "Let their table be a snare before them."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מִבֵּית אָבִיהָ לָמְדָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם רָעֵב שׂוֹנַאֲךָ הַאֲכִילֵהוּ לֶחֶם וְגוֹ׳״. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִטּוֹל עֵצָה וְיִמְרוֹד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: She learned this from her father’s house, as it is stated: “If your enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat” Rabbi Meir says: in order so that he would not take counsel and rebel
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: From her father's house she learned, as it is said: "If your enemy is hungry, feed him bread, etc." Rabbi Meir says: So that he will not take advice and rebel.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יַכִּירוּ בָּהּ שֶׁהִיא יְהוּדִית. רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל: אָחוֹת יֵשׁ לָנוּ בְּבֵית הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְיַסִּיחוּ דַּעְתָּן מִן הָרַחֲמִים. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא מָצוּי לָהּ בְּכׇל עֵת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר: אוּלַי יַרְגִּישׁ הַמָּקוֹם וְיַעֲשֶׂה לָנוּ נֵס.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: so that it not be found out that she was a Jew, Rabbi Neḥemya says: so that the Jewish people would not say: We have a sister in the king’s house, and neglect their mercy. Rabbi Yosei says: so that always be on hand for her, Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya said Perhaps the Omnipresent will take notice and He will perform for us a miracle.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: In order that they should not recognize in her that she is Jewish. Rabbi Nechemiah says: In order that the Israelites should not say, "We have a sister in the king's house," and divert their minds from mercy. Rabbi Yosei says: In order that she should be available to him at all times. Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: Perhaps the place will feel and perform a miracle for us.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: אַסְבִּיר לוֹ פָּנִים כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּהָרֵג הוּא וְהִיא. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מֶלֶךְ הֲפַכְפְּכָן הָיָה. אָמַר רַבִּי גַּמְלִיאֵל: עֲדַיִין צְרִיכִין אָנוּ לַמּוֹדָעִי, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַמּוֹדָעִי אוֹמֵר: קִנְּאַתּוּ בַּמֶּלֶךְ קִנְּאַתּוּ בַּשָּׂרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: I will act kindly toward him in order that he and she would be killed. Rabban Gamliel says: was a fickle king, Rabban Gamliel said: We still need HaModa’i As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer HaModa’i says: She made the king jealous of him and she made the ministers jealous of him,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: I will make his face pale so that he and she will be killed. Rabban Gamliel says: He was a king of jesters. Rabbi Gamliel said: We still need the Moda'ei, as it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer the Moda'ei says: His jealousy for the king is his jealousy for the ministers.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: ״לִפְנֵי שֶׁבֶר גָּאוֹן״. אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: ״בְּחוּמָּם אָשִׁית אֶת מִשְׁתֵּיהֶם וְגוֹ׳״. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ לְאֵלִיָּהוּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּמַאן חַזְיָא אֶסְתֵּר וַעֲבַדָא הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּכוּלְּהוּ תַּנָּאֵי וּכְכוּלְּהוּ אָמוֹרָאֵי.
human_translation: Rabba says: “Pride goes before destruction” Abaye and Rava, who both say “When they are heated, I will make feasts for them, Rabba bar Avuh happened upon Elijah said to him: In accordance with whose understanding did Esther see act in this manner? He, said to him: for all the tanna’im and all the amora’im .
llm_translation: Rabah said: "Before the breaking of pride." Abbaye and Rava both said: "With their heat I will set their feasts." Rabba bar Avuh found Elijah, he said to him: "Who sees the hidden and does such?" He said to him: "Like all the Tanaim and like all the Amoraim."

hebrew_text: ״וַיְסַפֵּר לָהֶם הָמָן אֶת כְּבוֹד עׇשְׁרוֹ וְרוֹב בָּנָיו״, וְכַמָּה רוֹב בָּנָיו? אָמַר רַב, שְׁלֹשִׁים: עֲשָׂרָה מֵתוּ, וַעֲשָׂרָה נִתְלוּ, וַעֲשָׂרָה מְחַזְּרִין עַל הַפְּתָחִים.
human_translation: “And Haman recounted to them the glory of his riches, and the multitude of his sons” And how many “the multitude of his sons”? Rav said: thirty ten died ten of them were hanged and ten beg at doors.
llm_translation: "And Haman recounted to them the glory of his wealth and the multitude of his sons." And how many were the multitude of his sons? Rav said, thirty: ten died, ten were hanged, and ten would go around the doorways."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: אוֹתָן שֶׁמְּחַזְּרִין עַל הַפְּתָחִים שִׁבְעִים הָיוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״שְׂבֵעִים בַּלֶּחֶם נִשְׂכָּרוּ״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״שְׂבֵעִים״ אֶלָּא ״שִׁבְעִים״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Those that begged at doors seventy, as it is written: “Those that were full, have hired themselves out for bread” Do not read it as: “Those that were full” [ seve’im rather, seventy [ shivim ],
llm_translation: The Sages said: Those who review their studies at the door were seventy, as it is written: "They were sated with bread" (Psalms 78:29). Do not read it as "sated" but as "seventy."

hebrew_text: וְרָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר: כּוּלָּן מָאתַיִם וּשְׁמוֹנָה הֲווֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרוֹב בָּנָיו״. ״וְרוֹב״ בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא מָאתַן וְאַרְבֵּיסַר הָווּ! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: ״וְרֹב״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And Rami bar Abba said: All of two hundred and eight, as it is stated: “And the multitude [ verov ] of his sons.” But the numerical value [ gimatriyya ] of verov equals two hundred and fourteen, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: verov is written
llm_translation: Ramei bar Abba said: All of them were 208, as it is stated: "And most of his sons." "And most" in gematria is 208! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "And most" is written.

hebrew_text: ״בַּלַּיְלָה הַהוּא נָדְדָה שְׁנַת הַמֶּלֶךְ״. אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם: נָדְדָה שְׁנַת מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם. וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי: נָדְדוּ עֶלְיוֹנִים, נָדְדוּ תַּחְתּוֹנִים. רָבָא אָמַר: שְׁנַת הַמֶּלֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: “On that night the sleep of the king was disturbed” Rabbi Tanḥum said: the sleep of the King of the universe, was disturbed. And the Sages say: the higher ones, was disturbed, and the lower ones, was disturbed. Rava said: literally: The sleep of King Ahasuerus
llm_translation: "On that night, the sleep of the king was disturbed." Rabbi Tanhum said: The sleep of the eternal king was disturbed. And the sages said: The upper ones were disturbed, the lower ones were disturbed. Rava said: It was the actual sleep of King Ahasuerus."

hebrew_text: נְפַלָה לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא בְּדַעְתֵּיהּ, אָמַר: מַאי דְּקַמַּן דְּזַמֵּינְתֵּיהּ אֶסְתֵּר לְהָמָן? דִּלְמָא עֵצָה קָא שָׁקְלִי עִילָּוֵיהּ דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא לְמִקְטְלֵיהּ. הֲדַר אָמַר: אִי הָכִי, לָא הֲוָה גַּבְרָא דְּרָחֵים לִי דַּהֲוָה מוֹדַע לִי? הֲדַר אָמַר: דִּלְמָא אִיכָּא אִינִישׁ דַּעֲבַד בִּי טֵיבוּתָא וְלָא פְּרַעְתֵּיהּ, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מִימַּנְעִי אִינָשֵׁי וְלָא מְגַלּוּ לִי, מִיָּד: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לְהָבִיא אֶת סֵפֶר הַזִּכְרוֹנוֹת דִּבְרֵי הַיָּמִים״.
human_translation: A thought occurred to him he said What is this before us that Esther has invited Haman? Perhaps they are conspiring against that man, to kill him. He said again If this is so, is there no man who loves me and would inform me He said again Perhaps there is some man who has done a favor for me and I have not rewarded him, and due to that people refrain from revealing to me Immediately “And he commanded the book of remembrances of the chronicles to be brought”
llm_translation: The matter fell into his mind, he said: What is the reason that you have prepared Esther for Haman? Perhaps he took the advice of those men to kill him. He then said: If so, was there not a man who showed me kindness and was known to me? He then said: Perhaps there is someone who did me a favor and I did not repay him, therefore people are withholding from me and not revealing it to me, immediately: "And he said to bring the book of records, the chronicles."

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּהְיוּ נִקְרָאִים״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּקְרָאִים מֵאֵילֵיהֶן. ״וַיִּמָּצֵא כָתוּב״ — ״כְּתָב״ מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ? מְלַמֵּד
human_translation: “And they were read this teaches that they were read by themselves. “And it was found written [ katuv ]” It should have said: A writing [ ketav ] teaches
llm_translation: "And they were called" - teaches that they are called by their names. "And it was found written" - "written" is needed for it? Teaches

hebrew_text: שֶׁשִּׁמְשַׁי מוֹחֵק וְגַבְרִיאֵל כּוֹתֵב. אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי, דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אִישׁ כְּפַר תְּמַרְתָּא: וּמָה כְּתָב שֶׁלְּמַטָּה שֶׁלִּזְכוּתָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵינוֹ נִמְחָק, כְּתָב שֶׁלְמַעְלָה — לָא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן.
human_translation: that Shimshai, was erasing and Gavriel was writing Rabbi Asi said: Rabbi Sheila, a man of the village of Timarta, taught: If something written below that is for the benefit of the Jewish people cannot be erased, is it not all the more so that something written above
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Shemshai erases and Gabriel writes. Rabbi Assi said, Rabbi Sheilah, the man of Kfar Temarta, expounded: 'And what is the writing of their lower part, the merit of Israel - it is not erased, the writing of their upper part - all the more so.'"

hebrew_text: ״לֹא נַעֲשָׂה עִמּוֹ דָּבָר״. אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאוֹהֲבִין אֶת מׇרְדֳּכַי, אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשּׂוֹנְאִים אֶת הָמָן.
human_translation: “Nothing has been done for him” Rava said: It is not because they love Mordecai but rather because they hate Haman.
llm_translation: "Not done with him a thing." Said Rava: Not because they loved Mordecai, but because they hated Haman.

hebrew_text: ״הֵכִין לוֹ״. תָּנָא: לוֹ הֵכִין.
human_translation: prepared for him” taught he had prepared for himself.
llm_translation: "He prepared for him." Tanna: For him he prepared.

hebrew_text: ״וַעֲשֵׂה כֵן לְמָרְדֳּכַי״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַנּוּ מָרְדֳּכַי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״הַיְּהוּדִי״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: טוּבָא מָרְדְּכַי אִיכָּא בִּיהוּדָאֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״הַיּוֹשֵׁב בְּשַׁעַר הַמֶּלֶךְ״.
human_translation: “And do so to Mordecai,” said to him Who is Mordecai? said to him: “The Jew.” said to him: There are several Mordecai among the Jews. said to him: “who sits at the king’s gate.”
llm_translation: "And do so for Mordecai." He said to him: Who is Mordecai? He said to him: "The Jew." He said to him: There is a good Mordecai among the Jews. He said to him: "Who sits at the king's gate."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סַגִּי לֵיהּ בְּחַד דִּיסְקַרְתָּא, אִי נָמֵי בְּחַד נַהֲרָא. אָמַר לֵיהּ: הָא נָמֵי הַב לֵיהּ, ״אַל תַּפֵּל דָּבָר מִכֹּל אֲשֶׁר דִּבַּרְתָּ״.
human_translation: said to him: It would be enough for him one village [ disekarta ] or one river said to him: This too you must give him. “Let nothing fail of all that you have spoken,”
llm_translation: He said to him: "Carry it in one basket, either in one dish." He said to him: "Here, carry it in one, 'Do not let any of the words that you have spoken fall.'"

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּקַּח הָמָן אֶת הַלְּבוּשׁ וְאֶת הַסּוּס״. אֲזַל אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ דְּיָתְבִי רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ וּמַחְוֵי לְהוּ הִלְכוֹת קְמִיצָה לְרַבָּנַן, כֵּיוָן דְּחַזְיֵיהּ מָרְדְּכַי דְּאַפֵּיק לְקִבְלֵיהּ וְסוּסְיָא מֵיחַד בִּידֵיהּ, מִירְתַת. אֲמַר לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן: הַאי רַשִּׁיעָא לְמִיקְטַל נַפְשַׁי קָא אָתֵי זִילוּ מִקַּמֵּיהּ דִּי לָא תִּכָּווּ בְּגַחַלְתּוֹ. בְּהָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא נִתְעַטֵּף מָרְדְּכַי וְקָם לֵיהּ לִצְלוֹתָא, אֲתָא הָמָן וִיתֵיב לֵיהּ קַמַּיְיהוּ וְאוֹרֵיךְ עַד דְּסַלֵּיק מָרְדֳּכַי לִצְלוֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: “Then Haman took the apparel and the horse” he went, he found as the Sages were sitting before him, and he was demonstrating to them the halakhot of the handful, Once Mordecai saw him coming toward him with his horse’s held in his hands, he became frightened, he said to the Sages: This evil man has come to kill me. Go away from him so that you should not get burnt from his coals, At that moment Mordecai wrapped himself and stood up to pray. Haman came and sat down before them and waited until Mordecai finished his prayer.
llm_translation: "And Haman took the garment and the horse." He went to find where the sages were sitting and was teaching them the laws of the measurement of a kezayit. When Mordecai saw that he had come to receive him, and the horse was ready in his hand, he was afraid. He said to the sages: 'This wicked one has come to kill me, go away from him so that you do not get burned in his coal.' At that moment, Mordecai wrapped himself and went to pray. Haman came and stood before him and lengthened until Mordecai finished praying.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּמַאי עָסְקִיתוּ? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, מַאן דִּמְנַדֵּב מִנְחָה מַיְיתֵי מְלֵי קוּמְצֵיהּ דְּסוּלְתָּא וּמִתְכַּפַּר לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲתָא מְלֵי קוּמְצֵי קִמְחָא דִּידְכוּ וְדָחֵי עַשְׂרָה אַלְפֵי כַּכְּרֵי כַסְפָּא דִּידִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רָשָׁע, עֶבֶד שֶׁקָּנָה נְכָסִים, עֶבֶד לְמִי וּנְכָסִים לְמִי?
human_translation: said to With what were you occupied? They said to him: When the Temple is standing, one who pledges a meal-offering would bring a handful of fine flour and achieve atonement with it. He said to them: Your handful of fine flour has come and cast aside my ten thousand pieces of silver, he said to Wicked man, a slave buys property, to whom belongs the slave and to whom belongs the property?
llm_translation: He said to them: With what did you engage? They said to him: In the time when the Temple stood, whoever would bring a voluntary meal-offering would bring fine flour for its handful and atone for himself. He said to them: Fine flour for the handful of my wheat comes and pushes aside ten thousand talents of my silver. He said to him: Wicked one, a slave who acquires possessions, a slave to whom and possessions to whom?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קוּם לְבוֹשׁ הָנֵי מָאנֵי וּרְכוֹב הַאי סוּסְיָא, דְּבָעֵי לָךְ מַלְכָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָכֵילְנָא עַד דְּעָיֵילְנָא לְבֵי בָנֵי וְאֶשְׁקוֹל לְמַזְיָיא, דְּלָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְאִשְׁתַּמּוֹשֵׁי בְּמָאנֵי דְמַלְכָּא הָכִי.
human_translation: said to him: Stand up, put on these garments and ride on this horse, for the king wants you said to him: I cannot until I enter the bathhouse bei vanei and trim my hair, for it is not proper conduct to use the king’s garments in this state
llm_translation: He said to him: "Get up, put on those garments and ride this horse, for the king requires you." He said to him: "We cannot go until we enter the house of the sons and weigh the produce, for it is not the way of the land to make use of the king's property in this manner."

hebrew_text: שַׁדַּרָה אֶסְתֵּר וַאֲסַרְתִּינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ בֵּי בָנֵי וּלְכוּלְּהוּ אוּמָּנֵי. עַיְּילֵיהּ אִיהוּ לְבֵי בָנֵי וְאַסְחְיֵהּ, וַאֲזַל וְאַיְיתִי זוּזָא מִבֵּיתֵיהּ וְקָא שָׁקֵיל בֵּיהּ מַזְיֵיהּ. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָא שָׁקֵיל לֵיהּ אִינְּגִיד וְאִיתְּנַח. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי קָא מִיתְּנַחַתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה חֲשִׁיב לֵיהּ לְמַלְכָּא מִכּוּלְּהוּ רַבְרְבָנוֹהִי, הַשְׁתָּא לִישַׁוְּיֵיהּ בַּלְנַאי וְסַפָּר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רָשָׁע, וְלָאו סַפָּר שֶׁל כְּפַר קַרְצוּם הָיִיתָ? תָּנָא: הָמָן, סַפָּר שֶׁל כְּפַר קַרְצוּם הָיָה עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם שָׁנָה.
human_translation: Esther sent closed all the bathhouses and all the craftsmen, he took into the bathhouse and washed him, and he went and brought scissors [ zuza ] from his house and trimmed his hair. he was trimming he injured himself and sighed. said to him: Why do you sigh? said to him: The man whom the king had regarded above all his ministers is now made a bathhouse attendant balanei and a barber. said to him: Wicked man, were you not the barber of the village of Kartzum? was taught Haman was the barber of the village of Kartzum for twenty-two years.
llm_translation: Esther sent and prohibited them for all the households of the sons and for all the craftsmen. He went to the households of the sons and prohibited it, then went and brought a coin from her house and gave it to him as a bribe. While he was taking it, he was told and he was caught. He said to him: Why are you caught? He said to him: A man who was considered by the king as the most important of all his ministers, now you want to equal him with a coin and a bribe? He said to him: Wicked one, were you not the scribe of Kfar Kartzum? It was taught: Haman was the scribe of Kfar Kartzum for twenty-two years.

hebrew_text: בָּתַר דְּשַׁקְלִינְהוּ לְמַזְיֵיהּ, לַבְשִׁינְהוּ לְמָאנֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סַק וּרְכֹב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא יָכֵילְנָא, דִּכְחִישָׁא חֵילַאי מִימֵי תַּעֲנִיתָא. גְּחֵין וּסְלֵיק. כִּי סָלֵיק, בְּעַט בֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא כְּתִיב לְכוּ: ״בִּנְפֹל אוֹיִבְךָ אַל תִּשְׂמָח״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲבָל בְּדִידְכוּ כְּתִיב: ״וְאַתָּה עַל בָּמוֹתֵימוֹ תִדְרוֹךְ״.
human_translation: After trimmed his hair, dressed the garments. said to him: Mount and ride. said to him: I am unable, as my strength has waned from the days of fasting stooped down and ascended As he was ascending gave a kick. said to him: Is it not written for you: “Do not rejoice when your enemy falls” said to him: This applies Jews, but with regard to you it is written: “And you shall tread upon their high places”
llm_translation: After they had taken leave of each other, he dressed himself in his garments, and he refused him. He said to him: "Take and ride." He said to him: "We cannot, for the power of the fast has weakened us." He bent down and went out. When he went out, he placed a thorn in his foot. He said to him: "Is it not written for you: 'Do not rejoice when your enemy falls'?" He said to him: "Those words apply to the people of Israel, but for you it is written: 'And you shall tread upon their high places.'"

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּקְרָא לְפָנָיו כָּכָה יֵעָשֶׂה לְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר הַמֶּלֶךְ חָפֵץ בִּיקָרוֹ״. כִּי הֲוָה נָקֵיט וְאָזֵיל בִּשְׁבִילָא דְּבֵי הָמָן, חֲזִיתֵיהּ בְּרַתֵּיה דְּקָיְימָא אַאִיגָּרָא, סְבַרָה הַאי דִּרְכִיב — אֲבוּהּ, וְהַאי דִּמְסַגֵּי קַמֵּיהּ — מָרְדֳּכַי. שְׁקַלָה עֲצִיצָא דְּבֵית הַכִּסֵּא וּשְׁדֵיתֵיהּ אַרֵישָׁא דַּאֲבוּהּ. דַּלִּי עֵינֵיהּ וַחֲזָת דַּאֲבוּהּ הוּא, נְפַלָה מֵאִיגָּרָא לְאַרְעָא וּמִתָה.
human_translation: “And he proclaimed before him: Thus shall it be done to the man whom the king delights to honor” As was taking along the street of Haman’s house, daughter was standing on the roof and saw She thought the one who is riding her father, and the one walking before him Mordecai. She took a chamber pot and cast its onto the head of her father, raised his eyes she saw that he was her father. she fell from the roof to the ground and died.
llm_translation: "And he called before him, 'Thus shall be done to the man whom the king desires to honor.'" For he had taken and gone to the house of Haman, he saw his daughter standing on the roof, he thought that the one riding was his father, and the one leading him was Mordecai. She took the chamber pot of the throne and poured it on the head of her father. She lifted her eyes and saw that it was her father, she fell from the roof to the ground and died.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּשׇׁב מׇרְדֳּכַי אֶל שַׁעַר הַמֶּלֶךְ״, אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שֶׁשָּׁב לְשַׂקּוֹ וּלְתַעֲנִיתוֹ. ״וְהָמָן נִדְחַף אֶל בֵּיתוֹ אָבֵל וַחֲפוּי רֹאשׁ״, ״אָבֵל״ — עַל בִּתּוֹ, ״וַחֲפוּי רֹאשׁ״ — עַל שֶׁאֵירַע לוֹ.
human_translation: And this is as it is written: “And Mordecai returned to the king’s gate” Rav Sheshet said: that he returned to his sackcloth and his fasting “but Haman hastened to his house, mourning, and having his head covered” “Mourning”; over his daughter. “And having his head covered”; due to what had happened to him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And this is what is written: 'And Mordecai returned to the king's gate.' Rav Sheshet said: He returned to his sackcloth and fasting. 'And Haman hurried to his house mourning and with his head covered,' 'mourning' - for his daughter, 'and with his head covered' - for the one who plotted against him." English translation:

hebrew_text: ״וַיְסַפֵּר הָמָן לְזֶרֶשׁ אִשְׁתּוֹ וּלְכׇל אוֹהֲבָיו וְגוֹ׳״. קָרֵי לְהוּ ״אוֹהֲבָיו״ וְקָרֵי לְהוּ ״חֲכָמָיו״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר דְּבַר חָכְמָה, אֲפִילּוּ בְּאוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, נִקְרָא חָכָם.
human_translation: “And Haman recounted to Zeresh his wife and to all his friends it calls them “his friends,” and it calls them “his wise men.” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Whoever says something wise, even if from the nations of the world, is called wise
llm_translation: "And Haman recounted to Zeresh his wife and to all his loved ones, etc." It is written for them "loved ones" and it is written for them "wise men." Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who says a word of wisdom, even among the nations of the world, is called wise.

hebrew_text: ״אִם מִזֶּרַע הַיְּהוּדִים מׇרְדֳּכַי וְגוֹ׳״. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִי מִשְּׁאָר שְׁבָטִים קָאָתֵי — יָכְלַתְּ לֵיהּ, וְאִי מִשֵּׁבֶט יְהוּדָה וּבִנְיָמִין וְאֶפְרַיִם וּמְנַשֶּׁה — לָא יָכְלַתְּ לֵיהּ. יְהוּדָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״יָדְךָ בְּעֹרֶף אוֹיְבֶיךָ״, אִינָךְ, דִּכְתִיב בְּהוּ: ״לִפְנֵי אֶפְרַיִם וּבִנְיָמִין וּמְנַשֶּׁה עוֹרְרָה אֶת גְּבוּרָתֶךָ״.
human_translation: “If Mordecai be of the seed of the Jews [ Yehudim ], said to him: If he descends from the other tribes, you can prevail over him, but if he from the tribe of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, or Manasseh, you cannot prevail over him. Judah, as it is written: “Your hand shall be on the neck of your enemies” the others as it is written with regard to them: “Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up Your might”
llm_translation: "If from the seed of the Jews Mordecai, etc." They said to him: If he comes from the rest of the tribes - you are able, but if he comes from the tribe of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh - you are not able. Judah, as it is written: "Your hand shall be on the neck of your enemies," you are not, as it is written concerning him: "Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, stir up your might."

hebrew_text: ״כִּי נָפוֹל תִּפּוֹל לְפָנָיו״. דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר אִלְעַאי: שְׁתֵּי נְפִילוֹת הַלָּלוּ, לָמָּה? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אוּמָּה זוֹ, מְשׁוּלָה לְעָפָר וּמְשׁוּלָה לְכוֹכָבִים. כְּשֶׁהֵן יוֹרְדִין — יוֹרְדִין עַד עָפָר, וּכְשֶׁהֵן עוֹלִין — עוֹלִין עַד לַכּוֹכָבִים.
human_translation: “But you shall fall [ nafol tippol ] before him” Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai interpreted homiletically: Why are these two fallings, said to This nation is compared to the dust and it is compared to the stars when they descend, they descend to the dust, and when they rise, they rise to the stars.
llm_translation: "When it falls, it shall fall before him." Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai expounded: These two falls, why? They said to him: One is compared to dust and one is compared to stars. When they descend, they descend to the dust, and when they ascend, they ascend to the stars.

hebrew_text: ״וְסָרִיסֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ הִגִּיעוּ וַיַּבְהִילוּ״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֱבִיאוּהוּ בְּבֶהָלָה.
human_translation: “The king’s chamberlains came, and they hastened [ vayavhilu ] This teaches that they brought him in disarray [ behala ],
llm_translation: "And the eunuchs of the king arrived and they hurried." This teaches that they brought him in a hurry.

hebrew_text: ״כִּי נִמְכַּרְנוּ אֲנִי וְעַמִּי וְגוֹ׳ כִּי אֵין הַצָּר שֹׁוֶה בְּנֵזֶק הַמֶּלֶךְ״. אָמְרָה לוֹ: צַר זֶה, אֵינוֹ שֹׁוֶה בְּנֵזֶק שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ. אִיקְּנִי בַּהּ בְּוַשְׁתִּי וְקַטְלַהּ, הַשְׁתָּא אִיקְּנִי בְּדִידִי וּ(מ)בָעֵי לְמִקְטְלִי.
human_translation: “For we are sold, I and my people, since the affliction [ tzar ] would not have been worth [ eino shoveh ] the damage to the king” she said to him: This adversary [ tzar ] is not concerned [ eino shoveh ] about the damage to the king. First he was jealous of Vashti and killed her, now he is jealous of me and desires to kill me.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "For we are sold, I and my people, etc., for the adversary hath no regard for the damage of the king." She said to him: This adversary is not concerned with the damage of the king. If he is sold to me with shame, I will accept him; but now that he is sold to me with dignity, I do not want him.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ וַיֹּאמֶר לְאֶסְתֵּר הַמַּלְכָּה״. ״וַיֹּאמֶר״ ״וַיֹּאמֶר״ לְמָה לִי? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: בַּתְּחִלָּה עַל יְדֵי תּוּרְגְּמָן, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרָה לֵיהּ מִדְּבֵית שָׁאוּל קָאָתֵינָא, מִיָּד: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לְאֶסְתֵּר הַמַּלְכָּה״.
human_translation: “Then said the king Ahasuerus and said to Esther the queen” Why do I “said” “said”? Rabbi Abbahu said: At first through the translator, Once she told him that she came from the house of Saul, immediately “And said to Esther the queen.”
llm_translation: "And the king Ahasuerus said, and he said to Queen Esther." "And he said," "and he said," "Why to me?" Rabbi Avahu said: Initially, through an interpreter, but once she said to him, 'I am of the house of Saul,' immediately: "And he said to Queen Esther."

hebrew_text: ״וַתֹּאמֶר אֶסְתֵּר אִישׁ צַר וְאוֹיֵב הָמָן הָרָע הַזֶּה״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיְתָה מַחְווֹה כְּלַפֵּי אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ, וּבָא מַלְאָךְ וְסָטַר יָדָהּ כְּלַפֵּי הָמָן.
human_translation: “And Esther said: An adversary and enemy is this wicked Haman” Rabbi Elazar said: teaches that she was pointing toward Ahasuerus, and an angel came and pushed her hand toward Haman.
llm_translation: "And Esther said, 'A man who is an adversary and an evil Haman this one.'" Rabbi Elazar said: It teaches that she was pointing towards Achashverosh, and an angel came and turned her hand towards Haman.

hebrew_text: ״וְהַמֶּלֶךְ קָם בַּחֲמָתוֹ וְגוֹ׳ וְהַמֶּלֶךְ שָׁב מִגִּנַּת הַבִּיתָן״. מַקֵּישׁ שִׁיבָה לְקִימָה: מָה קִימָה בְּחֵימָה, אַף שִׁיבָה בְּחֵימָה. דַּאֲזַל וְאַשְׁכַּח לְמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת דְּאִידְּמוֹ לֵיהּ כְּגַבְרֵי, וְקָא עָקְרִי לְאִילָנֵי דְּבוּסְתָּנֵי, וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי עוֹבָדַיְיכוּ? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: דְּפַקְּדִינַן הָמָן.
human_translation: “And the king arose in his wrath “Then the king returned out of the palace garden compare his returning to his arising: Just as his arising in wrath, so too, his returning in wrath. For he went he found ministering angels who appeared to him as people and they were uprooting trees from the garden, and he said to them: What are you doing? They said to him: Haman commanded us
llm_translation: "And the king arose in his anger, etc. And the king returned from the garden of the palace." He juxtaposes sitting to standing: Just as standing is in anger, so too sitting is in anger. He went and found the ministering angels resembling youths, uprooting the balsam trees, and he said to them: What are you doing? They said to him: We are fulfilling the decree of Haman."

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ, ״וְהָמָן נוֹפֵל עַל הַמִּטָּה״, ״נוֹפֵל״ — ״נָפַל״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁבָּא מַלְאָךְ וְהִפִּילוֹ עָלֶיהָ, אֲמַר: וַיי מִבֵּיתָא, וַיי מִבָּרָא. ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ הֲגַם לִכְבּוֹשׁ אֶת הַמַּלְכָּה עִמִּי בַּבָּיִת״.
human_translation: he entered his house “Haman was falling upon the bed” “was falling” [ nofel ] It should have said “fell” [ nafal ] Rabbi Elazar said: This teaches that an angel came and pushed him down on it, said: Woe unto in the house and woe outside, “Then the king said: Will he even force the queen before me in the house?”
llm_translation: He came to his house, "And Haman fell on the bed," "fell" — he fell from where did he fall! Rabbi Elazar said: It teaches that an angel came and caused him to fall on it, saying: "From the house of the Lord, and from the creation." "And the king said, 'Will he even assault the queen with me in the house?'"

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר חַרְבוֹנָה וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אַף חַרְבוֹנָה רָשָׁע — בְּאוֹתָהּ עֵצָה הָיָה, כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאָה שֶׁלֹּא נִתְקַיְּימָה עֲצָתוֹ, מִיָּד בָּרַח. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיַשְׁלֵךְ עָלָיו וְלֹא יַחְמוֹל מִיָּדוֹ בָּרוֹחַ יִבְרָח״.
human_translation: “And Harbonah, said Rabbi Elazar said: Harbonah was also wicked and involved in that plot, Once he saw that his plot had not succeeded, he immediately fled And this is that which is written: “It hurls itself at him, and does not spare; he would fain flee out of its hand”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And he said, 'Charvonah, etc.'" Rabbi Elazar said: Even Charvonah was wicked — in that counsel he was, once he saw that his advice was not fulfilled, immediately fled. And this is what is written: "And he will cast upon him, and not spare; he will surely flee out of his hand."

hebrew_text: ״וַחֲמַת הַמֶּלֶךְ שָׁכָכָה״. שְׁתֵּי שְׁכִיכוֹת הַלָּלוּ לָמָּה? אַחַת שֶׁל מַלְכּוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם וְאַחַת שֶׁל אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: אַחַת שֶׁל אֶסְתֵּר וְאַחַת שֶׁל וַשְׁתִּי.
human_translation: “Then the king’s wrath was assuaged [ shakhakha ]” Why are there two assuagings here? one of the King of the universe, and one of Ahasuerus. And some say: one due to Esther, and one due to Vashti,
llm_translation: "The wrath of the king subsided." Why are these two subsided? One of the King of the Universe and one of Ahasuerus. And some say: one of Esther and one of Vashti."

hebrew_text: ״לְכֻלָּם נָתַן לָאִישׁ חֲלִיפוֹת שְׂמָלוֹת וּלְבִנְיָמִן נָתַן חָמֵשׁ חֲלִיפוֹת״. אֶפְשָׁר דָּבָר שֶׁנִּצְטַעֵר בּוֹ אוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק —
human_translation: “To all of them he gave each man changes of clothing, but to Benjamin he gave five changes Is it possible that in the thing from which that righteous man had suffered,
llm_translation: "To all of them He gave each man changes of garments, and to Benjamin He gave five changes of garments." It is possible that a matter in which that righteous one is pained—

hebrew_text: יִכָּשֵׁל בּוֹ? דְּאָמַר רָבָא בַּר מַחְסֵיָא אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא, אָמַר רַב: בִּשְׁבִיל מִשְׁקַל שְׁנֵי סְלָעִים מֵילָת שֶׁהוֹסִיף יַעֲקֹב לְיוֹסֵף מִשְּׁאָר אֶחָיו נִתְגַּלְגֵּל הַדָּבָר וְיָרְדוּ אֲבוֹתֵינוּ לְמִצְרַיִם. אָמַר רַבִּי בִּנְיָמִן בַּר יֶפֶת: רֶמֶז רָמַז לוֹ, שֶׁעָתִיד בֵּן לָצֵאת מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁיֵּצֵא מִלִּפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ בַּחֲמִשָּׁה לְבוּשֵׁי מַלְכוּת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמׇרְדֳּכַי יָצָא בִּלְבוּשׁ מַלְכוּת תְּכֵלֶת וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: he should stumble As Rava bar Meḥaseyya said Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said Rav said: Due to two sela of fine wool that Jacob added to Joseph beyond the rest of his brothers, the story progressed and our forefathers went down to Egypt. Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet said: He intimated to him that a descendant was destined to issue from him who would go out from the presence of the king five royal garments, as it is stated: “And Mordecai went forth in royal apparel of sky blue
llm_translation: He stumbled in it? For Rava son of Mahseya said in the name of Rav Hama son of Gurya, Rav said: Because of the weight of the two stones that Jacob added to Joseph more than his brothers, the matter was revealed, and our ancestors descended to Egypt. Rabbi Benjamin son of Yefet said: A hint was hinted to him, that a son is destined to come from him, who will go out before the king in five royal garments, as it is said: "And Mordecai went out in royal apparel of blue, etc."

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּפּוֹל עַל צַוְּארֵי בִנְיָמִן אָחִיו״. כַּמָּה צַוָּארִין הֲווֹ לֵיהּ לְבִנְיָמִין? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בָּכָה עַל שְׁנֵי מִקְדָּשִׁים שֶׁעֲתִידִין לִהְיוֹת בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל בִּנְיָמִין וַעֲתִידִין לֵיחָרֵב. ״וּבִנְיָמִין בָּכָה עַל צַוָּארָיו״ — בָּכָה עַל מִשְׁכַּן שִׁילֹה, שֶׁעָתִיד לִהְיוֹת בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף וְעָתִיד לֵיחָרֵב.
human_translation: “And he fell on his brother Benjamin’s neck [ tzavarei How many necks did Benjamin have, Rabbi Elazar said: that cried over the two Temples that were destined to be in the territory of Benjamin and were destined to be destroyed. “And Benjamin wept on his neck” he cried over the tabernacle of Shiloh that was destined to be in the territory of Joseph and was destined to be destroyed.
llm_translation: "And it fell upon the neck of Benjamin his brother." How many necks did Benjamin have? Rabbi Elazar said: He wept over two Temples that were destined to be in the portion of Benjamin and were destined to be destroyed. "And Benjamin wept upon his necks" — he wept over the Mishkan in Shiloh, which was destined to be in the portion of Joseph and was destined to be destroyed.

hebrew_text: ״וְהִנֵּה עֵינֵיכֶם רוֹאוֹת וְעֵינֵי אָחִי בִנְיָמִין״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אָמַר לָהֶם: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין בְּלִבִּי עַל בִּנְיָמִין אָחִי, שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בִּמְכִירָתִי, כָּךְ אֵין בְּלִבִּי עֲלֵיכֶם. ״כִּי פִי הַמְדַבֵּר אֲלֵיכֶם״. כְּפִי — כֵּן לִבִּי.
human_translation: “And behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin” Rabbi Elazar said: said to Just as I harbor no in my heart toward my brother Benjamin, for he was not present when I was sold, so too, I harbor no toward you. “That it is my mouth [ ki fi ] that speaks to you” As my mouth [ kefi ] is, so is my heart.
llm_translation: "And behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin." Rabbi Elazar said, he said to them: Just as there is no concern in my heart for my brother Benjamin, that he was not in my sale, so too there is no concern in my heart for you. "For the mouth of the one speaking to you." As the mouth, so is my heart.

hebrew_text: ״וּלְאָבִיו שָׁלַח כְּזֹאת עֲשָׂרָה חֲמוֹרִים נוֹשְׂאִים מִטּוּב מִצְרָיִם״. מַאי ״מִטּוּב מִצְרָיִם״? אָמַר רַבִּי בִּנְיָמִין בַּר יֶפֶת אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שָׁלַח לוֹ יַיִן [יָשָׁן], שֶׁדַּעַת זְקֵנִים נוֹחָה הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: “And to his father he sent after this manner ten donkeys laden with the good things of Egypt” What are “the good things of Egypt” Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet said Rabbi Elazar said: He sent him aged wine, which the elderly find pleasing.
llm_translation: "And to his father he sent like this, ten donkeys carrying from the best of Egypt." What is "from the best of Egypt"? Rabbi Benjamin the son of Yefet said, Rabbi Eliezer said: He sent him old wine, for the knowledge of elders is settled within it.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֵּלְכוּ גַּם אֶחָיו וַיִּפְּלוּ לְפָנָיו״. אָמַר רַבִּי בִּנְיָמִין בַּר יֶפֶת אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: תַּעֲלָא בְּעִידָּנֵיהּ סְגֵיד לֵיהּ.
human_translation: “And his brothers even went and fell down before him” Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet said Rabbi Elazar said: This that people say: When the fox is in its hour, bow down to it,
llm_translation: "And his brothers also went and fell down before him." Rabbi Benjamin the son of Jephthah said in the name of Rabbi Elazar, this is what people say: 'Rise in its time and worship it.'"

hebrew_text: תַּעֲלָא? מַאי בְּצִירוּתֵיהּ מֵאֲחווֹהַּ? אֶלָּא, אִי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: ״וַיִּשְׁתַּחוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל רֹאשׁ הַמִּטָּה״, אָמַר רַבִּי בִּנְיָמִין בַּר יֶפֶת אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: תַּעֲלָא בְּעִידָּנֵיהּ סְגֵיד לֵיהּ.
human_translation: a fox? What, was he inferior to his brothers Rather, if such a statement was stated, it was stated as follows, “And Israel bowed himself upon the head of the bed” Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet said Rabbi Elazar said: When the fox is in its hour, bow down to it,
llm_translation: Elevated? What is meant by "from his bed"? Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus: "And Israel bowed at the head of the bed." Rabbi Benjamin son of Yefet said Rabbi Elazar: Elevate in its time, prostrate to it.

hebrew_text: ״וַיְנַחֵם אוֹתָם וַיְדַבֵּר עַל לִבָּם״. אָמַר רַבִּי בִּנְיָמִין בַּר יֶפֶת אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאָמַר לָהֶם דְּבָרִים שֶׁמִּתְקַבְּלִין עַל הַלֵּב: וּמָה עֲשָׂרָה נֵרוֹת לֹא יָכְלוּ לְכַבּוֹת נֵר אֶחָד, נֵר אֶחָד הֵיאַךְ יָכוֹל לְכַבּוֹת עֲשָׂרָה נֵרוֹת?
human_translation: “And he comforted them and spoke to their hearts” Rabbi Binyamin bar Yefet said Rabbi Elazar said: teaches that he spoke to them words that are acceptable to the heart, If ten lights could not put out one light, how can one light put out ten lights?
llm_translation: "And He comforted them and spoke to their hearts." Rabbi Benjamin the son of Yefet said, Rabbi Elazar said: This teaches that He said to them words that are received in the heart. And how is it that ten lamps could not extinguish one lamp, yet one lamp can extinguish ten lamps?

hebrew_text: ״לַיְּהוּדִים הָיְתָה אוֹרָה וְשִׂמְחָה וְשָׂשׂוֹן וִיקָר״. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: ״אוֹרָה״ — זוֹ תּוֹרָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי נֵר מִצְוָה וְתוֹרָה אוֹר״. ״שִׂמְחָה״ — זֶה יוֹם טוֹב, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְשָׂמַחְתָּ בְּחַגֶּךָ״. ״שָׂשׂוֹן״ — זוֹ מִילָה, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״שָׂשׂ אָנֹכִי עַל אִמְרָתֶךָ״.
human_translation: “The Jews had light and gladness, and joy and honor” Rav Yehuda said: “Light”; this Torah And similarly it says: “For the mitzva is a lamp and the Torah is light” “Gladness” [ simḥa ]; this the Festivals And similarly it says: “And you shall be glad [ vesamakhta ] on your Festival” “Joy” [ sasson ]; this circumcision, And similarly it says: “I rejoice [ sas ] at Your word”
llm_translation: "The Jews had light, joy, gladness, and honor." Rav Yehudah said: "Light" - this is Torah, as it says: "For a commandment is a lamp and Torah is light." "Joy" - this is a festival, as it says: "And you shall rejoice on your festival." "Gladness" - this is circumcision, as it says: "I rejoice at Your word."

hebrew_text: ״וִיקָר״ — אֵלּוּ תְּפִלִּין, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְרָאוּ כׇּל עַמֵּי הָאָרֶץ כִּי שֵׁם ה׳ נִקְרָא עָלֶיךָ וְיָרְאוּ מִמֶּךָּ״, וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: אֵלּוּ תְּפִלִּין שֶׁבָּרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: “Honor”; this is phylacteries, And similarly it says: “And all peoples of the earth will see that you are called by the name of the Lord; and they will be afraid of you” And it was taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great said: This the phylacteries worn on the head.
llm_translation: "וִיקָר" — these are tefillin, and so it says: "And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you, and they shall be afraid of you." And it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: these are the tefillin of the head.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֵת פַּרְשַׁנְדָּתָא וְגוֹ׳ עֲשֶׂרֶת בְּנֵי הָמָן״. אָמַר רַב אַדָּא דְּמִן יָפוֹ: ״עֲשֶׂרֶת בְּנֵי הָמָן״ וַ״עֲשֶׂרֶת״ צָרִיךְ לְמֵמְרִינְהוּ בִּנְשִׁימָה אַחַת, מַאי טַעְמָא — כּוּלְּהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי נְפַקוּ נִשְׁמְתַיְיהוּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וָיו דְּ״וַיְזָתָא״ צָרִיךְ לְמִימְתְּחַהּ בִּזְקִיפָא כְּמוּרְדְּיָא דְלִבְרוּת. מַאי טַעְמָא — כּוּלְּהוּ בְּחַד זְקִיפָא אִזְדְּקִיפוּ.
human_translation: And Parshandatha… the ten sons of Haman” Rav Adda from Jaffa said: the ten sons of Haman and “ten” must be said in one breath. What is the reason their souls all departed together. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: vav in “Vaizatha” must be elongated as a pole, like a steering oar of a ship [ liberot ]. What is the reason they were all hanged on one pole.
llm_translation: "And the ten sons of Haman." Rav Adda from Yaffo said: "The ten sons of Haman" and "ten" need to be combined in one breath. What is the reason? All of them went out together, their souls departed. Rabbi Yochanan said: The 'vav' in 'vayezata' needs to be written in a bent manner, like the horn of a snail. What is the reason? All of them were hanged on one beam, they were all hanged together.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פָּפָּא, דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אִישׁ כְּפַר תְּמַרְתָּא: כׇּל הַשִּׁירוֹת כּוּלָּן נִכְתָּבוֹת אָרִיחַ עַל גַּבֵּי לְבֵינָה וּלְבֵינָה עַל גַּבֵּי אָרִיחַ —
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa said Rabbi Sheila, a man of the village of Timarta, interpreted homiletically: All the songs are written a half brick arranged upon a whole brick and a whole brick arranged upon a half brick,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papa said, Rabbi Sheilah of the village of Timarta expounded: All the songs were written on a fragrant tablet, and the tablet on a fragrant tablet.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִשִּׁירָה זוֹ וּמַלְכֵי כְנַעַן, שֶׁאָרִיחַ עַל גַּבֵּי אָרִיחַ וּלְבֵינָה עַל גַּבֵּי לְבֵינָה. מַאי טַעְמָא — שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא תְּקוּמָה לְמַפַּלְתָּן.
human_translation: This is the principle for all songs in the Bible except this song, and the kings of Canaan a half brick arranged upon a half brick and a whole brick arranged upon a whole brick, What is the reason So that they should never rise from their downfall.
llm_translation: Outside of this song and the kings of Canaan, that I will place on top of a lion and a white lion on top of a white lion. What is the reason? So that there will not be a resurrection for their downfall.

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ לְאֶסְתֵּר הַמַּלְכָּה בְּשׁוּשַׁן הַבִּירָה הָרְגוּ הַיְּהוּדִים״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁבָּא מַלְאָךְ וּסְטָרוֹ עַל פִּיו.
human_translation: “And the king said to Esther the queen: The Jews have slain in Shushan the capital, Rabbi Abbahu said: This teaches that an angel came and slapped him on his mouth,
llm_translation: "And the king said to Esther the queen, 'In Shushan the capital, the Jews have killed.'" Rabbi Abbahu said: This teaches that an angel came and placed a blindfold over his eyes.

hebrew_text: ״וּבְבֹאָהּ לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ אָמַר עִם הַסֵּפֶר״. ״אָמַר״ — ״אָמְרָה״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמְרָה לוֹ: יֵאָמֵר בַּפֶּה מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב בַּסֵּפֶר.
human_translation: “But when she came before the king, he said with a letter” “He said”? It should have said: “She said,” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: She said to Let it be said by mouth, that which is written in the letter
llm_translation: "And when she came before the king, she said with the book." "Said" — "she said" is required! Rabbi Yochanan said, she said to him: Let what is written in the book be said with the mouth."

hebrew_text: ״דִּבְרֵי שָׁלוֹם וֶאֱמֶת״. אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁצְּרִיכָה שִׂרְטוּט כַּאֲמִיתָּה שֶׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: “Words of peace and truth” Rabbi Tanḥum said, and some say Rabbi Asi teaches that requires scoring, as the Torah itself,
llm_translation: "The words of peace and truth." Rabbi Tanhum said, and some say it was Rabbi Assi who said: This teaches that a woman needs to have the appearance of Torah truth."

hebrew_text: ״וּמַאֲמַר אֶסְתֵּר קִיַּים״. ״מַאֲמַר אֶסְתֵּר״ — אִין, ״דִּבְרֵי הַצּוֹמוֹת״ — לָא?! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״דִּבְרֵי הַצּוֹמוֹת ... וּמַאֲמַר אֶסְתֵּר קִיַּים (אֵת יְמֵי) הַפּוּרִים הָאֵלֶּה״.
human_translation: And the decree of Esther confirmed “the decree of Esther” indeed “the matters of the fasts” not? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: “The matters of the fasts And the decree of Esther confirmed these matters of Purim,”
llm_translation: "And the statement of Esther was confirmed." "The statement of Esther" - Yes, "the words of the fasts" - No?! Rabbi Yochanan said: "The words of the fasts... and the statement of Esther confirmed these days of Purim."

hebrew_text: ״כִּי מׇרְדֳּכַי הַיְּהוּדִי מִשְׁנֶה לַמֶּלֶךְ אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ וְגָדוֹל לַיְּהוּדִים וְרָצוּי לְרוֹב אֶחָיו״. ״לְרוֹב אֶחָיו״, וְלֹא לְכׇל אֶחָיו. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁפֵּירְשׁוּ מִמֶּנּוּ מִקְצָת סַנְהֶדְרִין.
human_translation: “For Mordecai the Jew was second to the king Ahasuerus, and great among the Jews, and accepted by the majority of his brethren” “By the majority of his brethren,” but not by all his brethren. teaches that some of the Sanhedrin parted from him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ki Mordechai HaYehudi mishneh laMelech Achashverosh veGadol laYehudim veRatzui leRov echav." "LeRov echav," veLo lechol echav. Melamed shepeirshu mimenu miktzat Sanhedrin. English translation: "For Mordecai the Jew was second to King Ahasuerus, and great among the Jews, and accepted by the majority of his brothers." "By the majority of his brothers," and not by all his brothers. This teaches that some Sanhedrin members explained it from him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: גָּדוֹל תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה יוֹתֵר מֵהַצָּלַת נְפָשׁוֹת, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא חָשֵׁיב לֵיהּ לְמׇרְדֳּכַי בָּתַר אַרְבְּעָה, וּלְבַסּוֹף בָּתַר חַמְשָׁה. מֵעִיקָּרָא כְּתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר בָּאוּ עִם זְרוּבָּבֶל יֵשׁוּעַ נְחֶמְיָה שְׂרָיָה רְעֵלָיָה מׇרְדֳּכַי בִּלְשָׁן״, וּלְבַסּוֹף כְּתִיב: ״הַבָּאִים עִם זְרוּבָּבֶל יֵשׁוּעַ נְחֶמְיָה עֲזַרְיָה רַעַמְיָה נַחֲמָנִי מׇרְדֳּכַי בִּלְשָׁן״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Studying Torah is greater than saving lives, as initially, Mordecai was mentioned after four but at the end after five. At first it is written: “Who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan” but in the end it is written: “Who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahmani, Mordecai, Bilshan”
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Great is the study of Torah more than saving lives, for initially it was considered to Mordecai after four, and ultimately after five. Initially it is written: "Who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan," and ultimately it is written: "The sons of Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָּא: גָּדוֹל תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה יוֹתֵר מִבִּנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, שֶׁכׇּל זְמַן שֶׁבָּרוּךְ בֶּן נֵרִיָּה קַיָּים — לֹא הִנִּיחוֹ עֶזְרָא וְעָלָה.
human_translation: Rav said, and some say Rav Shmuel bar Marta Studying Torah is greater than building the Temple. for as long as Baruch ben Neriah was alive Ezra, did not leave him and go up
llm_translation: Rav said, and some say it was Rav Shmuel bar Marta: The study of Torah is greater than the construction of the Temple, for as long as Baruch ben Neriyah was alive, Ezra was not needed and the Temple was built.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָּא: גָּדוֹל תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה יוֹתֵר מִכִּבּוּד אָב וָאֵם, שֶׁכׇּל אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁהָיָה יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ בְּבֵית עֵבֶר לֹא נֶעֱנַשׁ, דְּאָמַר מָר:
human_translation: Rabba said Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta said: Studying Torah is more than honoring one’s father and mother, that for all those years that our father Jacob spent in the house of Eber he was not punished As the Master said:
llm_translation: Rabba said, Rav Yitzchak bar Shmuel bar Marta said: Great is Torah study more than honoring father and mother, for all those years that our father Jacob was in the womb, he was not punished, as Mar said:

hebrew_text: לָמָּה נִמְנוּ שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל יִשְׁמָעֵאל? כְּדֵי לְיַחֵס בָּהֶן שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב. דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֵלֶּה שְׁנֵי חַיֵּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל מְאַת שָׁנָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים שָׁנָה וְשֶׁבַע שָׁנִים״. כַּמָּה קַשִּׁישׁ יִשְׁמָעֵאל מִיִּצְחָק? אַרְבֵּיסַר שְׁנִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַבְרָם בֶּן שְׁמוֹנִים שָׁנָה וְשֵׁשׁ שָׁנִים בְּלֶדֶת הָגָר אֶת יִשְׁמָעֵאל לְאַבְרָם״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאַבְרָהָם בֶּן מְאַת שָׁנָה בְּהִוָּלֶד לוֹ אֵת יִצְחָק בְּנוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְיִצְחָק בֶּן שִׁשִּׁים שָׁנָה בְּלֶדֶת אוֹתָם״, בַּר כַּמָּה הֲוָה יִשְׁמָעֵאל כִּדְאִתְיְלִיד יַעֲקֹב? בַּר שִׁבְעִים וְאַרְבְּעָה, כַּמָּה פָּיְישָׁן מִשְּׁנֵיהּ — שִׁתִּין וּתְלָת.
human_translation: Why were the years of Ishmael mentioned In order to reckon through them the years of Jacob. As it is written: “And these are the years of the life of Ishmael, a hundred and thirty-seven years” How much older was Ishmael than Isaac? Fourteen years. As it is written: “And Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram” And it is written: “And Abraham was a hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him” And it is written “And Isaac was sixty years old when she bore them” how old was Ishmael when Jacob was born? Seventy-four. How many of his years remained Sixty-three,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Why were the years of Yishmael counted? In order to include in them the years of Yaakov. As it is written: "Now these are the years of the life of Yishmael: a hundred and thirty-seven years." How much older was Yishmael than Yitzchak? Fourteen years, as it is written: "And Avram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Yishmael to Avram," and it is written: "And Avraham was a hundred years old when his son Yitzchak was born to him," and it is written: "And Yitzchak was sixty years old when they were born to him." How old was Yishmael when Yaakov was born? Seventy-four years. How many years were missing from his life? Thirty-two.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: הָיָה יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנִּתְבָּרֵךְ מֵאָבִיו בֶּן שִׁשִּׁים וְשָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנָה, וּבוֹ בַּפֶּרֶק מֵת יִשְׁמָעֵאל. דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּרְא עֵשָׂו כִּי בֵרַךְ וְגוֹ׳ וַיֵּלֶךְ עֵשָׂו אֶל יִשְׁמָעֵאל וַיִּקַּח אֶת מָחֲלַת בַּת יִשְׁמָעֵאל אֲחוֹת נְבָיוֹת״, מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״בַּת יִשְׁמָעֵאל״, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהִיא אֲחוֹת נְבָיוֹת? מְלַמֵּד שֶׁקִּידְּשָׁהּ יִשְׁמָעֵאל וָמֵת, וְהִשִּׂיאָהּ נְבָיוֹת אָחִיהָ.
human_translation: And it was taught Jacob our father was sixty-three years old at the time he was blessed by his father, and at that same time Ishmael died. As it is written: “When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed then Esau went to Ishmael and took for a wife Mahalath, the daughter of Ishmael, the sister of Nebaioth” From the fact that is stated: “the daughter of Ishmael,” do I not know that she was the sister of Nebaioth? This teaches that Ishmael betrothed her and died, and Nebaioth her brother married her off.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Our father Jacob was sixty-three years old when he received the blessing from his father, and at that time Ishmael died. As it is written: "And Esau saw that Isaac had blessed..." (Genesis 28:6). "And Esau went to Ishmael and took Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael, the sister of Nebaioth." From the fact that it says "the daughter of Ishmael," how do I know that she was the sister of Nebaioth? It teaches that Ishmael betrothed her and died, and Nebaioth, her brother, married her.

hebrew_text: שִׁתִּין וּתְלָת וְאַרְבֵּיסַר עַד דְּמִתְיְלִיד יוֹסֵף, הָא שִׁבְעִין וְשִׁבְעָה, וּכְתִיב: ״וְיוֹסֵף בֶּן שְׁלֹשִׁים שָׁנָה בְּעׇמְדוֹ לִפְנֵי פַּרְעֹה״, הָא מְאָה וּשְׁבַע, שַׁב דְּשִׂבְעָא וְתַרְתֵּי דְּכַפְנָא — הָא מְאָה וְשִׁיתְּסַר,
human_translation: sixty-three and fourteen until Joseph was born, this seventy-seven And it is written: “And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh” This a hundred and seven seven of plenty and two of famine, this a hundred and sixteen
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Sixty and three and fourteen until Joseph was born, that is seventy-seven. And it is written: 'And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh,' that is one hundred and seven. Subtract seven and two of the palm — that is one hundred and sixteen."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר פַּרְעֹה אֶל יַעֲקֹב כַּמָּה יְמֵי שְׁנֵי חַיֶּיךָ. וַיֹּאמֶר יַעֲקֹב אֶל פַּרְעֹה יְמֵי שְׁנֵי מְגוּרַי שְׁלֹשִׁים וּמְאַת שָׁנָה״, מְאָה וְשִׁיתְּסַר הָוְיָין,
human_translation: But it is written: “And Pharaoh said to Jacob, How many are the days of the years of your life? And Jacob said to Pharaoh, The days of the years of my sojournings are a hundred and thirty years” which is hundred and sixteen
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And Pharaoh said to Jacob, 'How many are the days of the years of your life?' And Jacob said to Pharaoh, 'The days of the years of my sojourning are one hundred and thirty years.'" (Genesis 47:8-9) English translation:

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אַרְבַּע עֶשְׂרֵה שְׁנִין דַּהֲוָה בְּבֵית עֵבֶר לָא חָשֵׁיב לְהוּ. דְּתַנְיָא: הָיָה יַעֲקֹב בְּבֵית עֵבֶר מוּטְמָן אַרְבַּע עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה. עֵבֶר מֵת לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּרַד יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ לַאֲרַם נַהֲרַיִם שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים, יָצָא מִשָּׁם וּבָא לוֹ לַאֲרַם נַהֲרַיִם, נִמְצָא כְּשֶׁעָמַד עַל הַבְּאֵר — בֶּן שִׁבְעִים וָשֶׁבַע שָׁנָה.
human_translation: Rather, learn from here As it is taught Jacob was in the house of Eber for fourteen years in hiding Eber died two years after Jacob our father went down to Aram-naharaim, left there, then went to Aram-naharaim. when stood at the well he was seventy-seven years old.
llm_translation: Rather, learn from it that fourteen years that were in the house of the crossing are not considered for him. As it was taught: Jacob was in the house of the crossing for fourteen years. After Jacob our father descended to Aram Naharaim, he stayed there for two years, then he left from there and came to Aram Naharaim. It turns out that when he stood by the well, he was seventy-seven years old.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּלָא אִיעֲנַשׁ — דְּתַנְיָא: נִמְצָא יוֹסֵף שֶׁפֵּירַשׁ מֵאָבִיו עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם שָׁנָה, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁפֵּירַשׁ יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ מֵאָבִיו, דְּיַעֲקֹב תְּלָתִין וְשִׁיתָּא הָוְיָין! אֶלָּא: אַרְבֵּיסַר דַּהֲוָה בְּבֵית עֵבֶר לָא חָשֵׁיב לְהוּ.
human_translation: And from where do we that was not punished As it is taught It turns out that Joseph was away from his father for twenty-two years, just as Jacob our father was away from his father Jacob thirty-six the fourteen that he was in the house of Eber are not counted,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we know that he was not punished? - As it was taught: Joseph was found to have been separated from his father for twenty-two years, just as our father Jacob was separated from his father, for Jacob was thirty-six years old! Rather, the twelve years that he spent in the house of Eber were not taken into account for him.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף דְּבֵית לָבָן עֶשְׂרִין שְׁנִין הָוְיָין! אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאִשְׁתַּהִי בְּאוֹרְחָא תַּרְתֵּין שְׁנִין, דְּתַנְיָא: יָצָא מֵאֲרַם נַהֲרַיִם וּבָא לוֹ לְסֻכּוֹת, וְעָשָׂה שָׁם שְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיַעֲקֹב נָסַע סֻכּוֹתָה וַיִּבֶן לוֹ בָּיִת וּלְמִקְנֵהוּ עָשָׂה סֻכּוֹת״, וּבְבֵית אֵל עָשָׂה שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים, וְהִקְרִיב זְבָחִים.
human_translation: ultimately, Laban’s house for twenty years. Rather, because on his journey he tarried two years as it is taught left Aram-naharaim and came to Sukkot, and spent eighteen months there, as it is stated: “And Jacob journeyed to Sukkot, built himself a house, and made booths [ sukkot ] for his cattle” He then was in Bethel for six months, and he brought offerings,
llm_translation: At the end of twenty years in the house of Laban! Rather, because it was on the way, twenty years, as it was taught: He left Aram Naharaim and came to Sukkot, and there he made eighteen months, as it is said: "And Jacob journeyed to Sukkot, and built himself a house and made booths for his livestock," and in Beit El he made six months, and offered sacrifices.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מְגִילָּה נִקְרֵאת
llm_translation: We will return to you, Megillah is read.

hebrew_text: הַקּוֹרֵא אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה לְמַפְרֵעַ — לֹא יָצָא. קְרָאָהּ עַל פֶּה, קְרָאָהּ תַּרְגּוּם בְּכׇל לָשׁוֹן — לֹא יָצָא. אֲבָל קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ לַלּוֹעֲזוֹת בְּלַעַז, וְהַלּוֹעֵז שֶׁשָּׁמַע אַשּׁוּרִית — יָצָא.
human_translation: one who reads the Megilla out of order, he has not fulfilled he read it by heart, if he read it in translation in any language he has not fulfilled However, for those who speak a foreign language, one may read in foreign language. And one who speaks a foreign language who heard Ashurit , has fulfilled
llm_translation: One who reads the Megillah out of order - has not fulfilled his obligation. If one read it by heart, or translated it into any language - he has not fulfilled his obligation. But if one reads it in a foreign language in a foreign tongue, and the foreigner who heard it understood Assyrian - he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: קְרָאָהּ סֵירוּגִין וּמִתְנַמְנֵם — יָצָא. הָיָה כּוֹתְבָהּ, דּוֹרְשָׁהּ וּמַגִּיהָהּ, אִם כִּוֵּון לִבּוֹ — יָצָא, וְאִם לָאו — לֹא יָצָא.
human_translation: If one read at intervals, or he is dozing off, he has fulfilled his obligation. If one was writing or expounding upon it, or correcting it, If he had intent he has fulfilled his obligation, but if not, he has not fulfilled
llm_translation: Its potsherds called and it rattled - he has fulfilled his obligation. If one was reading it, explaining it, and translating it, if his heart was intent - he has fulfilled his obligation, but if not - he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה כְּתוּבָה בְּסַם וּבְסִיקְרָא וּבְקוֹמוֹס וּבְקַנְקַנְתּוֹם, עַל הַנְּיָיר וְעַל הַדִּפְתְּרָא — לֹא יָצָא, עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא כְּתוּבָה אַשּׁוּרִית, עַל הַסֵּפֶר, וּבִדְיוֹ.
human_translation: If was written with sam or with sikra or with komos or with kankantom , on neyar or on diftera , he has not fulfilled unless is written in Ashurit , upon parchment and with ink.
llm_translation: It was written in sam, and in sikra, and in komos, and in kanakantom, on the paper and on the parchment - he has not fulfilled his obligation until it is written in Assyrian script, in a book, and with ink.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רָבָא, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּכְתָבָם וְכִזְמַנָּם״ — מָה זְמַנָּם לְמַפְרֵעַ לָא, אַף כְּתָבָם לְמַפְרֵעַ לָא.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rava said: The verse states according to their writing, and according to their appointed times Just as their appointed times cannot be out of order, so too, their writing must not be out of order.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? Amar Rava, de'amar kra: "Kikhtavam vekhizmanam" — mah zmanam lemafre'a la, af kikhtavam lemafre'a la. English translation: What is the meaning of these words? Rava said, as the verse states: "According to their writing and according to their time" — just as their time is not for annulment, so too their writing is not for annulment.

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי ״קְרִיאָה״ כְּתִיבָה הָכָא? ״עֲשִׂיָּיה״ כְּתִיבָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לִהְיוֹת עוֹשִׂים אֵת שְׁנֵי הַיָּמִים״, אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַיָּמִים הָאֵלֶּה נִזְכָּרִים וְנַעֲשִׂים״, אִיתַּקַּשׁ זְכִירָה לַעֲשִׂיָּיה: מָה עֲשִׂיָּיה לְמַפְרֵעַ לָא, אַף זְכִירָה לְמַפְרֵעַ לָא.
human_translation: Is reading written here at all? observing” is written as it is written: “That they should unfailingly observe these two days Rather, from here, as it is written: “And that these days should be remembered and observed Remembering is juxtaposed to observing, Just as observing cannot be out of order, so too, remembering, may not be out of order.
llm_translation: From the word "reading" is writing written here? "Doing" is written, as it is written: "to observe these two days." Rather, from here, as it is written: "and these days are remembered and done," memory is connected to action: just as action does not cause forgetfulness, so too memory does not cause forgetfulness.
