Not Rabbi Yehuda and not Rabbi Yosei! If it is Rabbi Yehuda — even initially, if it is Rabbi Yosei — even after the fact, not!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ לְכַתְּחִילָּה. וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִּידֵיהּ, הָא דְּרַבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Yehuda, even ab initio , And not difficult, this his own that of his master,
llm_translation: Always Rabbi Yehuda, and even at the outset. And not difficult: this one of his, that one of his.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: הַקּוֹרֵא אֶת שְׁמַע צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּשְׁמִיעַ לְאׇזְנוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שְׁמַע יִשְׂרָאֵל ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ ה׳ אֶחָד״ — הַשְׁמַע לְאָזְנֶיךָ מַה שֶּׁאַתָּה מוֹצִיא מִפִּיךָ. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: ״אֲשֶׁר אָנֹכִי מְצַוְּךָ הַיּוֹם עַל לְבָבֶךָ״ — אַחַר כַּוּוֹנַת הַלֵּב הֵן הֵן הַדְּבָרִים.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya: One who recites the Shema must make it audible to his ears, as it is stated: “Hear O Israel, the Lord our God; the Lord is One” allow your ears to hear you are expressing with your mouth. Rabbi Meir says: which I command you this day shall be in your heart” words,” after the intent of the heart,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah: One who recites the Shema must hear what he is saying, as it is stated: "Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is One" — hear with your ears what you are uttering from your mouth. Rabbi Meir says: "Which I command you today shall be upon your heart" — after the intention of the heart, these are the words.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי — אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה כְּרַבֵּיהּ סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, וְהָא דְּתָנֵי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא.
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this you even say that Rabbi Yehuda holds in accordance with his teacher, And as for that that Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, taught Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: The instance where it comes to this — even if you were to say Rabbi Yehuda agrees with his colleague, and that which Yehuda, the son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazzi, taught — it is Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר בְּקָטָן. (דְּתַנְיָא) אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: קָטָן הָיִיתִי, וּקְרִיתִיהָ לְמַעְלָה מֵרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן וּזְקֵנִים בְּלוֹד. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין מְבִיאִין רְאָיָה מִן הַקָּטָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says that a minor is fit It is taught Rabbi Yehuda said: I was a minor I read before Rabbi Tarfon and the Elders in Lod. They said to him One cannot bring a proof from a minor.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda permits with a minor. (As it was taught) Rabbi Yehuda said: I was a minor, and I read it above Rabbi Tarfon and elders in Lod. They said to him: We do not bring proof from a minor.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי: קָטָן הָיִיתִי, וּקְרִיתִיהָ לְמַעְלָה מֵרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵין מְבִיאִין רְאָיָה מִן הַמַּתִּיר.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi said: I was a minor I read before Rabbi Yehuda. They said to him: One cannot bring a proof from the one who permits
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi said: I was a minor, and I read it above Rabbi Yehuda, they said to him: One does not bring proof from the one who permits.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימְרוּ לֵיהּ: אֵין מְבִיאִין רְאָיָה מִן הַקָּטָן! חֲדָא וְעוֹד קָאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ. חֲדָא: דְּקָטָן הָיִיתָ, וְעוֹד: אֲפִילּוּ גָּדוֹל הָיִיתָ — אֵין מְבִיאִין רְאָיָה מִן הַמַּתִּיר.
human_translation: And let them say to him, one cannot bring a proof from minor. They said one and another; One you were a minor And furthermore, even you had been an adult one cannot bring a proof from the one who permits
llm_translation: And they should say to him: One does not bring proof from a minor! One and furthermore they say to him. One: You were a minor, and furthermore: even if you were an adult — one does not bring proof from the one who permits.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין קוֹרִין אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה, וְלֹא מָלִין, וְלֹא טוֹבְלִין, וְלֹא מַזִּין, וְכֵן שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם — לֹא תִּטְבּוֹל עַד שֶׁתָּנֵץ הַחַמָּה. וְכוּלָּן שֶׁעָשׂוּ מִשֶּׁעָלָה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: One may not read the Megilla, nor perform a circumcision, nor immerse nor sprinkle And also a woman who observes a day for day may not immerse herself until the sun has risen. And all these if one did them after daybreak, they are valid,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not read the Megillah, nor circumcise, nor immerse in a mikveh, nor sprinkle the ashes of the Red Heifer, and similarly a woman who observes one day corresponding to another — she may not immerse until the sun sets. And all of these, if they performed them from the break of dawn onwards — it is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָלַן? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהַיָּמִים הָאֵלֶּה נִזְכָּרִים וְנַעֲשִׂים״ — בַּיּוֹם אִין, בַּלַּיְלָה לָא. לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: חַיָּיב אָדָם לִקְרוֹת אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה בַּלַּיְלָה וְלִשְׁנוֹתָהּ בַּיּוֹם! כִּי קָתָנֵי — אַדְּיוֹם.
human_translation: From where do we As the verse states: “And that these days should be remembered and kept” during the day, yes, at night, no. Let us say that this is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A person is obligated to read the Megilla at night and repeat it during the day. as when teaches the daytime
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, menalan? D'amar kra: "Vehayamim ha'eleh nizkarim venasim" - bayom ein, balaila la. Leima tehevei teyuvta d'Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, d'amar Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Chayav adam likrot et ham'gilah balaila velishnotah bayom! Ki kataney - adyom. English translation: Gemara, from where do we derive this? As the verse states: "And these days are remembered and performed" - during the day, not at night. Let it be the preference of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A person is obligated to read the scroll at night and repeat it during the day! For it is taught - during the day.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מָלִין וְכוּ׳. דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי יִמּוֹל״.
human_translation: And one may not perform a circumcision as it is written: “And on the eighth day he shall be circumcised”
llm_translation: "And not circumcise, etc. As it is written: 'And on the eighth day he shall be circumcised.'"

hebrew_text: וְלֹא טוֹבְלִין וְלֹא מַזִּין וְכוּ׳. דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִזָּה הַטָּהוֹר עַל הַטָּמֵא [וְגוֹ׳] בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״, וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ טְבִילָה לְהַזָּיָה.
human_translation: And one may not immerse or sprinkle as it is written: “And the pure person shall sprinkle upon the impure and on the seventh day; And immersion is likened to sprinkling,
llm_translation: "And not immerse and not sprinkle, etc. As it is written: 'And he shall sprinkle the clean upon the unclean etc. on the seventh day,' and immersion is compared to sprinkling."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם לֹא תִּטְבּוֹל עַד שֶׁתָּנֵץ הַחַמָּה וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַאי שְׁנָא שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם מִכׇּל חַיָּיבֵי טְבִילוֹת!
human_translation: And also a woman who observes a day for a day may not immerse herself until the sun has risen. is obvious. What is different about a woman who observes a day for a day, from all the others who are obligated to immerse themselves,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And similarly, a woman who observes one day of purity opposite another day, should not immerse until the sun sets, etc." Obviously! What is the difference between a woman who observes one day opposite another from all those obligated in immersion!

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא תֶּיהְוֵי כִּרְאִיָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁל זָב — וּרְאִיָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁל זָב אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְבַעַל קֶרִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַזָּב וַאֲשֶׁר תֵּצֵא מִמֶּנּוּ שִׁכְבַת זָרַע״. מָה בַּעַל קֶרִי טוֹבֵל בַּיּוֹם — הַאי נָמֵי לִיטְבּוֹל בְּיוֹמֵיהּ.
human_translation: It is necessary it might enter your mind to say that should be treated like the first emission of a zav , And the first emission of a zav is likened to one who experienced a seminal discharge, as it is written: “This is the halakha of him that has an issue and of him whose semen goes from him” Just as one who experienced a seminal discharge immerses on the day so too, that one, may immerse himself on the day
llm_translation: It is necessary: Since your mind raised the question, I say, let it be like the first sighting of a zav - and the first sighting of a zav is connected to a ba'al keri, as it is written: "This is the Torah of the zav, and of the one who has a discharge, and of the one who has an emission of semen." Just as a ba'al keri immerses during the day - so too, he should immerse during his days.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בִּימָמָא לָא מָצְיָא טָבְלָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל יְמֵי זוֹבָהּ כְּמִשְׁכַּב נִדָּתָהּ יִהְיֶה לָּהּ״, בְּלֵילְיָא מִיהַת לֶיעְבֵּיד מִקְצָת שִׁימּוּר, וְתִיטְבּוֹל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כֵּיוָן דְּבָעֲיָא סְפִירָה —
human_translation: And this one, cannot immerse on the day as it is written: “All the days of her issue shall be to her as the bed of her menstruation” at least during the night she should perform a partial observation, and immerse herself teaches us since she is required to count
llm_translation: And this, in the daytime, one does not find a ritual immersion, as it is written: "All the days of her discharge, she shall be as in her menstrual impurity; she shall be unclean." At night, one should perform some level of guarding, and then immerse. It is inferred for us that once it requires counting —

hebrew_text: סְפִירָה בִּימָמָא הִיא.
human_translation: counting during the day
llm_translation: Counting in the daytime it is.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁעָשׂוּ מִשֶּׁעָלָה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר כָּשֵׁר. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רָבָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיִּקְרָא אֱלֹהִים לָאוֹר יוֹם״, לַמֵּאִיר וּבָא קְרָאוֹ ״יוֹם״.
human_translation: And all these if one did them after daybreak they are valid. From where is this matter Rava said: As the verse states: “And God called the light day” To that which was becoming lighter and lighter he called day.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And all those who made from the twilight pillar of dawn valid. What is the reason? Rava said: As the verse states: "And God called the light Day," to the one that illuminates, and its name is called "Day."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״וְלַחֹשֶׁךְ קָרָא לָיְלָה״ [לַמַּחְשִׁיךְ וּבָא קָרָא לַיְלָה]? הָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּעַד צֵאת הַכּוֹכָבִים לָאו לַיְלָה הוּא!
human_translation: However, if so “And the darkness ḥoshekh He called night” That which was becoming darker and darker He called night, we maintain until the stars come out it is not nighttime?
llm_translation: Rather from now on: "And to darkness He called 'night'" to darken and it came, He called 'night'? This establishes for us that until the emergence of the stars is not night!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא, מֵהָכָא: ״וַאֲנַחְנוּ עוֹשִׂים בַּמְּלָאכָה וְחֶצְיָם מַחֲזִיקִים בָּרְמָחִים מֵעֲלוֹת הַשַּׁחַר עַד צֵאת הַכּוֹכָבִים״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״(וְהָיָה) לָנוּ הַלַּיְלָה (לְמִשְׁמָר)״.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Zeira said: from here, “So we labored in the work; and half of them held the spears from the rising of the morning till the stars appeared” and states: “So that in the night they may be a guard to us;
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Zeira said, from here: "And we are doing work, and half are holding spears from the rising of the dawn until the stars come out," and it says: "(And it shall be) for us the night (to guard)."

hebrew_text: מַאי וְאוֹמֵר? וְכִי תֵּימָא: מִשֶּׁעָלָה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר לָאו יְמָמָא, וּמִכִּי עָרְבָא שִׁמְשָׁא לֵילְיָא, וְאִינְהוּ מְקַדְּמִי וּמְחַשְּׁכִי — תָּא שְׁמַע: ״(וְהָיָה) לָנוּ הַלַּיְלָה מִשְׁמָר וְהַיּוֹם מְלָאכָה״.
human_translation: What “and it states”? You might say that after “the rising of the morning” it is not day, and that from when the sun sets it is night, and they began early, and remained late, Come hear that which “So that in the night they may be a guard to us; and labor in the day.”
llm_translation: What is meant by "and he says"? And if you were to say: From when the morning pillar rises, is it not daytime, and when the evening sun sets, it becomes night, and they are advancing and darkening - come and hear: "And it shall be for us a night guard and the day for work."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כָּשֵׁר לִקְרִיאַת הַמְּגִילָּה, וְלִקְרִיאַת הַהַלֵּל, וְלִתְקִיעַת שׁוֹפָר, וְלִנְטִילַת לוּלָב, וְלִתְפִלַּת הַמּוּסָפִין, וּלְמוּסָפִין,
human_translation: the entire day is a valid for reading the Megilla; for reciting hallel ; for sounding the shofar for taking the lulav for the additional prayer and for the additional offerings
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The entire day is fit for reading the Megillah, and for reading the Hallel, and for blowing the shofar, and for taking the lulav, and for the additional prayers, and for the Musaf prayers.

hebrew_text: וּלְוִידּוּי הַפָּרִים, וּלְוִידּוּי מַעֲשֵׂר, וּלְוִידּוּי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: And for the confession over the bulls for the declaration with regard to tithes and for the confession on Yom Kippur
llm_translation: And for the redemption of the calves, and for the redemption of the tithe, and for the redemption of the Day of Atonement.

hebrew_text: לִסְמִיכָה, לִשְׁחִיטָה, לִתְנוּפָה, לְהַגָּשָׁה, לִקְמִיצָה, וּלְהַקְטָרָה, לִמְלִיקָה, וּלְקַבָּלָה, וּלְהַזָּיָה,
human_translation: for placing hands for slaughtering for waving for bringing near for scooping out a fistful and for burning for pinching and for receiving and for sprinkling
llm_translation: Connection, slaughter, waving, bringing near, pinching, and offering incense, salting, receiving, and sprinkling.

hebrew_text: וּלְהַשְׁקָיַית סוֹטָה, וְלַעֲרִיפַת הָעֶגְלָה, וּלְטׇהֳרַת הַמְּצוֹרָע.
human_translation: And for giving a woman suspected by her husband of having been unfaithful [ sota ] to drink for breaking the neck and for purification process of the leper
llm_translation: For the giving to drink of the Sotah, and for the burning of the calf, and for the purification of the leper.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה כָּשֵׁר לִקְצִירַת הָעוֹמֶר, וּלְהֶקְטֵר חֲלָבִים, וְאֵבָרִים. זֶה הַכְּלָל: דָּבָר שֶׁמִּצְוָתוֹ בַּיּוֹם — כָּשֵׁר כׇּל הַיּוֹם. דָּבָר שֶׁמִּצְוָתוֹ בַּלַּיְלָה — כָּשֵׁר כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: The entire night is reaping the omer for burning the fats and the limbs This is the principle: Something that it is a mitzva during the day is valid the entire day; something that it is a mitzva at night is valid the entire night.
llm_translation: Throughout the entire night is valid for harvesting the Omer, and for offering up fats and limbs. This is the principle: a matter whose commandment is during the day is valid the entire day. A matter whose commandment is at night is valid the entire night.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָלַן? דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהַיָּמִים הָאֵלֶּה נִזְכָּרִים וְנַעֲשִׂים״. לִקְרִיאַת הַהַלֵּל, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִמִּזְרַח שֶׁמֶשׁ עַד מְבוֹאוֹ״. (רַבִּי יוֹסֵי) אוֹמֵר: ״זֶה הַיּוֹם עָשָׂה ה׳״.
human_translation: From where do we the verse states: “That these days should be remembered and kept” For reciting the hallel , that which is written “From the rising of the sun to its setting, Rabbi Yosei said: “This is the day that the Lord has made”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive this? As the verse states: "And these days are remembered and performed." For the reading of the Hallel, as it is written: "From the rising of the sun to its setting." (Rabbi Yosei) says: "This is the day that the Lord has made."

hebrew_text: וְלִנְטִילַת לוּלָב, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּלְקַחְתֶּם לָכֶם בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן״. וְלִתְקִיעַת שׁוֹפָר, דִּכְתִיב: ״יוֹם תְּרוּעָה יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״. וּלְמוּסָפִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״דְּבַר יוֹם בְּיוֹמוֹ״. וְלִתְפִלַּת הַמּוּסָפִין — כְּמוּסָפִין שַׁוְּיוּהָ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And for taking the lulav , as it is written: “And you shall take for yourselves on the first day for sounding the shofar , as it is written: “It is a day of sounding the shofar to you” for additional offerings as it is written each on its own day” And for the additional prayer, the Sages made it equivalent to additional offerings.
llm_translation: Regarding the taking of the lulav, as it is written: "And you shall take for yourselves on the first day." And for the blowing of the shofar, as it is written: "A day of blowing shall it be for you." And for the additional offerings, as it is written: "The matter of a day on its day." And for the prayer of the additional offerings - like the additional offerings, the Sages established it.

hebrew_text: וּלְוִידּוּי פָּרִים, דְּיָלֵיף ״כַּפָּרָה״ ״כַּפָּרָה״ מִיּוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. דְּתַנְיָא גַּבֵּי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים: ״וְכִפֶּר בַּעֲדוֹ וּבְעַד בֵּיתוֹ״ — בְּכַפָּרַת דְּבָרִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. וְכַפָּרָה בִּימָמָא הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה יְכַפֵּר עֲלֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: And the confession over the bulls, as derived atonement atonement Yom Kippur. As it is taught with regard to Yom Kippur, and atone for himself and for his household” The verse speaks of atonement words, And the atonement is during the day, as it is written: on that day will He atone for you”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for the confession of the bulls, that it is repeated "like the atonement" "like the atonement" from the day of Atonement. As it was taught regarding the day of Atonement: "And he shall make atonement for himself and for his household" — with the atonement of words the Scripture speaks. And atonement is in the daytime, as it is written: "On this day he shall make atonement for you." English translation:

hebrew_text: וּלְוִידּוּי מַעֲשֵׂר וְכוּ׳, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאָמַרְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ בִּעַרְתִּי הַקֹּדֶשׁ מִן הַבַּיִת״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מְצַוְּךָ״.
human_translation: And for the declaration with regard to tithes, as it is written “And you shall say before the Lord your God, I have removed the sacred things out of my house” and juxtaposed to “This day the Lord your God has commanded you
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for the declaration of tithes, etc., as it is written: "And you shall say before the Lord your God, 'I have removed the sacred portion from the house,'" and juxtaposed to it: "Today the Lord your God commands you."

hebrew_text: לִסְמִיכָה וְלִשְׁחִיטָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְסָמַךְ ... וְשָׁחַט״, וּכְתִיב בַּהּ בִּשְׁחִיטָה: ״בַּיּוֹם זִבְחֲכֶם״. וְלִתְנוּפָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּיוֹם הֲנִיפְכֶם אֶת הָעוֹמֶר״.
human_translation: For placing hands and for slaughtering as it is written: “And he shall lay and slaughter it” And it is written with regard to slaughtering: “On the day that you slaughter” And for waving as it is written: “And on the day you wave the omer ”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: For leaning and for slaughtering, as it is written: "And he shall lean ... and slaughter," and it is written in it regarding slaughtering: "on the day of your sacrifice." And for waving, as it is written: "on the day of your waving the sheaf."

hebrew_text: וּלְהַגָּשָׁה — דְּאִיתַּקַּשׁ לִתְנוּפָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן מִיַּד הָאִשָּׁה אֵת מִנְחַת הַקְּנָאוֹת וְהֵנִיף... וְהִקְרִיב״. וְלִמְלִיקָה וְלִקְמִיצָה וּלְהַקְטָרָה וּלְהַזָּיָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּיּוֹם צַוּוֹתוֹ אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: And to bringing near it is likened to waving, as it is written: “And the priest shall take the meal-offering of jealousy from the woman’s hand, and shall wave and sacrifice And for scooping out a fistful and for pinching and for burning and for sprinkling as it is written: the day that he commanded the children of Israel
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And for offering — for it is necessary for waving, as it is written: 'And the kohen shall take from the woman's hand the meal-offering of jealousy and shall wave... and shall present.' And for salting, and for scooping, and for burning, and for sprinkling, as it is written: 'On the day he commands the children of Israel.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: וּלְהַשְׁקָיַית סוֹטָה — אָתְיָא ״תּוֹרָה״ ״תּוֹרָה״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְעָשָׂה לָהּ הַכֹּהֵן אֵת כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה הַזֹּאת״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״עַל פִּי הַתּוֹרָה אֲשֶׁר יוֹרוּךָ וְעַל הַמִּשְׁפָּט״.
human_translation: And to giving the sota to drink is derived “Torah” “Torah.” It is written here “And the priest shall execute upon her all this Torah” and it is written there “According to the Torah, which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment,
llm_translation: To give the Sotah to drink - it was taught: "Torah, Torah." It is written here: "And the kohen shall do to her all this Torah," and it is written there: "According to the Torah which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment."

hebrew_text: מָה מִשְׁפָּט בַּיּוֹם — אַף כָּאן בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: Just as judgment by day, so too here, by day.
llm_translation: The judgment during the day - here too during the day.

hebrew_text: וְלַעֲרִיפַת הָעֶגְלָה, אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: כַּפָּרָה כְּתִיב בָּהּ, כְּקָדָשִׁים. וּלְטׇהֳרַת מְצוֹרָע, דִּכְתִיב: ״זֹאת תִּהְיֶה תּוֹרַת הַמְּצוֹרָע בְּיוֹם טׇהֳרָתוֹ״.
human_translation: And for breaking the neck of the heifer, the school of Rabbi Yannai said: Atonement is written with regard to like sacred And for purifying the leper, as it is written: “This shall be the law of the leper on the day of his cleansing”
llm_translation: For the ashes of the heifer, the House of Rabbi Yannai said: "Atonement is written in it, like the holy things." And for the purification of the leper, as it is written: "This shall be the law of the leper on the day of his cleansing."

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה כָּשֵׁר לִקְצִירַת הָעוֹמֶר וְכוּ׳, דְּאָמַר מָר: קְצִירָה וּסְפִירָה — בַּלַּיְלָה, וַהֲבָאָה — בַּיּוֹם. וּלְהֶקְטֵר חֲלָבִים וְאֵבָרִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה עַד הַבּוֹקֶר״.
human_translation: “The entire night is a valid reaping the omer ,” as the Master said reaping and the counting at night, whereas bringing during the day. And for burning the fats and limbs as it is written all night until the morning”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: All the night is valid for the harvesting of the Omer, etc., as Mar said: Harvesting and counting - at night, and bringing - during the day. And for offering up fats and limbs, as it is written: "All the night until the morning." English translation:

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: דָּבָר שֶׁמִּצְוָתוֹ בְּיוֹם — כָּשֵׁר כׇּל הַיּוֹם. זֶה הַכְּלָל לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי סִידּוּר בָּזִיכִין וְסִלּוּק בָּזִיכִין,
human_translation: This is the principle: Something that it is a mitzva during the day is valid performed the entire day. This is the principle, are to add what? to include the arranging of the vessels and the removal of vessels
llm_translation: This is the principle: a matter whose commandment is during the day - valid the entire day. What is the principle coming to include? It is coming to include the arrangement of the Bazichin and the removal of the Bazichin.

hebrew_text: וּכְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: סִילֵּק אֶת הַיְּשָׁנָה שַׁחֲרִית, וְסִידֵּר אֶת הַחֲדָשָׁה עַרְבִית — אֵין בְּכָךְ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: And in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei said: If one removed the old in the morning and arranged the new toward the evening, there is nothing with this,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And like Rabbi Yosei. As it was taught, Rabbi Yosei says: Remove the old one in the morning, and arrange the new one in the evening - this is nothing.

hebrew_text: וּמָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים (״לִפְנֵי ה׳ תָּמִיד״) — שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא שׁוּלְחָן בְּלֹא לֶחֶם.
human_translation: And, how do I uphold before the Lord continually” that the table should not be without the bread,
llm_translation: And how do I fulfill ( "before the Lord always") — that there should not be a table without bread.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר שֶׁמִּצְוָתוֹ בַּלַּיְלָה — כָּשֵׁר כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה. לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי?
human_translation: Something that it is a mitzva at night may be performed the entire night. What to add
llm_translation: A matter whose commandment is at night - valid all night. For what?

hebrew_text: לְאֵתוֹיֵי אֲכִילַת פְּסָחִים, וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאָכְלוּ אֶת הַבָּשָׂר בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״וְעָבַרְתִּי בְאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם בַּלַּיְלָה הַזֶּה״, מַה לְהַלָּן עַד חֲצוֹת, אַף כָּאן עַד חֲצוֹת.
human_translation: to include the eating of the Paschal offering, not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, as it is taught “And they shall eat the meat on that night” Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya said: It is stated here: “On that night,” and it is stated further on: “And I will pass through the land of Egypt on that night” Just as there, until midnight, so too here, until midnight.
llm_translation: For the purpose of eating the Passover offering, and not like Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah. As it was taught: "And they shall eat the flesh in this night," Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah said: It is stated here "in this night" and it is stated there "and I will pass through the land of Egypt in this night," just as there until midnight, so too here until midnight.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַקּוֹרֵא לְמַפְרֵעַ
llm_translation: The one who reads to the one who acts rebelliously is honored.

hebrew_text: הַקּוֹרֵא אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה — עוֹמֵד וְיוֹשֵׁב. קְרָאָהּ אֶחָד, קְרָאוּהָ שְׁנַיִם — יָצְאוּ. מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְבָרֵךְ — יְבָרֵךְ, וְשֶׁלֹּא לְבָרֵךְ — לֹא יְבָרֵךְ.
human_translation: One who reads the Megilla standing or sitting. one reads two read it they have fulfilled a place where are accustomed to recite a blessing one should recite a blessing. And not to recite a blessing, one should not recite a blessing.
llm_translation: One who reads the Megillah - stands and sits. If one person read it, and two read it - they have fulfilled their obligation. In a place where it is customary to recite a blessing - he should recite a blessing, and where it is not customary to recite a blessing - he should not recite a blessing.

hebrew_text: בְּשֵׁנִי, וַחֲמִישִׁי, בַּשַּׁבָּת בַּמִּנְחָה — קוֹרִין שְׁלֹשָׁה. אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מֵהֶן, וְאֵין מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן, וְאֵין מַפְטִירִין בַּנָּבִיא. הַפּוֹתֵחַ וְהַחוֹתֵם בַּתּוֹרָה — מְבָרֵךְ לְפָנֶיהָ וּלְאַחֲרֶיהָ.
human_translation: On Mondays and Thursdays and on Shabbat during the afternoon service, three read one may neither decrease nor add to them. And one does not conclude with Prophets the one who begins and the one who concludes the the Torah recite a blessing; before and after its
llm_translation: In the second and fifth aliyah, on Shabbat during Mincha - they read three verses. They do not read less than them, and they do not add to them, and they do not conclude with a prophet. One who opens and closes with the Torah - blesses before it and after it.

hebrew_text: בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים וּבְחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד — קוֹרִין אַרְבָּעָה. אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מֵהֶן, וְאֵין מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן, וְאֵין מַפְטִירִין בַּנָּבִיא. הַפּוֹתֵחַ וְהַחוֹתֵם בַּתּוֹרָה — מְבָרֵךְ לְפָנֶיהָ וּלְאַחֲרֶיהָ.
human_translation: On New Moon and on the intermediate days of a Festival, four read one may neither decrease nor add to them. And one does not conclude with Prophets. the one who begins and the one who concludes the Torah recite a blessing. before and after its
llm_translation: In the beginnings of the months and on the weekdays of the festivals - they read four. They do not decrease from them, and they do not add to them, and they do not conclude with a prophet. The one who begins and the one who concludes with the Torah - blesses before it and after it.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מוּסָף וְאֵינוֹ יוֹם טוֹב — קוֹרִין אַרְבָּעָה, בְּיוֹם טוֹב — חֲמִשָּׁה, בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — שִׁשָּׁה, בְּשַׁבָּת — שִׁבְעָה. אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מֵהֶן, אֲבָל מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן, וּמַפְטִירִין בַּנָּבִיא. הַפּוֹתֵחַ וְהַחוֹתֵם בַּתּוֹרָה — מְבָרֵךְ לְפָנֶיהָ וּלְאַחֲרֶיהָ.
human_translation: This is the principle: Any on which there is an additional offering and that is not a Festival, four read on a Festival, five on Yom Kippur, six on Shabbat, seven One may not decrease but one may add to them. And one concludes with Prophets. the one who begins and the one who concludes the the Torah recite a blessing; before and after its
llm_translation: This is the principle: Anything that has an additional offering and is not a festival day - we read four blessings, on a festival day - five, on Yom Kippur - six, on Shabbat - seven. One does not decrease from them, but may add to them, and concludes with the Prophets. One who begins and concludes with the Torah - blesses before it and after it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּתּוֹרָה. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאַתָּה פֹּה עֲמֹד עִמָּדִי״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אִלְמָלֵא מִקְרָא כָּתוּב, אִי אֶפְשָׁר לְאוֹמְרוֹ. כִּבְיָכוֹל אַף הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בַּעֲמִידָה.
human_translation: It was taught is not the case with regard to the Torah, From where are these matters Rabbi Abbahu said: as the verse states: “But as for you, stand here with Me, And Rabbi Abbahu said: Were the verse not written it would be impossible to utter it, as it were, even the Holy One, Blessed be He, was standing
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanah: Ma she'ein kein ba'Torah. Menahanei milei? Amar Rabbi Avahu, de'amar kra: 'Ve'atah po amod imadi,' ve'amar Rabbi Avahu: Ilmalei mikra katuv, ei efshar le'omro. Kivyachol af hakadosh baruch hu ba'amidah." English translation: "Gemara: It was taught: What is not so in the Torah. What are the benefits? Rabbi Avahu said, as the verse states: 'And you stand here with me,' and Rabbi Avahu said: Were it not for the verse written, it would be impossible to say it. Just as the Holy One, blessed be He, is able to stand."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מִנַּיִן לָרַב שֶׁלֹּא יֵשֵׁב עַל גַּבֵּי מִטָּה וְיִשְׁנֶה לְתַלְמִידוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה פֹּה עֲמֹד עִמָּדִי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Abbahu said: From where that the teacher should not sit on a couch and teach his disciple on the ground? as it is stated: “But as for you, stand here with Me,”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Avahu said: From where do we derive that a teacher should not sit on a bed and sleep while his student is standing on the ground, as it is stated: "But you, stand here with me."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִימוֹת מֹשֶׁה וְעַד רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לֹא הָיוּ לְמֵדִין תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא מְעוּמָּד. מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, יָרַד חוֹלִי לָעוֹלָם וְהָיוּ לְמֵדִין תּוֹרָה מְיוּשָּׁב. וְהַיְינוּ דִּתְנַן: מִשֶּׁמֵּת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בָּטַל כְּבוֹד תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: the Sages taught: From the days of Moses until Rabban Gamliel, they would study Torah only while standing, When Rabban Gamliel died, weakness descended to the world, and they would study Torah while sitting. And this is as we learned When Rabban Gamliel died, honor the Torah ceased,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: From the days of Moses until Rabban Gamliel, they would only study Torah standing. From the time Rabban Gamliel died, illness came into the world, and they began studying Torah sitting. And this is what we learned: From the time Rabban Gamliel died, the honor of Torah was nullified.

hebrew_text: כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״וָאֵשֵׁב בָּהָר״, וְכָתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״וְאָנֹכִי עָמַדְתִּי בָּהָר״! אָמַר רַב: עוֹמֵד וְלוֹמֵד, יוֹשֵׁב וְשׁוֹנֶה. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: לֹא עוֹמֵד וְלֹא יוֹשֵׁב אֶלָּא שׁוֹחֶה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵין ״יְשִׁיבָה״ אֶלָּא לְשׁוֹן עַכָּבָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתֵּשְׁבוּ בְקָדֵשׁ יָמִים רַבִּים״. רָבָא אָמַר: רַכּוֹת מְעוּמָּד, וְקָשׁוֹת מְיוּשָּׁב.
human_translation: One verse says: “And I sat [ va’eshev ] on the mount” and another verse says: “And I stood on the mount” Rav said: stand and learn sit and review Rabbi Ḥanina said: not standing or sitting, but rather bowing. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: yeshiva is nothing more than an expression of remaining as it is stated: “And you dwelled [ vateshvu ] in Kadesh for many days” Rava said: easy standing and difficult sitting.
llm_translation: It is written: one says, "and I sat on the mountain," and it is written: one says, "and I stood on the mountain!" Rav said: one stands and learns, sits and repeats. Rabbi Chanina said: one neither stands nor sits but rather leans. Rabbi Yochanan said: "Yeshiva" means only a language of delay, as it is said: "And they sat in Kadesh for many days." Rava said: soft when standing, hard when sitting.

hebrew_text: קְרָאָהּ אֶחָד, קְרָאוּהָ שְׁנַיִם יָצְאוּ וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: one reads two read it they have fulfilled
llm_translation: The verse called it one, they called it two, they have fulfilled and so on.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּתּוֹרָה. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בַּתּוֹרָה — אֶחָד קוֹרֵא וְאֶחָד מְתַרְגֵּם, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא אֶחָד קוֹרֵא וּשְׁנַיִם מְתַרְגְּמִין. וּבַנָּבִיא — אֶחָד קוֹרֵא וּשְׁנַיִם מְתַרְגְּמִין, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ שְׁנַיִם קוֹרִין וּשְׁנַיִם מְתַרְגְּמִין. וּבַהַלֵּל וּבַמְּגִילָּה — אֲפִילּוּ עֲשָׂרָה קוֹרִין וַעֲשָׂרָה מְתַרְגְּמִין.
human_translation: It was taught: is not the case with regard to the Torah, The Sages taught the Torah, one reads and one may translate provided that there are not one reading and two translating, And the Prophets, one reads and two may translate, provided that there are not two reading and two translating. And hallel and the Megilla, even ten may read and ten may translate.
llm_translation: Mishna: That which is not so in the Torah. The Rabbis taught: In the Torah - one reads and one translates, provided that not one reads and two translate. And in the Prophets - one reads and two translate, provided that not two read and two translate. And in Hillel and in the Megillah - even ten read and ten translate.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דַּחֲבִיבָה — יָהֲבִי דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ וְשָׁמְעִי.
human_translation: What is the reason Since is cherished they will pay attention and hear it,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Since it is beloved - he gave his opinion and listened.

hebrew_text: מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לְבָרֵךְ — יְבָרֵךְ. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְאַחֲרֶיהָ, אֲבָל לְפָנֶיהָ — מִצְוָה לְבָרֵךְ. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת כּוּלָּן מְבָרֵךְ עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹבֵר לַעֲשִׂיָּיתָן.
human_translation: a place where are accustomed to recite a blessing one should recite a blessing. Abaye said: They taught only after But before a mitzva to recite the blessing Rav Yehuda said that Shmuel said: With regard to all the mitzvot, one recites a blessing over them prior to [ over ] their performance.
llm_translation: The place where they are accustomed to bless - he shall bless. Abaye said: They only taught this regarding after it, but before it - it is a mitzvah to bless. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: One who performs all the mitzvot, he blesses upon them as he fulfills them.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״עוֹבֵר״ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאַקְדּוֹמֵי הוּא? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיָּרׇץ אֲחִימַעַץ דֶּרֶךְ הַכִּכָּר וַיַּעֲבֹר אֶת הַכּוּשִׁי״. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְהוּא עָבַר לִפְנֵיהֶם״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, מֵהָכָא: ״וַיַּעֲבֹר מַלְכָּם לִפְנֵיהֶם וַה׳ בְּרֹאשָׁם״.
human_translation: From where be inferred that over is the language of precedence? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said that the verse states: “And Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and overran [ vaya’avor ] the Cushite” Abaye said: from here: “And he passed [ avar ] before them” And if you wish, say from here: “And their king passed [ vaya’avor ] before them and the Lord at their head”
llm_translation: What is the implication that this "passerby" is in front of them? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, a verse says: "Achimaaz ran by way of the plain and passed the Cushite." Abbaye said from here: "And he passed before them." And if you wish, say from here: "And their king passed before them, and the Lord at their head."

hebrew_text: לְפָנֶיהָ מַאי מְבָרֵךְ? רַב שֵׁשֶׁת מִקַּטְרַזְיָא אִיקְּלַע לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי וּבָרֵיךְ מנ״‎ח.
human_translation: What blessing is recited before Rav Sheshet from Katrazya happened before Rav Ashi, and he recited blessings, mem , nun , ḥet :
llm_translation: Before it, what does one bless? Rav Sheshet from Kafriya happened to come before Rav Ashi and he blessed: "Who nourishes all."

hebrew_text: לְאַחֲרֶיהָ מַאי מְבָרֵךְ? בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ מֶלֶךְ הָעוֹלָם (הָאֵל) הָרָב אֶת רִיבֵנוּ וְהַדָּן אֶת דִּינֵנוּ וְהַנּוֹקֵם אֶת נִקְמָתֵנוּ וְהַנִּפְרָע לָנוּ מִצָּרֵינוּ וְהַמְשַׁלֵּם גְּמוּל לְכׇל אוֹיְבֵי נַפְשֵׁנוּ, בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ הַנִּפְרָע לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מִכׇּל צָרֵיהֶם. רָבָא אָמַר: הָאֵל הַמּוֹשִׁיעַ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הִלְכָּךְ — נֵימְרִינְהוּ לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ: בָּרוּךְ אַתָּה ה׳ הַנִּפְרָע לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מִכׇּל צָרֵיהֶם הָאֵל הַמּוֹשִׁיעַ.
human_translation: What blessing is recited after Blessed are You, Lord our God, King of the universe, the God Who pleads our cause, and Who judges our claim, and Who avenges our vengeance, and Who punishes our foes, and Who brings retribution to our enemies. Blessed are You, Lord, Who, on behalf of Israel, exacts punishment from all of their foes. Rava said: the God who brings salvation. Rav Pappa said: Therefore, we should say both of them: Blessed are you, Lord, Who, on behalf of Israel, exacts punishment from all their foes; the God Who brings salvation.
llm_translation: After it, what does one bless? Blessed are You, Hashem our God, King of the world (the God) who pleads our cause, judges our judgment, avenges our vengeance, brings retribution upon our enemies, and repays all our adversaries, Blessed are You, Hashem, who brings retribution for Israel from all their enemies. Rava said: The saving God. Rav Papa said: Therefore, they said together: Blessed are You, Hashem, who brings retribution for Israel from all their enemies, the saving God.

hebrew_text: בְּשֵׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי בַּשַּׁבָּת בַּמִּנְחָה קוֹרִין שְׁלֹשָׁה וְכוּ׳. הָנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה, כְּנֶגֶד מִי? אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: כְּנֶגֶד תּוֹרָה נְבִיאִים וּכְתוּבִים. רָבָא אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד כֹּהֲנִים לְוִיִּם וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים.
human_translation: On Mondays and Thursdays and on Shabbat during the afternoon service, three read Corresponding to what were these three Rav Asi said: They correspond Pentateuch, Prophets, and Writings. Rava said: They correspond to Priests, Levites, and Israelites.
llm_translation: On Monday and Thursday during the afternoon prayer, three people read the Torah portion. These three, against whom? Rav Assi said: Against the Torah, Prophets, and Writings. Rava said: Against the Priests, Levites, and Israelites.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּתָנֵי רַב שִׁימִי: אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מֵעֲשָׂרָה פְּסוּקִין בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, ״וַיְדַבֵּר״ עוֹלֶה מִן הַמִּנְיָן. הָנֵי עֲשָׂרָה כְּנֶגֶד מִי?
human_translation: But this that Rav Shimi taught: One may not decrease ten verses in the synagogue, “And spoke is included in the count, to what do these ten correspond?
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rav Shimi teaches: Not less than ten verses in the synagogue, "And He spoke" counts towards the total. Those ten correspond to whom?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כְּנֶגֶד עֲשָׂרָה בַּטְלָנִין שֶׁבְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת. רַב יוֹסֵף: אָמַר כְּנֶגֶד עֲשֶׂרֶת הַדִּבְּרוֹת שֶׁנֶּאֶמְרוּ לְמֹשֶׁה בְּסִינַי. (רַבִּי לֵוִי אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד עֲשָׂרָה הִילּוּלִין שֶׁאָמַר דָּוִד בְּסֵפֶר תְּהִלִּים.) וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד עֲשָׂרָה מַאֲמָרוֹת שֶׁבָּהֶן נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: correspond to the ten idlers that are in the synagogue, Rav Yosef said: correspond to the Ten Commandments that were spoken to Moses at Sinai. Rabbi Levi said: correspond to the ten praise David said in the book of Psalms. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They correspond to the ten utterances with which the world was created.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Corresponding to the ten handbreadths in the synagogue. Rav Yosef said: He said corresponding to the Ten Commandments that were spoken to Moses at Sinai. (Rabbi Levi said: Corresponding to the ten expressions that David said in the Book of Psalms.) And Rabbi Yochanan said: Corresponding to the ten statements by which the world was created.

hebrew_text: הֵי נִינְהוּ? ״וַיֹּאמֶר״ דִּבְרֵאשִׁית. הָנֵי תִּשְׁעָה הָווּ! ״בְּרֵאשִׁית״ נָמֵי מַאֲמָר הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״בִּדְבַר ה׳ שָׁמַיִם נַעֲשׂוּ וּבְרוּחַ פִּיו כׇּל צְבָאָם״.
human_translation: What are these “and said” Genesis. there are nine of these “In the beginning” is also an utterance, as it is written: “By the word of the Lord were the heavens made; and all the host of them by the breath of His mouth”
llm_translation: They were? "And He said" in Genesis. They were nine! "In the beginning" is also a statement, as it is written: "By the word of the Lord the heavens were made, and by the breath of His mouth all their host."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁקָּרָא אַרְבָּעָה — מְשׁוּבָּח, שֵׁנִי שֶׁקָּרָא אַרְבָּעָה — מְשׁוּבָּח, שְׁלִישִׁי שֶׁקָּרָא אַרְבָּעָה — מְשׁוּבָּח.
human_translation: Rava said: the first read four he is praiseworthy; the second one read four he is praiseworthy; the third one read four he is praiseworthy.
llm_translation: Rava said, the first time he read four - praiseworthy, the second time he read four - praiseworthy, the third time he read four - praiseworthy.

hebrew_text: רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁקָּרָא אַרְבָּעָה מְשׁוּבָּח — דִּתְנַן: בְּשָׁלֹשׁ קוּפּוֹת שֶׁל שָׁלֹשׁ סְאִין שֶׁבָּהֶן תּוֹרְמִין אֶת הַלִּשְׁכָּה, וְהָיָה כָּתוּב עֲלֵיהֶן אב״‎ג, לֵידַע אֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן נִתְרְמָה רִאשׁוֹן, לְהַקְרִיב מִמֶּנָּה רִאשׁוֹן — שֶׁמִּצְוָה בָּרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: If the first read four he is praiseworthy as we learned removes from the chamber, with three baskets, three se’a . On is written, alef , beit , gimmel , to know which of them was removed first, to sacrifice from first, as it is a mitzva the first
llm_translation: First, who read four praised - as we learned: with three baskets of three se'ahs each, from which they would heap up the chamber, and it was written upon them אב״ג, to know which of them was heaped up first, to bring from it first - for the mitzvah is with the first.

hebrew_text: אֶמְצָעִי שֶׁקָּרָא אַרְבָּעָה מְשׁוּבָּח — דְּתַנְיָא: ״אֶל מוּל פְּנֵי הַמְּנוֹרָה יָאִירוּ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמְּצַדֵּד פְּנֵיהֶם כְּלַפֵּי נֵר מַעֲרָבִי, וְנֵר מַעֲרָבִי כְּלַפֵּי שְׁכִינָה. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִכָּאן שֶׁאֶמְצָעִי מְשׁוּבָּח.
human_translation: the middle one read four he is praiseworthy, as it is taught shall give light in front of the candelabrum” this teaches that turns the front toward western lamp and western lamp toward the Divine Presence. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: from here that the middle one is praiseworthy.
llm_translation: Middle that called four praiseworthy — as it was taught: "Towards the face of the menorah shall the lamps give light," teaching that they should be inclined towards the center, opposite the western lamp, and the western lamp opposite the Divine Presence. And Rabbi Yochanan said: From here it is praiseworthy in the middle.

hebrew_text: וְאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁקָּרָא אַרְבָּעָה מְשׁוּבָּח — מִשּׁוּם מַעֲלִין בַּקֹּדֶשׁ וְלֹא מוֹרִידִין. רַב פָּפָּא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא דַּאֲבִי גוֹבָר וְקָרָא רִאשׁוֹן אַרְבָּעָה, וְשַׁבְּחֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא.
human_translation: And if the last one read four he is praiseworthy, due to one elevates sanctity and does not downgrade. Rav Pappa happened to the synagogue of Avi Gover, and the first person read four and Rav Pappa praised him.
llm_translation: The last one who read four praises - because they ascend in holiness and do not descend. Rav Papa entered the synagogue of Avi Gobar and read the first four, and Rav Papa praised him.

hebrew_text: אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מֵהֶן וְאֵין מוֹסִיפִין. תָּנָא: הַפּוֹתֵחַ — מְבָרֵךְ לְפָנֶיהָ, וְהַחוֹתֵם — מְבָרֵךְ לְאַחֲרֶיהָ.
human_translation: one may neither decrease nor add to them. It is taught The one who begins recites a blessing before and the one who concludes recites a blessing after
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "They do not decrease from them, and they do not add. It was taught: One who opens - blesses before it, and one who closes - blesses after it."

hebrew_text: וְהָאִידָּנָא, דְּכוּלְּהוּ מְבָרְכִי לְפָנֶיהָ וּלְאַחֲרֶיהָ — הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּתַקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם הַנִּכְנָסִין וּמִשּׁוּם הַיּוֹצְאִין.
human_translation: And now that all recite blessings before and after this is the reason that the Sages instituted a decree due to those who enter and due to those who leave
llm_translation: And now, that in all of them bless before her and after her — that is the reason the Rabbis instituted: a decree due to those who enter and those who exit.

hebrew_text: בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים וּבְחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד קוֹרִין אַרְבָּעָה וְכוּ׳. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ עוּלָּא בַּר רַב מֵרָבָא: פָּרָשַׁת רֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ, כֵּיצַד קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ? ״צַו אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם אֶת קׇרְבָּנִי לַחְמִי״, דְּהָוְיָין תְּמָנְיָא פְּסוּקֵי, הֵיכִי נֶעְבֵּיד?
human_translation: On New Moon and on the intermediate days of a Festival, four read Ulla bar Rav raised a dilemma before Rava: The portion on the New Moon How does one read it “Command the children of Israel and say to them, My offering, the provision which is eight verses, what shall we do?
llm_translation: In the beginnings of the months and on the weekdays of the festivals, they read four and so forth. Ula son of Rav Merava asked: The portion of Rosh Chodesh, how is it read? "Command the children of Israel and say to them: My offering, My bread," which are eight verses, how are they arranged?

hebrew_text: נִיקְרֵי תְּרֵי תְּלָתָא תְּלָתָא פְּסוּקִין — פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ תְּרֵי, וְאֵין מְשַׁיְּירִין בַּפָּרָשָׁה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִין. נִיקְרֵי אַרְבָּעָה אַרְבְּעָה — פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ שִׁבְעָה, ״וּבְיוֹם הַשַּׁבָּת״ הָוַיִין תְּרֵי, ״וּבְרָאשֵׁי חׇדְשֵׁיכֶם״ הָוַיִין חֲמִשָּׁה, הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? נִיקְרֵי תְּרֵי מֵהָא וְחַד מֵהָנָךְ —
human_translation: the two should read three verses each, there will remain two verses one may not leave fewer than three verses a paragraph should read four each seven will be left “And on Shabbat day” is two “And on the beginnings of your months” is five What shall we do reads two from this and one of those
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Two verses, three verses, three verses — they are divided into two, and we do not leave less than three verses in the portion. Four verses, four verses — they are divided into seven, 'and on the Sabbath day' counts as two, 'and at the beginnings of your months' counts as five, what shall we do? Two are read from here and one from there —"

hebrew_text: אֵין מַתְחִילִין בַּפָּרָשָׁה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים. לִיקְרֵי תְּרֵי מֵהָא וּתְלָתָא מֵהָךְ, פָּשׁוּ לְהוּ תְּרֵי!
human_translation: one may not begin paragraph fewer than three verses he should read two from this and three from that only two remain
llm_translation: We do not begin the portion with less than three verses. Let two be read from here and three from there, so that two are clear!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: זוֹ לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי, כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ שָׁמַעְתִּי, דִּתְנַן: בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן — ״בְּרֵאשִׁית״ וִ״יְהִי רָקִיעַ״, וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: ״בְּרֵאשִׁית״ — בִּשְׁנַיִם, ״יְהִי רָקִיעַ״ — בְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: said to him: I have not heard this with regard to a similar I heard as we learned On Sunday, “In the beginning” and “Let there be a firmament” And it is taught in that regard “In the beginning” by two “Let there be a firmament” by one
llm_translation: He said to him: "This I did not hear, but something similar to it I did hear, as we learned: On the first day - 'In the beginning' and 'Let there be a firmament,' and it was taught about it: 'In the beginning' - in two, 'Let there be a firmament' - in one."

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: בִּשְׁלָמָא ״יְהִי רָקִיעַ״ בְּאֶחָד, דִּתְלָתָא פְּסוּקֵי הָווּ, אֶלָּא ״בְּרֵאשִׁית״ בִּשְׁנַיִם? חַמְשָׁה פְּסוּקֵי הָווּ, וְתַנְיָא: הַקּוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה לֹא יִפְחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים!
human_translation: And we discussed it: Granted, “Let there be a firmament” by one as it three verses. But “In the beginning” by two? five verses, and it was taught One who reads from the Torah should not fewer than three verses.
llm_translation: We were in it: Granted "let there be a firmament" is in one, for three verses were stated, but "in the beginning" is in two? There are five verses stated, and it was taught: One who reads in the Torah should not read less than three verses!

hebrew_text: וְאִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, רַב אָמַר: דּוֹלֵג. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: פּוֹסֵק.
human_translation: And it was stated with regard to Rav said: repeats And Shmuel said: divides
llm_translation: And it was taught: He ascended, Rav said: He is liable. And Shmuel said: He is exempt.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר דּוֹלֵג, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר פּוֹסֵק? קָסָבַר: כֹּל פְּסוּקָא דְּלָא פַּסְקֵיהּ מֹשֶׁה — אֲנַן לָא פָּסְקִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav said repeats What is the reason he did not state divides He holds any verse that Moses did not divide, we may not divide.
llm_translation: Rav said: He is silent. What is the reason he did not say "he rules"? He holds: any ruling that Moses did not rule, we do not rule.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר פָּסְקִינַן לֵיהּ? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא קָרָא: צַעַר גָּדוֹל הָיָה לִי אֵצֶל רַבִּי חֲנִינָא הַגָּדוֹל, וְלֹא הִתִּיר לִי לִפְסוֹק אֶלָּא לְתִינוֹקוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבָּן, הוֹאִיל וּלְהִתְלַמֵּד עֲשׂוּיִין.
human_translation: Does Shmuel say we may divide Didn’t Rabbi Ḥananya Kara, say: I had great distress with Rabbi Ḥanina the Great; and he permitted me to divide only for the schoolchildren, since they to be taught
llm_translation: Samuel said, "Do we conclude with him?" But didn't Rabbi Hananiah say a verse: "I had great difficulty with Rabbi Hanina the Great, and he only allowed me to conclude with the schoolchildren of the academy, since they are fit to study."

hebrew_text: הָתָם טַעְמָא מַאי — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: There, what is the reason Because it is not possible Here, too, it is not possible
llm_translation: There, what is the reason? - Because it is not possible. Here too, it is not possible.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר פּוֹסֵק, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר דּוֹלֵג? גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם הַנִּכְנָסִין וּמִשּׁוּם הַיּוֹצְאִין.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: divides What is the reason he did not state repeats decree due to those who enter and those who leave
llm_translation: Samuel said: What is the reason that he did not say "Doleg"? A decree because of those who enter and those who leave.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: פָּרָשָׁה שֶׁל שִׁשָּׁה פְּסוּקִים קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ בִּשְׁנַיִם, וְשֶׁל חֲמִשָּׁה פְּסוּקִים בְּיָחִיד. קָרָא רִאשׁוֹן שְׁלֹשָׁה — הַשֵּׁנִי קוֹרֵא שְׁנַיִם מִפָּרָשָׁה זוֹ וְאֶחָד מִפָּרָשָׁה אַחֶרֶת. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים שְׁלֹשָׁה, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מַתְחִילִין בַּפָּרָשָׁה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים.
human_translation: raises an objection Two read a paragraph of six verses, but of five a single the first read three the second reads two from this paragraph one from another, paragraph. And some say three one may not begin paragraph fewer than three verses
llm_translation: Challenger: A portion of six verses is read by two, and a portion of five verses by one. The first reads three — the second reads two from this portion and one from another portion. And some say three, because we do not begin a portion with less than three verses.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דּוֹלֵג — נִדְלוֹג, וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר פּוֹסֵק — נִפְסוֹק!
human_translation: And if it is so, according to the one who said repeats let him repeat And according to the one who said divides let him divide
llm_translation: "And if it is stated, according to the one who says 'doleg' - he should be pushed aside, and according to the one who says 'posek' - he should be cut off!"

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאֶפְשָׁר בְּהָכִי.
human_translation: There, it is different, as it is possible to in this
llm_translation: The difference there is that it is possible in this way.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים, וְאָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֵין מַתְחִילִין בַּפָּרָשָׁה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים, כָּךְ אֵין מְשַׁיְּירִין בַּפָּרָשָׁה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum said that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The halakha is in accordance with Some say, And Rabbi Tanḥum said that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Just as one may not begin paragraph fewer than three verses so too, one may not leave fewer than three verses a paragraph
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Tanhuma said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The halakha is in accordance with those who say, and Rabbi Tanhuma said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Just as one does not begin a portion with less than three verses, so too one does not leave over a portion with less than three verses.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה אַתְחַלְתָּא, דְּקָא מַקֵּיל תַּנָּא קַמָּא — מַחְמְירִי יֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים, שִׁיּוּר, דְּמַחְמִיר תַּנָּא קַמָּא — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּמַחְמְירִי יֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים?!
human_translation: is obvious. Now, the beginning the first tanna is lenient Some say, is stringent, leaving the first tanna is stringent not all the more so Some say, is stringent?
llm_translation: It is obvious! Now, what are you relying on, that you are lenient, the first Tanna is stringent - some say, the explanation, that if the first Tanna is stringent - all the more so the second Tanna is stringent?!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נִכְנָסִין שְׁכִיחִי, יוֹצְאִין לָא שְׁכִיחִי, דְּמַנְּחִי סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וְנָפְקִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say: Entering is common, leaving abandons a Torah scroll and leaves, is not common, teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "What is the reason: If the prominent ones enter, the less prominent ones leave, for when they bring out the Torah scroll, it is evident to us."

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא מַאי שְׁנָא שַׁיּוֹרֵי דְּלָא — מִשּׁוּם יוֹצְאִין, אַתְחוֹלֵי נָמֵי, גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם הַנִּכְנָסִין? אָמְרִי: מַאן דְּעָיֵיל שַׁיּוֹלֵי [מְ]שַׁיֵּיל.
human_translation: And the first tanna , what is different leaving which not due to those who leave beginning also decree due to those who enter, Say one who enters asks
llm_translation: The first Tanna: What is the difference between the gatekeepers who are not allowed to eat - because they are considered as those who leave the Temple, and the watchmen who are allowed to eat? They said: Whoever brings out items should bring in items.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הִלְכְתָא מַאי? שְׁלַח לֵיהּ, הִלְכְתָא: דּוֹלֵג, וְאֶמְצָעִי דּוֹלְגָן.
human_translation: Rabba, son of Rava, sent to Rav Yosef: What is the halakha sent him The halakha is one repeats and the middle repeats
llm_translation: Send to him Rabba, son of Rava, to Rav Yosef: What is the law? Send to him, the law: That one may leap, and the middle one of the leapers.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל, כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מוּסָף וְכוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: תַּעֲנִית צִבּוּר בְּכַמָּה? רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ וּמוֹעֵד דְּאִיכָּא קׇרְבַּן מוּסַף — אַרְבָּעָה, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלֵיכָּא קׇרְבַּן מוּסַף — לָא. אוֹ דִלְמָא: הָכָא נָמֵי אִיכָּא מוּסַף תְּפִלָּה.
human_translation: This is the principle: Any on which there is an additional offering A dilemma was raised before a public fast, how many the New Moon and a Festival, when there is an additional offering, four but here, when there is no additional offering, no, Or perhaps here, too, there is an additional prayer,
llm_translation: This is the principle: anything that includes an additional offering, etc. It was asked: A communal fast on what day of the week? Rosh Chodesh and a festival that has a additional offering - four, but here where there is no additional offering - not. Or perhaps: here too there is an additional prayer offering.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים וּבְחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד קוֹרִין אַרְבָּעָה, הָא בְּתַעֲנִית צִבּוּר שְׁלֹשָׁה! אֵימָא רֵישָׁא: בְּשֵׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי וּבַשַּׁבָּת בַּמִּנְחָה קוֹרִין שְׁלֹשָׁה: הָא תַּעֲנִית צִבּוּר אַרְבָּעָה! אֶלָּא מֵהָא לֵיכָּא לְמִישְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear that which On New Moon and on the intermediate days of a Festival, four read Doesn’t on a public fast, three Say the first clause On Mondays and Thursdays and on Shabbat during the afternoon service, three read Doesn’t a public fast, four Rather, nothing can be derived from this
llm_translation: Come and hear: At the beginning of the months and on the weekdays of the festival, we read four aliyot, but on a public fast day, we read three! Say at the beginning: On Monday, Thursday, and Shabbat during Mincha, we read three: but on a public fast day, we read four! Rather, from here it is not to be inferred.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּרַב אִיקְּלַע לְבָבֶל בְּתַעֲנִית צִבּוּר, קָם קְרָא בְּסִיפְרָא. פְּתַח בָּרֵיךְ, חֲתַים וְלָא בָּרֵיךְ. נְפוּל כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אַאַנְפַּיְיהוּ, וְרַב לָא נְפַל עַל אַפֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Come hear Rav happened to Babylonia on a public fast. He stood and read from scroll. he began he recited a blessing, he concluded, he did not recite a blessing. Everyone fell on their faces, but Rav did not fall on his face.
llm_translation: Come and hear: When Rav traveled to Babylon during a public fast, he stood up and read from a scroll. He began with a blessing but did not conclude with a blessing. The entire world collapsed, but Rav did not collapse on his face.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי רַב בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל קְרָא, מַאי טַעְמָא חֲתַם וְלָא בָּרֵיךְ? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּבָעֵי לְמִיקְרֵי אַחֲרִינָא בָּתְרֵיהּ?
human_translation: Now, Rav read an Israelite, What, is the reason he concluded he did not recite a blessing? Was it not because another was to read after him,
llm_translation: From the fact that Rav in the Land of Israel read, what is the reason that he concluded and did not bless? Is it not because he wanted to be called after others after him?

hebrew_text: לָא, רַב בְּכָהֲנֵי קְרָא. דְּהָא רַב הוּנָא קָרֵי בְּכָהֲנֵי.
human_translation: No, Rav read priests. as Rav Huna would read priests,
llm_translation: No, Rav in the case of priests. Because Rav Huna is called in the case of priests.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַב הוּנָא קָרֵי בְּכָהֲנֵי, דְּהָא אֲפִילּוּ רַב אַמֵּי וְרַב אַסִּי דְּכָהֲנֵי חֲשִׁיבִי דְּאַרְעָא יִשְׂרָאֵל, מִיכָּף כַּיְיפִי לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא. אֶלָּא רַב — הָא אִיכָּא שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּכָהֲנָא הֲוָה, וְדָבַר עֲלֵיהּ!
human_translation: Granted, Rav Huna read priests, as even Rav Ami and Rav Asi, the most esteemed priests in Eretz Yisrael, were subordinate to Rav Huna, However, Rav, there was Shmuel, who was a priest, and elevated above himself,
llm_translation: In truth, Rav Huna calls them "Kohanim," for even Rav Ammi and Rav Assi, who are considered Kohanim of the land of Israel, would bow to him. Rather, Rav—there was Shmuel, who was a Kohen, and he spoke about it!

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל נָמֵי מִיכָּף הֲוָה כַּיִיף לֵיהּ לְרַב, וְרַב הוּא דַּעֲבַד לֵיהּ כָּבוֹד, וְכִי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ — בְּפָנָיו, שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו — לָא עָבֵיד לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel was also subordinate to Rav, and it was Rav who showed honor And he did this in his presence, when he was not in his presence, did not do this,
llm_translation: Shmuel Nami of Michaf was like a son to Rav, and Rav would show him honor. And when he would do something for him, whether in his presence or not in his presence, he would not do it for him.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּרַב בְּכָהֲנֵי קְרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל קְרָא, לְפָנֶיהָ מַאי טַעְמָא בָּרֵיךְ! לְאַחַר תַּקָּנָה.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable Rav read from priests, because if it enters your mind to say he read from an Israelite, what is the reason he recited a blessing before after it was instituted
llm_translation: So was stated: It is fitting for Rav in matters of the priesthood, for if you were to say that the verse is speaking of Israel, what is the reason for the blessing before it? It is after the enactment.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לְאַחֲרֶיהָ נָמֵי לְבָרֵיךְ! שָׁאנֵי הֵיכָא דְּיָתֵיב רַב — דְּמֵיעָל עָיְילִי,
human_translation: If so, he should also have recited a blessing after it was different where Rav was present, as would enter
llm_translation: If so, afterwards, let him also come to the west! This is different from where Rav was sitting - for they went up.

hebrew_text: מִיפָּק לָא נָפְקִי.
human_translation: they would not leave
llm_translation: From where did he go out? He did not go out.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ בִּיטּוּל מְלָאכָה לָעָם, כְּגוֹן תַּעֲנִית צִבּוּר וְתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב — קוֹרִין שְׁלֹשָׁה,
human_translation: Come hear This is the principle: Any on which a deprivation of labor for the masses, for example, a public fast day and the Ninth of Av, three read
llm_translation: Come and hear, this is the principle: anything that involves refraining from work for the public, such as a communal fast or the Ninth of Av - we read three Torah portions.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁאֵין בּוֹ בִּיטּוּל מְלָאכָה לָעָם, כְּגוֹן רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים וְחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד — קוֹרִין אַרְבָּעָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: But on which not a deprivation of labor for the masses, for example, the New Moon, and on the intermediate days of a Festival, four read learn from here
llm_translation: And that which does not involve cessation of work for the public, such as the beginning of months and the eve of a festival - we read the Torah portion in a group of four. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, וְהָא אֲנַן לָא תְּנַן הָכִי: זֶה הַכְּלָל, כׇּל יוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ מוּסָף וְאֵינוֹ יוֹם טוֹב — קוֹרִין אַרְבָּעָה. לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵתוֹיֵי תַּעֲנִית צִיבּוּר וְתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב!
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Didn’t we learn in the mishna as follows: This is the principle: Any day on which there is an additional offering and is not a Festival, four read What is added Does it not to add a public fast and the Ninth of Av,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said, "But do we not teach it thus: This is the general principle - every day that has a Musaf sacrifice but is not a festival, we read four Torah portions. To what does this refer? Not to the fast of the congregation and the ninth of Av!"

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב אָשֵׁי מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? לָא תַּנָּא קַמָּא וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשֵׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי — קוֹרִין שְׁלֹשָׁה וּמַפְטִיר אֶחָד. בִּשְׁלִישִׁי וּבִרְבִיעִי — קוֹרֵא אֶחָד וּמַפְטִיר אֶחָד. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם קוֹרִין שְׁלֹשָׁה וּמַפְטִיר אֶחָד!
human_translation: But according to Rav Ashi, who is the mishna? It is not the first tanna and not Rabbi Yosei. As it is taught occurs on a Monday or a Thursday, three read And one concludes on a Tuesday or a Wednesday, one reads and one concludes Rabbi Yosei said: Three always read and one concludes
llm_translation: And for Rav Ashei, Mishnaic teaching, who is it from? It was not taught before Rabbi Yosei, as it is taught: If it falls on Monday or Thursday - they read three and conclude with one. If it falls on Tuesday or Friday - they read one and conclude with one. Rabbi Yosei says: Always read three and conclude with one!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, קַשְׁיָא ״זֶה הַכְּלָל״! לָא, לְאֵתוֹיֵי רֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ וּמוֹעֵד.
human_translation: However, This is the principle, difficult, No, to add the New Moon and a Festival.
llm_translation: And rather, the question is difficult: "This is the principle"! No, to include Rosh Chodesh and festival.

hebrew_text: הָא בְּהֶדְיָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ: בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים וּמוֹעֵד קוֹרִין אַרְבָּעָה!
human_translation: Aren’t these taught explicitly On the New Moon and on a Festival, four read
llm_translation: This is what is taught in the academy: On Rosh Chodesh and festivals, four are called up!

hebrew_text: סִימָנָא בְּעָלְמָא יָהֵיב, דְּלָא תֵּימָא יוֹם טוֹב וְחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, אֶלָּא נְקוֹט הַאי כְּלָלָא בִּידָךְ: כֹּל דְּטָפֵי לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא מֵחַבְרֵיהּ, טָפֵי לֵיהּ גַּבְרָא יַתִּירָא.
human_translation: merely gives a mnemonic Do not say that a Festival and the intermediate days of the Festival are the same Rather, hold this rule in your hand: any when there is an additional element an extra person is added
llm_translation: The sign in general gives, that do not say Yom Tov and Chol HaMoed are identical, for they are different, but take this principle in your hand: whoever minimizes his own matters in comparison to his friend, his friend's matters will be minimized.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ בְּרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ וּמוֹעֵד, דְּאִיכָּא קׇרְבַּן מוּסָף — קוֹרִין אַרְבָּעָה. בְּיוֹם טוֹב, דְּאָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה — חֲמִשָּׁה. בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, דְּעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת — שִׁשָּׁה. שַׁבָּת, דְּאִיכָּא אִיסּוּר סְקִילָה — שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: Therefore, on the New Moon and a Festival, there is an additional offering, four read On a Festival, when prohibited perform labor, five On Yom Kippur, when is punishable by karet , six Shabbat, when there is a prohibition stoning, seven
llm_translation: Therefore, on Rosh Chodesh and festivals, when there is a Musaf offering - we read four. On a festival, where labor is prohibited - five. On Yom Kippur, where the punishment is karet - six. On Shabbat, where there is a prohibition of stoning - seven.

hebrew_text: גּוּפַהּ: רַב אִיקְּלַע לְבָבֶל בְּתַעֲנִית צִבּוּר, קָם קְרָא בְּסִפְרָא. פְּתַח בָּרֵיךְ, חֲתַם וְלָא בָּרֵיךְ. נְפוּל כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אַאַנְפַּיְיהוּ וְרַב לָא נְפַל עַל אַנְפֵּיהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא רַב לָא נְפַל עַל אַפֵּיהּ?
human_translation: the itself. Rav happened to Babylonia on a public fast. He stood and read from a scroll. he began he recited a blessing, he concluded, he did not recite a blessing. Everyone fell on their faces, but Rav did not fall on his face. What is the reason that Rav did not fall on his face?
llm_translation: The body: Rav arrived in Babylon during a public fast, he began reading from a scroll. He opened but did not conclude. The entire world fell on their faces, but Rav did not fall on his face. What is the reason Rav did not fall on his face?

hebrew_text: רִצְפָּה שֶׁל אֲבָנִים הָיְתָה, וְתַנְיָא: ״וְאֶבֶן מַשְׂכִּית לֹא תִתְּנוּ בְּאַרְצְכֶם לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֹת עָלֶיהָ״. ״עָלֶיהָ״ אִי אַתָּה מִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה בְּאַרְצְכֶם, אֲבָל אַתָּה מִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה עַל אֲבָנִים שֶׁל בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ. כִּדְעוּלָּא, דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: לֹא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא רִצְפָּה שֶׁל אֲבָנִים בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: It was a stone floor, and it was taught “Nor shall you install any figured stone in your land, to bow down upon it” upon it, you shall not bow down in your land, but you shall bow down upon the stones of the Temple. in accordance with Ulla, Ulla said: The Torah prohibited only a stone floor.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: There was a stone pavement, and it was taught: "And you shall not set up a stone of any kind in your land to bow down upon it." "Upon it" - you may not bow down in your land, but you may bow down upon the stones of the Temple. As it is known, for Ulla said: The Torah only prohibited a stone pavement alone.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי מַאי אִירְיָא רַב, אֲפִילּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי! קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הֲוַאי.
human_translation: If so, why specifically Rav All of also in front of Rav,
llm_translation: So what is the meaning of "Rav," even all of them are trustworthy! He was standing before Rav this one.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיזִיל לְגַבֵּי צִיבּוּרָא וְלִינְפּוֹל עַל אַפֵּיהּ! לָא בָּעֵי (ל)מַיטְרַח צִיבּוּרָא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַב פִּישּׁוּט יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם הֲוָה עָבֵיד, וְכִדְעוּלָּא. דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: לָא אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא פִּישּׁוּט יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: should have gone to the congregation and fallen on his face He did not want to trouble the congregation And if you wish, say Rav would stretch out his arms and legs And in accordance with Ulla, as Ulla said: The Torah prohibited only outstretched arms and legs.
llm_translation: And he should go in front of the congregation and fall on his face! He does not need the congregation to exert themselves. And if you wish, say: Rav Pishut would do hands and feet, as usual. As Ula said: The Torah only prohibited hands and feet alone.

hebrew_text: וְלִיפּוֹל עַל אַפֵּיהּ, וְלָא לֶיעְבֵּיד פִּישּׁוּט יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם! לָא מְשַׁנֵּי מִמִּנְהֲגֵיהּ.
human_translation: should have fallen on his face without stretching out his arms and legs. He did not change his custom
llm_translation: And to fall on her face, and not to injure the hands and feet! It does not deviate from her customs.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אָדָם חָשׁוּב שָׁאנֵי, כִּדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵין אָדָם חָשׁוּב רַשַּׁאי לִיפּוֹל עַל פָּנָיו אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן נַעֲנֶה כִּיהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ קוּם לָךְ [וְגוֹ׳]״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say An important person is different, in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said: An important person is not permitted to fall on his face unless he will be answered like Joshua bin Nun as it is written: “And the Lord said to Joshua: Get up;
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: A person esteemed is different, like Rabbi Elazar. For Rabbi Elazar said: A person esteemed is not worthy to fall on his face unless he is humble like Joshua the son of Nun, as it is written: "And the Lord said to Joshua, 'Rise up and so forth.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קִידָּה — עַל אַפַּיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתִּקֹּד בַּת שֶׁבַע אַפַּיִם אֶרֶץ״. כְּרִיעָה — עַל בִּרְכַּיִם, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מִכְּרוֹעַ עַל בִּרְכָּיו״. הִשְׁתַּחֲוָאָה — זוֹ פִּישּׁוּט יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲבוֹא נָבוֹא אֲנִי וְאִמְּךָ וְאַחֶיךָ לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֹת לְךָ אָרְצָה״.
human_translation: The Sages taught kidda upon face, as it is stated: “Then Bathsheba bowed [ vatikod ] with her face to the ground” Keria upon one’s knees, as it is stated from kneeling [ mikkeroa ] upon his knees” hishtaḥava’a , that is arms and legs spread as it is stated “Shall I and your mother and your brothers indeed come to bow down [ lehishtaḥavot ] to you to the ground?”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Kiddah" - on the palms, as it is stated: "And she bowed and prostrated herself to the ground." "K'ri'ah" - on the knees, and so it says: "He bowed upon his knees." "Hishtachava'ah" - this is prostration of hands and feet, as it is stated: "Shall I and your mother and your brothers indeed come to bow down to you to the ground?"

hebrew_text: לֵוִי אַחְוִי קִידָּה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי, וְאִיטְּלַע.
human_translation: Levi demonstrated kidda before Rabbi became lame.
llm_translation: Levi Achvi questioned before Rabbi, and he remained silent.

hebrew_text: וְהָא (קָא) גְּרַמָא לֵיהּ? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְעוֹלָם אַל יָטִיחַ אָדָם דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָדָם גָּדוֹל הֵטִיחַ דְּבָרִים כְּלַפֵּי מַעְלָה וְאִיטְּלַע וּמַנּוּ — לֵוִי. הָא וְהָא גְּרַמָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: this that caused Didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: A person should never speak impertinently toward on High, as a great man spoke impertinently toward on High and he became lame? And who was he? Levi. this and that caused
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And did this cause it for him? But didn't Rabbi Elazar say: One should never cast words before the Omnipresent, for behold, a great man cast words before the Omnipresent and was swallowed up – Levi. This and this caused it for him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: חֲזֵינָא לְהוּ לְאַבָּיֵי
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said: I saw Abaye
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Avin said: "I saw them to Abaye."

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא דִּמְצַלֵּי אַצְלוֹיֵי.
human_translation: and Rava, who would bend
llm_translation: And Rava would find at his lodging.

hebrew_text: בְּיוֹם טוֹב חֲמִשָּׁה, בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שִׁשָּׁה כּוּ׳. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? לֹא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְלָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דְּתַנְיָא: בְּיוֹם טוֹב חֲמִשָּׁה, וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שִׁשָּׁה, וּבְשַׁבָּת שִׁבְעָה, אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מֵהֶן וְאֵין מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: בְּיוֹם טוֹב חֲמִשָּׁה, וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שִׁבְעָה, וּבְשַׁבָּת שִׁשָּׁה, אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מֵהֶן אֲבָל מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: On a Festival, five on Yom Kippur, six Who is the mishna? not Rabbi Yishmael and not Rabbi Akiva, as it is taught On a Festival, five and on Yom Kippur, six and on Shabbat, seven One may not decrease or add to the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: On a Festival, five and on Yom Kippur, seven and on Shabbat, six One may not decrease but one may add to them.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: On a festival, five; on Yom Kippur, six. Mishna: Who is the Tanna? Not Rabbi Yishmael and not Rabbi Akiva. As it was taught: On a festival, five; and on Yom Kippur, six; and on Shabbat, seven; one does not subtract from them and one does not add to them, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: On a festival, five; on Yom Kippur, seven; and on Shabbat, six; one does not subtract from them, but one adds to them.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — קַשְׁיָא תּוֹסֶפֶת! אִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — קַשְׁיָא שִׁשָּׁה וְשִׁבְעָה!
human_translation: Who is If Rabbi Yishmael, difficult adding, If Rabbi Akiva, difficult six and seven
llm_translation: Who is the authority? If it is Rabbi Yishmael - it is a difficulty of addition! If it is Rabbi Akiva - it is a difficulty of six and seven!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: תְּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל הִיא. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּיוֹם טוֹב חֲמִשָּׁה, בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שִׁשָּׁה, בְּשַׁבָּת שִׁבְעָה, אֵין פּוֹחֲתִין מֵהֶן אֲבָל מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: Rava said: the tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: On a Festival, five on Yom Kippur, six on Shabbat, seven One may not decrease these but one may add to them. the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Rava said: It is a teaching of the school of Rabbi Ishmael. For it was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: On a festival, five; on Yom Kippur, six; on Shabbat, seven. One may not decrease from them, but one may add to them. These are the words of Rabbi Ishmael.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אַדְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל! תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: there is a contradiction Rabbi Yishmael, Rabbi Yishmael Two tanna’im , in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: The difficulty of Rabbi Yishmael to Rabbi Yishmael! Two teachings in the school of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: מַאן תְּנָא לְהָא דְּתַנְיָא: בְּיוֹם טוֹב מְאַחֲרִין לָבוֹא, וּמִמֻּהְרִין לָצֵאת. בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מִמֻּהְרִין לָבוֹא, וּמְאַחֲרִין לָצֵאת. וּבְשַׁבָּת מִמֻּהְרִין לָבוֹא, וּמִמֻּהְרִין לָצֵאת. לֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאִית לֵיהּ גַּבְרָא יַתִּירָא? אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — דִּנְפִישׁ סִידּוּרָא דְּיוֹמָא.
human_translation: Who taught that which is taught On a Festival, one is slow to arrive and one is quick to leave on Yom Kippur, one is quick to arrive and slow to leave; and on Shabbat, one is quick to arrive, and quick to leave Let us say Rabbi Akiva, who holds an additional man Even you say Rabbi Yishmael, the order of the day, is long,
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that taught this Mishnah: On a festival, they delay in coming in, and they hurry to go out. On Yom Kippur, they hurry to come in, and they delay in going out. And on Shabbat, they hurry to come in, and they hurry to go out. Let us say, Rabbi Akiva, who has an extra man? Even if you say Rabbi Yishmael — the order of the day is different.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲמִשָּׁה וְשִׁבְעָה כְּנֶגֶד מִי? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר נַחְמָנִי וְחַד דְּעַמְיָה, וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי וְחַד דְּעַמֵּיהּ, וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר נַחְמָנִי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי. חַד אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד בִּרְכַּת כֹּהֲנִים, וְחַד אָמַר: כְּנֶגֶד שְׁלֹשָׁה שׁוֹמְרֵי הַסַּף, חֲמִשָּׁה מֵרוֹאֵי פְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ, שִׁבְעָה רוֹאַי פְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ.
human_translation: Corresponding to what these three, five, and seven, Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani and one who was with him disagree about this. And who was Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi. And some say Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi and one who was with him. And who was Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani, and some say Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani. One said: correspond the Priestly Benediction. And one said: correspond to the three guards of the door five of who saw the king’s face and the seven who saw the king’s face
llm_translation: These three, five, and seven correspond to whom? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani and Chad D'Ameya disagree about it, and they count - Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi. And some say: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi and Chad D'Ameya, and they count - Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani, and some say Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani. One said: Corresponding to the blessing of the priests, and one said: Corresponding to the three guards of the sword, five who see the face of the king, seven who see the face of the king.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: שְׁלֹשָׁה חֲמִשָּׁה וְשִׁבְעָה — שְׁלֹשָׁה שׁוֹמְרֵי הַסַּף, חֲמִשָּׁה מֵרוֹאֵי פְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ, שִׁבְעָה רוֹאִי פְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ. אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: עַד הָאִידָּנָא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא פָּרִישׁ לַן מָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא הֲוָה יָדַעְנָא דִּצְרִיכִיתוּ לֵיהּ, וּמִי בְּעֵיתוּ מִינַּאי מִילְּתָא וְלָא אֲמַרִי לְכוּ?!
human_translation: Rav Yosef taught three, five, and seven three guards of the door, five of who saw the king’s face, the seven who saw the king’s face. Abaye said to him: What is the reason that until now the Master did not explain to us said to him: I did not know that you needed this Have you asked me something and I did not tell you?
llm_translation: Tanna Rabbi Yosef taught: Three, five, and seven - three are the guards of the sword, five are those who see the face of the king, seven are those who see the face of the king. Abaye said to him: Until now, what is the reason that our master did not explain it to us? He said to him: We did not know that you needed it, and who would have thought to say it to you?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ יַעֲקֹב מִינָאָה לְרַב יְהוּדָה: הָנֵי שִׁשָּׁה דְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים כְּנֶגֶד מִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּנֶגֶד שִׁשָּׁה שֶׁעָמְדוּ מִימִינוֹ שֶׁל עֶזְרָא וְשִׁשָּׁה מִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעֲמוֹד עֶזְרָא הַסּוֹפֵר עַל מִגְדַּל עֵץ אֲשֶׁר עָשׂוּ לַדָּבָר וַיַּעֲמוֹד אֶצְלוֹ מַתִּתְיָה וְשֶׁמַע וַעֲנָיָה וְאוּרִיָּה וְחִלְקִיָּה וּמַעֲשֵׂיָה עַל יְמִינוֹ וּמִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ פְּדָיָה וּמִישָׁאֵל וּמַלְכִּיָּה וְחָשׁוּם וְחַשְׁבַּדָּנָה זְכַרְיָה מְשֻׁלָּם״.
