human_translation: Ya’akov of Mina said to Rav Yehuda: Corresponding to whom were these six on Yom Kippur said to him: corresponds to the six who stood to Ezra’s right and the six who stood to his left, as it is stated: “And Ezra the Scribe stood upon a platform of wood, which they had made for the purpose, and beside him stood Mattithiah, and Shema, and Anaiah, and Uriah, and Hilkiah, and Maaseiah, on his right hand, and on his left hand, Pedaiah, and Mishael, and Malchiah, and Hashum, and Hashbadanah, Zechariah, Meshullam”
llm_translation: He said to him, Jacob from Minna'ah to Rav Yehudah: These six of Yom Kippurim against whom? He said to him: Against the six who stood to the right of Ezra and the six to his left, as it is said: "And Ezra the scribe stood upon a wooden tower which they made for the purpose, and beside him stood Mattithiah, Shema, Ananiah, Uriah, Hilkiah, and Maaseiah on his right, and on his left Pedaiah, Mishael, Malchiah, Hashum, Hashbaddanah, Zechariah, Meshullam."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי שִׁבְעָה הָווּ! הַיְינוּ ״זְכַרְיָה״ הַיְינוּ ״מְשֻׁלָּם״, וְאַמַּאי קְרָאוֹ ״מְשֻׁלָּם״? דְּמִישְׁלָם בְּעוֹבָדֵיהּ.
human_translation: Those were seven Zechariah is Meshullam, And why was he called Meshullam? Because he was perfect [ mishlam ] in his actions.
llm_translation: These seven were! This is "Zekharyah," this is "Meshullam," and why was he called "Meshullam"? Because he was paid in full for his work.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַכֹּל עוֹלִין לַמִּנְיָן שִׁבְעָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ קָטָן וַאֲפִילּוּ אִשָּׁה. אֲבָל אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אִשָּׁה לֹא תִּקְרָא בְּתוֹרָה, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד צִבּוּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught All count toward the quorum of seven even a minor and even a woman. However, the Sages said a woman should not read the Torah, out of respect for the congregation.
llm_translation: The sages taught: All are counted for the quorum of seven, even a minor and even a woman. But the sages said: A woman should not be called up to the Torah, out of respect for the congregation.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַפְטִיר, מַהוּ שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה לַמִּנְיָן שִׁבְעָה? רַב הוּנָא וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא, חַד אָמַר: עוֹלֶה, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה. מַאן דְּאָמַר עוֹלָה — דְּהָא קָרֵי,
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before concludes [ maftir ] what is count toward the quorum of seven Rav Huna and Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba One said: He counts, and one said: He does not count. The one who said he counts because he reads
llm_translation: He asked them: Regarding the one who reads the Haftarah, what is the law if he is included in the count of seven? Rav Huna and Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba, one said: He counts, and one said: He does not count. The one who said he counts - because it is called,

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה — כִּדְעוּלָּא. דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: מִפְּנֵי מָה הַמַּפְטִיר בְּנָבִיא צָרִיךְ שִׁיקְרָא בְּתוֹרָה תְּחִלָּה — מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד תּוֹרָה, וְכֵיוָן דְּמִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד תּוֹרָה הוּא — לְמִנְיָנָא לָא סָלֵיק.
human_translation: And the one who said he does not count in accordance with Ulla, as Ulla said: For what must who concludes the Prophets read from the Torah first? due to respect for the Torah, And since out of respect for the Torah, he is not included in the quorum
llm_translation: One who says it does not ascend - as D'Ulla. For Ulla said: Why does the one who concludes in the Prophets need to begin with the Torah? - Because of the honor of the Torah. And since it is for the honor of the Torah, it does not come out for counting.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַמַּפְטִיר בְּנָבִיא לֹא יִפְחוֹת מֵעֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד פְּסוּקִין, כְּנֶגֶד שִׁבְעָה שֶׁקְּרָאוֹ בְּתוֹרָה. וְאִם אִיתָא, עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה הָוְיִין! כֵּיוָן דְּמִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד תּוֹרָה הוּא —
human_translation: raises an objection The one who concludes with the Prophets may not fewer than twenty-one verses, corresponding to the seven who read from the Torah. And if it is so, is twenty-four Since due to respect for the Torah,
llm_translation: Challenger: One who reads from the Prophets should not read less than twenty-one verses, corresponding to the seven verses that he read in the Torah. But if it is so, then twenty-four verses should be sufficient! Since it is done for the honor of the Torah —

hebrew_text: כְּנֶגְדּוֹ נָמֵי לָא בָּעֵי.
human_translation: it is not necessary also
llm_translation: Opposite him, Nami does not require.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: וַהֲרֵי ״עוֹלוֹתֵיכֶם סְפוֹ״, דְּלָא הָוְיִין עֶשְׂרִין וְחַד, וְקָרֵינַן! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּסְלֵיק עִנְיָינָא.
human_translation: Rava strongly objects to this But “Add your burnt offerings” which does not have twenty-one verses, and we read it. There it is different, as the topic is completed
llm_translation: Rava objects to this: But what about "your burnt offerings are counted," which are not twenty-one, yet we still read it! It is different there because the matter is clear.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָא דְּלָא סָלֵיק עִנְיָינָא לָא? וְהָאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַבָּא: זִמְנִין סַגִּיאִין הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְכִי הֲוָה קָרֵינַן עֲשָׂרָה פְּסוּקֵי, אֲמַר לַן: אַפְּסִיקוֹ! מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ תּוּרְגְּמָן שָׁאנֵי. דְּתָנֵי רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין תּוּרְגְּמָן, אֲבָל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ תּוּרְגְּמָן — פּוֹסֵק.
human_translation: But where the topic is not completed, not Didn’t Rav Shmuel bar Abba say: Many times I stood before Rabbi Yoḥanan and when we had read ten verses he would say to us: Stop. In a place where there is a translator, it is different. as Rav Taḥalifa bar Shmuel taught: They taught only a place where there is no translator; but in a place where there is a translator, one may stop
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And where is it that the matter did not come up? And Rav Shmuel bar Abba said: Sometimes there were great scholars standing before Rabbi Yochanan, and when we would read ten verses, he would say to us: Stop! In a place where there is a translator, it is different. For Rav Tahalifa bar Shmuel taught: They only said this in a place where there is no translator, but in a place where there is a translator, one may pause.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין פּוֹרְסִין עַל שְׁמַע, וְאֵין עוֹבְרִין לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה, וְאֵין נוֹשְׂאִין אֶת כַּפֵּיהֶם, וְאֵין קוֹרִין בְּתוֹרָה, וְאֵין מַפְטִירִין בַּנָּבִיא,
human_translation: One does not recite the blessing [ poresin ] Shema ; nor does one pass before the ark nor do the lift their hands nor is the Torah read nor does one conclude with the Prophets
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One does not spread out on account of the Shema, and one does not pass in front of the ark, and one does not lift up their hands, and one does not read in the Torah, and one does not conclude with the Prophets.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין מַעֲמָד וּמוֹשָׁב, וְאֵין אוֹמְרִים בִּרְכַּת אֲבֵלִים וְתַנְחוּמֵי אֲבֵלִים, וּבִרְכַּת חֲתָנִים, וְאֵין מְזַמְּנִין בְּשֵׁם — פָּחוֹת מֵעֲשָׂרָה. וּבְקַרְקָעוֹת — תִּשְׁעָה וְכֹהֵן, וְאָדָם כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן.
human_translation: And one does not observe standing up and sitting down nor does one recite the mourners’ blessing or comfort mourners or bridegrooms’ blessing; and one does not invite with the name with fewer than ten land nine and one priest, And similarly, a person
llm_translation: And they do not make a standing and sitting, and they do not say the blessings of mourners and the consolations of mourners, and the blessing of grooms, and they do not invite in the name — less than ten. And in courtyards — nine and a priest, and a person like them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְנִקְדַּשְׁתִּי בְּתוֹךְ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁבִּקְדוּשָּׁה לֹא יְהֵא פָּחוֹת מֵעֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: From where are these matters, Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: as the verse states: “And I shall be hallowed among the children of Israel” any expression of sanctity may not be fewer than ten
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are these words? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, as the verse states: "And I will be sanctified among the children of Israel," anything that is designated for sanctity must not be less than ten. English translation:

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אָתְיָא ״תּוֹךְ״ ״תּוֹךְ״, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְנִקְדַּשְׁתִּי בְּתוֹךְ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״הִבָּדְלוּ מִתּוֹךְ הָעֵדָה״,
human_translation: From where be inferred? as Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: It is inferred “among,” “among.” Here, it is written: “And I shall be hallowed among the children of Israel,” and there, it is written “Separate yourselves from among this congregation”
llm_translation: What is the implication? For Rabbi Chiya taught: It comes to include "within" within, as it is written here: "And I will be sanctified among the children of Israel," and it is written there: "Separate yourselves from within the congregation."

hebrew_text: וְאָתְיָא ״עֵדָה״ ״עֵדָה״, דִּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״עַד מָתַי לָעֵדָה הָרָעָה הַזֹּאת״ — מָה לְהַלָּן עֲשָׂרָה, אַף כָּאן עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: inferred “congregation” “congregation” as it is written there: “How long shall I bear with this evil congregation?” just as there, ten so too, here, ten
llm_translation: "And it was taught: 'Edah' 'Edah', as it is written there: 'How long shall I bear with this evil congregation' - just as there it is referring to ten, so too here it is referring to ten."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין מַעֲמָד וּמוֹשָׁב פָּחוֹת מֵעֲשָׂרָה. כֵּיוָן דְּבָעֵי לְמֵימַר: ״עִמְדוּ יְקָרִים עֲמוֹדוּ, שְׁבוּ יְקָרִים שֵׁבוּ״ — בְּצִיר מֵעֲשָׂרָה לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא.
human_translation: And one does not observe standing up and sitting down with fewer than ten Since is required to say: Stand, dear stand; sit down, dear sit down, fewer than ten it is not proper conduct
llm_translation: And they do not make a standing or sitting of less than ten. Since when they want to say: "Arise, honorable ones, stand; Sit, honorable ones, sit" — in a group of less than ten is not considered a gathering.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין אוֹמְרִים בִּרְכַּת אֲבֵלִים וּבִרְכַּת חֲתָנִים (וְכוּ׳). מַאי בִּרְכַּת אֲבֵלִים? בִּרְכַּת רְחָבָה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּרְכַּת אֲבֵלִים בַּעֲשָׂרָה, וְאֵין אֲבֵלִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן. בִּרְכַּת חֲתָנִים בַּעֲשָׂרָה, וַחֲתָנִים מִן הַמִּנְיָן.
human_translation: one does not recite the mourners’ blessing and the bridegrooms’ blessing What is the mourners’ blessing? The blessing in the square as Rabbi Yitzḥak said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The mourners’ blessing with ten and mourners are not included in the count. The bridegrooms’ blessing with ten and bridegrooms are included in the count.
llm_translation: The text reads: "And one does not recite the blessings of mourners and the blessings of groomsmen, etc. What is the blessing of mourners? A broad blessing. For Rabbi Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The blessing of mourners is with ten, and mourners are not counted in the minyan. The blessing of groomsmen is with ten, and groomsmen are counted in the minyan."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מְזַמְּנִין עַל הַמָּזוֹן בַּשֵּׁם פָּחוֹת מֵעֲשָׂרָה (וְכוּ׳). כֵּיוָן דְּבָעֵי לְמֵימַר ״נְבָרֵךְ לֵאלֹהֵינוּ״ — בְּצִיר מֵעֲשָׂרָה לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא.
human_translation: And one does not invite for nourishment, with the name with fewer than ten Since one is required to say: Let us bless our Lord, fewer than ten not proper conduct
llm_translation: "And one does not appoint over the food in the name of less than ten (and so on). Since when he wants to say 'Let us bless our God' — with less than ten is not the way of the land."

hebrew_text: וְהַקַּרְקָעוֹת תִּשְׁעָה וְכֹהֵן, וְאָדָם כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן (וְכוּ׳). מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: land nine and one priest, And similarly, a person From where are these matters,
llm_translation: The floors nine and a priest, and a person equivalent to them (and so forth). From where are these matters derived?

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֲשָׂרָה כֹּהֲנִים כְּתוּבִים בַּפָּרָשָׁה. חַד לְגוּפֵיהּ, (וְחַד לְמַעוֹטֵי,) וְאִידַּךְ הָוֵי מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט, וְאֵין מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט אֶלָּא לְרַבּוֹת. תִּשְׁעָה יִשְׂרְאֵלִים וְחַד כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Shmuel said: priest written ten in the portion One for itself, And one to exclude And the other are restrictions following restrictions, one restriction after another only to amplify. nine Israelites and one priest.
llm_translation: Shmuel said: Ten Kohanim are written in the portion. One for itself, (and one for exclusions,) and the other should be an exclusion after an exclusion, and an exclusion after an exclusion is only to include. Nine Yisraelim and one Kohen.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: חֲמִשָּׁה כֹּהֲנִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה יִשְׂרְאֵלִים! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: And say five priests and five Israelites. difficult,
llm_translation: And why: five priests and five Israelites! It is difficult.

hebrew_text: וְאָדָם כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן. אָדָם מִי קָדוֹשׁ?
human_translation: And similarly, a person Can a person become consecrated
llm_translation: And a person, like them. Adam, who is holy?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: בְּאוֹמֵר ״דְּמֵי עָלַי״. דְּתַנְיָא: הָאוֹמֵר ״דְּמֵי עָלַי״ — שָׁמִין אוֹתוֹ כְּעֶבֶד. וְעֶבֶד אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְקַרְקָעוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִתְנַחַלְתֶּם אוֹתָם לִבְנֵיכֶם אַחֲרֵיכֶם לָרֶשֶׁת אֲחוּזָּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: to one who says: My assessment upon me, as it is taught one who says: My assessment upon me, assesses him as a slave And a slave is compared to land, as it is written “And you shall take them as an inheritance for your children after you, to inherit them for a possession”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: When one says "my blood," as it was taught: One who says "my blood" — we listen to him like a slave. And a slave is connected to the ground, as it is written: "And you shall inherit them for your children after you, to inherit as a possession."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַקּוֹרֵא בְּתוֹרָה — לֹא יִפְחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים, וְלֹא יִקְרָא לִמְתוּרְגְּמָן יוֹתֵר מִפָּסוּק אֶחָד.
human_translation: One who reads from the Torah should not read fewer than three verses. And he should not read to the translator more than one verse
llm_translation: It was taught: One who reads in the Torah should not recite less than three verses, and should not call the interpreter to translate more than one verse.

hebrew_text: וּבַנָּבִיא שְׁלֹשָׁה. הָיוּ שְׁלָשְׁתָּן שָׁלֹשׁ פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת — קוֹרִין אֶחָד אֶחָד.
human_translation: And with regard to the Prophets, three If the three constitute three paragraphs, one must read one by one.
llm_translation: And in the prophet, three. They were three, three sections - they read one by one.

hebrew_text: מְדַלְּגִין בַּנָּבִיא וְאֵין מְדַלְּגִין בַּתּוֹרָה. וְעַד כַּמָּה הוּא מְדַלֵּג? עַד כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִפְסוֹק הַמְתוּרְגְּמָן.
human_translation: One may skip the Prophets, but one may not skip the Torah. How far may he skip? As far as the translator will not conclude
llm_translation: We skip in the Prophet and we do not skip in the Torah. And until how much does one skip? Until the interpreter does not pause.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִין כְּנֶגֶד מִי? אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: כְּנֶגֶד תּוֹרָה נְבִיאִים וּכְתוּבִים.
human_translation: Corresponding to what were these three verses, Rav Asi said: correspond to the Torah, Prophets, and Writings.
llm_translation: The text: These three verses correspond to whom? Rav Assi said: They correspond to the Torah, the Prophets, and the Writings.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יִקְרָא לַמְּתוּרְגְּמָן יוֹתֵר מִפָּסוּק אֶחָד, וּבַנָּבִיא — שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּסוּקִים, וְאִם הָיוּ שְׁלָשְׁתָּן שָׁלֹשׁ פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת — קוֹרֵא אֶחָד אֶחָד. כְּגוֹן: ״כִּי כֹה אָמַר ה׳ חִנָּם נִמְכַּרְתֶּם״. ״כִּי כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ אֱלֹהִים מִצְרַיִם יָרַד עַמִּי בָרִאשׁוֹנָה״, ״וְעַתָּה מַה לִּי פֹה נְאֻם ה׳״.
human_translation: And one should not read to the translator more than one verse And with regard to the Prophets, three If the three constitute three paragraphs, he must read separately, for example, “For thus says the Lord, You were sold for naught” “For thus says the Lord God, at first My people went down to Egypt” “Now therefore what have I here, says the Lord”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And one should not call the Meturgeman more than one verse, and in the case of a prophet — three verses, and if there were three separate sections — one should read them one by one. For example: "For thus says the Lord, 'You were sold for nothing.'" "For thus says the Lord God, 'My people went down to Egypt at first.'" "And now, what do I have here, says the Lord."

hebrew_text: מְדַלְּגִין בַּנָּבִיא וְאֵין מְדַלְּגִין בַּתּוֹרָה. וּרְמִינְהִי: קוֹרֵא ״אַחֲרֵי מוֹת״ וְ״אַךְ בֶּעָשׂוֹר״ — וְהָא קָא מְדַלֵּג!
human_translation: One may skip the Prophets, but one may not skip the Torah. raises a contradiction reads “After the death” “Only on the tenth day” Doesn’t he skip
llm_translation: We skip in the Prophets but we do not skip in the Torah. And raise a contradiction: One reads "Acharei Mot" and "Ach Be'asor" - and this is skipping!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּכְדֵי שֶׁיִּפְסוֹק הַתּוּרְגְּמָן, וְכָאן בִּכְדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִפְסוֹק הַתּוּרְגְּמָן.
human_translation: Abaye said: This not difficult. Here, where the translator will conclude There, where the translator will not conclude
llm_translation: Abaye said, not difficult: here in order for the interpreter to finish, and here in order for the interpreter not to finish.

hebrew_text: וְהָא עֲלַהּ קָתָנֵי: מְדַלְּגִין בַּנָּבִיא וְאֵין מְדַלְּגִין בַּתּוֹרָה, וְעַד כַּמָּה הוּא מְדַלֵּג — עַד כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִפְסוֹק הַתּוּרְגְּמָן. מִכְלָל דְּבַתּוֹרָה כְּלָל כְּלָל לָא!
human_translation: Wasn’t it taught with regard to that One may skip while the Prophets, but one may not skip while the Torah. How far may he skip? As far as the translator will not conclude by inference that the Torah not at all.
llm_translation: And this is what it means to say: We may skip in the Prophets, but we may not skip in the Torah. And how much may one skip? Until the interpreter does not pause. From the inference of the Torah, a general principle is not general at all!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּעִנְיָן אֶחָד, כָּאן בִּשְׁתֵּי עִנְיָינוֹת. וְהָתַנְיָא: מְדַלְּגִין בַּתּוֹרָה בְּעִנְיָן אֶחָד, וּבַנָּבִיא בִּשְׁנֵי עִנְיָינִין. כָּאן וְכָאן, בִּכְדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִפְסוֹק הַתּוּרְגְּמָן.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said not difficult Here, one topic. There, two topics. And so it is taught One may skip the Torah one topic, and in Prophets two topics. here and there, the translator will not conclude
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said, it is not difficult: here in one matter, here in two matters. And it was taught: We may skip in the Torah in one matter, but in the Prophets in two matters. Here and here, so that the interpreter will not be interrupted.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵין מְדַלְּגִין מִנָּבִיא לְנָבִיא, וּבַנָּבִיא שֶׁל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר — מְדַלֵּג, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְדַלֵּג מִסּוֹף הַסֵּפֶר לִתְחִילָּתוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught another One may not skip from prophet to prophet, However, one may skip prophet among the twelve provided that he does not skip from the end of the book to the beginning,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Another opinion teaches: One does not skip from one prophet to another, but in the case of the prophet of the Twelve Minor Prophets, one may skip, provided that one does not skip from the end of the book to its beginning.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּפְטִיר בַּנָּבִיא — הוּא פּוֹרֵס עַל שְׁמַע, וְהוּא עוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה, וְהוּא נוֹשֵׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו. וְאִם הָיָה קָטָן — אָבִיו אוֹ רַבּוֹ עוֹבְרִין עַל יָדוֹ.
human_translation: The one who concludes with the Prophets is the one recite the blessing Shema , and he passes before the ark and he lifts his hands And if is a minor, his father or teacher pass in his place.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who reads the Haftarah — he spreads over the lectern, and he passes before the ark, and he raises his hands. And if he is a minor — his father or teacher pass by his side.

hebrew_text: קָטָן קוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה וּמְתַרְגֵּם. אֲבָל אֵינוֹ פּוֹרֵס עַל שְׁמַע, וְאֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה, וְאֵינוֹ נוֹשֵׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו.
human_translation: A minor may read the Torah and translate but he may not recite the blessing Shema , and he may not pass before the ark and he may not lift his hands
llm_translation: A minor reads in the Torah and translates. But he does not recite the Shema, and he does not pass before the Ark, and he does not raise his hands.

hebrew_text: פּוֹחֵחַ — פּוֹרֵס אֶת שְׁמַע וּמְתַרְגֵּם. אֲבָל אֵינוֹ קוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה, וְאֵינוֹ עוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה, וְאֵינוֹ נוֹשֵׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו.
human_translation: One whose limbs are exposed [ poḥe’aḥ ] may recite the blessing Shema and translate but he may not read from the Torah he may not pass before the ark and he may not lift his hands
llm_translation: Interpreter - translates the name and interprets. But he does not read in the Torah, and he does not pass before the ark, and he does not raise his hands.

hebrew_text: סוֹמֵא — פּוֹרֵס אֶת שְׁמַע וּמְתַרְגֵּם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁלֹּא רָאָה מְאוֹרוֹת מִיָּמָיו — אֵינוֹ פּוֹרֵס עַל שְׁמַע.
human_translation: blind may recite the blessing Shema , and he may translate Rabbi Yehuda says: Anyone who has not seen the luminaries, in his life, may not recite the blessing Shema .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Soma - poreis et shema u'metargem. Rabbi Yehuda omer: Kol shelo ra'ah me'orot miyamav - einu poreis al shema. English translation: Soma - he recites the Shema and translates. Rabbi Yehuda says: Anyone who has not seen the lights from his youth - does not recite the Shema.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם כָּבוֹד. רַבָּה בַּר שִׁימִי אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם דְּאָתֵי לְאִינְּצוֹיֵי.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Pappa said: due to honor. Rabba bar Shimi said due to they will come to quarrel,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? Rav Papa said: Because of honor. Rabbah bar Shimi said: Because it leads to negligence.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּעָבֵיד בְּחִנָּם.
human_translation: What is between them? There is between them where does so free
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them that is done for free.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וְאִם הָיָה קָטָן — אָבִיו אוֹ רַבּוֹ עוֹבְרִין עַל יָדוֹ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם [אִי]נְּצוֹיֵי — קָטָן בַּר [אִי]נְּצוֹיֵי הוּא?
human_translation: We learned And if is a minor, his father or teacher pass in his place. If you say due to quarrel, will a minor engage in quarreling?
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: And if he was a minor - his father or his teacher may transgress on his behalf. If you say it is because of his lack of understanding - is a minor lacking understanding?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי — מִשּׁוּם כָּבוֹד? קָטָן בַּר כָּבוֹד הוּא?! אֶלָּא אִיכָּא כְּבוֹד אָבִיו וּכְבוֹד רַבּוֹ,
human_translation: Rather, what due to honor? Does a minor have honor Rather, it is honor his father and his teacher.
llm_translation: Rather, what is it — due to honor? Is he a minor in honor?! Rather, there is honor of his father and honor of his teacher,

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, אִיכָּא נִצּוּיֵי אָבִיו וְנִצּוּיֵי רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: Here, also, it is his father or teacher quarreling.
llm_translation: Here we have a case where the honor due to one's father conflicts with the honor due to one's teacher.

hebrew_text: פּוֹחֵחַ פּוֹרֵס עַל שְׁמַע וְכוּ׳. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ עוּלָּא בַּר רַב מֵאַבָּיֵי: קָטָן פּוֹחֵחַ מַהוּ שֶׁיִּקְרָא בַּתּוֹרָה?
human_translation: One whose limbs are exposed [ poḥe’aḥ ] may recite the blessing Shema Ulla bar Rav raised a dilemma before Abaye: What is a minor whose limbs are exposed read from the Torah?
llm_translation: The one who opens and spreads upon hearing, etc. Ulla son of Rav Me'abayei asked: A minor who opens, what should he be called in the Torah?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְתִיבְּעֵי לָךְ עָרוֹם! עָרוֹם מַאי טַעְמָא לָא — מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד צִבּוּר, הָכָא נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד צִבּוּר.
human_translation: said to him: And raise the dilemma naked. What is the reason that naked may not due to respect for the public. Here, too, due to respect for the public.
llm_translation: He said to him: "And you should demand for yourself naked! Naked, what is the reason why not? - Because of the honor of the community, here too because of the honor of the community."

hebrew_text: סוֹמֵא פּוֹרֵס עַל שְׁמַע וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הַרְבֵּה צָפוּ לִדְרוֹשׁ בַּמֶּרְכָּבָה, וְלֹא רָאוּ אוֹתָהּ מִימֵיהֶם.
human_translation: blind may recite the blessing Shema , It is taught they said to Rabbi Yehuda: Many have seen to expound upon the Chariot, although they have never seen it.
llm_translation: Blind man who spreads his hand over his ear and so on. It was taught: They said to Rabbi Yehuda, "Many have gazed to expound in the chariot, and they did not see it from their days."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָתָם בְּאֹבַנְתָּא דְלִיבָּא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא, וְהָא קָא מִיכַּוֵּין וְיָדַע. הָכָא מִשּׁוּם הֲנָאָה הוּא, וְהָא לֵית לֵיהּ הֲנָאָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda there, the matter depends upon the heart’s comprehension, and one can concentrate and understand here, due to the benefit and does not derive benefit
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, there in the oven of Libba, he was hanging a word, and he was discerning and knew. Here, it is due to pleasure, and there is no pleasure.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן — אִית לֵיהּ הֲנָאָה, כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כׇּל יָמַי הָיִיתִי מִצְטַעֵר עַל מִקְרָא זֶה: ״וְהָיִיתָ מְמַשֵּׁשׁ בַּצׇּהֳרַיִם כַּאֲשֶׁר יְמַשֵּׁשׁ הָעִוֵּר בָּאֲפֵלָה״, וְכִי מָה אִכְפַּת לֵיהּ לְעִוֵּר בֵּין אֲפֵילָה לְאוֹרָה?
human_translation: And the Rabbis derives benefit in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, as it is taught Rabbi Yosei said: All of my life I was troubled by this verse, “And you shall grope at noon as the blind man gropes in the darkness” What matter to a blind whether dark or light?
llm_translation: The scholars — he has benefit, like Rabbi Yosei. As it was taught, Rabbi Yosei said: "All my days I have been distressed about this verse: 'And you shall grope at noon as the blind gropes in darkness,' why does it matter to the blind whether it is dark or light?"

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁבָּא מַעֲשֶׂה לְיָדִי: פַּעַם אַחַת הָיִיתִי מְהַלֵּךְ בְּאִישׁוֹן לַיְלָה וַאֲפֵלָה, וְרָאִיתִי סוֹמֵא שֶׁהָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ וַאֲבוּקָה בְּיָדוֹ. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: בְּנִי, אֲבוּקָה זוֹ לָמָּה לָךְ? אָמַר לִי: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁאֲבוּקָה בְּיָדִי, בְּנֵי אָדָם רוֹאִין אוֹתִי וּמַצִּילִין אוֹתִי מִן הַפְּחָתִין וּמִן הַקּוֹצִין וּמִן הַבַּרְקָנִין.
human_translation: until incident occurred to me. I was once walking in the absolute darkness of the night, and I saw a blind man who was walking on way with a torch in his hands. I said to him: My son, why do you this torch He said to me: As long as I have a torch in my hand, people see me and save me from the pits and the thorns and the thistles.
llm_translation: Until the incident came to my hand: Once I was walking in the darkness of night, and it was dark, and I saw a blind man walking on the road with a torch in his hand. I said to him: My son, why do you need this torch? He said to me: As long as I have a torch in my hand, people see me and save me from pits, thorns, and thistles.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּהֵן שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּיָדָיו מוּמִין לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף מִי שֶׁהָיוּ יָדָיו צְבוּעוֹת סְטֵיס לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָעָם מִסְתַּכְּלִין בּוֹ.
human_translation: A priest who has blemishes on his hands may not lift his hands Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one whose hands were colored with satis , may not lift his hands because the congregation will look at him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A priest who has blemishes on his hands should not raise his hands. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even someone whose hands are dyed with saffron should not raise his hands, because people gaze at him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: מוּמִין שֶׁאָמְרוּ, בְּפָנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: יָדָיו בּוֹהֲקָנִיּוֹת — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: יָדָיו בּוֹהֲקָנִיּוֹת — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו. עֲקוּמּוֹת עֲקוּשׁוֹת — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו.
human_translation: taught The blemishes that said on his face, hands, and feet, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: his hands are spotted he may not lift his hands this is also taught hands are spotted, he may not lift his hands curved or bent he may not lift his hands
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A teaching: Blemishes that they said, in his presence his hands and his feet. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: His hands with calluses — he should not lift up his hands. It was also taught likewise: His hands with calluses — he should not lift up his hands. Crooked and bent — he should not lift up his hands.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: חֵיפָנִי וּבֵישָׁנִי — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אֵין מוֹרִידִין לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה לֹא אַנְשֵׁי בֵּית שְׁאָן וְלֹא אַנְשֵׁי (בֵּית) חֵיפָה וְלֹא אַנְשֵׁי טִבְעוֹנִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁקּוֹרִין לָאַלְפִין עַיְינִין וְלָעַיְינִין אַלְפִין.
human_translation: Rav Asi said: from Haifa or Beit She’an may not lift his hands This is also taught One may not allow the people of Beit She’an, nor the people of Beit Haifa, nor the people of Tivonin to pass before the ark because they pronounce alef as ayin and ayin as alef ,
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: A person from Ḥeifa and one from Beishani should not raise their hands. It was taught in a baraita similarly: We do not appoint as leaders before the ark neither the people of Beit She'an, nor the people of (Beit) Ḥeifa, nor the people of Tiv'on, because they are called "blind to thousands and seeing to thousands."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי: אִלְמָלֵי אַתָּה לֵוִי — פָּסוּל אַתָּה מִן הַדּוּכָן, מִשּׁוּם דַּעֲבֵי קָלָךְ. אֲתָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אֵימָא לֵיהּ: כְּשֶׁאַתָּה מַגִּיעַ אֵצֶל ״וְחִכִּיתִי לַה׳״, לֹא נִמְצֵאת מְחָרֵף וּמְגַדֵּף?!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya said to Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi If you were a Levite, you would be disqualified from the platform because your voice is thick. went and told his father, said to him: Go say to him: When you reach “And I will wait upon [ veḥikkiti ] the Lord” will you not be a maligner and a blasphemer?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Chiya to Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi: If you were not Levi, you would be disqualified from the assembly, because you speak lightly. His father came and said to him: Go and say to him, "When you reach 'I will wait for the Lord,' you will not be found scoffing and blaspheming?!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זַבְלְגָן לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו. וְהָא הַהוּא דַּהֲוָה בְּשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, וַהֲוָה פָּרֵיס יְדֵיהּ! הָהוּא דָּשׁ בְּעִירוֹ הֲוָה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: זַבְלְגָן לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו, וְאִם הָיָה דָּשׁ בְּעִירוֹ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: whose eyes run may not lift his hands Wasn’t there a certain in the neighborhood of Rav Huna, and he would spread his hands That was a familiar in his town. This is also taught One whose eyes run should not lift his hands but if he is a familiar in his town, he is permitted
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Zavlegan should not lift his hands. But that one who was in the neighborhood of Rav Huna, and he would spread out his hands! That one who was in his city. It was also taught likewise: Zavlegan should not lift his hands, and if he was in his city - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סוֹמֵא בְּאַחַת מֵעֵינָיו — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו. וְהָא הַהוּא דַּהֲוָה בְּשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דַּהֲוָה פָּרֵיס יְדֵיהּ! הָהוּא דָּשׁ בְּעִירוֹ הֲוָה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: סוֹמֵא בְּאַחַת מֵעֵינָיו — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו, וְאִם הָיָה דָּשׁ בְּעִירוֹ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One who is blind in one eye may not lift his hands Wasn’t there a certain in the neighborhood of Rabbi Yoḥanan, and he would lift his hands That was a familiar in his town, This is also taught One who is blind in one eye may not lift his hands but if he is a familiar in his town, he is permitted
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One who is blind in one of his eyes - he should not raise his hands. But that one who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Yochanan, who would spread out his hands! That one who was blind in his city. It was also taught likewise: One who is blind in one of his eyes - he should not raise his hands, but if he was blind in his city - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִי שֶׁהָיוּ יָדָיו צְבוּעוֹת — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת כַּפָּיו. תָּנָא: אִם רוֹב אַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר מְלַאכְתָּן בְּכָךְ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: One whose hands are colored should not lift his hands taught If most of the townspeople are engaged in this occupation, he is permitted
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One whose hands are soiled - should not lift his hands. It was taught: If most of the people of the city are engaged in such work - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר: אֵינִי עוֹבֵר לִפְנֵי הַתֵּיבָה בִּצְבוּעִין — אַף בִּלְבָנִים לֹא יַעֲבוֹר. בְּסַנְדָּל אֵינִי עוֹבֵר — אַף יָחֵף לֹא יַעֲבוֹר.
human_translation: One who says: I will not pass before the ark in colored may not pass even in white I will not pass wearing sandals, he may not pass even barefoot,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who says, "I will not pass before the Ark wearing colored garments," may also not pass wearing white garments. One who says, "I will not pass wearing sandals," may also not pass barefoot.

hebrew_text: הָעוֹשֶׂה תְּפִלָּתוֹ עֲגוּלָּה — סַכָּנָה, וְאֵין בָּהּ מִצְוָה. נְתָנָהּ עַל מִצְחוֹ אוֹ עַל פַּס יָדוֹ — הֲרֵי זוֹ דֶּרֶךְ הַמִּינוּת. (צִיפַּן) [צִיפָּהּ] זָהָב וּנְתָנָהּ עַל בֵּית אוּנְקְלִי שֶׁלּוֹ — הֲרֵי זוֹ דֶּרֶךְ הַחִיצוֹנִים.
human_translation: One who constructs his phylacteries a round danger and not mitzva If one placed on his forehead, or on his palm, this is the way of the heretics, one plated with gold or placed on his sleeve [ unkeli ], this is the way of the outsiders,
llm_translation: One who makes his prayer round - it is a danger, and there is no mitzvah in it. If he placed it on his forehead or on the palm of his hand - this is the way of heresy. He plated it with gold and placed it on his belt buckle - this is the way of the external ones.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא — חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא מִינוּת נִזְרְקָה בּוֹ.
human_translation: What is the reason We are concerned that perhaps he has been imbued with heresy,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? - We are concerned that perhaps a species of impurity was thrown into it.

hebrew_text: הָעוֹשֶׂה תְּפִלָּתוֹ עֲגוּלָּה סַכָּנָה וְאֵין בָּהּ מִצְוָה. לֵימָא תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן, תְּפִלִּין מְרוּבָּעוֹת הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי! וְאָמַר רָבָא: בְּתִפְרָן וּבַאֲלַכְסוֹנָן!
human_translation: One who constructs his phylacteries a round danger and not mitzva Let us say we learned that which the Sages taught phylacteries square is a halakha to Moses from Sinai. And Rava said along their seams and their diagonals [ alakhsonan ],
llm_translation: One who makes his tefillin round, it is a danger and there is no mitzvah in it. Let us say what we learned in the Mishnah that the Sages taught: Tefillin must be square, a halakha from Moses at Sinai! And Rava said: With their straps and with their boxes!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַתְנִיתִין דַּעֲבִידָא כִּי אַמְגּוּזָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: the mishna that one constructed like a nut,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The Mishnah that is being done is like a nut.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹמֵר:
human_translation: one says
llm_translation: The one who says:

hebrew_text: ״יְבָרְכוּךָ טוֹבִים״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ דֶּרֶךְ הַמִּינוּת. ״עַל קַן צִפּוֹר יַגִּיעוּ רַחֲמֶיךָ״, וְ״עַל טוֹב יִזָּכֵר שְׁמֶךָ״, ״מוֹדִים מוֹדִים״ — מְשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: May the good bless You, this is a path of heresy, Your mercy is extended to a bird’s nest, or: May Your name be mentioned with the good; We give thanks, we give thanks, silence him.
llm_translation: "May the good bless you" — this is the way of heresy. "On the nest of a bird Your mercies will reach" and "On the good Your name will be remembered," "We acknowledge, we acknowledge" — they silence him.

hebrew_text: הַמְכַנֶּה בַּעֲרָיוֹת — מְשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ. הָאוֹמֵר: ״׳וּמִזַּרְעֲךָ לֹא תִתֵּן לְהַעֲבִיר לַמּוֹלֶךְ׳, לֹא תִתֵּן לְאַעְבָּרָא בְּאַרְמָיוּתָא״ — מְשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ בִּנְזִיפָה.
human_translation: one modifies forbidden sexual relations, they silence him. one says “And you shall not give any of your seed to set them apart to Molekh” you shall not give to impregnate an Aramean woman, he is silenced with rebuke.
llm_translation: One who calls out the forbidden relationships - they silence him. One who says, "And from your offspring you shall not give to pass to Molech," you shall not give to pass in Aramaic - they silence him with a fine.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא ״מוֹדִים מוֹדִים״ — דְּמִיחֲזֵי כִּשְׁתֵּי רָשׁוּיוֹת. ״וְעַל טוֹב יִזָּכֵר שְׁמֶךָ״ נָמֵי, דְּמַשְׁמַע: עַל טוֹב — אִין, וְעַל רַע — לָא, וּתְנַן: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְבָרֵךְ עַל הָרָעָה כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהוּא מְבָרֵךְ עַל הַטּוֹבָה. אֶלָּא: ״עַל קַן צִפּוֹר יַגִּיעוּ רַחֲמֶיךָ״ מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Granted, We give thanks, we give thanks, as it appears like two authorities. And, they also May Your name be mentioned with the good, indicates for the good and not for the bad, and we learned One is obligated to bless for the bad just as he blesses for the good. However, Your mercy is extended to a bird’s nest, what is the reason
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, 'bishlama' 'modim modim' — d'michazei kishte rashuyot. 'Ve'al tov yizkhar shemekha' namei, d'mashma: al tov — ein, ve'al ra — la, utenan: hayav adam levarekh al hara'ah keshem shehu mevarekh al hatovah. Ella: 'al kan tzipor yagi'u rachamekha' mai ta'ama?" English translation: "Gemara, 'in truth' 'we give thanks, we give thanks' — for it appears like two permissions. 'And for good let Your name be remembered' also, for it implies: for good — yes, and for bad — no, and we learned: a person is obligated to bless for the bad just as he blesses for the good. Rather: 'on the nest of a bird let Your mercies reach' what is the reason?"

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ תְּרֵי אָמוֹרָאֵי בְּמַעְרְבָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר זְבִידָא, חַד אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמֵּטִיל קִנְאָה בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית, וְחַד אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה מִדּוֹתָיו שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא רַחֲמִים, וְאֵינָן אֶלָּא גְּזֵירוֹת.
human_translation: Two amora’im in the West, disagree this Rabbi Yosei bar Avin and Rabbi Yosei bar Zevida. One said because engenders jealousy among God’s creations, And one said because one transforms the attributes of the Holy One, Blessed be He, into mercy, and they are nothing but decrees
llm_translation: They disputed it: two Amoraim in the West. Rabbi Yosei bar Avin and Rabbi Yosei bar Zavida. One said: Because he Joseph aroused jealousy through the incident of the sale of Joseph, and one said: Because he Joseph emulates the attributes of the Holy One, blessed be He, in showing mercy, and they are nothing but decrees.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דִּנְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה, אֲמַר: אַתָּה חַסְתָּ עַל קַן צִפּוֹר — אַתָּה חוּס וְרַחֵם עָלֵינוּ! (אַתָּה חַסְתָּ עַל ״אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת בְּנוֹ״ — אַתָּה חוּס וְרַחֵם עָלֵינוּ.) אֲמַר רַבָּה: כַּמָּה יָדַע הַאי מֵרַבָּנַן לְרַצּוֹיֵי לְמָרֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא ״מְשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ״ תְּנַן!
human_translation: a particular descended in the presence of Rabba, said You have shown mercy to birds, nest; have mercy and pity upon us. You have shown mercy and its offspring have mercy and pity upon us. Rabba said: How much does this rabbi know to appease his Master! Abaye said to him: Didn’t we learn they silence him?
llm_translation: That one who stood before Rabba, said: "You have had mercy on a bird's nest - have mercy and compassion on us!" (You have had mercy on "that and its offspring" - have mercy and compassion on us.) Rabba said: How much the master knows to please his Master. Abaye said to him: But didn't we learn that "we silence him"!

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּה, לְחַדּוֹדֵי לְאַבָּיֵי הוּא דִּבְעָא.
human_translation: And Rabba, he wanted to hone Abaye’s
llm_translation: And Rabbah, to the boundaries of Abbaye, he sought.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דִּנְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, אָמַר: ״הָאֵל הַגָּדוֹל הַגִּבּוֹר וְהַנּוֹרָא הָאַדִּיר וְהֶחָזָק וְהָאַמִּיץ״.
human_translation: a particular descended in the presence of Rabbi Ḥanina. said: God, the great, the mighty, and the awesome, the powerful, and the strong, and the fearless.
llm_translation: That one who stood before Rabbi Chanina said: "The great, mighty, and awesome God, the majestic, strong, and mighty."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סַיֵּימְתִּינְהוּ לִשְׁבָחֵיהּ דְּמָרָךְ? הַשְׁתָּא הָנֵי תְּלָתָא, אִי לָאו דְּכַתְבִינְהוּ מֹשֶׁה בְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וַאֲתוֹ כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה וְתַקְּנִינְהוּ — אֲנַן לָא אָמְרִינַן לְהוּ. וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי! מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ אֶלֶף אַלְפֵי אֲלָפִים דִּינְרֵי זָהָב, וְהָיוּ מְקַלְּסִין אוֹתוֹ (בְּאֶלֶף) דִּינְרֵי כֶסֶף. לֹא גְּנַאי הוּא לוֹ?!
human_translation: said to him: Have you concluded the praises of your Master? Even these three that we recite: had Moses our teacher not written them in the Torah and had the members of the Great Assembly not come and incorporated them we would not recite them. And you went on and recited all of these. It is comparable to a man who possessed many thousands of golden dinars, yet they were praising him for a thousand silver Isn’t that deprecatory toward him?
llm_translation: He said to him: Have you finished praising your master? Now these three, if Moses did not write them in the Torah, and the Great Assembly did not establish them - we do not say them. And you say all of this! It is like a man who had a thousand thousands of gold dinars, and they would mock him with a thousand silver dinars. Is it not a disgrace for him?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: הַכֹּל בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם חוּץ מִיִּרְאַת שָׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעַתָּה יִשְׂרָאֵל מָה ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ שׁוֹאֵל מֵעִמָּךְ כִּי אִם לְיִרְאָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: Everything is in the hands of Heaven, except for fear of Heaven. as it is stated: “And now, Israel, what does the Lord your God ask of you other than to fear
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chanina: Everything is in the hands of Heaven except for the fear of Heaven, as it is stated: "And now, Israel, what does the Lord your God ask of you but to fear."

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּיִרְאָה מִילְּתָא זוּטַרְתִּי הִיא?! אִין, לְגַבֵּי מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ מִילְּתָא זוּטַרְתִּי הִיא. מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁמְּבַקְּשִׁין הֵימֶנּוּ כְּלִי גָּדוֹל וְיֵשׁ לוֹ — דּוֹמֶה עָלָיו כִּכְלִי קָטָן. קָטָן וְאֵין לוֹ — דּוֹמֶה עָלָיו כִּכְלִי גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: by inference that fear is a minor matter, Indeed, for Moses our teacher, is a minor matter. It is comparable to one who is asked for a large vessel and he has it seems to him like a small vessel a small it seems to him like a large vessel.
llm_translation: From the principle of fear, is this matter insignificant?! No, in comparison to our teacher Moses, this matter is insignificant. It is likened to a person who seeks from him a large vessel, and he has it - he appears to him as a small vessel. If he is small and does not have it - he appears to him as a large vessel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הָאוֹמֵר ״שְׁמַע שְׁמַע״ — כְּאוֹמֵר ״מוֹדִים מוֹדִים״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: One who says: Listen listen is like one who says: We give thanks, we give thanks.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: One who says "Shema Shema" - it is like saying "Modim Modim," it is considered as if he has admitted.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַקּוֹרֵא אֶת שְׁמַע וְכוֹפְלָהּ — הֲרֵי זֶה מְגוּנֶּה. מְגוּנֶּה הוּא דְּהָוֵי, שַׁתּוֹקֵי לָא מְשַׁתְּקִינַן לֵיהּ?! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאָמַר מִילְּתָא מִילְּתָא וְתָנֵי לַהּ, הָא דְּאָמַר פְּסוּקָא פְּסוּקָא וְתָנֵי לֵהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection: One who recites Shema and repeats it, it is reprehensible. It is reprehensible, they do not silence him. This not difficult. This one who recites and repeats each individual word. that one who recites and repeats an entire verse,
llm_translation: Challenger: One who reads the Shema and repeats it - this is considered a disgrace. Is it a disgrace that he is silent and does not repeat it?! It is not difficult: this is like one who says word by word and teaches it to him, this is like one who says verse by verse and teaches it to him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: וְדִלְמָא מֵעִיקָּרָא לָא כַּוֵּין דַּעְתֵּיהּ וְהַשְׁתָּא כַּוֵּין דַּעְתֵּיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַבְרוּתָא כְּלַפֵּי שְׁמַיָּא? אִי לָא מְכַוֵּין דַּעְתֵּיהּ, מָחֵינָא לֵיהּ בְּאַרְזַפְתָּא דְנַפָּחָא עַד דִּמְכַוֵּין דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava And perhaps initially he did not focus his attention and now he focused his attention. said to him: Can one have familiarity with Heaven, If he did not focus his attention, we beat him with a blacksmith’s hammer until he focuses his attention,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rava: And perhaps from the outset he did not intend his mind, and now he intends his mind? He said to him: Is companionship like facing heaven? If his mind is not intent, I will strike him with a cedar beam until his mind is intent.

hebrew_text: הַמְכַנֶּה בַּעֲרָיוֹת מְשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ. תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: קְלוֹן אָבִיו וּקְלוֹן אִמּוֹ.
human_translation: one modifies forbidden sexual relations, they silence him. Rav Yosef taught The shame of his father and the shame of his mother,
llm_translation: The one who calls out the forbidden relationships, they silence him. Rav Yosef taught: The disgrace of his father and the disgrace of his mother.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר: ״וּמִזַּרְעֲךָ לֹא תִתֵּן לְהַעֲבִיר וְכוּ׳״. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל הַבָּא עַל הַגּוֹיָה וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: one says, “And you shall not give any of your seed to set them apart to Molekh” from the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: the verse speaks of a Jew who has relations with a gentile woman and fathered from her a son idol worship.
llm_translation: The one who says: "And from your offspring you shall not give to pass through, etc." It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: In Israel, one who comes upon a non-Jewish woman and begets a son from her for foreign worship, the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַעֲשֵׂה רְאוּבֵן — נִקְרָא וְלֹא מִתַּרְגֵּם. מַעֲשֵׂה תָמָר — נִקְרָא וּמִתַּרְגֵּם. מַעֲשֵׂה עֵגֶל הָרִאשׁוֹן — נִקְרָא וּמִתַּרְגֵּם, וְהַשֵּׁנִי — נִקְרָא וְלֹא מִתַּרְגֵּם. בִּרְכַּת כֹּהֲנִים, מַעֲשֵׂה דָוִד וְאַמְנוֹן — נִקְרָאִין וְלֹא מִתַּרְגְּמִין.
human_translation: The incident of Reuben, is read but not translated, The incident of Tamar is read and translated. The first incident of the Calf, is read and translated, but the second is read but not translated. the Priestly Benediction and the incident of David and Amnon read, but not translated.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The incident of Reuben was read but not translated. The incident of Tamar was read and translated. The first incident of the Golden Calf was read and translated, but the second incident was read but not translated. The Priestly Blessing, the incident of David and Amnon, are read but not translated.

hebrew_text: אֵין מַפְטִירִין בַּמֶּרְכָּבָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַפְטִירִין בְּ״הוֹדַע אֶת יְרוּשָׁלַםִ״.
human_translation: One may not conclude with the Chariot And Rabbi Yehuda permits Rabbi Eliezer says: One may not conclude with “Make known to Jerusalem
llm_translation: We do not conclude the reading in the chariot, and Rabbi Yehuda permits it. Rabbi Eliezer says: We do not conclude the reading with "Make known to Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יֵשׁ נִקְרִין וּמִתַּרְגְּמִין, וְיֵשׁ נִקְרִין וְלֹא מִתַּרְגְּמִין, וְיֵשׁ לֹא נִקְרִין וְלֹא מִתַּרְגְּמִין. אֵלּוּ נִקְרִין וּמִתַּרְגְּמִין. בָּלַ״‎ת עָקָ״‎ן נִשְׁפֶּ״‎ה סִימָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught There are read and translated; there are are read but not translated; and there are are neither read nor translated. The following are read and translated: bet , lamed , tav ; ayin , kuf , nun ; nun , shin , peh , heh a mnemonic
llm_translation: The Sages taught: There are those who read and translate, and there are those who read but do not translate, and there are those who neither read nor translate. These are the ones who read and translate. When the ox stumbles, the sign is lost.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית נִקְרָא וּמִתַּרְגֵּם. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אָתוּ לְשַׁיּוֹלֵי מָה לְמַעְלָה מָה לְמַטָּה,
human_translation: of the act of Creation [ bereshit ], is read and translated. is obvious. Lest you say will come to ask What is above and what is below,
llm_translation: The story of the Creation was read and translated. Obviously! What might you say: they came to inquire, "What is above, what is below?"

hebrew_text: וּמָה לִפְנִים וּמָה לְאָחוֹר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: what was before and what is after, therefore teaches us
llm_translation: And what is before and what is behind, this is what is implied to us.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂה לוֹט וּשְׁתֵּי בְנוֹתָיו נִקְרָא וּמִתַּרְגֵּם. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נֵיחוּשׁ לִכְבוֹדוֹ דְאַבְרָהָם, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The incident of Lot and his two daughters is read and translated. is obvious. Lest you say one should be concerned for the honor of Abraham, therefore teaches us
llm_translation: The story of Lot and his two daughters is called and translated. Obviously! What might you say: "A design to honor Abraham," is what it implies to us.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂה תָמָר וִיהוּדָה נִקְרָא וּמִתַּרְגֵּם. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֵיחוּשׁ לִכְבוֹדוֹ דִיהוּדָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן שְׁבָחֵיהּ הוּא דְּאוֹדִי.
human_translation: The incident of Tamar, and Judah is read and translated. is obvious. Lest you say one should be concerned for the honor of Judah, therefore teaches us is to his credit, as he confessed
llm_translation: The story of Tamar and Judah, called and translated. Obviously! What could you say: to be concerned for the honor of Judah, it is evident to us that his praises are true.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂה עֵגֶל הָרִאשׁוֹן נִקְרָא וּמִתַּרְגֵּם. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֵיחוּשׁ לִכְבוֹדָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּנִיחָא לְהוּ, דְּהָוְיָא לְהוּ כַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: The first of the incident of the Calf [ egel ] is read and translated. is obvious. Lest you say one should be concerned for the honor of the Jewish people, therefore teaches us that all the more so is it amenable to them so that they will achieve atonement
llm_translation: The incident of the first calf was called and interpreted. Obviously! What might you say: to be concerned for the honor of the children of Israel, it is evident to us: all the more so that it is fitting for them, for it would be like atonement for them.

hebrew_text: קְלָלוֹת וּבְרָכוֹת נִקְרִין וּמִתַּרְגְּמִין. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא פָּיְיגָא דַּעְתַּיְיהוּ דְצִבּוּרָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The curses [ kelalot ] and blessings are read and translated. is obvious. Lest you say one should be concerned that perhaps the congregation will become dismayed therefore teaches us
llm_translation: Curses and blessings are read and translated. Obviously! What might you say: perhaps the suspicion that their intention is for the public, we hear.

hebrew_text: אַזְהָרוֹת וָעוֹנָשִׁין נִקְרִין וּמִתַּרְגְּמִין. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא אָתוּ לְמֶעְבַּד מִיִּרְאָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The warnings and punishments [ onashin ], are read and translated. is obvious. Lest you say will come to act out of fear therefore teaches us
llm_translation: Warnings and punishments are read and translated. Obviously! What might you say: Perhaps you will come to act out of fear, it is clear to us.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂה אַמְנוֹן וְתָמָר נִקְרָא וּמִתַּרְגֵּם [מַעֲשֵׂה אַבְשָׁלוֹם נִקְרָא וּמִתַּרְגֵּם]. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֵיחוּשׁ לִיקָרֵיהּ דְּדָוִד, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The incident of Amnon and Tamar, is read and translated. the incident of Absalom is read and translated, is obvious. Lest you say one should be concerned for the honor of David, therefore teaches us
llm_translation: The story of Amnon and Tamar is read and translated the story of Absalom is read and translated. Obviously! What could you say: to be concerned about the honor of David, he is listening to us.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂה פִּילֶגֶשׁ בַּגִּבְעָה נִקְרָא וּמִתַּרְגֵּם. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֵיחוּשׁ לִכְבוֹדוֹ דְבִנְיָמִין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The incident of the concubine [ pilegesh ] in Gibeah is read and translated. is obvious. Lest you say one should be concerned for the honor of Benjamin, therefore teaches us
llm_translation: The incident of Pilegesh in Gibeah is called and translated. Obviously! What might you say: To be concerned for the honor of Benjamin, he is listening to us.

hebrew_text: ״הוֹדַע אֶת יְרוּשָׁלִַם אֶת תּוֹעֲבוֹתֶיהָ״ נִקְרָא וּמִתַּרְגֵּם. פְּשִׁיטָא! לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה קוֹרֵא לְמַעְלָה מֵרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר ״הוֹדַע אֶת יְרוּשָׁלִַם אֶת תּוֹעֲבוֹתֶיהָ״. אָמַר לוֹ: עַד שֶׁאַתָּה בּוֹדֵק בְּתוֹעֲבוֹת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם צֵא וּבְדוֹק בְּתוֹעֲבוֹת אִמֶּךָ. בָּדְקוּ אַחֲרָיו וּמָצְאוּ בּוֹ שֶׁמֶץ פְּסוּל.
human_translation: “Make known [ hoda ] to Jerusalem her abominations” is read and translated. is obvious. to exclude Rabbi Eliezer, as it is taught an incident with regard to a certain man who was reading in the presence of Rabbi Eliezer, “Make known to Jerusalem her abominations.” said to him: Before you examine the abominations of Jerusalem, go and examine the abominations of your mother. they examined his and found him to have a stain of illegitimacy.
llm_translation: "Declare Jerusalem, her abominations" is read and translated. Obviously! To refute Rabbi Eliezer. For it was taught: There was an incident with a certain man who was reading above Rabbi Eliezer, "Declare Jerusalem, her abominations." He said to him: Until you examine the abominations of Jerusalem, go and examine the abominations of your mother. They examined after him and found in him a blemish, rendering him unfit.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ נִקְרִין וְלֹא מִתַּרְגְּמִין, (רעבד״‎ן סִימָן) מַעֲשֵׂה רְאוּבֵן נִקְרָא וְלֹא מִתַּרְגֵּם. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁהָלַךְ לְכָבוּל, וְהָיָה קוֹרֵא חַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת ״וַיְהִי בִּשְׁכּוֹן יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְאָמַר לוֹ לַמְּתוּרְגְּמָן: (הַפְסֵק) אַל תְּתַרְגֵּם אֶלָּא אַחֲרוֹן, וְשִׁיבְּחוּהוּ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: And these read but are not translated. reish , ayin , bet , dalet , nun a mnemonic the incident of Reuben is read but not translated. an incident involving Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel, who went to Kavul, and the sexton of the synagogue was reading: “And it came to pass, while Israel dwelt said to the translator: Stop, translate only the end And the Sages praised him
llm_translation: And these are read but not translated, (Rav Adda Siman) the incident of Reuven was read but not translated. And the incident with Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel who went to receive, and he was reading as the cantor in the synagogue "And it was when Israel dwelt," and he said to the translator: (the ruling) do not translate except the last, and the sages praised him.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂה עֵגֶל הַשֵּׁנִי נִקְרָא וְלֹא מִתַּרְגֵּם. אֵיזֶה מַעֲשֵׂה עֵגֶל הַשֵּׁנִי — מִן ״וַיֹּאמֶר מֹשֶׁה״ עַד ״וַיַּרְא מֹשֶׁה״.
human_translation: The second incident of the Calf is read but not translated. What is the second incident of the Calf? from “And Moses said until “And Moses saw”
llm_translation: The incident of the second calf was read but not translated. What is the incident of the second calf? - From "And Moses said" to "And Moses saw."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם יְהֵא אָדָם זָהִיר בִּתְשׁוּבוֹתָיו, שֶׁמִּתּוֹךְ תְּשׁוּבָה שֶׁהֱשִׁיבוֹ אַהֲרֹן לְמֹשֶׁה פָּקְרוּ הַמְעַרְעֲרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וָאַשְׁלִיכֵהוּ בָאֵשׁ וַיֵּצֵא הָעֵגֶל הַזֶּה״.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: A person should always be careful in his responses, as, based on Aaron’s response to Moses, the skeptics renounced It is stated “And I cast it into the fire and this calf came forth”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: A person should always be careful with his repentance, for through the repentance that Aaron brought about, those who were stirring up trouble were nullified, as it is said: "And I threw it into the fire, and out came this calf."

hebrew_text: בִּרְכַּת כֹּהֲנִים נִקְרִין וְלֹא מִתַּרְגְּמִין. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״יִשָּׂא״.
human_translation: the Priestly Benediction [ birkat kohanim ] read but not translated. What is the reason because it is written: lift up
llm_translation: Blessing of the priests is read and not translated. What is the reason? Because it is written: "He shall lift up."

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂה דָּוִד וְאַמְנוֹן לֹא נִקְרִין וְלֹא מִתַּרְגְּמִין. וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ מַעֲשֵׂה אַמְנוֹן וְתָמָר נִקְרָא וּמִתַּרְגֵּם! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִּכְתִיב ״אַמְנוֹן בֶּן דָּוִד״, הָא דִּכְתִיב ״אַמְנוֹן״ סְתָמָא.
human_translation: The incident of David and Amnon is neither read nor translated. Didn’t you say the incident of Amnon and Tamar is read and translated? this not difficult. This where is written: Amnon, son of David. That where it is written Amnon.
llm_translation: The story of David and Amnon is not read and not translated. But didn't you say that the story of Amnon and Tamar is read and translated? There is no difficulty: here it is written "Amnon son of David," here it is written "Amnon" without specification.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל הַמִּקְרָאוֹת הַכְּתוּבִין בַּתּוֹרָה לִגְנַאי — קוֹרִין אוֹתָן לְשֶׁבַח, כְּגוֹן: ״יִשְׁגָּלֶנָּה״ — יִשְׁכָּבֶנָּה, ״בַּעֲפוֹלִים״ — בַּטְּחוֹרִים, ״חִרְיוֹנִים״ — דִּבְיוֹנִים, ״לֶאֱכוֹל אֶת חוֹרֵיהֶם וְלִשְׁתּוֹת אֶת מֵימֵי שִׁינֵּיהֶם״ — לֶאֱכוֹל אֶת צוֹאָתָם וְלִשְׁתּוֹת אֶת מֵימֵי רַגְלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: The Sages taught All of the verses that are written in the Torah in a coarse manner are read in a refined manner. For example, “shall lie with her yishgalena ]” yishkavena , “with hemorrhoids [ bafolim ]” bateḥorim . “doves’ dung [ ḥiryonim ]” divyonim . “to eat their own excrement [ ḥoreihem ] and drink their own urine [ meimei shineihem ]” To eat their own excrement [ tzo’atam ] and drink their own urine [ meimei ragleihem ].
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: All the verses written in the Torah for disgrace - we read them for praise, for example: "Yishgalennah" - "Yishkabennah," "Ba'afolim" - "Battechorim," "Chiryonim" - "Dibyonim," "Le'echol et choreihem ve'lishtot et meimei shineihem" - "Le'echol et tzo'atam ve'lishtot et meimei ragleihem."

hebrew_text: ״לְמַחֲרָאוֹת״ — לְמוֹצָאוֹת, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: ״לְמַחֲרָאוֹת״ כִּשְׁמָן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא גְּנַאי לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: “into latrines [ lemoḥra’ot ]” lemotza’ot . Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: Lemoḥara’ot as it is written because it is contempt for idol worship,
llm_translation: "Talmudic text: 'Lemacharaot' - Lemotsaot, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: 'Lemacharaot' like oil, because it is a disgrace for idol worship."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כֹּל לֵיצָנוּתָא אֲסִירָא, בַּר מִלֵּיצָנוּתָא דַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה — דְּשַׁרְיָא. דִּכְתִיב: ״כָּרַע בֵּל קֹרֵס נְבוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״קָרְסוּ כָרְעוּ יַחְדָּיו לֹא יָכְלוּ מַלֵּט מַשָּׂא וְגוֹ׳״. רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״לְעֶגְלוֹת בֵּית אָוֶן יָגוּרוּ שְׁכַן שׁוֹמְרוֹן כִּי אָבַל עָלָיו עַמּוֹ וּכְמָרָיו עָלָיו יָגִילוּ עַל כְּבוֹדוֹ כִּי גָלָה מִמֶּנּוּ״. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״כְּבוֹדוֹ״, אֶלָּא ״כְּבֵידוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: All mockery is forbidden except for mockery of idol worship, which is permitted, as it is written: “Bel bows down, Nevo stoops” it is written: “They stoop, they bow down together; they could not deliver the burden” Rabbi Yannai said: from here: “The inhabitants of Samaria shall be in dread for the calves of Beth-aven; for its people shall mourn over it, and its priests shall tremble for it, for its glory, because it is departed from it” Do not read “its glory [ kevodo ],” rather its burden [ keveido ],
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: All mockery is forbidden, except for mockery of idolatry - it is permitted. As it is written: "Bel bows down, Nevo stoops" (Isaiah 46:1), and it is written: "They stoop, they bow down together; they could not deliver the burden" (Isaiah 46:7). Rabbi Yannai said, from here: "For the calves of Beth-aven tremble, for its people will mourn over it, and its idolatrous priests will wail over it, over its glory, for it has departed from it" (Hosea 10:5). Do not read it as "its glory," but rather as "its weight."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: שְׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְבַר יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימַר לֵיהּ לְגוֹי: שִׁקְלֵיהּ לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְאַנְּחֵיהּ בְּשִׁין תָּיו שֶׁלּוֹ. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הַאי מַאן דִּסְנֵי שׁוּמְעָנֵיהּ — שְׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְבַזּוֹיֵיהּ בְּגִימֶל וְשִׁין, הַאי מַאן דְּשַׁפִּיר שׁוּמְעָנֵיהּ — שְׁרֵי לְשַׁבּוֹחֵיהּ, וּמַאן דְּשַׁבְּחֵיהּ — יָנוּחוּ לוֹ בְּרָכוֹת עַל רֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ said in the name of Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika: It is permitted for a Jew to say to a gentile: Take your idol and put it in your shin tav , Rav Ashi said: One whose reputation is tarnished, it is permitted to humiliate him gimmel sin , One whose reputation is commendable, it is permitted to praise him, and one who praises him, blessings will rest upon his head.
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Manoah said in the name of Rav Acha son of Rava: It is permitted for a Jew to say to a non-Jew, "Take it to be used for idol worship, and its value in exchange for it." Rav Ashi said: One who dislikes his neighbor should praise him with a weasel and a tooth, and one who praises him, blessings shall rest upon his head.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַקּוֹרֵא אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה עוֹמֵד
llm_translation: The reader of the Megillah shall now return.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי הָעִיר שֶׁמָּכְרוּ רְחוֹבָהּ שֶׁל עִיר — לוֹקְחִין בְּדָמָיו בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת. בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת — לוֹקְחִין תֵּיבָה. תֵּיבָה — לוֹקְחִין מִטְפָּחוֹת. מִטְפָּחוֹת —
human_translation: Residents of a town who sold the town square, purchase a synagogue with the proceeds a synagogue, they may purchase an ark an ark, they may purchase wrapping cloths wrapping cloths,
llm_translation: Sons of the city who sold its street - they acquire with its money the synagogue. The synagogue - they acquire a ark. The ark - they acquire curtains. Curtains -

hebrew_text: יִקְחוּ סְפָרִים. סְפָרִים — לוֹקְחִין תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: they may purchase scrolls scrolls they may purchase a Torah
llm_translation: They should take books. Books - one acquires Torah.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אִם מָכְרוּ תּוֹרָה — לֹא יִקְחוּ סְפָרִים. סְפָרִים — לֹא יִקְחוּ מִטְפָּחוֹת. מִטְפָּחוֹת — לֹא יִקְחוּ תֵּיבָה. תֵּיבָה — לֹא יִקְחוּ בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת. בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת — לֹא יִקְחוּ אֶת הָרְחוֹב.
human_translation: However, if they sold a Torah they may not purchase scrolls scrolls they may not purchase wrapping cloths. wrapping cloths, they may not purchase an ark. an ark, they may not purchase a synagogue. a synagogue, they may not purchase a town square.
llm_translation: But if they sold a Torah - they may not take books. Books - they may not take scrolls. Scrolls - they may not take chests. Chests - they may not take a synagogue. A synagogue - they may not take the street.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּמוֹתְרֵיהֶן.
human_translation: And similarly, to surplus funds
llm_translation: And so in their remnants.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּנֵי הָעִיר שֶׁמָּכְרוּ רְחוֹבָהּ שֶׁל עִיר. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בַּר יוֹסֵי סְתִומְתָּאָה, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הָרְחוֹב אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם קְדוּשָּׁה.
human_translation: Residents of a town who sold the town square Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is the statement of Rabbi Menaḥem bar Yosei, cited unattributed. However, the Rabbis say: The town square does not have any sanctity.
llm_translation: Gemar in the city that sold its street of the city. Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: These are the words of Rabbi Menachem bar Yosei S'tumta, but the sages say: The street does not have sanctity.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מְנַחֵם בַּר יוֹסֵי, מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ? הוֹאִיל וְהָעָם מִתְפַּלְּלִין בּוֹ בְּתַעֲנִיּוֹת וּבְמַעֲמָדוֹת. וְרַבָּנַן — הַהוּא אַקְרַאי בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Menaḥem bar Yosei, what is his reason Since the people pray in on fast days and on watches, And the Rabbis, that is merely an irregular occurrence.
llm_translation: Rabbi Menachem bar Yosei, what is his reasoning? Since the people pray in it with fasts and standing. And the Rabbis - that verse is a general principle.

hebrew_text: בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת — לוֹקְחִין תֵּיבָה. אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת שֶׁל כְּפָרִים, אֲבָל בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת שֶׁל כְּרַכִּין, כֵּיוָן דְּמֵעָלְמָא אָתוּ לֵיהּ — לָא מָצוּ מְזַבְּנִי לֵיהּ, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּים.
human_translation: a synagogue, they may purchase an ark. Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: They taught only a synagogue of a village, However, a synagogue of a city, since come to it from the world, are not able to sell it, because it is of the public
llm_translation: Synagogue - they take a box. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: They only taught this regarding the synagogue of villages, but in the synagogue of cities, since people come and go - they do not appoint a treasurer for it, as it belongs to the public.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הַאי בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא דְּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמֵעָלְמָא אָתוּ לַהּ, כֵּיוָן דְּאַדַּעְתָּא דִּידִי קָאָתוּ — אִי בָּעֵינָא מְזַבֵּינְנָא לַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: This synagogue of Mata Meḥasya, although from the world come to it, since they come at my discretion, if I wish, I can sell it.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: This synagogue of Mata Mahseya, even though they come from the world, since they know that my intention is to come — if I want, I will join them.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת שֶׁל טוּרְסִיִּים שֶׁהָיָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁמְּכָרוּהָ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְעָשָׂה בָּהּ כׇּל צְרָכָיו, וְהָא הָתָם דִּכְרַכִּים הֲוָה! הָהִיא, בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא זוּטֵי הֲוָה, וְאִינְהוּ עַבְדוּהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident involving a synagogue of bronze workers [ tursiyyim ] that was in Jerusalem, which they sold to Rabbi Eliezer, and he used it for all his needs. But wasn’t there of cities, That was a small synagogue, and themselves built it.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Challenger: Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident in the synagogue of the Tyrians that was in Jerusalem, which they sold to Rabbi Eliezer, and he made all his needs in it. But there, it was a place of merchants! That one, it was a small synagogue, and they served it.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״בְּבֵית אֶרֶץ אֲחוּזַּתְכֶם״, אֲחוּזַּתְכֶם מִיטַּמָּא בִּנְגָעִים, וְאֵין יְרוּשָׁלָיִם מִיטַּמָּא בִּנְגָעִים. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֲנִי לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי אֶלָּא מְקוֹם מִקְדָּשׁ בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: raises an objection in a house of the land of your possession” “Your possession,” can become ritually impure with leprosy, but Jerusalem cannot become ritually impure with leprosy, Rabbi Yehuda said: I heard only the site of the Temple alone,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: "In your land possession," your land possession is susceptible to impurity from afflictions, but Jerusalem is not susceptible to impurity from afflictions. Rabbi Yehuda said: I only heard this regarding the Temple alone.

hebrew_text: הָא בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת מִיטַּמְּאִין, אַמַּאי? הָא דִּכְרַכִּין הָווּ! אֵימָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֲנִי לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי אֶלָּא מְקוֹם מְקוּדָּשׁ בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: but synagogues and study halls can become ritually impure. Why that they are city? say Rabbi Yehuda said: I heard only a sacred site,
llm_translation: The houses of assembly and the houses of study are susceptible to impurity, why? Because they are used for sitting! I might say, Rabbi Yehuda said: I have only heard this regarding a holy place alone.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: לֹא נִתְחַלְּקָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם לִשְׁבָטִים, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: נִתְחַלְּקָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם לִשְׁבָטִים.
human_translation: With regard to what disagree? The first tanna holds Jerusalem was not apportioned to the tribes, And Rabbi Yehuda holds: Jerusalem was apportioned to the tribes,
llm_translation: With what did they disagree? It was taught: The first Tanna holds: Jerusalem was not divided among the tribes, and Rabbi Yehuda holds: Jerusalem was divided among the tribes.

hebrew_text: וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְהָנֵי תַנָּאֵי.
human_translation: in the dispute these tanna’im :
llm_translation: And in the dispute of those Tannaim.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: מָה הָיָה בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל יְהוּדָה — הַר הַבַּיִת, הַלְּשָׁכוֹת, וְהָעֲזָרוֹת. וּמָה הָיָה בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל בִּנְיָמִין — אוּלָם, וְהֵיכָל, וּבֵית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים.
human_translation: as it is taught What was in the portion of Judah? The Temple mount, the chambers, and the courtyards. And what was in the portion of Benjamin? The Entrance Hall, the Sanctuary, and the Holy of Holies.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: What was in the portion of Judah? — The Temple Mount, the chambers, and the courts. And what was in the portion of Benjamin? — The Hall, the Sanctuary, and the Holy of Holies.

hebrew_text: וּרְצוּעָה הָיְתָה יוֹצֵאת מֵחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל יְהוּדָה וְנִכְנֶסֶת בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל בִּנְיָמִין, וּבָהּ מִזְבֵּחַ בָּנוּי, וְהָיָה בִּנְיָמִין הַצַּדִּיק מִצְטַעֵר עָלֶיהָ בְּכׇל יוֹם לְבוֹלְעָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חוֹפֵף עָלָיו כׇּל הַיּוֹם״, לְפִיכָךְ זָכָה בִּנְיָמִין וְנַעֲשָׂה אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָן לַשְּׁכִינָה.
human_translation: And a strip issued forth from the portion of Judah and entered into the portion of Benjamin, and upon the altar was built, and Benjamin, the righteous, would agonize over it every day to absorb it as it is stated “He covers it throughout the day, Therefore, Benjamin was privileged by becoming the host [ ushpizekhan ] of the
llm_translation: And a crack was going out from the portion of Judah and entering into the portion of Benjamin, and within it was a built altar, and Benjamin the righteous would grieve over it every day to swallow it, as it is said: "He digs over it all day." Therefore, Benjamin merited and it became a dwelling place for the Divine Presence.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר לֹא נִתְחַלְּקָה יְרוּשָׁלַיִם לִשְׁבָטִים. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מַשְׂכִּירִים בָּתִּים בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵינָן שֶׁלָּהֶן. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר (בַּר צָדוֹק) אוֹמֵר: אַף לֹא מִטּוֹת. לְפִיכָךְ, עוֹרוֹת קָדָשִׁים — בַּעֲלֵי אוּשְׁפִּיזִין נוֹטְלִין אוֹתָן בִּזְרוֹעַ.
human_translation: And this tanna holds Jerusalem was not apportioned to the tribes, as it is taught One may not rent out houses in Jerusalem, due to that do not belong to Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok says: Even beds may not Therefore, hides of offerings innkeepers taking them by force,
llm_translation: The Tanna holds that Jerusalem was not divided among the tribes. As it was taught: One may not rent houses in Jerusalem, because they do not belong to them. Rabbi Elazar (son of Tzadok) says: Not even beds. Therefore, the hides of holy sacrifices - those who are expert tanners may take them by the arm.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְמִישְׁבַּק אִינָשׁ גּוּלְפָּא וּמַשְׁכָּא בְּאוּשְׁפִּיזֵיהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: Learn from it is proper etiquette a person to leave flask and hide at his inn,
llm_translation: Abaye said: "Learn from it that a person should not sit in a place of uncoveredness and expose himself to danger."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא מָכְרוּ שִׁבְעָה טוֹבֵי הָעִיר בְּמַעֲמַד אַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר, אֲבָל מָכְרוּ שִׁבְעָה טוֹבֵי הָעִיר בְּמַעֲמַד אַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר, אֲפִילּוּ
human_translation: Rava said: They taught only when the seven representatives of the town had not sold in an assembly of the residents of the town. However, the seven representatives of the town had sold in an assembly of the residents of the town, even
llm_translation: Rava said: They only taught that they did not sell the seven distinguished members of the city in the presence of the people of the city, but if they sold the seven distinguished members of the city in the presence of the people of the city, even

hebrew_text: לְמִישְׁתֵּא בֵּיהּ שִׁיכְרָא — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: to drink beer with seems well
llm_translation: To drink in it beer - beautiful are its prices.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהוּא תִּילָּא דְּבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לְמִיזְרְעֵהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל זַבְנֵיהּ מִשִּׁבְעָה טוֹבֵי הָעִיר בְּמַעֲמַד אַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר, וְזַרְעֵהּ.
human_translation: Ravina had a certain a mound of a synagogue. He came before Rav Ashi said to him: What is to sowing He said to him: Go, purchase it from the seven representatives of the town in an assembly of the residents of the town, and sow it.
llm_translation: Ravina had a certain fig tree in the courtyard of the synagogue. He came before Rav Ashi, and said to him: "What about planting it?" He said to him: "Go and buy it from seven of the best men in the city, in the presence of the men of the city, and plant it."

hebrew_text: רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא הֲוָה קָא בָנֵי בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא. הֲוָה הָהִיא כְּנִישְׁתָּא עַתִּיקָא, הֲוָה בָּעֵי לְמִיסְתְּרַיהּ וּלְאֵתוֹיֵי לִיבְנֵי וּכְשׁוּרֵי מִינַּהּ וְעַיּוֹלֵי לְהָתָם. יָתֵיב וְקָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ הָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לָא לִיסְתּוֹר בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא עַד דְּבָנֵי בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא אַחֲרִיתִי — הָתָם מִשּׁוּם פְּשִׁיעוּתָא, כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא מַאי? אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא וַאֲסַר לֵיהּ. לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא וַאֲסַר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rami bar Abba was building a synagogue. There was a certain old synagogue he wished to demolish, and bring bricks and beams from it, and bring them to there, He sat and considered that which Rav Ḥisda as Rav Ḥisda said: One should not demolish a synagogue until one has built another synagogue. there due to negligence, a case like this, what He came before Rav Pappa and he prohibited him He before Rav Huna, and he prohibited him
llm_translation: Ramei bar Abba was building the synagogues. That synagogue was ancient, he wanted to hide and bring in stones and beams from it and its types of materials and bring them there. He sat and was seeking advice from Rav Ḥisda, as Rav Ḥisda said: Do not destroy synagogues until you build other synagogues last — there, due to negligence, what is the reason? He came before Rav Papa and he permitted him. He came before Rav Huna and he permitted him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא, חַלּוֹפַהּ וְזַבּוֹנַהּ — שְׁרֵי, אוֹגוֹרַהּ וּמַשְׁכּוֹנַהּ — אֲסִיר. מַאי טַעְמָא: בִּקְדוּשְׁתַּהּ קָאֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: this synagogue, exchanging it or selling it is permitted, renting it or mortgaging it is prohibited. What is the reason remains in its sacred state.
llm_translation: Rava said: This synagogue, its exchange and its purchase - permitted; its storage and its dwelling - prohibited. What is the reason? It stands in its sanctity.

hebrew_text: לִיבְנֵי נָמֵי, חַלּוֹפִינְהוּ וְזַבּוֹנִינְהוּ — שְׁרֵי, אוֹזוֹפִינְהוּ — אֲסִיר. הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּעַתִּיקָתָא, אֲבָל בְּחַדְתָּ[תָ]א — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: also bricks exchanging them or selling them is permitted, renting them out is prohibited. This applies to old but as for new we have no with it
llm_translation: Sons of Na'ami, they exchanged and sold them - permissible, they redeemed them - prohibited. These matters in the ancient times, but in the new times - we do not have authority in them.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הַזְמָנָה מִילְּתָא הִיא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי כְּגוֹן הָאוֹרֵג בֶּגֶד לַמֵּת. אֲבָל הָכָא, כְּטָווּי לְאָרִיג דָּמֵי, וְלֵיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר.
human_translation: And even according to the one who said designation is significant, this applies for example, one who weaves a garment for a corpse. However, here comparable to spun to weave there is no one who said
llm_translation: And even according to the one who says that an appointment is a matter, these matters, such as weaving a garment for the deceased. But here, it is like preparing for weaving, and it is not according to the one who says.

hebrew_text: מַתָּנָה, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא, חַד אָסַר, וְחַד שָׁרֵי. מַאן דְּאָסַר: בְּמַאי תִּפְקַע קְדוּשְׁתַּהּ?! וּמַאן דְּשָׁרֵי: אִי לָאו דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ הֲנָאָה מִינֵּיהּ — לָא הֲוָה יָהֵיב לֵיהּ, הֲדַר הָוֵה לַיהּ מַתָּנָה כִּזְבִינֵי.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree about a gift One prohibited and one permitted The one who prohibits with this its sanctity is removed? And the one who permitted if did not benefit from he would not have given it. the gift has reverted to being like a sale,
llm_translation: Gift, they dispute in it Rav Acha and Ravina, one prohibited, and one permitted. Who prohibited: with what will its sanctity be redeemed?! And who permitted: if it was not pleasurable to him — he would not have given it, he would have taken it back like a purchase.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: תַּשְׁמִישֵׁי מִצְוָה — נִזְרָקִין. תַּשְׁמִישֵׁי קְדוּשָּׁה — נִגְנָזִין. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן תַּשְׁמִישֵׁי מִצְוָה: סוּכָּה, לוּלָב, שׁוֹפָר, צִיצִית. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן תַּשְׁמִישֵׁי קְדוּשָּׁה: דְּלוֹסְקְמֵי סְפָרִים, תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת, וְתִיק שֶׁל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה, וְנַרְתִּיק שֶׁל תְּפִילִּין וּרְצוּעוֹתֵיהֶן.
human_translation: The Sages taught Articles of a mitzva may be thrown out articles sanctity must be interred And these are articles of a mitzva: A sukka ; a lulav ; a shofar ; ritual fringes. And these are articles of sanctity: Cases scrolls, phylacteries; and mezuzot ; and a container for a Torah scroll; and a cover for phylacteries; and their straps.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Items used for a mitzvah - are discarded. Items of holiness - are buried. And these are items used for a mitzvah: a sukkah, a lulav, a shofar, tzitzit. And these are items of holiness: worn-out phylacteries, phylacteries and mezuzot, a Torah scroll case, and the pouch of phylacteries and their straps.
