hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, מֵרֵישׁ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הַאי כּוּרְסְיָא, תַּשְׁמִישׁ דְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הוּא, וּשְׁרֵי. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזֵינָא דְּמוֹתְבִי עִלָּוֵיהּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה, אָמֵינָא: תַּשְׁמִישׁ קְדוּשָּׁה הוּא, וַאֲסִיר.
human_translation: Rava said: Initially, I used to say this lectern is an article of an article And it is permitted once I saw that the Torah scroll is placed upon I said it is an article of sanctity, and it is prohibited
llm_translation: Rava said, "Initially, I thought: this chair, it is a utensil of utility, and permitted. But once I saw that a Torah scroll is placed upon it, I said: it is a holy utensil, and prohibited."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא, מֵרֵישׁ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הַאי פְּרִיסָא, תַּשְׁמִישׁ דְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הוּא. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזֵינָא דְּעָיְיפִי לֵיהּ וּמַנְּחִי סִיפְרָא עִלָּוֵיהּ, אָמֵינָא: תַּשְׁמִישׁ קְדוּשָּׁה הוּא, וַאֲסִיר.
human_translation: And Rava said: Initially, I used to say this curtain, is an article of an article once I saw that is folded over and a Torah scroll is placed upon it. I said it is an article of sanctity and it is prohibited
llm_translation: And Rava said, "Initially, I thought: this cloth is a utensil of a utensil. But when I saw that he was using it and placing a book on it, I said: it is a holy utensil, and it is prohibited."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי תֵּיבוּתָא דְּאִירְפַט, מִיעְבְּדַהּ תֵּיבָה זוּטַרְתִּי — שְׁרֵי, כּוּרְסְיָיא — אֲסִיר. וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי פְּרִיסָא דִּבְלָה, לְמִיעְבְּדֵיהּ פְּרִיסָא לְסִפְרֵי — שְׁרֵי, לְחוּמְשִׁין — אֲסִיר.
human_translation: And Rava said: this ark that has fallen apart, constructing a smaller ark is permitted, a lectern is prohibited And Rava said: this curtain that has become worn out, to fashion it a wrapping cloth for scrolls is permitted, for one of the five is prohibited.
llm_translation: And Rava said: This cushion of earthenware, if one made a cushion smaller than it - it is permitted; if one made a cushion larger than it - it is prohibited. And Rava said: This cloth spread over a bed, if one made a cloth to spread over books - it is permitted; to spread over weapons - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הָנֵי זְבִילֵי דְחוּמָּשֵׁי וְקַמְטְרֵי דְסִפְרֵי — תַּשְׁמִישׁ קְדוּשָּׁה נִינְהוּ, וְנִגְנָזִין. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי לָאו לְכָבוֹד עֲבִידָן, לְנַטּוֹרֵי בְּעָלְמָא עֲבִידִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And Rava said: these cases for one of the five and sacks for scrolls, they are articles of sanctity. they are to be interred Isn’t obvious? Lest you say these are not made for the honor are made merely to protection, teaches us
llm_translation: And Rava said: Those dung of red beets and stalks of sycamore trees — they are used for holy purposes, and are stored away. It is obvious! Lest you say: These are not done for honor, they are done for mundane purposes, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא (דִּיהוּדָאֵי) [דְּ]רוֹמָאֵי דַּהֲוָה פְּתִיחַ לְהָהוּא אִידְּרוֹנָא דַּהֲוָה מַחֵית בֵּיהּ מֵת, וַהֲווֹ בָּעוּ כָּהֲנֵי לְמֵיעַל לְצַלּוֹיֵי הָתָם. אֲתוֹ, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרָבָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: דַּלּוֹ תֵּיבוּתָא אוֹתְבוּהָ, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּלִי עֵץ הֶעָשׂוּי לְנַחַת, וּכְלִי עֵץ הֶעָשׂוּי לְנַחַת אֵינוֹ מְקַבֵּל טוּמְאָה וְחוֹצֵץ בִּפְנֵי הַטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: a certain synagogue of the Jews of Rome that opened out into a room in which a corpse was lying, And the priests wished to enter in order to pray there. They came and spoke to Rava, He said to them: Lift up the ark and put it down as it is a wooden utensil that is designated to rest and a wooden utensil that is designated to rest is not susceptible to ritual impurity, and serves as a barrier to ritual impurity
llm_translation: That certain synagogue (of the) Romans, that was a place of gathering for the community, where there was a certain pillar that was causing death, and the priests came to consult there. They came, they said to Rava. He said to them: Hang a bed, place it there, for it is like a wooden vessel made for resting, and a wooden vessel made for resting does not become impure and does not serve as a barrier before impurity.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: וְהָא זִמְנִין דִּמְטַלְטְלִי לֵיהּ כִּי מַנַּח סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה עִלָּוֵיהּ, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ מִיטַּלְטֵל מָלֵא וְרֵיקָם! אִי הָכִי לָא אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: The Rabbis said to Rava: But isn’t sometimes moved when a Torah scroll is resting inside it, and it is is moved when it is full and when it is empty; If so, it is not possible
llm_translation: The sages said to Rava: But the times when one may carry it (the Torah scroll) on his shoulder, and it would be moving, full and empty! If so, it is not possible.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: מִטְפְּחוֹת סְפָרִים שֶׁבָּלוּ — עוֹשִׂין אוֹתָן תַּכְרִיכִין לְמֵת מִצְוָה, וְזוֹ הִיא גְּנִיזָתָן.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: wrapping cloths of scrolls that have become worn out, they may be made into shrouds for a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ], and this is their interred.
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: From worn-out parchment scrolls, they make them into shrouds for a corpse. This is their proper disposal.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה שֶׁבָּלָה — גּוֹנְזִין אוֹתוֹ אֵצֶל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, וַאֲפִילּוּ שׁוֹנֶה הֲלָכוֹת. אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: וּבִכְלִי חֶרֶס, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּנְתַתָּם בִּכְלִי חָרֶשׂ לְמַעַן יַעַמְדוּ יָמִים רַבִּים״.
human_translation: And Rava said: A Torah scroll that became worn out is interred next to a Torah scholar, and even one who studies the halakhot Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: And in an earthenware vessel, as it is stated: “And put them in an earthenware vessel, that they may last for many days”
llm_translation: And Rava said: A worn-out Torah scroll - we bury it next to a Torah scholar, even if he only reviews laws. Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: And in an earthenware vessel, as it is said: "And you shall place them in an earthenware vessel, so that they may endure for many days."

hebrew_text: (וְאָמַר) רַב פַּפִּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: מִבֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא לְבֵי רַבָּנַן — שְׁרֵי, מִבֵּי רַבָּנַן לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא — אֲסִיר. וְרַב פָּפָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מַתְנִי אִיפְּכָא. אָמַר רַב אַחָא:
human_translation: And Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: from a synagogue into a study hall permitted, from a study hall into a synagogue prohibited, And Rav Pappa in the name of Rava teaches the opposite, Rav Aḥa said:
llm_translation: (And) said Rav Pappi from the name of Rava: From the house of the synagogue to the house of the Rabbis - permitted, from the house of the Rabbis to the house of the synagogue - forbidden. And Rav Papa from the name of Rava taught the opposite. Said Rav Acha:

hebrew_text: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב פַּפֵּי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת — מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: It stands to reason in accordance with Rav Pappi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: It is permitted a synagogue to be made a study hall. learn from it
llm_translation: The measurement of Rav Pappa is reasonable, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A synagogue - it is permitted to make it a study hall. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׂרֹף אֶת בֵּית ה׳ וְאֶת בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ וְאֵת כׇּל בָּתֵּי יְרוּשָׁלִַם וְאֶת כׇּל בֵּית גָּדוֹל שָׂרַף בָּאֵשׁ״. ״בֵּית ה׳״ — זֶה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ. ״בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ״ — אֵלּוּ פַּלְטֵרִין שֶׁל מֶלֶךְ. ״וְאֵת כׇּל בָּתֵּי יְרוּשָׁלִַם״ — כְּמַשְׁמָעָן. ״וְאֶת כׇּל בֵּית גָּדוֹל שָׂרַף בָּאֵשׁ״ — רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, חַד אָמַר: מָקוֹם שֶׁמְּגַדְּלִין בּוֹ תּוֹרָה, וְחַד אָמַר: מָקוֹם שֶׁמְּגַדְּלִין בּוֹ תְּפִלָּה.
human_translation: Bar Kappara interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: “And he burnt the house of the Lord, and the king’s house, and all the houses of Jerusalem, and every great house he burnt with fire” “The house of the Lord”; this is the Holy Temple. “The king’s house”; these are the king’s palaces [ palterin ]. “And all the houses of Jerusalem”; as its literal sense. “And every great house he burnt with fire,” Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi One said: a place where the Torah is made great, and one said: a place where prayer is made great,
llm_translation: Bar Kappara expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "And he burned the house of the Lord and the king's house and all the houses of Jerusalem; every great house he burned with fire." "The house of the Lord" - this is the Temple. "The king's house" - these are the palaces of the king. "And all the houses of Jerusalem" - as it sounds. "Every great house he burned with fire" - Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, one said: a place where Torah is magnified, and one said: a place where prayer is magnified.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר תּוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״ה׳ חָפֵץ לְמַעַן צִדְקוֹ יַגְדִּיל תּוֹרָה וְיַאְדִּיר״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר תְּפִלָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״סַפְּרָה נָּא הַגְּדוֹלוֹת אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה אֱלִישָׁע״, וֶאֱלִישָׁע דַּעֲבַד — בְּרַחֲמֵי הוּא דַּעֲבַד.
human_translation: The one who said Torah as it is written: “The Lord was pleased, for His righteousness’ sake, to make Torah great and glorious” And the one who said prayer as it is written: “Tell me, the great things that Elisha has done” and that which Elisha did, he did through prayer.
llm_translation: The one who says Torah, as it is written: "Hashem desires, for the sake of His righteousness, to make the Torah great and glorious." And the one who says prayer, as it is written: "Tell of the great deeds that Elisha has done," and Elisha who did them, did so with compassion.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי הוּא דְּאָמַר מָקוֹם שֶׁמְּגַדְּלִין בּוֹ תּוֹרָה, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Conclude that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi is the one who said a place where the Torah is made great, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said It is permitted a synagogue to be made a study hall. learn from it
llm_translation: The completion of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, he said: "The place where Torah is magnified, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A synagogue is permitted to be made like a study hall. Learn from it."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מָכְרוּ תּוֹרָה לֹא יִקְחוּ סְפָרִים וְכוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לִמְכּוֹר סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה יָשָׁן לִיקַּח בּוֹ חָדָשׁ? כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מְעַלֵּי לֵיהּ — אָסוּר, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּלֵיכָּא לְעַלּוֹיֵי עִילּוּיָיא אַחֲרִינָא — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי?
human_translation: However, they sold a Torah they may not purchase scrolls A dilemma was raised before What is to sell an old Torah scroll to purchase a new one? since are not raised it is prohibited; or, perhaps since there is no raising another, higher seems well
llm_translation: But they sold a Torah, they should not take books, etc. It was asked of them: What about selling an old Torah scroll to buy a new one? Since he does not elevate it - forbidden, or perhaps: since there are no other elevations afterwards - it is fine?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֲבָל מָכְרוּ תּוֹרָה לֹא יִקְחוּ סְפָרִים. סְפָרִים הוּא דְּלָא, הָא תּוֹרָה בְּתוֹרָה — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי. מַתְנִיתִין דִּיעֲבַד. כִּי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לַן, לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: Come hear However, if they sold a Torah they may not purchase scrolls It is scrolls that may not but Torah with Torah seems well The mishna after the fact When the dilemma was raised to us, ab initio .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: aval makru Torah lo yikchu sefarim. Sefarim hu de'la, ha Torah b'Torah - shapir damei. Matnitin di'avad. Ki ka mivaya lan, l'chatichila." English translation: "Come and hear: But they may not take books for the Torah was sold. Books, that is not so, but the Torah for the Torah - its value is good. Mishnaic teaching that it happened. When it comes to us, initially."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: גּוֹלְלִין סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה בְּמִטְפְּחוֹת חוּמָּשִׁין, וְחוּמָּשִׁין בְּמִטְפְּחוֹת נְבִיאִים וּכְתוּבִים. אֲבָל לֹא נְבִיאִים וּכְתוּבִים בְּמִטְפְּחוֹת חוּמָּשִׁין, וְלֹא חוּמָּשִׁין בְּמִטְפְּחוֹת סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Come hear A Torah scroll may be rolled up in wrapping cloths one of the five And one of the five in wrapping cloths of the Prophets or Writings, However, the Prophets or Writings may not in wrapping cloths of one of the five one of the five may not in wrapping cloths for a Torah scroll.
llm_translation: Come and hear: We roll a Torah scroll with belts, and belts with Prophets and Writings. But not Prophets and Writings with belts, and not belts with a Torah scroll.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: גּוֹלְלִים סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה בְּמִטְפְּחוֹת חוּמָּשִׁין, מִטְפְּחוֹת חוּמָּשִׁין — אִין, מִטְפְּחוֹת סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה — לָא.
human_translation: In any event, is teaching: A Torah scroll may be rolled up in wrapping cloths of one of the five wrapping cloths of one of the five wrapping cloths of Torah scroll, no,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may roll a Torah scroll with belts of fine linen, but not with belts of wool. If with belts of wool — no, but with belts of a Torah scroll — yes.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וְלֹא חוּמָּשִׁין בְּמִטְפְּחוֹת סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה. הָא תּוֹרָה בְּתוֹרָה — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי! אֶלָּא מֵהָא לֵיכָּא לְמִישְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: say the latter clause And one of the five may not in wrapping cloths a Torah scroll. but Torah in Torah seems well. Rather, no can be deduced from
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: v'lo chumashin b'mitpachot sefer Torah. Ha Torah b'Torah - shapir damei! Ela meha leika le'mishma minah." English translation: "Say the latter clause: And not five fifths in the wrappings of a Torah scroll. The Torah in the Torah - its value is beautiful! Rather, from here there is no inference."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מַנִּיחִין סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה עַל גַּבֵּי תּוֹרָה, וְתוֹרָה עַל גַּבֵּי חוּמָּשִׁין, וְחוּמָּשִׁין עַל גַּבֵּי נְבִיאִים וּכְתוּבִים. אֲבָל לֹא נְבִיאִים וּכְתוּבִים עַל גַּבֵּי חוּמָּשִׁין, וְלֹא חוּמָּשִׁין עַל גַּבֵּי תוֹרָה.
human_translation: Come hear A Torah scroll may be placed upon Torah and a Torah upon one of the five and one of the five upon the Prophets or Writings. However, the Prophets or Writings may not upon one of the five and one of the five may not be placed upon a Torah
llm_translation: Come and hear: One may place a Torah scroll on top of another Torah scroll, and a Torah scroll on top of the Five Books of Moses, and the Five Books of Moses on top of the Prophets and Writings. However, one may not place the Prophets and Writings on top of the Five Books of Moses, nor the Five Books of Moses on top of the Torah.

hebrew_text: הַנָּחָה קָאָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי הַנָּחָה, דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, מִיכְרָךְ הֵיכִי כָּרְכִינַן? וְהָא קָא יָתֵיב דַּפָּא אַחַבְרֵיהּ! אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר — שְׁרֵי. הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר — שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: you say of placing placing is different, because it is impossible As, if you do not say so, how furl Does sheet not rest upon another? Rather, since it is impossible it is permitted. Here too, since it is impossible it is permitted.
llm_translation: The text is saying: Is she talking about rest? Rest is different, for it is impossible. For if you do not say so, how will you explain the verse, "And he sat at the entrance of the tent"? Rather, since it is impossible - it is permitted. Here too, since it is impossible - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: לֹא יִמְכּוֹר אָדָם סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה יָשָׁן לִיקַּח בּוֹ חָדָשׁ.
human_translation: Come hear As Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: A person may not sell an old Torah scroll to purchase a new one.
llm_translation: Come and hear: for Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan in the name of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: A person should not sell an old Torah scroll in order to buy a new one.

hebrew_text: הָתָם — מִשּׁוּם פְּשִׁיעוּתָא. כִּי קָאָמְרִינַן: כְּגוֹן דִּכְתִיב וּמַנַּח לְאִיפְּרוֹקֵי, מַאי?
human_translation: There, because of negligence. when we speak, where is written and waiting to be redeemed What
llm_translation: There — because of negligence. When we say: For example, as it is written "and he shall place on the forehead," what?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אֵין מוֹכְרִין סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה וְלִישָּׂא אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Come hear As Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Meir: A Torah scroll may be sold only to study Torah or to marry a woman.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Meir: One may only sell a Torah scroll in order to study Torah and to marry a woman.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תּוֹרָה בְּתוֹרָה שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי. דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי תַּלְמוּד, שֶׁהַתַּלְמוּד מֵבִיא לִידֵי מַעֲשֶׂה. אִשָּׁה נָמֵי: ״לָא תֹהוּ בְרָאָהּ לָשֶׁבֶת יְצָרָהּ״, אֲבָל תּוֹרָה בְּתוֹרָה — לָא.
human_translation: Learn from Torah, for Torah, seems well, Perhaps study is different, as the study leads to action, a woman is also “He created it not a waste; He formed it to be inhabited” But Torah Torah not
llm_translation: Listen, derive from it: Torah within Torah is fitting. Perhaps it differs from Talmud, for Talmud leads to action. A woman said: "He did not create it a waste, He formed it to be inhabited," but Torah within Torah - no.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: לֹא יִמְכּוֹר אָדָם סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לוֹ. יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אֲפִילּוּ אֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל וּמָכַר סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה אוֹ בִּתּוֹ — אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה סִימַן בְּרָכָה לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: the Sages taught A person may not sell a Torah scroll, even if he does not need it. Furthermore, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Even has nothing to eat, and he sold a Torah scroll or his daughter he never sees a sign of blessing
llm_translation: The sages taught: A person should not sell a Torah scroll even if he does not need it. Furthermore, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Even if he has nothing to eat and he sells a Torah scroll or his daughter, he will never see a sign of blessing.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בְּמוֹתְרֵיהֶן. אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁמָּכְרוּ וְהוֹתִירוּ, אֲבָל גָּבוּ וְהוֹתִירוּ — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And similarly, to surplus funds Rava said: They taught only where sold and there was left over. However, if collected and there was left over is permitted
llm_translation: And so in their surplus. Rava said: They only taught that if they sold and left over, but if they collected and left over — it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בַּמָּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁלֹּא הִתְנוּ, אֲבָל הִתְנוּ — אֲפִילּוּ לְדוּכְסוּסְיָא מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to In what is this statement said? When they did not stipulate However, they made a stipulation, even for a dukhsusya is permitted.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: In what case are these words said? - That they did not specify, but if they specified - even for a dukhsuseya it is permitted.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא שֶׁמָּכְרוּ וְהוֹתִירוּ, כִּי הִתְנוּ מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא שֶׁגָּבוּ וְהוֹתִירוּ. טַעְמָא דְּהִתְנוּ, הָא לֹא הִתְנוּ — לָא!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say that they sold and there was left over, when they made a stipulation, of what is it? Rather, where they collected and there was left over the reason that they made stipulation. However, if they did not make a stipulation, no,
llm_translation: How are they similar? If you say that they sold and left over, what did they stipulate? Rather, that they collected and left over. The reason they stipulated, if they did not stipulate — no!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם שֶׁמָּכְרוּ וְהוֹתִירוּ, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: בַּמָּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁלֹּא הִתְנוּ שִׁבְעָה טוֹבֵי הָעִיר בְּמַעֲמַד אַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר, אֲבָל הִתְנוּ שִׁבְעָה טוֹבֵי הָעִיר בְּמַעֲמַד אַנְשֵׁי הָעִיר — אֲפִילּוּ לְדוּכְסוּסְיָא נָמֵי מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Actually, where they sold and there was left over and this is what is saying: In what is this statement said? where the seven representatives of the town did not stipulate in an assembly of the residents of the town. However, if the seven representatives of the town made a stipulation in an assembly of the residents of the town, even for a dukhsusya would also be permitted.
llm_translation: Always they sold and left, and thus it says: In what are these matters said - that they did not appoint seven good men of the city in the presence of the people of the city, but if they appointed seven good men of the city in the presence of the people of the city - even for a tax collector it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְהָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן דַּהֲוָה מְסַדַּר מַתְנְיָתָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מִי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת מַאי ״דּוּכְסוּסְיָא״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: פָּרָשָׁא דְמָתָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to one of the Sages who would arrange the Mishna before Rav Sheshet: Did you hear from Rav Sheshet what dukhsusya He said to him: This is what Rav Sheshet said: the town horseman
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to that certain Sage who used to arrange Mishnayot before Rav Sheshet: "Who informed you from Rav Sheshet what is 'Dukhsusya'?" He said to him, thus said Rav Sheshet: "The interpretation of a verse."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִלְכָּךְ, הַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דִּשְׁמִעַ לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא וְלָא יָדַע פֵּירוּשַׁאּ, לִישַׁיְּילַהּ (קַמֵּיהּ) [לְמַאן] דִּשְׁכִיחַ קַמֵּי(ה) רַבָּנַן, דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר דְּלָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ מִן גַּבְרָא רַבָּה.
human_translation: Abaye said: Accordingly, this young Torah scholar who has heard something and does not know the meaning he should inquire before who is frequently before the Sages, as it is impossible that did not hear from great man.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Therefore, this student who hears a matter from the Rabbis and does not understand its explanation, let him ask (before) to whom he is standing before the Rabbis, for it is impossible that he will not hear from a great man.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: בְּנֵי הָעִיר שֶׁהָלְכוּ לְעִיר אַחֶרֶת וּפָסְקוּ עֲלֵיהֶן צְדָקָה — נוֹתְנִין, וּכְשֶׁהֵן בָּאִין, מְבִיאִין אוֹתָהּ עִמָּהֶן וּמְפַרְנְסִין בָּהּ עֲנִיֵּי עִירָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Meir: residents of a town who went to another town and, made them pledge charity, they must give But when they go they bring it with them, and with it they finance the poor of their town.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Meir: The residents of a city who went to another city and charity was collected on their behalf - they give, and when they return, they bring it with them and support the poor of their own city.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: בְּנֵי הָעִיר שֶׁהָלְכוּ לְעִיר אַחֶרֶת וּפָסְקוּ עֲלֵיהֶן צְדָקָה — נוֹתְנִין, וּכְשֶׁהֵן בָּאִין, מְבִיאִין אוֹתָהּ עִמָּהֶן. וְיָחִיד שֶׁהָלַךְ לְעִיר אַחֶרֶת וּפָסְקוּ עָלָיו צְדָקָה — תִּנָּתֵן לַעֲנִיֵּי אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר.
human_translation: That is also taught residents of a town who went to another town and, made them pledge charity, they must give But when they go they bring it with them. But an individual who went to another town and, made him pledge charity, he should give it to the poor of that town.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: The residents of a city who went to another city and charity was collected on their behalf - it is given, and when they come, it is brought with them. And an individual who went to another city and charity was collected on his behalf - it is given to the poor of that city.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא גְּזַר תַּעֲנִיתָא. עָל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַב חָנָה בַּר חֲנִילַאי וְכֹל בְּנֵי מָתֵיהּ, רְמוֹ עֲלַיְיהוּ צְדָקָה וִיהַבוּ. כִּי בָּעוּ לְמֵיתֵי, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: נִותְּבַהּ לַן מָר וְנֵיזִיל וּנְפַרְנֵס בַּהּ עַנְיֵי מָאתִין.
human_translation: Rav Huna decreed a fast day. Rav Ḥana bar Ḥanilai and all the people of his town came to charity was imposed upon them and they gave When they wanted to go they said to May our Master give to us and we will go and with it we will finance the poor of our own town.
llm_translation: Rav Huna decreed a fast. Rav Hanah bar Hanilai and all the sons of his city raised charity for them and gave. When they wanted to die, they said to him: "Master, let us be satiated and go out and support one hundred poor people with it."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ, תְּנֵינָא: בַּמָּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּשֶׁאֵין שָׁם
human_translation: He said to them: It was taught In what is this statement, said? When there is no
llm_translation: He said to them, "We have learned: In what context are these words spoken? - When there is not there."

hebrew_text: חֲבֵר עִיר, אֲבָל יֵשׁ שָׁם חֲבֵר עִיר — תִּינָּתֵן לַחֲבֵר עִיר. וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן דְּעַנְיֵי דִּידִי וְדִידְכוּ עֲלַי סְמִיכִי.
human_translation: town scholar However, there is a town scholar there, should be given to the town scholar, And all the more so as both my poor and your rely upon me
llm_translation: Fellow of the city, but there is a fellow of the city - the fellow of the city shall be given. And certainly, my witnesses and your witnesses are upon me to support.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מוֹכְרִין אֶת שֶׁל רַבִּים לְיָחִיד, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמּוֹרִידִין אוֹתוֹ מִקְּדוּשָּׁתוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם כֵּן אַף לֹא מֵעִיר גְּדוֹלָה לְעִיר קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: They may not sell belonging to the community to an individual, due to that they downgrade its sanctity, the statement of Rabbi Meir. said to him: If so, also not from a large town to a small town.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not sell property belonging to the public to an individual, because this diminishes its sanctity, the words of Rabbi Meir. They said to him: If so, one should not even transfer a large city to a small one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שַׁפִּיר קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר! וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, מֵעִיר גְּדוֹלָה לְעִיר קְטַנָּה — מֵעִיקָּרָא קַדִּישָׁא, הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי קַדִּישָׁא. מֵרַבִּים לְיָחִיד לֵיכָּא קְדוּשָּׁה.
human_translation: The Rabbis are saying well to Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Meir from a large town to a small town, as at the outset it was sacred now too it is sacred from a community to an individual, there is no the sanctity
llm_translation: The Gemara: "The Rabbis were speaking nicely to Rabbi Meir! And Rabbi Meir, from a large city to a small city — originally it was holy, now it is still holy. When there are many, sanctity does not exist for the individual."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן — אִי אִיכָּא לְמֵיחַשׁ, כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא נָמֵי אִיכָּא לְמֵיחַשׁ, מִשּׁוּם ״בְּרוֹב עָם הַדְרַת מֶלֶךְ״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, If there is to be concerned in a case like this as well, there to be concerned due to “In the multitude of people is the king’s glory”
llm_translation: The sages - if there is room for concern, for this type of case there is room for concern, due to "in the multitude of people is the king's glory."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מוֹכְרִין בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת אֶלָּא עַל תְּנַאי, שֶׁאִם יִרְצוּ יַחְזִירוּהוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ מִמְכַּר עוֹלָם, חוּץ מֵאַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים: לְמֶרְחָץ, וּלְבוּרְסְקִי, לִטְבִילָה, וּלְבֵית הַמַּיִם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מוֹכְרִין אוֹתָהּ לְשֵׁם חָצֵר, וְהַלּוֹקֵחַ — מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצֶה יַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: They may sell a synagogue only with a stipulation that if desire it, will return it the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: They may sell a synagogue with a permanent sale except four things, For a bathhouse, or for a tannery [ burseki ], for immersion, or for a lavatory. Rabbi Yehuda says: They may sell for serving as a courtyard, and the buyer may do as he wishes,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not sell a synagogue except on condition that if they wish, they may redeem it. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. The Sages say: One may sell it permanently, except for four things: for a bathhouse, a tannery, for immersion, and for a water pit. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may sell it for the purpose of a courtyard, and the buyer may do as he pleases.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּלְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הֵיכִי דָּיְירִי בַּהּ? הָא הָוְיָא לַהּ רִבִּית!
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Meir, how may live in it? Isn’t tantamount interest?
llm_translation: Gemara: And for Rabbi Meir, how does it suffice for him? This would be sufficient for him to learn from it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּשִׁיטַת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֲמָרָהּ, דְּאָמַר: צַד אֶחָד בְּרִבִּית מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Meir stated in the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: Uncertain interest, is permitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Meir in the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda said it, as he said: "One side in a ribit transaction is permitted."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה נוֹשֶׁה בַּחֲבֵירוֹ מָנֶה, וְעָשָׂה לוֹ שָׂדֵהוּ מֶכֶר, בִּזְמַן שֶׁמּוֹכֵר אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת — מוּתָּר, לוֹקֵחַ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת — אָסוּר.
human_translation: as it is taught one had a debt of one hundred dinars against his fellow, and made sale of his field as long as the seller consumes the produce is permitted. buyer consumes the produce, prohibited,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Behold, if one was lending to his fellow a Maneh, and he made a sale of his field to him, at the time when he sells, eating its fruits is permitted; when he buys, eating its fruits is prohibited.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ לוֹקֵחַ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת — מוּתָּר. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּבַיְתוֹס בֶּן זוֹנִן שֶׁעָשָׂה שָׂדֵהוּ מֶכֶר עַל פִּי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, וְלוֹקֵחַ אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת הָיָה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִשָּׁם רְאָיָה?! מוֹכֵר אוֹכֵל פֵּירוֹת הָיָה וְלֹא לוֹקֵחַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even buyer consumes the produce, it is permitted. And Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident involving Baitos ben Zunen, who made sale of his field under the direction of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, and the buyer was consuming the produce said to him: a proof from there? the seller who was consuming the produce and not the buyer.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: Even if one is taking or eating fruits - it is permitted. And Rabbi Yehudah said: There was an incident with Baytus ben Zonin who sold his field according to the ruling of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, and he was taking and eating fruits. They said to him: Is there any proof from there?! He was selling and eating fruits, not taking.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? צַד אֶחָד בְּרִבִּית אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. מָר סָבַר: צַד אֶחָד בְּרִבִּית מוּתָּר, וּמָר סָבַר: צַד אֶחָד בְּרִבִּית אָסוּר.
human_translation: What is between them? an uncertain interest is the between them. Sage, holds uncertain interest is permitted and Sage, holds uncertain interest is prohibited.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is one side in ribit that distinguishes between them. One Master holds: one side in ribit is permitted, and one Master holds: one side in ribit is forbidden.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא צַד אֶחָד בְּרִבִּית אָסוּר, וְהָכָא רִבִּית עַל מְנָת לְהַחֲזִיר אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. מָר סָבַר: רִבִּית עַל מְנָת לְהַחֲזִיר מוּתָּר, וּמָר סָבַר: אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rava said According to everyone, uncertain interest is prohibited, and here interest on the condition that it will be returned is between them. Sage, holds interest on condition that it will be returned is permitted; And Sage, holds it is prohibited.
llm_translation: Rava said: In general, interest from one side is prohibited, but here, interest is permitted in order to return, there is a distinction between them. Mar thought: Interest in order to return is permitted, and Mar thought: It is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים מוֹכְרִין אוֹתוֹ מִמְכַּר עוֹלָם וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוּתָּר לָאָדָם לְהַשְׁתִּין מַיִם בְּתוֹךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁל תְּפִלָּה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: They may sell a synagogue with a permanent sale. Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: It is permitted for a person to urinate within four cubits of a prayer,
llm_translation: The Sages say: "One may sell it as a permanent sale, etc." Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: It is permitted for a person to urinate within four cubits of prayer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מוֹכְרִין אוֹתָהּ לְשׁוּם חָצֵר, וְלוֹקֵחַ — מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצֶה יַעֲשֶׂה. וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן לָא קָאָמְרִי אֶלָּא בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת, דִּקְבִיעַ קְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ. אֲבָל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, דְּלָא קְבִיעַ קְדוּשְׁתַּיְיהוּ — לָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: What is he teaching us? We learned Rabbi Yehuda says: They may sell as a courtyard, and the buyer may do with it as he wishes, And even the Rabbis, say only a synagogue whose sanctity is permanent. However, four cubits whose sanctity is not permanent, no,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: What is he implying to us? It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: One may sell it for the sake of a courtyard, and the buyer may do as he pleases. And even the Rabbis only said this regarding a synagogue, for its sanctity is established. But for four cubits, whose sanctity is not established - no.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל — מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וּמַשְׁתִּין, וְהַמַּשְׁתִּין — מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וּמִתְפַּלֵּל.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav Naḥman: One who prayed should distance himself four cubits and may he urinate. And one who urinated should distance himself four cubits, and may he pray.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Nachman: One who prays - he distances four cubits and urinates, and one who urinates - he distances four cubits and prays.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בִּשְׁלָמָא הַמַּשְׁתִּין מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וּמִתְפַּלֵּל — תְּנֵינָא: כַּמָּה יַרְחִיק מֵהֶן וּמִן הַצּוֹאָה, אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת.
human_translation: said to him: Granted, one who urinated should distance himself four cubits and may he pray, we learned How far must one distance from and excrement? Four cubits.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Indeed, one who urinates should distance himself four cubits and pray." We learned: "How far should he distance himself from them and from excrement? Four cubits."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל מַרְחִיק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת וּמַשְׁתִּין לְמָה לִי? אִי הָכִי, קַדֵּשְׁתִּינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ שְׁבִילֵי דִנְהַרְדְּעָא. תְּנִי: יִשְׁהֶה.
human_translation: But one who prayed should distance four cubits and may he urinate, why should I If that is so, you have sanctified all the streets of the city of Neharde’a, teach one should wait the time
llm_translation: Rather: one who prays distances four cubits and urinates, why to me? If so, I have sanctified them for all the paths of the river. It was taught: he should wait.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מַשְׁתִּין יִשְׁהֶה כְּדֵי הִילּוּךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, מִשּׁוּם נִיצוֹצוֹת. אֶלָּא: מִתְפַּלֵּל יִשְׁהֶה כְּדֵי הִילּוּךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, לְמָה לִי? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שֶׁכֹּל אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת תְּפִלָּתוֹ סְדוּרָה בְּפִיו, וְרַחוֹשֵׁי מְרַחֲשָׁן שִׂפְווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Granted, one who urinated waits the time it takes to walk four cubits due to the droplets However, one who prayed should wait the time it takes to walk four cubits why should I Rav Ashi said: Because all four cubits, his prayer is arranged in his mouth, and his lips are articulating
llm_translation: In truth, one should urinate and wait the time it takes to walk four cubits, due to drips. Rather, one who prays should wait the time it takes to walk four cubits, why? Rav Ashe said: Because his entire prayer of four cubits is arranged in his mouth, and the whisperers are whispering his lips.

hebrew_text: זַלְפָ״‎ן סִימָן.
human_translation: a mnemonic Zayin , lamed , peh , nun .
llm_translation: Zalfan siman.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי זַכַּאי: בַּמָּה הֶאֱרַכְתָּ יָמִים? אָמַר לָהֶם: מִיָּמַי לֹא הִשְׁתַּנְתִּי מַיִם בְּתוֹךְ אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת שֶׁל תְּפִלָּה, וְלֹא כִּנִּיתִי שֵׁם לַחֲבֵירִי, וְלֹא בִּיטַּלְתִּי קִידּוּשׁ הַיּוֹם. אִמָּא זְקֵינָה הָיְתָה לִי, פַּעַם אַחַת מָכְרָה כִּפָּה שֶׁבְּרֹאשָׁהּ וְהֵבִיאָה לִי קִידּוּשׁ הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi Zakkai was asked by his disciples: In which were you longevity? He said to them: In my days, I never urinated within four cubits of prayer. Nor did I call my fellow by a nickname. And I never neglected sanctifying the day I had an elderly mother, once, she sold the kerchief that was on her head, and she brought me sanctifying the day.
llm_translation: They asked his students Rabbi Zakkai: "In what have you prolonged days?" He said to them: "From my days I have not changed water within four cubits of prayer, and I have not given a nickname to my friend, and I have not neglected the sanctification of the day. I had an elderly mother, once she sold a headscarf and brought me the sanctification of the day."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: כְּשֶׁמֵּתָה, הַנִּיחָה לוֹ שְׁלוֹשׁ מֵאוֹת גַּרְבֵי יַיִן. כְּשֶׁמֵּת הוּא, הִנִּיחַ לְבָנָיו שְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים גַּרְבֵי יַיִן.
human_translation: It was taught When died, she left him three hundred barrels of wine. When he died, he left his sons three thousand barrels of wine.
llm_translation: Mishnah: When she died, she left for him three hundred barrels of wine. When he died, he left for his sons three thousand barrels of wine.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא הֲוָה אָסַר רִיתָא וְקָאֵי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב, אָמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא הֲוָה לִי קִידּוּשָׁא, וּמַשְׁכַּנְתֵּיהּ לְהֶמְיָינַאי וְאֵתַאי בֵּיהּ קִידּוּשָׁא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יְהֵא רַעֲוָא דְּתִיטּוּם בְּשִׁירָאֵי.
human_translation: Rav Huna was girded with straw [ rita ] and was standing before Rav. said to him: What is this? He said I had no sanctifying so I pawned my belt [ hemyanai ], and with I brought sanctifying said to him: May it be will you be enveloped in silk [ shira’ei ]
llm_translation: Rav Huna was engaged in marital relations and Rav came before him, he said to him: What is this? He said to him: I did not have a ritual immersion, and I engaged in marital relations with her, and then I had a ritual immersion. He said to him: May the evil that is within you be wrapped in thorns.

hebrew_text: כִּי אִיכַּלַּל רַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ, רַב הוּנָא אִינִישׁ גּוּצָא הֲוָה, גְּנָא אַפּוּרְיָא. אָתְיָין בְּנָתֵיהּ וְכַלָּתֵיהּ שָׁלְחָן וְשָׁדְיָין מָנַיְיהוּ עֲלֵיהּ עַד דְּאִיטּוּם בְּשִׁירָאֵי. שְׁמַע רַב וְאִיקְּפַד, אֲמַר: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אֲמַרְתְּ לִי כִּי בָּרֵכְתָּיךְ: ״וְכֵן לְמָר״.
human_translation: When Rabba, his son, was married, Rav Huna, was a short man, was lying on bed, His daughters and daughters-in-law came removed and threw their garments upon him until he was enveloped in silk. Rav heard he became angry said: What is the reason when I blessed you, you did not say to me: And likewise to Master?
llm_translation: When Rabba, his son, became ill, Rav Huna said: "A certain demon was involved, a white one." His daughters and daughters-in-law prepared a table and sent it to him until they became drunk with wine. Rav heard and became angry, saying: "Why did you not tell me that you blessed him: 'And so to my master'?"

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ: בַּמָּה הֶאֱרַכְתָּ יָמִים? אָמַר לָהֶם: מִיָּמַי לֹא עָשִׂיתִי קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וְלֹא פָּסַעְתִּי עַל רָאשֵׁי עַם קָדוֹשׁ, וְלֹא נָשָׂאתִי כַּפַּי בְּלֹא בְּרָכָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua was asked by his disciples: In which were you longevity? He said to them: In my days, I never made a shortcut through a synagogue. Nor did I stride over heads of sacred people, And I never raised my hands without a blessing
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua: "By what means have you lengthened your days?" He said to them: "Throughout my days, I have not made a shortcut through the synagogue, nor have I stepped over the heads of the holy people, nor have I raised my hands without a blessing."

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי פְּרִידָא: בַּמָּה הֶאֱרַכְתָּ יָמִים? אָמַר לָהֶם: מִיָּמַי לֹא קְדָמַנִי אָדָם לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ,
human_translation: Rabbi Perida was asked by his disciples: In which were you longevity? He said to them: In my days, no person before me to the study hall,
llm_translation: They asked his students Rabbi P'rida: "In what did you merit long days?" He said to them: "Since my youth no man preceded me to the study hall."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בֵּרַכְתִּי לִפְנֵי כֹהֵן, וְלֹא אָכַלְתִּי מִבְּהֵמָה שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ מַתְּנוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: And I never recited in the presence of a priest, And I never ate from an animal whose portions, had not been set aside.
llm_translation: "And not I blessed before kohen, and not I ate from animal that not separated its gifts."

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָסוּר לֶאֱכוֹל מִבְּהֵמָה שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ מַתְּנוֹתֶיהָ. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל מִבְּהֵמָה שֶׁלֹּא הוּרְמוּ מַתְּנוֹתֶיהָ, כְּאִילּוּ אוֹכֵל טְבָלִים. וְלֵית הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: which Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is prohibited to eat from an animal whose portions have not been set aside. And Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Anyone who eats from an animal whose portions have not been set aside is as if he were eating untithed produce. And the halakha is not in accordance with his
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rabbi Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: It is forbidden to eat from an animal that its tithes have not been separated. And Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who eats from an animal that its tithes have not been separated is as if he eats from consecrated property. And there is no halacha like his opinion.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בֵּרַכְתִּי לִפְנֵי כֹהֵן,
human_translation: And I never blessed in the presence of a priest,
llm_translation: And not I blessed before kohen,

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דִּמְעַלְּיוּתָא הִיא? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁמְּבָרֵךְ לְפָנָיו, אֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל עַם הָאָרֶץ — אוֹתוֹ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם חַיָּיב מִיתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל מְשַׂנְאַי אָהֲבוּ מָוֶת״. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״מְשַׂנְאַי״, אֶלָּא ״מַשְׂנִיאַי״.
human_translation: Is this to say that is virtuous? But Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Any Torah scholar who to bless in his presence, even a High Priest who is an ignoramus, that Torah scholar is liable to death penalty as it is stated: “All those who hate me, love death” Do not read “those who hate Me [ mesan’ai ],” rather Those who make Me hated [ masni’ai ].
llm_translation: In the matter of arrogance, what is it? And Rabbi Yochanan said: Any Torah scholar who blesses before you, even a High Priest who is an ignoramus - that Torah scholar is liable to death, as it is stated: "All who hate Me love death." Do not read it as "those who hate," but rather "those who cause hatred."

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמַר אִיהוּ, בְּשָׁוִין.
human_translation: When says this, of equal
llm_translation: For he said, "In agreement."

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא בֶּן הַקָּנָה: בַּמֶּה הֶאֱרַכְתָּ יָמִים? אָמַר לָהֶם: מִיָּמַי לֹא נִתְכַּבַּדְתִּי בִּקְלוֹן חֲבֵרִי, וְלֹא עָלְתָה עַל מִטָּתִי קִלְלַת חֲבֵרִי, וּוַתְּרָן בְּמָמוֹנִי הָיִיתִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥunya ben HaKana was asked by his disciples: In which were you longevity? He said to them: In my days, I never attained veneration at my fellow’s degradation. Nor did my fellow’s curse go up with me upon my bed. And I was openhanded with my money.
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Neḥunyah ben HaQanah: "In what have you prolonged days?" He said to them: "In my days, I have not honored myself with the disgrace of my fellow, nor has the curse of my fellow come upon my bed, and I have been liberal with my money."

hebrew_text: לֹא נִתְכַּבַּדְתִּי בִּקְלוֹן חֲבֵרִי — כִּי הָא דְּרַב הוּנָא דָּרֵי מָרָא אַכַּתְפֵּיהּ. אֲתָא רַב חָנָא בַּר חֲנִילַאי וְקָא דָרֵי מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי רְגִילַתְּ דְּדָרֵית בְּמָאתָיךְ — דְּרִי, וְאִי לָא, אִתְיַיקּוֹרֵי אֲנָא בְּזִילוּתָא דִּידָךְ לָא נִיחָא לִי.
human_translation: I never attained veneration at my fellow’s denigration. such as that of Rav Huna, who was carrying a hoe over his shoulder Rav Ḥana bar Ḥanilai came and, took the hoe from him said to him: If you are accustomed to carry in your own city, carry it; but if not, for me to be venerated through your denigration is not pleasing for me.
llm_translation: I have not honored with disgrace my colleague - for this is like what Rav Huna who was a master of appearance did. Rav Ḥana bar Ḥanilai came and was a master of heresy. He said to him: If you are accustomed to dwell in your hundred, dwell, but if not, I am not pleased with your going out.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עָלְתָה עַל מִטָּתִי קִלְלַת חֲבֵרִי — כִּי הָא דְּמַר זוּטְרָא כִּי הֲוָה סָלֵיק לְפוּרְיֵיהּ, אֲמַר: שְׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְכׇל מַאן דְּצַעֲרָן.
human_translation: Nor did my fellow’s curse go up with me upon my bed. such as that of Mar Zutra. When he would go to bed he would say: I forgive anyone who has vexed me.
llm_translation: "And not ascended upon my bed curse of my friend — for this that said Mar Zutra when he would go out to relieve himself, he would say: 'Permitted to him all who cause him distress.'"

hebrew_text: וּוַתְּרָן בְּמָמוֹנִי הָיִיתִי — דְּאָמַר מָר: אִיּוֹב וַותְּרָן בְּמָמוֹנֵיהּ הֲוָה, שֶׁהָיָה מַנִּיחַ פְּרוּטָה לַחֶנְוָנִי מִמָּמוֹנֵיהּ.
human_translation: And I was openhanded with my money. that which the Master said: Job was openhanded with his money, as he would leave a peruta of his money with the shopkeeper.
llm_translation: And I was wealthy - as Mar said: If Job was wealthy in his money, for he would leave a small coin for the beggar from his money.

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֶת רַבִּי נְחוּנְיָא הַגָּדוֹל (אָמַר לוֹ): בַּמֶּה הֶאֱרַכְתָּ יָמִים? אֲתוֹ גַּוּוֹזֵי וְקָא מָחוּ לֵיהּ. סְלֵיק, יְתֵיב אַרֵישָׁא דְּדִיקְלָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ, רַבִּי: אִם נֶאֱמַר ״כֶּבֶשׂ״ לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״אֶחָד״? אָמַר לְהוּ: צוּרְבָּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן הוּא, שִׁבְקוּהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva asked Rabbi Neḥunya the Great; he said to him: In which were you longevity? attendants [ gavzei ] came and beating he climbed up and sat upon the top of a date palm. he said to My teacher, If it is stated “lamb” why is it stated “one”; said to He is a young Torah scholar, let him be.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva asked Rabbi Nechunia the Elder: "In what have you lengthened days?" He came and kissed him. He went out, sat at the head of the palm tree, and said to him, "Rabbi, if it says 'a lamb,' why does it say 'one'?" He said to them: "It is a tradition from the Sages, leave it."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״אֶחָד״ — מְיוּחָד שֶׁבְּעֶדְרוֹ.
human_translation: he said to him: “one” the unique one of its flock,
llm_translation: He said to him: "One" - unique in its order.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִיָּמַי לֹא קִבַּלְתִּי מַתָּנוֹת, וְלֹא עָמַדְתִּי עַל מִדּוֹתַי, וּוַתְּרָן בְּמָמוֹנִי הָיִיתִי.
human_translation: said to him: In my days I never accepted gifts. Nor was I inflexible a measure And I was openhanded with my money.
llm_translation: He said to him: "From my youth I did not accept gifts, and I did not rely on my character traits, and I was lenient with my money."

hebrew_text: לֹא קִבַּלְתִּי מַתָּנוֹת, כִּי הָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כִּי הֲווֹ מְשַׁדְּרִי לֵיהּ מַתָּנוֹת מִבֵּי נְשִׂיאָה — לָא הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל. כִּי הֲוָה מְזַמְּנִי לֵיהּ — לָא הֲוָה אָזֵיל, אֲמַר לְהוּ: לָא נִיחָא לְכוּ דְּאֶחְיֶה, דִּכְתִיב: ״שׂוֹנֵא מַתָּנוֹת יִחְיֶה״. רַבִּי זֵירָא כִּי הֲווֹ מְשַׁדְּרִי לֵיהּ מִבֵּי נְשִׂיאָה — לָא הֲוָה שָׁקֵיל. כִּי הֲוָה מְזַמְּנִי לֵיהּ — אָזֵיל. אֲמַר: אִתְיַיקּוֹרֵי דְּמִתְיַיקְּרִי בִּי.
human_translation: I never accepted gifts; such as that of Rabbi Elazar. When they would send him gifts from the house of the Nasi , he would not take and when they would invite him, he would not go He say to them: Is it not pleasing to you that I should live, as it is written: “He that hates gifts shall live” Rabbi Zeira when they would send him from the house of the Nasi , he would not accept but when they would invite him, he would go He said: They are honored by my
llm_translation: I did not accept gifts, for this is like what Rabbi Elazar said: when they used to send him gifts from the house of the president, he would not accept. When they would invite him, he would not go. He said to them: It is not pleasing to me to live, as it is written: "He who hates gifts will live." Rabbi Zeira, when they used to send him gifts from the house of the president, he would not accept. When they would invite him, he would go. He said: The sharp ones are sharp with me.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא עָמַדְתִּי עַל מִדּוֹתַי — דְּאָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַמַּעֲבִיר עַל מִדּוֹתָיו — מַעֲבִירִין מִמֶּנּוּ כׇּל פְּשָׁעָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן וְעוֹבֵר עַל פֶּשַׁע״. לְמִי נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן — לְמִי שֶׁעוֹבֵר עַל פֶּשַׁע.
human_translation: Nor was I inflexible a measure which Rava said: Anyone who overlooks a measure all his transgressions are removed from him, as it is stated: “He pardons iniquity and overlooks transgression” For whom does He pardon iniquity? For he who overlooks transgressions
llm_translation: I did not stand on my measures - as Rava said: Anyone who overlooks his measures - they overlook all his transgressions from him, as it is stated: "He who bears iniquity and passes over transgression." To whom does "bears iniquity" refer? To one who passes over transgression.

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל רַבִּי אֶת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה: בַּמָּה הֶאֱרַכְתָּ יָמִים? אָמַר לוֹ: קַצְתָּ בְּחַיַּי? אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, תּוֹרָה הִיא וְלִלְמוֹד אֲנִי צָרִיךְ. אָמַר לוֹ: מִיָּמַי לֹא נִסְתַּכַּלְתִּי בִּדְמוּת אָדָם רָשָׁע. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָסוּר לְאָדָם לְהִסְתַּכֵּל בְּצֶלֶם דְּמוּת אָדָם רָשָׁע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לוּלֵא פְּנֵי יְהוֹשָׁפָט מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה אֲנִי נוֹשֵׂא אִם אַבִּיט אֵלֶיךָ וְאִם אֶרְאֶךָּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa: In which were you longevity? He said to him: are you wearied of my life? said to him: My teacher, it is Torah and I must learn said to him: In my days I never gazed at the likeness of a wicked man, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is prohibited for a person to gaze in the image of the likeness of a wicked man, as it is stated “Were it not that I regard the presence of Jehoshaphat, the king of Judea, I would not look toward you, nor see you”
llm_translation: Rabbi asked Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha: "In what have you lengthened days?" He said to him: "Have you shortened my life?" He said to him: "Rabbi, it is Torah, and to learn I am in need." He said to him: "In my days, I have not looked upon the likeness of a wicked person." For Rabbi Yochanan said: "It is forbidden for a person to look at the image of a wicked person, as it is stated: 'Should I not look favorably upon Jehoshaphat king of Judah, I would not look at you nor see you.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: עֵינָיו כֵּהוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי כִּי זָקֵן יִצְחָק וַתִּכְהֶיןָ עֵינָיו מֵרְאוֹת״, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִסְתַּכַּל בְּעֵשָׂו הָרָשָׁע.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: his eyes become dim, as it is stated: “And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim so that he could not see” because he gazed at the wicked Esau.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: His eyes became dim, as it is stated: "Now it came to pass, when Isaac was old, and his eyes were too dim to see," because he gazed at Esau the wicked.

hebrew_text: וְהָא גְּרַמָא לֵיהּ? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: לְעוֹלָם אַל תְּהִי קִלְלַת הֶדְיוֹט קַלָּה בְּעֵינֶיךָ, שֶׁהֲרֵי אֲבִימֶלֶךְ קִלֵּל אֶת שָׂרָה, וְנִתְקַיֵּים בְּזַרְעָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִנֵּה הוּא לָךְ כְּסוּת עֵינַיִם״: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״כְּסוּת״, אֶלָּא ״כְּסִיַּית עֵינַיִם״!
human_translation: Did this cause Didn’t Rabbi Yitzḥak say: A curse of an ordinary person should not be lightly regarded in your eyes, because Abimelech cursed Sarah, and was fulfilled, in her descendant. As it is stated “Behold, it is for you a covering of the eyes” Do not read “a covering [ kesut ] rather A blindness [ kesiat ] of the eyes.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: And did the bone cause it? But didn't Rabbi Yitzchak say: Always let not the curse of a commoner be light in your eyes, for behold, Avimelech cursed Sarah, and it was fulfilled in her offspring, as it is stated: "Behold, it is for you a covering of the eyes." Do not read it as "covering," but rather as "covering of the eyes"!

hebrew_text: הָא וְהָא גְּרַמָא לֵיהּ. רָבָא אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״שְׂאֵת פְּנֵי רָשָׁע לֹא טוֹב״.
human_translation: this and that caused it. Rava said: from here: “It is not good to raise the face of the wicked”
llm_translation: Here and here caused to him. Rava said, from here: "To show partiality to the wicked is not good."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעַת פְּטִירָתוֹ, אָמַר לוֹ: [רַבִּי] בָּרְכֵנִי! אָמַר לוֹ: יְהִי רָצוֹן שֶׁתַּגִּיעַ לַחֲצִי יָמַי. וּלְכוּלְּהוּ לָא? אָמַר לוֹ: הַבָּאִים אַחֲרֶיךָ — בְּהֵמָה יִרְעוּ?!
human_translation: At the time of departure said to him: My teacher, bless me. He said to him: May it be will that you reach to half of my days. to the entirety of not said to him: Shall those who come after you tend cattle?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: At the time of his passing, he said to him: Rabbi, bless me! He said to him: May it be the will that you reach half my days. And for all of them not? He said to him: Those who come after you - shall they graze like cattle?! English translation: At the time of his passing, he said to him: Rabbi, bless me! He said to him: May it be the will that you reach half my days. And for all of them not? He said to him: Those who come after you - shall they graze like cattle?!

hebrew_text: אֲבוּהּ בַּר אִיהִי וּמִנְיָמִן בַּר אִיהִי, חַד אָמַר: תֵּיתֵי לִי דְּלָא אִסְתַּכַּלִי בְּגוֹי, וְחַד אָמַר: תֵּיתֵי לִי דְּלָא עֲבַדִי שׁוּתָּפוּת בַּהֲדֵי גּוֹי.
human_translation: Avuh bar Ihi and Minyamin bar Ihi One said: May come to me for I never gazed at gentile. And one said: May come to me for I never formed a partnership with gentile,
llm_translation: Avuh bar Ihi and Minyamin bar Ihi, one said: "Give me so that I do not rely on a non-Jew," and one said: "Give me so that I do not engage in partnership with a non-Jew."

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי זֵירָא: בַּמָּה הֶאֱרַכְתָּ יָמִים? אָמַר לָהֶם: מִיָּמַי לֹא הִקְפַּדְתִּי בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתִי, וְלֹא צָעַדְתִּי בִּפְנֵי מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנִּי, וְלֹא הִרְהַרְתִּי בִּמְבוֹאוֹת הַמְטוּנָּפוֹת, וְלֹא הָלַכְתִּי אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בְּלֹא תּוֹרָה וּבְלֹא תְּפִילִּין, וְלֹא יָשַׁנְתִּי בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ לֹא שֵׁינַת קֶבַע וְלֹא שֵׁינַת עֲרַאי, וְלֹא שַׂשְׂתִּי בְּתַקָּלַת חֲבֵירִי, וְלֹא קָרָאתִי לַחֲבֵירִי (בַּחֲנִיכָתוֹ), וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: (בַּחֲכִינָתוֹ).
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira was asked by his disciples: In which were you longevity? He said to them: In my days, I was never angry inside my house Nor did I walk ahead of someone who was a greater than me. Nor did I meditate in filthy alleyways, Nor did I walk four cubits without Torah or without phylacteries. Nor did I sleep in a study hall, neither a deep sleep or a brief nap. Nor did I rejoice when my fellow stumbled. Nor did I call my fellow by his derogatory nickname [ ḥanikhato ]. And some say his nickname [ ḥakhinato ],
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Zeira: In what have you prolonged days? He said to them: From my youth I did not take care within my house, and I did not walk before one greater than myself, and I did not contemplate the entrances of the perfumed chambers, and I did not walk four cubits without Torah and without Tefillin, and I did not sleep in the study hall, neither a permanent sleep nor a temporary sleep, and I did not rejoice in the downfall of my fellow, and I did not call my fellow (by a nickname), and it is said: (in his wisdom).

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת שֶׁחָרַב — אֵין מַסְפִּידִין בְּתוֹכוֹ, וְאֵין מַפְשִׁילִין בְּתוֹכוֹ חֲבָלִים, וְאֵין פּוֹרְשִׂין לְתוֹכוֹ מְצוּדוֹת, וְאֵין שׁוֹטְחִין עַל גַּגּוֹ פֵּירוֹת, וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין אוֹתוֹ קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא,
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda said further: A synagogue that fell into ruin one may not eulogize in it. And nor may one stretch out ropes in it. And nor may one spread traps within it. And nor may one spread out produce upon its roof And nor may one make it a shortcut.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: If a synagogue collapses, one does not eulogize within it, and one does not spread ropes within it, and one does not set up traps within it, and one does not spread out fruits on its roof, and one does not make it into a storage room.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַהֲשִׁמּוֹתִי אֶת מִקְדְּשֵׁיכֶם״ — קְדוּשָּׁתָן אַף כְּשֶׁהֵן שׁוֹמְמִין.
human_translation: as it is stated: “And I will bring desolation to your sanctuaries” their sanctity even when they are desolate.
llm_translation: It is stated: "And I will desolate your sanctuaries" — their holiness even when they are desolate.

hebrew_text: עָלוּ בּוֹ עֲשָׂבִים לֹא יִתְלוֹשׁ, מִפְּנֵי עׇגְמַת נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: grass sprang up in one should not pick due to anguish
llm_translation: They ascended upon it herbs not shall be uprooted, because of distress of soul.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת אֵין נוֹהֲגִין בָּהֶן קַלּוּת רֹאשׁ. אֵין אוֹכְלִין בָּהֶן, וְאֵין שׁוֹתִין בָּהֶן,
human_translation: The Sages taught synagogues: One may not act inside them with frivolity. one may not eat in them; nor may one drink in them;
llm_translation: The sages taught: In synagogues, they do not engage in light-headedness. They do not eat in them, and they do not drink in them.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין נֵיאוֹתִין בָּהֶם, וְאֵין מְטַיְּילִין בָּהֶם, וְאֵין נִכְנָסִין בָּהֶן בַּחַמָּה מִפְּנֵי הַחַמָּה, וּבַגְּשָׁמִים מִפְּנֵי הַגְּשָׁמִים. וְאֵין מַסְפִּידִין בָּהֶן הֶסְפֵּד שֶׁל יָחִיד. אֲבָל קוֹרִין בָּהֶן, וְשׁוֹנִין בָּהֶן, וּמַסְפִּידִין בָּהֶן הֶסְפֵּד שֶׁל רַבִּים,
human_translation: and one may not adorn oneself inside them; nor may one wander about inside them; nor may one enter them in the sun from the sun, or in the rain from the rain; nor may one offer a eulogy inside them for an individual, However, one may read inside them, and one may study inside them, and one may offer a eulogy inside them for the public
llm_translation: And we do not adorn them, and we do not take walks in them, and we do not enter them in the sun because of the sun, and in the rain because of the rain. And we do not eulogize in them an individual eulogy. But we read in them, and repeat in them, and eulogize in them a communal eulogy.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי — בְּיִשּׁוּבָן, אֲבָל בְּחוּרְבָּנָן — מַנִּיחִין אוֹתָן וְעוֹלִין בָּהֶן עֲשָׂבִים, וְלֹא יִתְלוֹשׁ מִפְּנֵי עׇגְמַת נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: When When occupied But when they are in ruin, they should be left alone grass will sprout up inside them. And should not be picked due to anguish
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: When — in their return, but in their destruction — we leave them and plant grass in them, and they should not be uprooted due to distress of the soul.

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂבִים מַאן דְּכַר שְׁמַיְיהוּ? חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: וּמְכַבְּדִין אוֹתָן וּמַרְבִּיצִין אוֹתָן כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲלוּ בָּהֶן עֲשָׂבִים. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי — בְּיִשּׁוּבָן, אֲבָל בְּחוּרְבָּנָן — מַנִּיחִין אוֹתָן לַעֲלוֹת. עָלוּ בָּהֶן עֲשָׂבִים — לֹא יִתְלוֹשׁ, מִפְּנֵי עׇגְמַת נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: grass? Who mentioned about it? is incomplete and is teaching the following: And they should sweep them and sprinkle in order that grass not sprout up in them. Rabbi Yehuda said: When When occupied but when they are in ruin, they should be left alone will sprout up inside them. grass did sprout up, it should not be removed, due to anguish
llm_translation: Plants - who mentions their name? The sages of Yisrael. And thus it was taught: "And they honor them and spread them out so that plants do not grow in them." Rabbi Yehuda said: When? - in their return, but in their ruin - they let them grow. If plants grow in them - they should not be uprooted, due to distress of the soul.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת שֶׁבְּבָבֶל, עַל תְּנַאי הֵן עֲשׂוּיִין. וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן, אֵין נוֹהֲגִין בָּהֶן קַלּוּת רֹאשׁ. וּמַאי נִיהוּ — חֶשְׁבּוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Asi said: Synagogues in Babylonia are built with a stipulation But nevertheless, should not act inside them with frivolity. What is this? calculations
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: The synagogues in Babylon are made according to their custom. Nevertheless, they do not conduct themselves with frivolity in them. And what is the reason? - Considerations.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת שֶׁמְּחַשְּׁבִין בּוֹ חֶשְׁבּוֹנוֹת — מְלִינִין בּוֹ אֶת הַמֵּת. מְלִינִין סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ? לָא סַגִּי דְּלָאו הָכִי? אֶלָּא, לְסוֹף שֶׁיָּלִינוּ בּוֹ מֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Rav Asi said: a synagogue in which make calculations, they will keep a corpse inside it overnight. Can it enter your mind they will keep a corpse inside it overnight? there will not be any other alternative? Rather, ultimately they will keep a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ] overnight
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: A synagogue in which they calculate their accounts - they may lay a corpse in it. Do you really think that this is not sufficient? Rather, at the end, when they lay a corpse in it, it is a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין נֵיאוֹתִין בָּהֶן. אָמַר רָבָא: חֲכָמִים וְתַלְמִידֵיהֶם מוּתָּרִין, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מַאי בֵּי רַבָּנַן — בֵּיתָא דְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And one may not adorn oneself inside them. Rava said: Torah scholars and their disciples are permitted as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What Bei of the Sages, house [ beita ] of the Sages.
llm_translation: "And they are not adorned with them. Rava said: Sages and their disciples are permitted, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is the meaning of 'the house of the Sages'? The house of the Sages."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין נִכְנָסִין בָּהֶן בַּחַמָּה מִפְּנֵי הַחַמָּה וּבַגְּשָׁמִים מִפְּנֵי הַגְּשָׁמִים. כִּי הָא דְּרָבִינָא וְרַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה הֲווֹ קָיְימִי וְשָׁאֲלִי שְׁאֵילְתָּא מֵרָבָא, אֲתָא זִילְחָא דְמִיטְרָא, עָיְילִי לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא אָמְרִי: הַאי דְּעָיְילִינַן לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא לָאו מִשּׁוּם מִיטְרָא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁמַעְתָּא בָּעֲיָא צִילּוּתָא כְּיוֹמָא דְאִסְתָּנָא.
human_translation: And nor may one enter them in the sun from the sun, or in the rain from the rain. is similar to that Ravina and Rav Adda bar Mattana. They were standing and asking a question of Rava, a shower [ zilḥa ] of rain began They entered the synagogue, saying: Our having entered the synagogue is not due to the rain, rather, it is due to the halakha requires clarity like the day the north wind [ istena ]
llm_translation: And they do not enter them in the heat because of the heat, and in the rain because of the rain. For this that Ravina and Rav Adda bar Matna were standing and asked a question from Rava, a wind from the courtyard came, they went to the synagogue and said: We who go to the synagogue, it is not because of the rain, but because the community needs salvation like the day of Esther.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אִי אִצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ לְמִיקְרֵי גַּבְרָא מִבֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן הוּא — לֵימָא הִלְכְתָא, וְאִי תַּנָּא הוּא — לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין, וְאִי קָרָא הוּא — לֵימָא פְּסוּקָא. וְאִי לָא, לֵימָא לֵיהּ לְיָנוֹקָא: אֵימָא לִי פְּסוּקָיךְ. אִי נָמֵי, נִישְׁהֵי פּוּרְתָּא וְנֵיקוּם.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: If a person needs to summon an individual from a synagogue, what said to him: If he is a young Torah scholar, let him recite a halakha and if he is a tanna let him recite mishnayot ; and if he is an expert in Bible, let him recite a verse; and if not let him say to a child: Recite for me a verse Alternatively, he should remain for a short and stand up
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: If a person needs to be called a man from the house of study, what is the reason? He said to him: If he is a rock from the sages — say it is a halacha, and if he is a Mishnaic scholar — say it is a Mishna, and if he is a reader — say it is a verse. And if not, say to him: Tell me your verses. If so, let him be adorned with beauty and rise.

hebrew_text: וּמַסְפִּידִין בָּהֶן הֶסְפֵּד שֶׁל רַבִּים. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי הֶסְפֵּידָא דְרַבִּים? מַחְוֵי רַב חִסְדָּא: כְּגוֹן הֶסְפֵּידָא דְּקָאֵי בֵּיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת. מַחְוֵי רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כְּגוֹן הֶסְפֵּידָא דְּקָאֵי בֵּיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא.
human_translation: And one may offer a eulogy inside them for the public What are the circumstances of a eulogy for the public? Rav Ḥisda depicted For example, a eulogy at which Rav Sheshet is present. Rav Sheshet depicted For example, a eulogy at which Rav Ḥisda is present.
llm_translation: And they eulogize in them the eulogy of the many. How is the eulogy of the many conducted? It is like the eulogy of Rab Hisda: for example, the eulogy that is being conducted for Rab Sheshet. It is like the eulogy of Rab Sheshet: for example, the eulogy that is being conducted for Rab Hisda.

hebrew_text: רַפְרָם אַסְפְּדַהּ לְכַלְּתֵיהּ בְּבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא, אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא דִּידִי וּדְמִיתָא אָתוּ כּוּלֵּיהּ עָלְמָא. רַבִּי זֵירָא סַפְדֵיהּ לְהָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן בְּבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא, אֲמַר: אִי מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא דִּידִי, אִי מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא (דִּידֵיהּ) דְּמִיתָא, אָתוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rafram eulogized his daughter-in-law inside a synagogue. He said: Due to my honor and of the deceased, everyone will come Rabbi Zeira eulogized a certain Sage inside a synagogue. He said: Whether due to my honor, or whether due to the honor of the deceased, everyone will come
llm_translation: Rafḥam gathered for his daughter in the synagogue, he said: Because of my honor and my likeness, all the people came. Rabbi Zeira eulogized him in that place from the sages in the synagogue, he said: Whether because of my honor, or because of his honor, all the people came.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ סַפְדֵיהּ לְהָהוּא צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דִּשְׁכִיחַ בְּאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל דַּהֲוָה תָּנֵי הִלְכָתָא בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע שׁוּרָתָא, אֲמַר: וַוי חָסְרָא אַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל גַּבְרָא רַבָּה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish eulogized a certain young Torah scholar who was frequently in Eretz Yisrael and who used to study halakha in the twenty-fourth row said: Alas, Eretz Yisrael has lost a great man.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish eulogized that outstanding Torah scholar from the Land of Israel who would teach the Halakha in twenty-four rows, saying: "Woe to the loss of the Land of Israel, a great man has passed away."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה תָּנֵי הִלְכְתָא סִיפְרָא וְסִיפְרֵי וְתוֹסֶפְתָּא וּשְׁכֵיב, אֲתוֹ וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַב נַחְמָן: לִיסְפְּדֵיהּ מָר! אֲמַר: הֵיכִי נִסְפְּדֵיהּ? הֵי צַנָּא דִּמְלֵי סִיפְרֵי דַּחֲסַר?!
human_translation: a certain man who used to study halakha , the Sifra , and the Sifrei , and the Tosefta , and he died. came and said to Rav Naḥman: Let the Master eulogize him. He said How can I eulogize him? Alas, a basket filled with books is lost?
llm_translation: That one who used to teach Halakha, Scripture, Sifra, Sifrei, Tosefta, and Shekhev, he came and they said to Rav Nachman: "Master should be eulogized!" He said: "How should he be eulogized? Should we eulogize a basket full of missing books?!"

hebrew_text: תָּא חֲזִי מָה בֵּין תַּקִּיפֵי דְּאַרְעָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל לַחֲסִידֵי דְבָבֶל.
human_translation: Come see what between the harsh of Eretz Yisrael and the saintly ones of Babylonia.
llm_translation: Come and see, what is the difference between the righteous of the Land of Israel and the pious of Babylon.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: וּדְאִשְׁתַּמַּשׁ בְּתָגָא — חָלֵף. תָּנֵי רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: זֶה הַמִּשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּמִי שֶׁשּׁוֹנֶה הֲלָכוֹת כִּתְרָהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: We learned there And one who makes use of the crown [ taga ] will perish Reish Lakish taught: This one who served by one who studies halakhot , the crown of the Torah.
llm_translation: We learned there: And if one made use of a taga - he is exempt. Reish Lakish taught: This refers to one who makes use of water that changes the laws of her Torah.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: לִשְׁתַּמַּשׁ אִינִישׁ בְּמַאן דְּתָנֵי אַרְבְּעָה, וְלָא לִשְׁתַּמַּשׁ בְּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי אַרְבְּעָה. כִּי הָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הֲוָה אָזֵיל בְּאוֹרְחָא מְטָא עוּרְקְמָא דְמַיָּא, אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא אַרְכְּבֵיהּ אַכַּתְפֵּיהּ וְקָא מְעַבַּר לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קְרֵית? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קָרֵינָא. תְּנֵית? תָּנֵינָא אַרְבָּעָה סִידְרֵי מִשְׁנָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּסַלְתְּ לָךְ אַרְבְּעָה טוּרֵי וְטָעֲנַתְּ בַּר לָקִישׁ אַכַּתְפָּךְ?! שְׁדִי בַּר לָקִישָׁא בְּמַיָּא!
human_translation: And Ulla said: a person should be served by one who studies four and he should not be served by one who teaches four as in that of Reish Lakish. He was traveling along the road he reached puddle of water. A certain man came placed him upon his shoulders and transferring him said to him: Have you read He said to him: I have read Have you studied I have studied four orders of the Mishna. said to him: You have hewn four mountains and you bear the weight of the son of Lakish upon your shoulders? throw the son of Lakish into the water.
llm_translation: And Ula said: One may engage with someone who teaches four topics, but not engage with someone who teaches four topics. For this is like Reish Lakish who was walking on the way by the bank of the river, a certain man came and pushed him and caused him to cross over. He said to him: Did you read the Mishnah? He said to him: I read. Did you study the Mishnah? We have learned four orders of Mishnah. He said to him: You invalidated four rows of Torah scholars and you pushed Reish Lakish into the water! May Bar Reish Lakish be appeased with water!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִיחָא לִי דַּאֲשַׁמְּעֵיהּ לְמָר. אִי הָכִי, גְּמוֹר מִינִּי הָא מִלְּתָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל הֵן הֶחֱמִירוּ עַל עַצְמָן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ רוֹאוֹת טִיפַּת דָּם כְּחַרְדָּל יוֹשְׁבוֹת עָלָיו שִׁבְעָה נְקִיִּים.
human_translation: said to It is pleasing for me to serve the Master If so, learn from me this matter that Rabbi Zeira said. Jewish women were strict upon themselves in that even if they see a spot of blood of a mustard seed they wait on its account seven clean
llm_translation: He said to him: It is good for me to hear it from the master. If so, it is completely clear to me the matter that Rabbi Zeira said: The daughters of Israel were stringent upon themselves that even if they see a drop of blood like the size of a mustard seed, they sit upon seven clean ones.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ: כׇּל הַשּׁוֹנֶה הֲלָכוֹת, מוּבְטָח לוֹ שֶׁהוּא בֶּן עוֹלָם הַבָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲלִיכוֹת עוֹלָם לוֹ״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״הֲלִיכוֹת״ אֶלָּא ״הֲלָכוֹת״.
human_translation: The school of Eliyahu taught: Anyone who studies halakhot he is guaranteed that he is destined for the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “His ways [ halikhot ] are eternal” Do not read halikhot [ways]; rather, halakhot .
llm_translation: Mishnaic teaching of the school of Elijah: Anyone who reviews halakhot, it is guaranteed to him that he is a son of the World to Come, as it is stated: "The ways of the world are his." Do not read "ways" but rather "halakhot."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן:
human_translation: The Sages taught
llm_translation: The sages taught:

hebrew_text: מְבַטְּלִין תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה לְהוֹצָאַת הַמֵּת, וּלְהַכְנָסַת הַכַּלָּה. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי אִילְעַאי שֶׁהָיָה מְבַטֵּל תַּלְמוּד תּוֹרָה לְהוֹצָאַת הַמֵּת וּלְהַכְנָסַת הַכַּלָּה. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּשֶׁאֵין שָׁם כׇּל צוֹרְכּוֹ, אֲבָל יֵשׁ שָׁם כׇּל צוֹרְכּוֹ — אֵין מְבַטְּלִין.
human_translation: One interrupts Torah study to carry out the dead and to escort a bride They said about Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Elai, that he would interrupt Torah study to carry out the dead and to escort a bride In what is this statement said? where there are not sufficient However, there are sufficient should not interrupt
llm_translation: We nullify the study of Torah for the sake of escorting the deceased and for the sake of accompanying the bride. They said about Rabbi Yehuda the son of Rabbi Ilai that he would nullify the study of Torah for the sake of escorting the deceased and for the sake of accompanying the bride. In what case are these words said? In a situation where there is no one else to attend to the needs, but if there is someone else to attend to the needs, we do not nullify it.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה כׇּל צוֹרְכּוֹ? אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אִינְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: תְּרֵיסַר אַלְפֵי גַּבְרֵי, וְשִׁיתָּא אַלְפֵי שִׁיפּוּרֵי. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: תְּרֵיסַר אַלְפֵי גַּבְרֵי, וּמִינַּיְיהוּ שִׁיתָּא אַלְפֵי שִׁיפּוּרֵי. עוּלָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דְּחָיְיצִי גַּבְרֵי מֵאֲבוּלָּא עַד סִיכְרָא.
human_translation: And how many are sufficient? Rav Shmuel bar Inya said in the name of Rav: Twelve thousand men and six thousand horns And some say Twelve thousand men, among whom are six thousand horns. Ulla said: For example, to make a procession of people from the gate [ abbula ] to the place of burial.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much is all his need? Rav Shmuel bar Inya said in the name of Rav: Twelve thousand men, and six thousand scribes. And some say: Twelve thousand men, and from them six thousand scribes. Ulla said: For example, from Chayitzi to Avula until Sikra."

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: כִּנְתִינָתָהּ כָּךְ נְטִילָתָהּ. מָה נְתִינָתָהּ בְּשִׁשִּׁים רִיבּוֹא, אַף נְטִילָתָהּ בְּשִׁשִּׁים רִיבּוֹא. הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְמַאן דְּקָרֵי וְתָנֵי, אֲבָל לְמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי — לֵית לֵיהּ שִׁיעוּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: As was given, so it taken away, Just as was given in the presence of six hundred thousand so too its taking in the presence of six hundred thousand This applies to someone who read and studied But for someone who taught there is no limit
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: As its giving, so is its taking. Just as its giving is in sixty ribo, so too its taking is in sixty ribo. These words are for one who reads and teaches, but for one who learns, there is no measure.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: בּוֹא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה חֲבִיבִין יִשְׂרָאֵל לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁבְּכָל מָקוֹם שֶׁגָּלוּ — שְׁכִינָה עִמָּהֶן. גָּלוּ לְמִצְרַיִם — שְׁכִינָה עִמָּהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַנִּגְלֹה נִגְלֵיתִי לְבֵית אָבִיךָ בִּהְיוֹתָם בְּמִצְרַיִם וְגוֹ׳״. גָּלוּ לְבָבֶל — שְׁכִינָה עִמָּהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְמַעַנְכֶם שֻׁלַּחְתִּי בָבֶלָה״. וְאַף כְּשֶׁהֵן עֲתִידִין לִיגָּאֵל — שְׁכִינָה עִמָּהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁב ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ אֶת שְׁבוּתְךָ״. ״וְהֵשִׁיב״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״וְשָׁב״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שָׁב עִמָּהֶן מִבֵּין הַגָּלִיּוֹת.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: Come and see how beloved the Jewish people are before the Holy One, Blessed be He. As every place they were exiled, the Divine Presence with them. They were exiled to Egypt, the Divine Presence with them, as it is stated: “Did I reveal myself to the house of your father when they were in Egypt?” They were exiled to Babylonia, the Divine Presence with them, as it is stated: “For your sake I have sent to Babylonia” So too, when, in the future, they will be redeemed, the Divine Presence will be with them, as it is stated: “Then the Lord your God will return with your captivity” It does not state: He will bring back, but rather “He will return,” teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, will return with them from among the exiles.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: Come and see how beloved Israel is before the Holy One, blessed be He, for wherever they were exiled, the Divine Presence was with them. When they were exiled to Egypt, the Divine Presence was with them, as it is stated: "I have surely seen the affliction of My people who are in Egypt." When they were exiled to Babylon, the Divine Presence was with them, as it is stated: "For your sake, I have sent to Babylon." And even when they are destined to be redeemed, the Divine Presence will be with them, as it is stated: "And the Lord your God will bring back your captivity." It does not say "and He will return," but rather "and He will bring back," teaching that the Holy One, blessed be He, will return with them from among the exiles.

hebrew_text: בְּבָבֶל הֵיכָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא דְּהוּצָל, וּבְבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא דְּ״שַׁף וִיתֵיב״ בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא. וְלָא תֵּימָא הָכָא וְהָכָא, אֶלָּא זִמְנִין הָכָא וְזִמְנִין הָכָא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תֵּיתֵי לִי, דְּכִי מְרַחַיקְנָא פַּרְסָה, עָיֵילְנָא וּמְצַלֵּינָא הָתָם. אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל [וְלֵוִי] הֲווֹ יָתְבִי בִּכְנִישְׁתָּא דְּשַׁף וִיתֵיב בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא. אֲתַאי שְׁכִינָה, שְׁמַעוּ קוֹל רִיגְשָׁא [קָמוּ וּנְפַקוּ.
human_translation: Where in Babylonia Abaye said: In the synagogue of Huzal and in the synagogue that was destroyed and rebuilt in Neharde’a. And do not say here and there, Rather, at times here and at times there Abaye said: I have coming to me, for whenever I am a distance of a parasang I go in and pray there, the father of Shmuel and Levi were sitting in the synagogue that was destroyed and rebuilt in Neharde’a. The Divine Presence came they heard a loud sound, they arose and left.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In Babylon, where is it? Abaye said: In the synagogue of Huzal, and in the synagogue of "Shaf and Yatev" in Nehardea. And do not say here and here, but sometimes here and sometimes here. Abaye said: Give me, for when I extend my foot, I come and sit there. Abba the son of Shmuel and Levi used to sit in the synagogue of Shaf and Yatev in Nehardea. The Divine Presence came, they heard a tumult, they arose and left.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת הֲוָה יָתֵיב בְּבֵי כְּנִישְׁתָּא דְּשַׁף וִיתֵיב בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא, אֲתַאי שְׁכִינָה] וְלָא נְפַק. אֲתוֹ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת וְקָא מְבַעֲתוּ לֵיהּ. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, עָלוּב וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ עָלוּב, מִי נִדְחֶה מִפְּנֵי מִי? אֲמַר לְהוּ: שִׁבְקוּהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet was sitting in the synagogue that was destroyed and rebuilt in Neharde’a, the Divine Presence came but he did not go out. The ministering angels came and were frightening him said before Him: Master of the Universe, wretched and not wretched, who should defer to whom? said to them: Leave him.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet was sitting in the synagogue of Shaf and sitting in Nehardea, the Divine Presence came and did not leave. The ministering angels came and were pushing him. He said before Him: Master of the universe, the guilty and the innocent, who is rejected because of whom? He said to them: Leave him.

hebrew_text: ״וָאֱהִי לָהֶם לְמִקְדָּשׁ מְעַט״, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵלּוּ בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת שֶׁבְּבָבֶל. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: זֶה בֵּית רַבֵּינוּ שֶׁבְּבָבֶל.
