human_translation: “Yet I have been to them as a little sanctuary Rabbi Yitzḥak said: This the synagogues and study halls in Babylonia. And Rabbi Elazar said: This the house of our master, in Babylonia,
llm_translation: "And 'I will be to them a little sanctuary,'" said Rabbi Yitzchak: These are the synagogues and study halls in Babylon. And Rabbi Elazar said: This is our teacher's house in Babylon."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״ה׳ מָעוֹן אַתָּה הָיִיתָ לָּנוּ״, אֵלּוּ בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מֵרֵישׁ הֲוַאי גָּרֵיסְנָא בְּבֵיתָא וּמְצַלֵּינָא בְּבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא, כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁמַעִית לְהָא דְּקָאָמַר דָּוִד: ״ה׳ אָהַבְתִּי מְעוֹן בֵּיתֶךָ״, הֲוַאי גָּרֵיסְנָא בְּבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא.
human_translation: Rava interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: “Lord, You have been our dwelling place This the synagogues and study halls. Abaye said: Initially, I used to study in home and pray in the synagogue. Once I heard that which David says: “Lord, I love the habitation of Your house” I would study in the synagogue,
llm_translation: Rava expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "Hashem, You have been our dwelling place"? These are synagogues and study halls. Abaye said: From the beginning, I would dwell in the house and pray in the synagogue, once I heard what David said: "Hashem, I have loved the dwelling of Your house," I would dwell in the synagogue.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַקַּפָּר אוֹמֵר: עֲתִידִין בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת שֶׁבְּבָבֶל שֶׁיִּקָּבְעוּ בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי כְּתָבוֹר בֶּהָרִים וּכְכַרְמֶל בַּיָּם יָבֹא״, וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה תָּבוֹר וְכַרְמֶל שֶׁלֹּא בָּאוּ אֶלָּא לְפִי שָׁעָה לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה, נִקְבָּעִים בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת שֶׁקּוֹרִין וּמַרְבִּיצִין בָּהֶן תּוֹרָה — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Elazar HaKappar says: In the future, the synagogues and the study halls in Babylonia will be reestablished in Eretz Yisrael, as it is stated: “Surely, like Tabor among the mountains, and like Carmel by the sea, so shall he come” And are matters not a fortiori Just as Tabor and Carmel, which came only momentarily to study Torah, were established in Eretz Yisrael all the more so the synagogues and study halls in which the Torah is read and disseminated,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar HaKappar says: The synagogues and study halls in Babylonia will eventually be established in the Land of Israel, as it is stated: "For as the mountains shall depart and the hills be removed, but My kindness shall not depart from you, neither shall the covenant of My peace be removed" (Isaiah 54:10). And is it not a logical inference: If mountains and hills, which were only established for a temporary purpose of studying Torah, are established in the Land of Israel, how much more so synagogues and study halls where Torah is read and expounded upon — how much more so.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ בַּר קַפָּרָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״לָמָּה תְּרַצְּדוּן הָרִים גַּבְנוּנִּים״, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לָהֶם: לָמָּה תִּרְצוּ דִּין עִם סִינַי? כּוּלְּכֶם בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִים אַתֶּם אֵצֶל סִינַי. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״גַּבְנוּנִים״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״אוֹ גִבֵּן אוֹ דַק״. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הַאי מַאן דִּיהִיר — בַּעַל מוּם הוּא.
human_translation: Bar Kappara interpreted homiletically: What is which is written: “Why do you look askance [ teratzdun ], O high-peaked mountains, A Divine Voice issued forth and said to Why do you seek [ tirtzu ] a legal dispute [ din ] with Sinai? You are all blemished in comparison to Sinai, it is written here: “High-peaked [ gavnunnim ]” and it is written there, “Or crookbacked [ gibben ] or a dwarf” Rav Ashi said: Learn from one who is arrogant is blemished.
llm_translation: Bar Kappara expounded, what is the meaning of the verse: "Why do you gaze at the mountains, at the hills you covet?" A heavenly voice emerged and said to them: Why do you seek judgment with Sinai? All of you are blemished in comparison to Sinai. It is written here: "Gavnu'anim," and it is written there: "Either a thief or a robber." Rav Ashe said: Learn from this, whoever is haughty — he is blemished.

hebrew_text: אֵין עוֹשִׂין אוֹתוֹ קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא מַאי ״קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא״? אָמַר רָבָא: קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא כִּשְׁמָהּ. מַאי כִּשְׁמָהּ? כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר: אַדְּמַקֵּיפְנָא אַדָּרֵי, אֵיעוּל בְּהָא.
human_translation: it may not be made a kappendarya . What is kappendarya ? Rava said: A shortcut, as its name. What As its name? like one who said: Instead of going around the houses [ makkifna addari ] I will enter this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: They do not make it a "kapendarya." What is a "kapendarya"? Rava said: Its name is kapendarya. What is its name? Like the one who said: "I will surround and enclose it, and I will go around it." English translation: They do not make it a "kapendarya." What is a "kapendarya"? Rava said: Its name is kapendarya. What is its name? Like the one who said: "I will surround and enclose it, and I will go around it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אִם הָיָה שְׁבִיל מֵעִיקָּרָא — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: If path had initially it is permitted
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avahu: If the path was from the beginning - permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הַנִּכְנָס עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲשׂוֹת קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא — מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא. וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַנִּכְנָס לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת לְהִתְפַּלֵּל — מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ קַפֶּנְדַּרְיָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְבֹא עַם הָאָרֶץ לִפְנֵי ה׳ בַּמּוֹעֲדִים הַבָּא דֶּרֶךְ שַׁעַר צָפוֹן לְהִשְׁתַּחֲווֹת יֵצֵא דֶּרֶךְ שַׁעַר נֶגֶב״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: one who enters without intending to make it a shortcut, he is permitted to make it a shortcut And Rabbi Ḥelbo said Rav Huna said: one who enters a synagogue to pray, he is permitted to make it a shortcut as it is stated: “And when the people of the land shall come before the Lord in the appointed seasons, he that enters by way of the north gate to bow down shall go forth by the way of the south gate”
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: One who enters with the intention of not performing the Kappendarya - it is permitted to perform the Kappendarya. And Rabbi Chelbo said in the name of Rav Huna: One who enters the synagogue to pray - it is permitted to perform the Kappendarya, as it is stated: "And when the people of the land come before the Lord at the appointed times, the one who enters by way of the north gate to bow shall go out by way of the south gate."

hebrew_text: עָלוּ בּוֹ עֲשָׂבִים — לֹא יִתְלוֹשׁ, מִפְּנֵי עׇגְמַת נֶפֶשׁ. וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵינוֹ תּוֹלֵשׁ וּמַאֲכִיל, אֲבָל תּוֹלֵשׁ וּמַנִּיחַ! כִּי תְּנַן נָמֵי מַתְנִיתִין — תּוֹלֵשׁ וּמַאֲכִיל תְּנַן.
human_translation: grass sprang up in one should not pick due to anguish But isn’t it taught One may not pick and feed but he may pick and leave When we learned the mishna as well, we learned pick feed
llm_translation: They ascended upon it weeds - not to be uprooted, due to distress of the soul. And it was taught: One does not uproot and feed, but uproots and leaves! For we learned in a Mishnah: One uproots and feeds we learned.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֵּית הַקְּבָרוֹת, אֵין נוֹהֲגִין בָּהֶן קַלּוּת רֹאשׁ. אֵין מַרְעִין בָּהֶן בְּהֵמָה, וְאֵין מוֹלִיכִין בָּהֶן אַמַּת הַמַּיִם, וְאֵין מְלַקְּטִין בָּהֶן עֲשָׂבִים. וְאִם לִיקֵּט — שׂוֹרְפָן בִּמְקוֹמָן, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד מֵתִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught a cemetery, one may not act with frivolity; one may not graze an animal inside it; and one may not direct a water channel through it; and one may not gather grass inside it and if one gathered it should be burnt on the spot, out of respect for the dead.
llm_translation: The sages taught: In a cemetery, one does not walk with an uncovered head. One does not relieve oneself there, nor lead an animal there, nor measure a cubit of water there, nor gather herbs there. And if one did gather, they should be burned in their place, out of respect for the deceased.

hebrew_text: אַהֵיָיא? אִילֵּימָא אַסֵּיפָא — כֵּיוָן שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפָן בִּמְקוֹמָן מַאי כְּבוֹד מֵתִים אִיכָּא? אֶלָּא אַרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: to which If we say to the last clause, Since is burnt on the spot, what respect for the dead is there Rather, to the first clause
llm_translation: אַהֵיָיא? - Ahaiya? אִילֵּימָא - Ileima, אַסֵּיפָא - Asseifa — כֵּיוָן שֶׁשּׂוֹרְפָן בִּמְקוֹמָן מַאי כְּבוֹד מֵתִים אִיכָּא? אֶלָּא אַרֵישָׁא.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת, קוֹרִין בְּפָרָשַׁת שְׁקָלִים. חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹךְ הַשַּׁבָּת — מַקְדִּימִין לְשֶׁעָבַר, וּמַפְסִיקִין לְשַׁבָּת אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: the New Moon of Adar occurs on Shabbat, reads the portion of Shekalim occurs during the week, they advance to the previous and, they interrupt on the following Shabbat,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If Rosh Chodesh Adar falls on Shabbat, we read the portion of Shekalim. If it falls within Shabbat itself, we read it earlier and interrupt for the following Shabbat.

hebrew_text: בַּשְּׁנִיָּה ״זָכוֹר״. בַּשְּׁלִישִׁית פָּרָה אֲדוּמָּה. בָּרְבִיעִית ״הַחוֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה לָכֶם״. בַּחֲמִישִׁית חוֹזְרִין לִכְסִדְרָן.
human_translation: On the second “Remember On the third the Red Heifer [ Para ] On the fourth “This month [ haḥodesh ] shall be for you” On the fifth they resume the order
llm_translation: In the second reading "Remember." In the third reading a red heifer. In the fourth reading "This month shall be for you." In the fifth reading they return to their order.

hebrew_text: לַכֹּל מַפְסִיקִין: בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים, בַּחֲנוּכָּה וּבְפוּרִים, בְּתַעֲנִיּוֹת וּבְמַעֲמָדוֹת, וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: For all interrupts on the New Moons, on Hanukkah, and on Purim, on fast days, and on the watches, and on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: To all we interrupt: at the beginning of months, at Hanukkah and Purim, during fasts and public fast days, and on Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: בְּאֶחָד בַּאֲדָר מַשְׁמִיעִין עַל הַשְּׁקָלִים,
human_translation: We learned there On the first of Adar they make announcement concerning shekels.
llm_translation: We learned there: On the first of Adar, they announce regarding the shekels,

hebrew_text: וְעַל הַכִּלְאַיִם.
human_translation: And concerning diverse kinds
llm_translation: And regarding the forbidden mixtures.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא עַל הַכִּלְאַיִם — דִּזְמַן זְרִיעָה הִיא, אֶלָּא עַל הַשְּׁקָלִים מְנָלַן?
human_translation: Granted, concerning diverse kinds, as is a time of sowing. But concerning the shekels, from where do we
llm_translation: In peace upon the kilayim - for it is a time of sowing, but upon the shekalim, from where do we derive?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי טָבִי אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״זֹאת עוֹלַת חוֹדֶשׁ בְּחׇדְשׁוֹ״, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: חַדֵּשׁ וְהָבֵא קׇרְבָּן מִתְּרוּמָה חֲדָשָׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Tavi said Rabbi Yoshiyya said: as the verse states: “This is the burnt-offering of each New Moon in its renewal The Torah says: renew and bring the offering from the new collections
llm_translation: Rabbi Tavi said, Rabbi Yoshiyah said, as the verse states: "This is the burnt offering of the new moon in its month," the Torah said: "A new and fresh offering from the contribution of the new."

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן דִּבְנִיסָן בָּעֵי אַקְרוֹבֵי מִתְּרוּמָה חֲדָשָׁה, קָדְמִינַן וְקָרֵינַן בְּאֶחָד בַּאֲדָר, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלַיְתוֹ שְׁקָלִים לַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: And since during Nisan must be brought from the new collections they advance and they read on the first of Adar, in order that will bring the shekels to the Temple
llm_translation: And since when the month of Nisan arrives, we require close proximity to a new offering, we precede and read on the first of Adar, so that the shekels will arrive at the Temple.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן — דְּלָא כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. דְּאִי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, הָאָמַר שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת, דְּתַנְיָא: שׁוֹאֲלִין בְּהִלְכוֹת הַפֶּסַח קוֹדֶם לְפֶסַח שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת.
human_translation: In accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, for if Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, Didn’t he say two weeks As it is taught We inquire into the halakhot of Passover thirty days before Passover. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: two weeks
llm_translation: As one who is not like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. For if Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, he said two Sabbaths, as it is taught: They inquire about the laws of Passover thirty days before Passover. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: two Sabbaths.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בּוֹ שׁוּלְחָנוֹת יוֹשְׁבִין בַּמְּדִינָה וּבְעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה יוֹשְׁבִין בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — מִשּׁוּם שׁוּלְחָנוֹת קָדְמִינַן וְקָרֵינַן.
human_translation: Even you say Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, since the Master said: On the fifteenth tables are set up throughout the country, and on the twenty-fifth they are set up in the Temple. Because of the tables they advance and read it
llm_translation: Even if you say, "Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel," since the Master said: "On the fifteenth of it, his tables are seated in the province, and on the twenty-fifth, they are seated in the Temple" — because we prioritize the tables and read the Megillah.

hebrew_text: מַאי פָּרָשַׁת שְׁקָלִים? רַב אָמַר: ״צַו אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם אֶת קׇרְבָּנִי לַחְמִי״. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: ״כִּי תִשָּׂא״.
human_translation: What is portion of Shekalim ? Rav said: “Command the children of Israel, and say to them: My offering, the provision And Shmuel said: “When you take the count”
llm_translation: What is the portion of Shekalim? Rav said: "Command the children of Israel and say to them, 'My offering, My bread.'" And Shmuel said: "When you take."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״כִּי תִשָּׂא״, הַיְינוּ דְּקָרֵי לַהּ פָּרָשַׁת שְׁקָלִים — דִּכְתִיב בַּהּ ״שְׁקָלִים״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אֶת קׇרְבָּנִי לַחְמִי״, הָכָא מִידֵּי ״שְׁקָלִים״ כְּתִיבִי הָתָם? אִין, טַעְמָא מַאי — כִּדְרַבִּי טָבִי.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said “When you take the count,” this is that it is called the portion of Shekalim , for shekels is written in However, according to one who said “My offering, the provision Is there anything written shekels here? Yes. What is the reason As per of Rabbi Tavi,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, according to the one who says "when you take," that is to say, he reads to it the portion of Shekalim - as it is written in it "Shekalim." But according to the one who says "my offering, my bread," why is it written here immediately after "Shekalim"? No, what is the reason? Like Rabbi Tavi.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״צַו אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיבִי ״קׇרְבָּנוֹת״ הָתָם, כִּדְרַבִּי טָבִי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״כִּי תִשָּׂא״, ״קׇרְבָּנוֹת״ מִי כְּתִיבִי? שְׁקָלִים לָאֲדָנִים כְּתִיבִי!
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said “Command the children of Israel: because the offerings are written there, as per of Rabbi Tavi. However, according to one who said “When you take the count,” Is the offerings written shekels for the sockets are written
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says, "Command the children of Israel" — because it is written "offerings" there, as Rabbi Tavi. But according to the one who says, "When you take," where is "offerings" written? Shekels for the sockets it is written!

hebrew_text: כִּדְתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: שָׁלֹשׁ תְּרוּמוֹת הֵן. שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וְשֶׁל אֲדָנִים לָאֲדָנִים, וְשֶׁל בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת לְבֶדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: in accordance with that Rav Yosef taught: there were three contributions of the altar for the altar; and of the sockets for the sockets; and of the Temple maintenance for the Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: As it was taught by Rav Yosef: Three terumot they are. Of the altar to the altar, and of the sockets to the sockets, and of the flooring of the house to the flooring of the house.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״כִּי תִשָּׂא״, הַיְינוּ דְּשָׁנֵי הַאי רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ מִשְּׁאָר רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים,
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said “When you take the count,” this is what is different this New Moon and other New Moons
llm_translation: In peace, according to the one who says "when you take," that is, the difference of this Rosh Chodesh from the other heads of months,

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״צַו אֶת קׇרְבָּנִי״, מַאי שָׁנֵי? שָׁנֵי, דְּאִילּוּ רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים קָרוּ שִׁיתָּא בְּעִנְיָינָא דְיוֹמָא וְחַד בִּדְרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ, וְאִילּוּ הָאִידָּנָא — כּוּלְּהוּ בִּדְרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: However, according to the one who said “Command My offering,” what is different different: For New Moons, six read from of the matter of the day and one from the New Moon, whereas now, all the New Moon.
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says, "Command My offering," what is the difference? The difference is that if the heads of months fall on the same day as the matter of the day, and one falls on the new moon, but if it is now, all of them fall on the new moon.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְסֵדֶר פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת הוּא חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: works out well according to the one who said that one resumes the order portions.
llm_translation: He left it for the one who said to arrange the portions, he returns.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְסֵדֶר הַפְטָרוֹת הוּא חוֹזֵר, וּפָרַשְׁתָּא דְיוֹמָא קָרֵינַן, מַאי שָׁנֵי?
human_translation: However, according to the one who says one resumes the order of concluding haftarot and one also reads from of the matter of the day, then What is different
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who said to arrange the readings, he goes back, and the portion of the day we read, what is different?

hebrew_text: שָׁנֵי, דְּאִילּוּ רָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים קָרוּ שִׁיתָּא בְּעִנְיָינָא דְיוֹמָא וְחַד קָרֵי בִּדְרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ, וְאִילּוּ הָאִידָּנָא — קָרוּ תְּלָתָא בְּעִנְיָינָא דְיוֹמָא, וְאַרְבְּעָה קָרוּ בִּדְרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: different: For whereas New Moons, six read from of the matter of the day and one from the New Moon, now, three of the matter of the day and four read from the New Moon.
llm_translation: Two, for if the heads of the months coincided with the matter of the day, and one is read in the context of the month, whereas if it were nowadays, three coincide with the matter of the day, and four are read in the context of the month.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת קוֹרִין בְּפָרָשַׁת שְׁקָלִים, וּמַפְטִירִין בִּיהוֹיָדָע הַכֹּהֵן. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״כִּי תִשָּׂא״, הַיְינוּ דְּמַפְטִירִין בִּיהוֹיָדָע הַכֹּהֵן — דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֶּסֶף נַפְשׁוֹת עֶרְכּוֹ״,

Granted according to the one who says "When you take," that is why they conclude with the Haftarah of Jehoiada the priest - for it is similar to it, as it is written: "The money of the atonements of the souls."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״אֶת קׇרְבָּנִי לַחְמִי״, מִי דָּמֵי? דָּמֵי, כִּדְרַבִּי טָבִי.
human_translation: However, according to the one who said “My offering, the provision is comparable It is comparable, as per Rabbi Tavi:
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says, "My offering, my bread," whose blood is it? Its blood, as Rabbi Tavi said.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: חָל לִהְיוֹת בַּפָּרָשָׁה הַסְּמוּכָה לָהּ, בֵּין מִלְּפָנֶיהָ וּבֵין מִלְּאַחֲרֶיהָ — קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ וְכוֹפְלִין אוֹתָהּ.

llm_translation: Challenger: It is possible to be in the adjacent portion to it, whether before it or after it - we read it and repeat it.

human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said “When you take the count” this is That could occur at that time
llm_translation: In peace, according to the one who says "when you take," that is to say, that he contributes at that time.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״צַו ... אֶת קׇרְבָּנִי״, מִי מִתְרְמֵי בְּהָהוּא זִימְנָא? אִין — לִבְנֵי מַעְרְבָא דְּמַסְּקִי לִדְאוֹרָיְיתָא בִּתְלָת שְׁנִין.
human_translation: However, according to the one who said “Command My offering” does ever occur at that time Yes, for the people of the West, who complete the Torah in three years.
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says, "Command... my offering," who is exempt in that case? Not the people of Ma'arava who engage in Torah study for three years.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, קוֹרִין ״כִּי תִשָּׂא״ וּמַפְטִירִין בִּיהוֹיָדָע הַכֹּהֵן.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Shmuel: When the New Moon of Adar occurs on Shabbat, they read “When you take the count,” and they read as the haftara Jehoiada the priest.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Shmuel: When Rosh Chodesh Adar falls on Shabbat, we read "Ki Tisa" and conclude with the Haftarah of Jehoiada the priest.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא: רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת — מוֹצִיאִין שָׁלֹשׁ תּוֹרוֹת, וְקוֹרִין בָּהֶן אֶחָד בְּעִנְיָינוֹ שֶׁל יוֹם, וְאֶחָד בְּשֶׁל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ, וְאֶחָד בְּ״כִי תִשָּׂא״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא: רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ טֵבֵת שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת — מְבִיאִין שָׁלֹשׁ תּוֹרוֹת, וְקוֹרִין בָּהֶן אֶחָד בְּעִנְיָינוֹ שֶׁל יוֹם, וְאֶחָד בִּדְרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ, וְאֶחָד בַּחֲנוּכָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa said: the New Moon of Adar occurs on Shabbat, takes out three Torah scrolls and reads from them. one, of the matter of the day; and one for the New Moon; and one “When you take the count.” And Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa said: the New Moon of Tevet, occurs on Shabbat, they bring three Torah scrolls and read from them. one, the of the matter of the day; and one, for the New Moon; and one, for Hanukkah.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak Nafcha: If Rosh Chodesh Adar falls on Shabbat - we take out three Torah scrolls, and we read in them one regarding the matter of the day, and one regarding Rosh Chodesh, and one regarding "When you take a census." And Rabbi Yitzchak Nafcha said: If Rosh Chodesh Tevet falls on Shabbat - we bring out three Torah scrolls, and we read in them one regarding the matter of the day, and one regarding Rosh Chodesh, and one regarding Chanukah.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא — בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ — כְּרַב סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר פָּרָשַׁת שְׁקָלִים ״אֶת קׇרְבָּנִי לַחְמִי״, וּבִשְׁתֵּי תוֹרוֹת סַגִּי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא הָא וְלָא בָּעֲיָא הָךְ! חֲדָא מִכְּלַל חֲבֶירְתָּהּ אִיתְּמַר.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ טֵבֵת שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּחוֹל, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: קָרוּ תְּלָתָא בְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ, וְחַד בַּחֲנוּכָּה. וְרַב דִּימִי דְּמִן חֵיפָא אֲמַר: קָרוּ תְּלָתָא בַּחֲנוּכָּה, וְחַד בְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: was stated: the New Moon of Tevet occurs on a weekday, Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Three read for the New Moon, and one for Hanukkah. And Rav Dimi of Haifa said: Three read for Hanukkah, and one for the New Moon.
llm_translation: It was stated: On the first day of Tevet that falls on a weekday, Rabbi Yitzchak said: Three readings on Rosh Chodesh, and one on Chanukah. And Rav Dimi from Haifa said: Three readings on Chanukah, and one on Rosh Chodesh.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מָנִי: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּתָדִיר וְשֶׁאֵינוֹ תָּדִיר תָּדִיר קוֹדֵם.
human_translation: Rabbi Mani said: It stands to reason in accordance with Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa, for a frequent and an infrequent frequent takes precedence
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Mani: The opinion of Rabbi Yitzchak Napacha is logical, for what is frequent takes precedence over what is not frequent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב דִּימִי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִי גָּרַם לָרְבִיעִי שֶׁיָּבֹא — רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ, הִלְכָּךְ רְבִיעִי בְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ בָּעֵי מִיקְרֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin said: It stands to reason in accordance with Rav Dimi, What caused the fourth to come The New Moon, Therefore, the fourth person should read for the New Moon.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avin said: The calculation of Rav Dimi is logical, who caused the fourth day to come? — The new moon, therefore the fourth day on the new moon is called "Mikrei."

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין בְּרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ, וְרַבָּה אָמַר: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין בַּחֲנוּכָּה, וְהִלְכְתָא: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין בַּחֲנוּכָּה, וְרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ עִיקָּר.
human_translation: What was about Rav Yosef said: We do not concern ourselves the New Moon And Rabba said: We do not concern ourselves with Hanukkah And the halakha we do not concern ourselves with Hanukkah and the New Moon is primary.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְאַבָּיֵי נִיחָא, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Granted, according to Abaye, it works out well, But according to Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa, difficult.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא: וּלְאַבָּיֵי מִי נִיחָא? תִּינַח לְפָנֶיהָ, לְאַחֲרֶיהָ הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa said to you: And according to Abaye, does it work out well? precedes works out well, following what circumstances be found?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak Nappachah said to you: And for Abbaye, who is suitable? Place it in front of her, how do you find it afterwards?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר: כּוֹפְלָהּ בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת, הָכָא נָמֵי כּוֹפְלָהּ בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת.
