hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אַבָּיֵי: הַשְׁתָּא אָמְרִי לְמַפְרֵעַ הוּא דְּקָרֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: קָרוּ שִׁיתָּא עַד ״וַיַּקְהֵל״, וְחַד תָּנֵי וְקָרֵי מִ״כִּי תִשָּׂא״ עַד ״וְעָשִׂיתָ״.
human_translation: Abaye strongly objects to this: Now will say they are reading out of sequence, Rather, Abaye said: Six read until “And he assembled” and one repeats and reads from “When you take the count” until “And you shall make
llm_translation: Abbaye objects to him: The question is, is it the opinion of Mafraya that he reads the Torah portion? Rather, Abbaye said: He read six verses until "Vayakhel," and one verse taught and he read from "Ki Tisa" until "Ve'asita."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּ״כִי תִשָּׂא״ עַצְמָהּ — קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ וְכוֹפְלִין אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Abaye: occurs on itself “When you take the count,” is read and repeated
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Abaye: If she became "Ki Tisa" arrogant - they read it and repeat it.

hebrew_text: חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹךְ הַשַּׁבָּת — מַקְדִּימִין לַשַּׁבָּת שֶׁעָבְרָה. אִיתְּמַר: רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, רַב אָמַר: מַקְדִּימִין, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מְאַחֲרִין.
human_translation: occurs during the week, advances to the previous week. was stated: the New Moon of Adar occurs on Friday, Rav said: advances And Shmuel said: They defer
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If it falls on Shabbat - we advance the Shabbat that has passed. It was stated: Rosh Chodesh Adar that falls on Erev Shabbat, Rav said: We advance it, and Shmuel said: We delay it.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר מַקְדִּימִין — דְּאִם כֵּן בָּצְרִי לְהוּ יוֹמֵי שׁוּלְחָנוֹת. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר מְאַחֲרִין — אָמַר לָךְ: סוֹף סוֹף חֲמֵיסַר בְּמַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא מִיקְּלַע, וְשׁוּלְחָנוֹת לָא נָפְקִי עַד חַד בְּשַׁבָּא, הִלְכָּךְ מְאַחֲרִין.
human_translation: Rav said: They advance as, if there will be less than the days, the tables And Shmuel said: They defer said to you: Ultimately, the fifteenth occurs on a Friday, and the tables will not be brought out until Sunday. Therefore, they defer
llm_translation: Rav said, "We advance - for if so, it is necessary to prepare the tables." And Shmuel said, "We delay - he said to you: Ultimately, the thirteenth hour on Friday afternoon arrives, and the tables do not come out until one hour on Sabbath eve, therefore we delay."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹךְ הַשַּׁבָּת — מַקְדִּימִין לְשֶׁעָבַר, וּמַפְסִיקִין לְשַׁבָּת אַחֶרֶת. מַאי לָאו אֲפִילּוּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת? לֹא, בְּתוֹךְ הַשַּׁבָּת דַּוְקָא.
human_translation: We learned occurs during the week, they advance to the previous and they interrupt on the following Shabbat. What; is it not even on Friday? No; specifically during of the week.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If one becomes ill in the middle of Shabbat, we prioritize the previous day (Friday) and we interrupt for the following Shabbat. What, is it not even on Friday evening? No, specifically in the middle of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֵיזוֹ הִיא שַׁבָּת רִאשׁוֹנָה — כׇּל שֶׁחָל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹכָהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת. מַאי לָאו: אֲפִילּוּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — דּוּמְיָא דְּתוֹכָהּ, מָה תּוֹכָהּ מַקְדִּימִין — אַף עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת מַקְדִּימִין!
human_translation: Come hear Which is the first Shabbat whichever during which the New Moon of Adar occurs, and even on Friday. What, is it not even on Friday is similar to during just as during they advance so too, Friday, they advance
llm_translation: Come and hear: What is the first Shabbat? — Any time the new month of Adar falls within it, even on Friday. What is the reason? — Even on Friday is like within it, just as we prioritize within it, so too we prioritize Friday!

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בָּהּ. וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי שְׁמוּאֵל: בָּהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel said: On which And so the school of Shmuel taught: On which
llm_translation: Shmuel said: in it. And so too it was taught in the school of Shmuel: in it.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: מְסָרְגִין לְשַׁבָּתוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֵין מְסָרְגִין. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: אֵימָתַי אֲנִי אוֹמֵר אֵין מְסָרְגִין — בִּזְמַן שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, אֲבָל בִּזְמַן שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹךְ הַשַּׁבָּת — מַקְדִּים וְקוֹרֵא מִשַּׁבָּת שֶׁעָבְרָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא שְׁבָט.
human_translation: like tanna’im , they interrupt the flow of Shabbatot , the statement of Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: They do not interrupt the flow Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: When do I say that they do not interrupt the flow When occurs on Friday, However, when occurs during the week, one advances and reads on the previous Shabbat, although it is Shevat,
llm_translation: Tannaim: They would braid for the Sabbaths, the words of Rabbi Yehuda the Prince. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: They do not braid. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: When do I say they do not braid? When it happens to be on Friday evening, but when it happens to be during the Sabbath - one may recite and read from the previous Sabbath, even though it is a staff.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁנִיָּיה ״זָכוֹר״ וְכוּ׳. אִיתְּמַר: פּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, רַב אָמַר: מַקְדִּימִין פָּרָשַׁת זָכוֹר, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מְאַחֲרִין.
human_translation: On the second “Remember [ zakhor ] was stated: Purim occurs on a Friday, Rav said: advances the portion of Zakhor And Shmuel said: They defer
llm_translation: In the second reading, "Remember" etc. It was stated: Purim that falls on Erev Shabbat, Rav said: We read the portion of "Remember" earlier, and Shmuel said: We read it later.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר מַקְדִּימִין — כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּיקְדּוֹם עֲשִׂיָּה לִזְכִירָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר מְאַחֲרִין — אָמַר לָךְ: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא מוּקָּפִין דְּעָבְדִי בַּחֲמֵיסַר, עֲשִׂיָּה וּזְכִירָה בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי קָא אָתְיָין.
human_translation: Rav said: They advance in order that the observance should not precede the remembrance And Shmuel said: They defer said to you: Since there are the walled that observe on the fifteenth, the observance and the remembrance come together
llm_translation: Rav said, "We prioritize - so that they will not be extinguished, perform the action to remember." And Shmuel said, "We delay - he said to you: since there are those who are meticulous in observing the prohibition, action and remembrance come together simultaneously."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: בַּשְּׁנִיָּה ״זָכוֹר״. וְהָא כִּי מִיקְּלַע רֵישׁ יַרְחָא בְּשַׁבָּת, מִיקְּלַע פּוּרִים בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, וְקָתָנֵי בַּשְּׁנִיָּה ״זָכוֹר״! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַאי שְׁנִיָּה — שְׁנִיָּה לְהַפְסָקָה.
human_translation: We learned On the second Zakhor . Is it not when the New Moon occurs on Shabbat, Purim occurs on Friday, and teaches: On the second Zakhor ? Rav Pappa said: What is the second the second after the interruption
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "In the second cup 'Remember'." But is it not the case that when the head of the month of Nisan falls on Shabbat, Purim falls on Erev Shabbat, and it is taught in the Mishnah "In the second cup 'Remember'!"? Rav Papa said: What is the meaning of "second"? - "Second" for interruption.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֵיזוֹ שַׁבָּת שְׁנִיָּה — כׇּל שֶׁחָל פּוּרִים לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹכָהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת. מַאי לָאו: עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — דּוּמְיָא דְּתוֹכָהּ, מָה תּוֹכָהּ מַקְדִּימִין — אַף עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת מַקְדִּימִין!
human_translation: Come hear Which is the second Shabbat whichever during which Purim occurs, and even on Friday. What, is it not even on Friday, is similar to during just as during we advance so too, Friday, we advance
llm_translation: Come and hear: What is a "second Shabbat"? Any Shabbat that Purim falls within it, even on Friday. What is the reason? Friday is similar to within it, just as within it takes precedence, so too Friday takes precedence!

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בָּהּ. וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי שְׁמוּאֵל: בָּהּ.
human_translation: Shmuel said: On which And so the school of Shmuel taught: On which
llm_translation: Shmuel said: in it. And so too it was taught in the school of Shmuel: in it.

hebrew_text: חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת עַצְמָהּ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין מַקְדִּימִין. וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: עֲדַיִין הִיא מַחְלוֹקֶת. אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: פּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת — מַקְדִּים וְקוֹרֵא בַּשַּׁבָּת שֶׁעָבְרָה ״זָכוֹר״.
human_translation: occurs on Shabbat itself, Rav Huna said: Everyone agrees, they do not advance And Rav Naḥman said: is still a dispute, It was also stated Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Abba said Rav said: Purim occurs on Shabbat, one advances and reads Zakhor on the previous Shabbat,
llm_translation: It happened that Purim fell on Shabbat itself, Rav Huna said: According to everyone, we do not advance it. And Rav Nachman said: It is still a dispute. It was also stated: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said, Rabbi Abba said Rav: Purim that falls on Shabbat - we advance it and read the previous Shabbat "Zachor."

hebrew_text: בַּשְּׁלִישִׁית פָּרָה אֲדוּמָּה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזוֹ הִיא שַׁבָּת שְׁלִישִׁית — כֹּל שֶׁסְּמוּכָה לְפוּרִים מֵאַחֲרֶיהָ. אִיתְּמַר, רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: שַׁבָּת הַסְּמוּכָה לְרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ נִיסָן.
human_translation: On the third the Red Heifer [ Para ] The Sages taught Which is the third Shabbat? Whichever immediately after Purim. was stated: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: The Shabbat that is immediately the New Moon of Nisan.
llm_translation: In the third year a red heifer, etc. The Sages taught: What is the meaning of the "third Sabbath"? — Any Sabbath that is adjacent to Purim from behind it. It was stated: Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: The Sabbath that is adjacent to the new moon of Nisan.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: הָא דְּאִיקְּלַע רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ נִיסָן בְּשַׁבָּת, הָא דְּאִיקְּלַע בְּאֶמְצַע שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And do not disagree, This where the New Moon of Nisan occurs on Shabbat And that where occurs during the middle of the week.
llm_translation: And not dispute: this that the head of the month of Nisan falls on Shabbat, this that it falls in the middle of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: בָּרְבִיעִית ״הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה לָכֶם״. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בַּשַּׁבָּת — קוֹרִין ״כִּי תִשָּׂא״, וּמַפְטִירִין בִּ״יהוֹיָדָע״. וְאִי זוֹ הִיא שַׁבָּת רִאשׁוֹנָה — כֹּל שֶׁחָל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹכָהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת. בַּשְּׁנִיָּה ״זָכוֹר״, וּמַפְטִירִין ״פָּקַדְתִּי״. וְאִי זוֹ הִיא שַׁבָּת שְׁנִיָּה — כֹּל שֶׁחָל פּוּרִים לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹכָהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: On the fourth “This month [ haḥodesh ] shall be for you” The Sages taught the New Moon of Adar occurs on Shabbat, they read “When you take the count” And they read as the haftara Jehoiada And which is the first Shabbat? whichever during which the New Moon of Adar occurs, and even on Friday. On the second Zakhor , and they read as the haftara “I remembered And which is the second Shabbat? whichever during which Purim occurs, and even on Friday.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "In the fourth month, 'This month is for you.' The Rabbis taught: If Rosh Chodesh Adar falls on Shabbat - we read 'Ki Tisa' and conclude with 'Yehoyada.' And if it is not the first Shabbat - any time Rosh Chodesh Adar falls within it, even on Erev Shabbat. On the second Shabbat, 'Zachor,' and we conclude with 'Pakadti.' And if it is not the second Shabbat - any time Purim falls within it, even on Erev Shabbat."

hebrew_text: בַּשְּׁלִישִׁית פָּרָה אֲדוּמָּה, וּמַפְטִירִין ״וְזָרַקְתִּי עֲלֵיכֶם״. וְאֵי זוֹ הִיא שַׁבָּת שְׁלִישִׁית — כֹּל שֶׁסְּמוּכָה לְפוּרִים מֵאַחֲרֶיהָ. בָּרְבִיעִית הַחֹדֶשׁ הַזֶּה, וּמַפְטִירִין ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ [אֱלֹהִים] בָּרִאשׁוֹן בְּאֶחָד לַחֹדֶשׁ״.
human_translation: On the third the Red Heifer [ Para ], and they read as the haftara “Then will I sprinkle upon you” And which is the third Shabbat? That which is adjacent to Purim and after it. On the fourth “This month [ haḥodesh ] and they read as the haftara “Thus says the Lord God: In the first month, on the first day of the month”
llm_translation: In the third reading is a red heifer, and we conclude with "and I will sprinkle upon you." And what is the third Sabbath? Any Sabbath that is adjacent to Purim from behind. In the fourth reading of this month, and we conclude with "thus says the Lord God in the beginning on the first of the month."

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא שַׁבָּת רְבִיעִית — כֹּל שֶׁחָל רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ נִיסָן לִהְיוֹת בְּתוֹכָהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And which is the fourth Shabbat? whichever during which the New Moon of Nisan occurs, and even on Friday.
llm_translation: And which is the fourth Shabbat? — Any that the head of the month of Nissan falls within it, even on Friday.

hebrew_text: בַּחֲמִישִׁית חוֹזְרִין לִכְסִדְרָן וְכוּ׳. לְסֵדֶר מַאי? רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר: לְסֵדֶר פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת הוּא חוֹזֵר. רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר: לְסֵדֶר הַפְטָרוֹת הוּא חוֹזֵר.
human_translation: On the fifth we resume the order. To the order what Rabbi Ami said: One resumes the order of portions. Rabbi Yirmeya said: One resumes the order of the haftarot .
llm_translation: In the fifth aliyah they return to their order, etc. To what order are they returning? Rabbi Ammi said: To arrange the Torah portions he returns. Rabbi Yirmeya said: To arrange the Haftarah portions he returns.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דִּתְנַן: לַכֹּל מַפְסִיקִין, לְרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים, לַחֲנוּכָּה, וּלְפוּרִים, לְתַעֲנִיּוֹת, וּלְמַעֲמָדוֹת, וּלְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: Abaye said: It stands to reason in accordance with of Rabbi Ami, as we learned For all we interrupt to the New Moons, to Hanukkah, and to Purim, to fast days, and to watches, and to Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Abaye said: The customs of Rabbi Ammi are logical, as we learned: We interrupt for all these occasions: for the New Moons, for Hanukkah, and for Purim, for fasts, for public fasts, and for Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: לְסֵדֶר פָּרָשִׁיּוֹת הוּא חוֹזֵר — הַיְינוּ דְּאִיכָּא פָּרָשָׁה בְּחוֹל. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: לְסֵדֶר הַפְטָרוֹת הוּא חוֹזֵר — הַפְטָרָה בְּחוֹל מִי אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said that one resumes the order of portions, this is that there is portion on weekdays. However, according to one who said one resumes the order of haftarot , Is there a haftara on weekdays?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: In truth, according to the one who says: he goes back to arrange the Torah portions — that is, there is a portion on a weekday. But according to the one who says: he goes back to arrange the Haftarah portions — is there a Haftarah on a weekday?

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ — הָא כִּדְאִיתָא וְהָא כִּדְאִיתָא.
human_translation: And the other one, This as it is, and that as it is.
llm_translation: And the other one - this one as it was said, and this one as it was said.

hebrew_text: וּבְתַעֲנִיּוֹת לְמָה לִי הַפְסָקָה? לִיקְרֵי מִצַּפְרָא בְּעִנְיָנָא דְיוֹמָא, וּבְמִנְחָה בְּתַעֲנִיתָא! מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מִצַּפְרָא כִּינּוּפְיָא.
human_translation: But on fast days, why do I interruption Let us read in the morning of the matter of the day, and in the afternoon of a fast day. supports Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: From the morning a gathering
llm_translation: "And in fasts, why do I need a break? To call from the watchtower about the matter of the day, and in the afternoon during the fast! It supports Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: 'From the watchtower they call.'"

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי עָבְדִינַן? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִצַּפְרָא לְפַלְגֵיהּ דְּיוֹמָא מְעַיְּינִינַן בְּמִילֵּי דְמָתָא. מִפַּלְגֵיהּ דְּיוֹמָא לְפַנְיָא, רִיבְעָא דְיוֹמָא קָרוּ וּמַפְטְרִי, וְרִיבְעָא דְיוֹמָא בָּעוּ רַחֲמֵי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרְאוּ בְּסֵפֶר תּוֹרַת ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיהֶם רְבִיעִית הַיּוֹם וּרְבִיעִית (הַיּוֹם) מִתְוַודִּים וּמִשְׁתַּחֲוִים״.
human_translation: What does do Abaye said: From the morning until the middle of the day, examine the affairs of the town From the middle of the day until the evening, a quarter of the day reading and reading the haftara , and a quarter of the day praying, as it is stated: “And they read in the book of the Torah of the Lord their God one quarter of the day, and a quarter of the day they confessed, and they prostrated themselves
llm_translation: How do we do it? Abaye said: From the morning watch until the end of the day we engage in matters of the world. From the end of the day until the evening, we read and pray, and in the evening we seek mercy, as it is said: "And they stood up in their place and read from the Book of the Law of the Lord their God for a quarter of the day, and for another quarter they confessed and worshiped the Lord their God."

hebrew_text: וְאֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא? לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֵלַי יֵאָסְפוּ כֹּל חָרֵד בְּדִבְרֵי אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל מַעַל הַגּוֹלָה וַאֲנִי יוֹשֵׁב מְשׁוֹמֵם עַד לְמִנְחַת הָעָרֶב״, וּכְתִיב: ״וּבְמִנְחַת הָעֶרֶב קַמְתִּי מִתַּעֲנִיתִי״.
human_translation: But I should reverse It should not enter your mind as it is written: “Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel due to the transgression of the exiles gathered around me, and I sat appalled until the evening offering” and it is written “And at the evening offering I arose from my fast,
llm_translation: And the opposite, I? Not has gone up your mind, as it is written: "And I gathered all trembling in the words of the God of Israel, upon the return, and I sat desolate until the evening offering," and it is written: "And at the evening offering I arose from my fasting."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּפֶּסַח קוֹרִין בְּפָרָשַׁת מוֹעֲדוֹת שֶׁל תּוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים. בָּעֲצֶרֶת — ״שִׁבְעָה שָׁבוּעוֹת״. בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי בְּאֶחָד לַחֹדֶשׁ״. בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — ״אַחֲרֵי מוֹת״. בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג קוֹרִין בְּפָרָשַׁת מוֹעֲדוֹת שֶׁבְּתוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים, וּבִשְׁאָר כׇּל יְמוֹת הַחַג בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹת הַחַג.
human_translation: On Passover, reads from the portion of the Festivals of Leviticus On Shavuot “Seven weeks” On Rosh HaShana on the seventh month on the first of the month” On Yom Kippur “After the death” On the first Festival day of Sukkot they read from the portion of the Festivals of Leviticus and on the other days of Sukkot from the offerings of Sukkot
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: On Passover, we read the portion of the festivals from the Torah of the priests. On Shavuot - "seven weeks." On Rosh Hashanah - "In the seventh month, on the first day of the month." On Yom Kippur - "After the death." On the first day of the festival of Sukkot, we read the portion of the festivals from the Torah of the priests, and on all the other days of the festival, with the festival offerings.

hebrew_text: בַּחֲנוּכָּה — בַּנְּשִׂיאִים. בַּפּוּרִים — ״וַיָּבֹא עֲמָלֵק״. בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים — ״וּבְרָאשֵׁי חׇדְשֵׁיכֶם״. בְּמַעֲמָדוֹת — בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית. בְּתַעֲנִיּוֹת —
human_translation: On Hanukkah from the princes On Purim “And Amalek came” On the New Moon “And in the beginnings of your months” And in the watches the act of Creation On fast days,
llm_translation: Hanukkah - with the princes. Purim - "And Amalek came." Rosh Chodesh - "And at the beginnings of your months." Ma'amadot - with the work of Creation. Ta'anitot -

hebrew_text: בְּרָכוֹת וּקְלָלוֹת. אֵין מַפְסִיקִין בִּקְלָלוֹת, אֶלָּא אֶחָד קוֹרֵא אֶת כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: blessings and curses One should not interrupt curses Rather, one person reads all of them.
llm_translation: Tractate: Berakhot uKlalot. Ein mafsikin biKlalot, ela echad kore et kulan. Translation: Blessings and Curses. We do not interrupt in curses, rather one reads them all.

hebrew_text: בְּשֵׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי, בַּשַּׁבָּת בַּמִּנְחָה — קוֹרִין כְּסִדְרָן, וְאֵין עוֹלִים לָהֶם מִן הַחֶשְׁבּוֹן.
human_translation: On Mondays, and on Thursdays, on Shabbat during the afternoon they read in accordance order, However, are not counted in the reckoning
llm_translation: In the second and fifth aliyah, on Shabbat during Mincha - they read in their proper order, and they do not ascend from the calculation.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְדַבֵּר מֹשֶׁה אֶת מוֹעֲדֵי ה׳ אֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, מִצְוָתָן שֶׁיְּהוּ קוֹרִין כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד בִּזְמַנּוֹ.
human_translation: as is stated: “And Moses declared to the children of Israel the appointed seasons of the Lord” the mitzva that should read each one in its time.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And Moses spoke the appointed times of the Lord to the children of Israel," their commandment is that each and every one should read the Torah portion at its appointed time.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּפֶסַח קוֹרִין בְּפָרָשַׁת מוֹעֲדוֹת וּמַפְטִירִין בְּפֶסַח גִּלְגָּל, וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּאִיכָּא תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי, יוֹמָא קַמָּא — בְּפֶסַח גִּלְגָּל, וּלְמָחָר — בְּפֶסַח יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught On Passover, reads from the portion of the Festivals and they read as the haftara Passover Gilgal And nowadays, when there are two days of Passover, on the first day Passover at Gilgal, and on the next day from Passover by Josiah
llm_translation: The sages taught: On Passover, they read the portion of the festivals, and conclude with the portion of the wheel of the cart, and now that there are two days of Passover, on the first day - they conclude with the portion of the wheel of the cart, and on the next day - with the portion of Josiah.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַפֶּסַח מְלַקֵּט וְקוֹרֵא מֵעִנְיָנוֹ שֶׁל פֶּסַח. מַאי הִיא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מֵאַפּ״‎וֹ סִימָן.
human_translation: And on other days of Passover, one collects and reads matters to Passover. What are these Rav Pappa said: A mnemonic mem , alef , peh vav . [
llm_translation: And the rest of the days of Pesach one may gather and read from the matter of Pesach. What is it? Rav Papa said: From Aleph to Tav is a sign.

hebrew_text: יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל פֶּסַח קוֹרִין ״וַיְהִי בְּשַׁלַּח״, וּמַפְטִירִין ״וַיְדַבֵּר דָּוִד״. וּלְמָחָר ״כׇּל הַבְּכוֹר״, וּמַפְטִירִין ״עוֹד הַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: On the last Festival day of Passover, they read “And it came to pass, when let go” and they read as the haftara “And David spoke” And on the next day, “All the firstborns” and they read as the haftara “This very day”
llm_translation: Last day of Passover, they read "And it came to pass, when he had made an end" and conclude with "And David spoke." The next day, "All the firstborn" is read, and they conclude with "Yet this day."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, וְהָאִידָּנָא נְהוּג עָלְמָא לְמִיקְרֵי: מְשַׁךְ תּוֹרָא, קַדֵּשׁ בְּכַסְפָּא, פְּסַל בְּמַדְבְּרָא, שַׁלַּח בּוּכְרָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: And nowadays, everyone is accustomed to read Draw the bull, sanctify with money, hew in the wilderness, send the firstborn.
llm_translation: Abaye said, and now it is customary in the world to say: "Draw out the Torah, sanctify with silver, carve in the wilderness, and send in the morning."

hebrew_text: בָּעֲצֶרֶת ״שִׁבְעָה שָׁבוּעוֹת״, וּמַפְטִירִין בַּחֲבַקּוּק. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁלִישִׁי״, וּמַפְטִירִין בַּמֶּרְכָּבָה. וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּאִיכָּא תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי, עָבְדִינַן כְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ וְאִיפְכָּא.
human_translation: On Shavuot “Seven weeks,” and they read as the haftara from Habakkuk, Others say: “In the third month” and they read as the haftara from the Chariot And nowadays, when there are two days we act in accordance with both but in the reverse order.
llm_translation: At the assembly of "Shavuot," and we conclude with the Book of Habakkuk. Others say: "In the third month," and we conclude with the Book of Ezekiel. And now that there are two days, we do both, this and that.

hebrew_text: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה: ״בַּחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי״, וּמַפְטִירִין: ״הֲבֵן יַקִּיר לִי אֶפְרַיִם״. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: ״וַה׳ פָּקַד אֶת שָׂרָה״, וּמַפְטִירִין בְּחַנָּה.
human_translation: On Rosh HaShana “On the seventh month and they read as the haftara “Is Ephraim My dear son?” And some say “And the Lord visited Sarah” And they read as the haftara from Hannah
llm_translation: In the beginning of the year: "In the seventh month," and we conclude with: "Is Ephraim not a precious son to Me." And some say: "And the Lord visited Sarah," and we conclude with Hannah.

hebrew_text: וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּאִיכָּא תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי — יוֹמָא קַמָּא כְּיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים, לִמְחַר: ״וְהָאֱלֹהִים נִסָּה אֶת אַבְרָהָם״, וּמַפְטִירִין ״הֲבֵן יַקִּיר״.
human_translation: And nowadays, when there are two days the first day in accordance Some say. And on the next day “And God tested Abraham” and they read as the haftara “Is Ephraim My dear son?”
llm_translation: And the case now where there are two days - the first day, as some say, tomorrow: "And God tested Abraham," and concluding with "Take now your son."

hebrew_text: בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים קוֹרִין ״אַחֲרֵי מוֹת״, וּמַפְטִירִין ״כִּי כֹה אָמַר רָם וְנִשָּׂא״. וּבַמִּנְחָה קוֹרִין בָּעֲרָיוֹת וּמַפְטִירִין בְּיוֹנָה.
human_translation: On Yom Kippur they read “After the death” , and they read as the haftara “For thus says the High and Lofty One” And during the afternoon read from forbidden sexual relations And they read as the haftara Jonah,
llm_translation: On the Day of Atonement, they read "Acharei Mot" and conclude with "Ki Ko Amar Ram VeNisa." And during the afternoon service, they read about forbidden relationships and conclude with the section about the dove.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא גְּבוּרָתוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, אַתָּה מוֹצֵא עִנְוְותָנוּתוֹ. דָּבָר זֶה כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה, וְשָׁנוּי בַּנְּבִיאִים, וּמְשׁוּלָּשׁ בַּכְּתוּבִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Wherever you find the might of the Holy One, Blessed be He, you find His humility this fact is written in the Torah, repeated in the Prophets, and stated a third time in the Writings.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Every place that you find the might of the Holy One, blessed be He, you find His humility. This matter is written in the Torah, repeated in the Prophets, and alluded to in the Writings.

hebrew_text: כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״כִּי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם הוּא אֱלֹהֵי הָאֱלֹהִים וַאֲדוֹנֵי הָאֲדוֹנִים״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״עוֹשֶׂה מִשְׁפַּט יָתוֹם וְאַלְמָנָה״. שָׁנוּי בַּנְּבִיאִים: ״כֹה אָמַר רָם וְנִשָּׂא שׁוֹכֵן עַד וְקָדוֹשׁ וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְאֶת דַּכָּא וּשְׁפַל רוּחַ״, מְשׁוּלָּשׁ בַּכְּתוּבִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״סוֹלּוּ לָרוֹכֵב בָּעֲרָבוֹת בְּיָהּ שְׁמוֹ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״אֲבִי יְתוֹמִים וְדַיַּין אַלְמָנוֹת״.
human_translation: It is written in the Torah: “For the Lord your God is the God of gods and the Lord of lords” and it is written afterward: “He executes the judgment of the fatherless and widow” It is repeated in the Prophets: thus says the High and Lofty One that inhabits eternity, Whose name is sacred” and it is written afterward: with him that is of a contrite and humble spirit, It is stated a third time in the Writings, as it is written: “Extol Him Who rides upon the clouds, Whose name is the Lord” and it is written afterward: “A father of the fatherless, and a judge of widows”
llm_translation: It is written in the Torah: "For the Lord your God is the God of gods and the Lord of lords," and it is written afterwards: "He executes justice for the orphan and the widow." It is altered in the Prophets: "Thus says the High and Lofty One who inhabits eternity, whose name is Holy," and it is written afterwards: "And with the contrite and lowly of spirit." It is repeated in the Writings, as it is written: "Praise Him who rides upon the clouds; His name is the Lord," and it is written afterwards: "The father of orphans and the judge of widows."

hebrew_text: יוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג קוֹרִין בְּפָרָשַׁת מוֹעֲדוֹת שֶׁבְּתוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים, וּמַפְטִירִין ״הִנֵּה יוֹם בָּא לַה׳״. וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּאִיכָּא תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי, לִמְחַר מִיקְרָא הָכִי נָמֵי קָרֵינַן, אַפְטוֹרֵי מַאי מַפְטִירִין — ״וַיִּקָּהֲלוּ אֶל הַמֶּלֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה״.
human_translation: the first Festival day of Sukkot , they read from the portion of the Festivals in Leviticus and they read as the haftara “Behold the day of the Lord comes” And nowadays, when there are two days on the next day, they read the same what do they read as the haftara ? “And assembled themselves to King Solomon”
llm_translation: Good day, the first day of the festival, they read in the portion of the appointed times in the Torah of the priests, and they conclude with "Behold, a day is coming for the Lord." And now that there are two days, the next day we read the verse thus: "And they assembled before King Solomon."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁאָר כׇּל יְמוֹת הַחַג קוֹרִין בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹת הֶחָג. יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן קוֹרִין ״כׇּל הַבְּכוֹר״, מִצְוֹת וְחוּקִּים וּבְכוֹר, וּמַפְטִירִין ״וַיְהִי כְּכַלּוֹת שְׁלֹמֹה״. לְמָחָר קוֹרִין ״וְזֹאת הַבְּרָכָה״, וּמַפְטִירִין ״וַיַּעֲמֹד שְׁלֹמֹה״.
human_translation: And on all the other days of Sukkot , they read from the offerings of Sukkot On the last Festival day they read “All the firstborns,” mitzvot and statutes firstborns And they read as the haftara “And it was so, that when Solomon had made an end On the next day, they read “And this is the blessing” and they read as the haftara “And Solomon stood”
llm_translation: And the rest of all the days of the festival they read in the festival offerings. On the last day of the festival they read "All the firstborn," commandments and statutes and firstborn, and conclude with "And it came to pass, when Solomon had finished." The next day they read "And this is the blessing," and conclude with "And Solomon stood up."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: שַׁבָּת שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, בֵּין בַּפֶּסַח, בֵּין בַּסּוּכּוֹת — מִקְרָא קָרֵינַן ״רְאֵה אַתָּה״. אַפְטוֹרֵי, בַּפֶּסַח — ״הָעֲצָמוֹת הַיְּבֵשׁוֹת״. וּבַסּוּכּוֹת — ״בְּיוֹם בֹּא גוֹג״.
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rav said: Shabbat occurs on the intermediate days whether on Passover or on Sukkot , they read the Torah “See, You They read as the haftara , on Passover, the dry bones and on Sukkot on that day when Gog shall come”
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: If Shabbat falls on the intermediate days of a festival, whether it is during Passover or during Sukkot, we read the verse "See, you." For the haftarah on Passover, we read "dry bones." And on Sukkot, we read "on the day that Gog comes."

hebrew_text: בַּחֲנוּכָּה — בַּנְּשִׂיאִים, וּמַפְטִירִין בְּנֵרוֹת דִּזְכַרְיָה. וְאִי מִיקַּלְעִי שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת — קַמַּיְיתָא בְּנֵרוֹת דִּזְכַרְיָה, בָּתְרָיְיתָא בְּנֵרוֹת שְׁלֹמֹה.
human_translation: On Hanukkah from the princes and they read as the haftara from the lamps of Zechariah And if it occurs that there are two Shabbatot on the first from the lamps of Zechariah, and on the latter one from the lamps of Solomon
llm_translation: Hanukkah - with princes, and we read in the lamps of Zechariah. And if it falls on two Sabbaths - before it with the lamps of Zechariah, after it with the lamps of Solomon.

hebrew_text: בַּפּוּרִים — ״וַיָּבֹא עֲמָלֵק״. בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים — ״וּבְרָאשֵׁי חׇדְשֵׁיכֶם״. רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, מַפְטִירִין ״וְהָיָה מִדֵּי חֹדֶשׁ בְּחׇדְשׁוֹ״. חָל לִהְיוֹת בְּאֶחָד בַּשַּׁבָּת, מֵאֶתְמוֹל מַפְטִירִין ״וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ יְהוֹנָתָן מָחָר חֹדֶשׁ״.
human_translation: On Purim “And Amalek came” On the New Moon “And in the beginnings of your month” the New Moon occurs on Shabbat, they read as the haftara “And it shall come to pass that every New Moon, occurs on Sunday, on the previous day, they read as the haftara “And Jonathan said to him: Tomorrow is the New Moon”
llm_translation: In Purim - "And Amalek came." In the beginning of months - "And in the beginning of your months." When Rosh Chodesh falls on Shabbat, we read "And it shall be from one new moon to another." When it falls on Sunday, we read "And Jonathan said to him, 'Tomorrow is the new moon.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא:
human_translation: Rav Huna said:
llm_translation: Rav Huna said:

hebrew_text: רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אָב שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, מַפְטִירִין ״חׇדְשֵׁיכֶם וּמוֹעֲדֵיכֶם שָׂנְאָה נַפְשִׁי הָיוּ עָלַי לָטוֹרַח״. מַאי ״הָיוּ עָלַי לָטוֹרַח״? אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: לֹא דַּיָּין לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁחוֹטְאִין לְפָנַי, אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּטְרִיחִין אוֹתִי לֵידַע אֵיזוֹ גְּזֵירָה קָשָׁה אָבִיא עֲלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: New Moon of Av occurs on Shabbat, they read as the haftara “Your New Moons and your Festivals, My soul hated; they were a burden to Me” What is “They were a burden to Me”? The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: It is not enough for the Jewish people that they sin before Me, but they burden Me to reconsider what harsh decree I shall bring upon them,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: On the first of Av that falls on Shabbat, we read "Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hates; they have become a burden to me." What does "they have become a burden to me" mean? The Holy One, blessed be He, said: It is not enough for the Israelites that they sin before Me, but they trouble Me to know which harsh decree I will bring upon them.

hebrew_text: בְּתִשְׁעָה בְּאָב גּוּפֵיהּ מַאי מַפְטְרִינַן? אָמַר רַב: ״אֵיכָה הָיְתָה לְזוֹנָה״. מִקְרָא מַאי? תַּנְיָא, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: ״וְאִם לֹא תִשְׁמְעוּ לִי״, רַבִּי נָתָן בַּר יוֹסֵף אוֹמֵר: ״עַד אָנָה יְנַאֲצוּנִי הָעָם הַזֶּה״, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: ״עַד מָתַי לָעֵדָה הָרָעָה הַזֹּאת״. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָאִידָּנָא נְהוּג עָלְמָא לְמִיקְרֵי ״כִּי תוֹלִיד בָּנִים״, וּמַפְטִירִין ״אָסוֹף אֲסִיפֵם״.
human_translation: On Ninth of Av itself, what do we read as the haftara ? Rav said: “How become a harlot?” What Torah portion It is taught others say: “But if you will not hearken to me” Rabbi Natan bar Yosef said: “How long will this people provoke me?” And some say: “How long shall I bear with this evil congregation?” Abaye said: Nowadays, everyone is accustomed to read “When you shall beget children” and they read as the haftara “I will utterly consume them”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: On the ninth of Av itself, what do we exempt? Rav said: "How has the harlot become." What is the verse? It was taught: Others say: "But if you will not listen to me," Rabbi Natan bar Yosef says: "How long will this evil congregation scorn me," and some say: "Until when will this wicked congregation." Abaye said: Nowadays, it is customary for people to read "When you give birth to children," and we exempt "Gather together their assembly."

hebrew_text: [בְּמַעֲמָדוֹת] בְּמַעֲשֵׂה בְרֵאשִׁית וְכוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אִלְמָלֵא מַעֲמָדוֹת לֹא נִתְקַיְּימוּ שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם לֹא בְרִיתִי יוֹמָם וָלָיְלָה חוּקּוֹת שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ לֹא שָׂמְתִּי״.
human_translation: In the watches the act of Creation. From where are these matters Rabbi Ami said: were it not for watches, heaven and earth would not endure, as it is stated: “Were it not for My covenant day and night, I would not have set the statutes of heaven and earth”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Bema'amadot bema'aseh bereshit ve'chu. Menahanei milei? Amar Rabbi Amei: Ilmala ma'amadot lo nitkayemu shamayim va'aretz, shene'emar: "Im lo b'riti yomam va'laila chukot shamayim va'aretz lo samti." English translation: In the standing in the work of Genesis and onwards. What are the benefits? Rabbi Amei said: If not for the standing, the heavens and the earth would not endure, as it is said: "If not for My covenant day and night, I would not have established the laws of heaven and earth."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמַר ה׳ אֱלֹהִים בַּמָּה אֵדַע כִּי אִירָשֶׁנָּה״, אָמַר אַבְרָהָם לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, שֶׁמָּא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם יִשְׂרָאֵל חוֹטְאִים לְפָנֶיךָ וְאַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה לָהֶם כְּדוֹר הַמַּבּוּל וּכְדוֹר הַפְּלַגָּה? אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו.
human_translation: And it is written: “And he said, O Lord God, by what shall I know that I shall inherit it?” Abraham said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, perhaps, Heaven forbid, the Jewish people will sin before You, and You will do to them as generation of the Flood and as generation of the Dispersion, said to him: No,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And Hashem Elokim said, 'How will I know that I will inherit it?'" Avraham said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, perhaps, Heaven forbid, if Israel sins before You, will You deal with them like the generation of the Flood and the generation of the Dispersion? He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, ״בַּמֶּה אֵדַע״? אָמַר לוֹ: ״קְחָה לִי עֶגְלָה מְשׁוּלֶּשֶׁת וְגוֹ׳״. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, תִּינַח בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים. בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים מָה תְּהֵא עֲלֵיהֶם? אָמַר לוֹ: כְּבָר תִּקַּנְתִּי לָהֶם סֵדֶר קׇרְבָּנוֹת, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁקּוֹרְאִין בָּהֶן מַעֲלֶה אֲנִי עֲלֵיהֶן כְּאִילּוּ מַקְרִיבִין לְפָנַי קׇרְבָּן, וּמוֹחֵל אֲנִי עַל כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹתֵיהֶם.
human_translation: said before Him: Master of the Universe: “By what shall I know this?” said to him: “Take Me a heifer of three years old” said before Him: Master of the Universe, works out well when the Temple is standing when the Temple will no be standing, what will become of them? said to him: I have already established for them the order of offerings, Whenever they read those I will deem it as if they sacrificed an offering before Me, and I will pardon them for all of their iniquities.
llm_translation: He said before Him: Master of the world, "How will I know?" He said to him: "Take for Me a three-year-old calf, etc." He said before Him: Master of the world, may it be established at the time when the Temple is standing. At a time when the Temple is not standing, what shall be upon them? He said to him: I have already arranged for them a set order of sacrifices. Whenever they read in them, I consider it as if they are offering a sacrifice before Me, and I forgive all their sins.

hebrew_text: בְּתַעֲנִיּוֹת בְּרָכוֹת וּקְלָלוֹת, וְאֵין מַפְסִיקִין בַּקְּלָלוֹת. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר גַּמָּדָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״מוּסַר ה׳ בְּנִי אַל תִּמְאָס״.
human_translation: On fast days blessings and curses and one may not interrupt curses From where are these matters Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda said Rabbi Asi said: For the verse states: “My son, do not despise the chastening of the Lord,
llm_translation: In fasts, blessings, and curses, and we do not interrupt in curses. From where are these matters derived? Rabbi Chiya bar Gamda said in the name of Rabbi Assi: As the verse says, "My son, do not despise the discipline of the Lord."

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אוֹמְרִים בְּרָכָה עַל הַפּוּרְעָנוּת: אֶלָּא הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? תָּנָא: כְּשֶׁהוּא מַתְחִיל — מַתְחִיל בַּפָּסוּק שֶׁלִּפְנֵיהֶם, וּכְשֶׁהוּא מְסַיֵּים — מְסַיֵּים בַּפָּסוּק שֶׁלְּאַחֲרֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said because one does not say a blessing over a calamity. Rather, does one do? taught When one begins one begins with the verse before and when one concludes one concludes with the verse after them.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Because they do not recite a blessing on afflictions, how should one act? It was taught: When one begins, he begins with the verse before them, and when he concludes, he concludes with the verse after them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּקְלָלוֹת שֶׁבְּתוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים, אֲבָל קְלָלוֹת שֶׁבְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה — פּוֹסֵק. מַאי טַעְמָא — הַלָּלוּ בִּלְשׁוֹן רַבִּים אֲמוּרוֹת, וּמֹשֶׁה מִפִּי הַגְּבוּרָה אֲמָרָן, וְהַלָּלוּ בִּלְשׁוֹן יָחִיד אֲמוּרוֹת, וּמֹשֶׁה מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ אֲמָרָן.
human_translation: Abaye said: They taught only with regard to the curses that are in Leviticus, but with regard to the curses that are in Deuteronomy, one may interrupt What is the reason These are stated in the plural, and Moses pronounced them from the mouth of the Almighty. these are stated in the singular, and Moses said them on his own,
llm_translation: Abaye said: They only taught this distinction regarding curses in the Torah of the Priests, but regarding curses in the Mishnah Torah - one may interrupt. What is the reason? - These curses were spoken in the language of the masses, and Moses said them from the mouth of the Almighty, but these curses were spoken in the language of an individual, and Moses said them from his own mouth.

hebrew_text: לֵוִי בַּר בּוּטֵי הֲוָה קָרֵי וְקָא מְגַמְגֵּם קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא בַּאֲרוּרֵי. אָמַר לוֹ: אַכְּנַפְשָׁךְ. לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא קְלָלוֹת שֶׁבְּתוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים, אֲבָל שֶׁבְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה — פּוֹסֵק.
human_translation: Levi bar Buti was reading the curses before Rav Huna, and he was stammering said to him: If you wish, they taught only with regard to the curses that are in Leviticus. But with regard to the curses that are in Deuteronomy, one may interrupt
llm_translation: Levi bar Buti was reading and murmuring before Rav Huna in the curses. He said to him: "May your soul be bound up." They only taught curses in the Torah of the Priests, but in the Mishnah Torah, it concludes.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: עֶזְרָא תִּיקֵּן לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיְּהוּ קוֹרִין קְלָלוֹת שֶׁבְּתוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים קוֹדֶם עֲצֶרֶת, וְשֶׁבְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה קוֹדֶם רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי וְאִיתֵּימָא רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּכְלֶה הַשָּׁנָה וְקִלְלוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Ezra enacted for the Jewish people that they should read the curses that are in Leviticus before Shavuot and that are in Deuteronomy before Rosh HaShana. What is the reason Abaye said, and some say Reish Lakish In order that the year may conclude its curses,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Ezra instituted for Israel that they should read the curses in the Torah of the priests before Shavuot, and those in the Torah of the laity before Rosh Hashanah. What is the reason? Abaye said, and some say it was Resh Lakish: So that the year and its curses should end.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא שֶׁבְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה, אִיכָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּכְלֶה שָׁנָה וְקִלְלוֹתֶיהָ. אֶלָּא שֶׁבְּתוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים, אַטּוּ עֲצֶרֶת רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה הִיא? אִין, עֲצֶרֶת נָמֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה הִיא. דִּתְנַן: וּבַעֲצֶרֶת עַל פֵּירוֹת הָאִילָן.
human_translation: Granted, that are in Deuteronomy, there is In order that the year may conclude its curses, However, that are in Leviticus, Is that to say Shavuot is a new year? Yes, Shavuot is also a new year, as we learned And on Shavuot , concerning the fruit of the trees,
llm_translation: In the peace that is in the Mishnah Torah, there is a time for the year to end and its curses. But in the Torah of the Priests, is the assembly of Rosh Hashanah? No, the assembly is indeed Rosh Hashanah. As we learned: "And on the assembly at the fruit of the tree."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אִם יֹאמְרוּ לָךְ זְקֵנִים ״סְתוֹר״ וִילָדִים ״בְּנֵה״ — סְתוֹר וְאַל תִּבְנֶה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּתִירַת זְקֵנִים בִּנְיָן, וּבִנְיַן נְעָרִים סְתִירָה. וְסִימָן לַדָּבָר — רְחַבְעָם בֶּן שְׁלֹמֹה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If old men say to you: Demolish, and children Build, demolish and do not build, because the demolishing of old men is building, and the building of children is demolishing. An indication of this matter Rehoboam, son of Solomon.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If the elders say to you "destroy" and the young say "build" - destroy and do not build, because the destruction of the elders is building, and the building of the young is destruction. And a sign for this matter is Rehoboam son of Solomon.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָקוֹם שֶׁמַּפְסִיקִין בַּשַּׁבָּת שַׁחֲרִית — שָׁם קוֹרִין בְּמִנְחָה, בְּמִנְחָה — שָׁם קוֹרִין בְּשֵׁנִי, בְּשֵׁנִי — שָׁם קוֹרִין בַּחֲמִישִׁי, בַּחֲמִישִׁי — שָׁם קוֹרִין לַשַּׁבָּת הַבָּאָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מָקוֹם שֶׁמַּפְסִיקִין בַּשַּׁבָּת שַׁחֲרִית — שָׁם קוֹרִין בְּמִנְחָה, וּבַשֵּׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי, וְלַשַּׁבָּת הַבָּאָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught the place where concludes on Shabbat morning, there they read in the afternoon in the afternoon there they read on Monday on Monday, there they read on Thursday on Thursday, there they read on the coming Shabbat. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: the place where they conclude on Shabbat morning, there they read in the afternoon And they read on Monday and on Thursday and on the coming Shabbat.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: In a place where they pause on Shabbat morning, there they read the Mincha service. In a place where they read the Mincha service, there they read the second service. In a place where they read the second service, there they read the fifth service. In a place where they read the fifth service, there they read for the coming Shabbat. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: In a place where they pause on Shabbat morning, there they read the Mincha service, and the second service, and the fifth service, and for the coming Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הֲלָכָה, מָקוֹם שֶׁמַּפְסִיקִין בַּשַּׁבָּת שַׁחֲרִית — שָׁם קוֹרִין בְּמִנְחָה, וּבְשֵׁנִי וּבַחֲמִישִׁי, וְלַשַּׁבָּת הַבָּאָה. וְלֵימָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: The halakha the place where they conclude on Shabbat morning, there they read in the afternoon And they read on Monday and on Thursday and on the coming Shabbat. let him say: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Halacha, in a place where they pause on Shabbat morning, there they read the Mincha service, on Monday, Thursday, and the following Shabbat. And let us say: Halacha follows Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּאָפְכִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: Because there are those who reversed
llm_translation: Due to the fact that he turned it over to him.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פּוֹתֵחַ וְרוֹאֶה, גּוֹלֵל וּמְבָרֵךְ, וְחוֹזֵר וּפוֹתֵחַ וְקוֹרֵא. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: פּוֹתֵחַ וְרוֹאֶה וּמְבָרֵךְ וְקוֹרֵא.
human_translation: The Sages taught he should open and see furl and recite the blessing, and he should again open and read. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda said: He should open and see and, he should recite the blessing, and read.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One opens and sees, rolls and blesses, and then goes back and opens and reads. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: One opens and sees, blesses, and reads.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? כִּדְעוּלָּא. דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ הַקּוֹרֵא בַּתּוֹרָה לֹא יְסַיֵּיעַ לַמְתוּרְגְּמָן — כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ תַּרְגּוּם כָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה. הָכָא נָמֵי: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ בְּרָכוֹת כְּתוּבִין בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir’s in accordance with of Ulla, as Ulla said: For what did say one who reads from the Torah should not assist the translator, In order that should not say the translation is written in the Torah. Here too, in order that should not say the blessings are written in the Torah.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir's opinion? Like Du'la. For Du'la said: Why did the readers of the Torah say that one should not assist the translator? So that people will not say that the translation is written in the Torah. Here too: so that people will not say that the blessings are written in the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: תַּרְגּוּם — אִיכָּא לְמִיטְעֵי, בְּרָכוֹת — לֵיכָּא לְמִיטְעֵי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda translation, there is erring the blessings, there is no erring.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda: Targum — there is for planting, blessings — there is not for planting.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: הֲלָכָה, פּוֹתֵחַ וְרוֹאֶה וּמְבָרֵךְ וְקוֹרֵא. וְלֵימָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה! מִשּׁוּם דְּאָפְכִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rav Mattana said: halakha he should open see and, he should recite the blessing and read. let him say: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Because there are those who reversed
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav Matna: The halakha is to open, see, bless, and read. And let us say: The halakha is like Rabbi Yehuda! Because he turned it around for them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: הַלּוּחוֹת וְהַבִּימוֹת — אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם קְדוּשָּׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said Rav Mattana said: The boards, and the platforms do not have any sanctity.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira said Rav Matna: The tablets and the platforms - they do not have sanctity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁפַטְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַגּוֹלֵל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה — צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּעֲמִידֶנּוּ עַל הַתֶּפֶר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shefatya said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: When one furls a Torah scroll, he needs to position it on the seam
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shefatya said Rabbi Yochanan: One who rolls a Torah scroll - he must stand it on the seam.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁפַטְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַגּוֹלֵל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה — גּוֹלְלוֹ מִבַּחוּץ, וְאֵין גּוֹלְלוֹ מִבִּפְנִים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shefatya said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: When one rolls a Torah scroll he should roll it from the outside, and he should not roll it from the inside,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shefatya said, Rabbi Yochanan said: One who rolls a Torah scroll - roll it from the outside, and do not roll it from the inside.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהוּא מְהַדְּקוֹ — מְהַדְּקוֹ מִבִּפְנִים, וְאֵינוֹ מְהַדְּקוֹ מִבַּחוּץ.
human_translation: And when one tightens he should tighten it from the inside, and not from the outside,
llm_translation: And when he grinds it - he grinds it from within, and he does not grind it from without.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁפַטְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עֲשָׂרָה שֶׁקָּרְאוּ בַּתּוֹרָה, הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבָּהֶם גּוֹלֵל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה. הַגּוֹלְלוֹ נוֹטֵל שְׂכַר כּוּלָּן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: עֲשָׂרָה שֶׁקָּרְאוּ בַּתּוֹרָה, הַגּוֹלֵל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה קִיבֵּל שְׂכַר כּוּלָּן. שְׂכַר כּוּלָּן סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: קִיבֵּל שָׂכָר כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shefatya said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: ten read from the Torah, the greatest among them should furl the Torah scroll, And the one who furls it takes the reward of all of them, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: ten read from the Torah, the one who furls it receives the reward of all of them. Can it enter your mind the reward of all of them? Rather, say He receives a reward equivalent to all of them.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shefatya said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Ten who were called in the Torah, the greatest among them rolls a Torah scroll. The one who rolls it receives the reward of all of them, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Ten who were called in the Torah, the one who rolls a Torah scroll receives the reward of all of them. Did it enter your mind that he received the reward of all of them? Rather say: He received a reward equivalent to all of them.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁפַטְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁמִּשְׁתַּמְּשִׁין בְּבַת קוֹל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאׇזְנֶיךָ תִּשְׁמַעְנָה דָבָר מֵאַחֲרֶיךָ לֵאמֹר״. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי, דְּשָׁמַע קָל גַּבְרָא בְּמָתָא, וְקָל אִיתְּתָא בְּדַבְרָא. וְהוּא דְּאָמַר: ״הֵין הֵין״ וְהוּא דְּאָמַר: ״לָאו לָאו״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shefatya said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: from where that one may make use of a Divine Voice As it is stated: “And your ears shall hear a word behind you saying: This applies when one heard a male voice in the city, or a female voice in the fields, And that when said: Yes, yes. And that when said: No, no.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shefatya said, Rabbi Yochanan said: From where do we derive that they make use of a Bat Kol? As it is stated: "And your ears shall hear a word behind you, saying." And these are the matters: a man hears a voice in the city, and a woman hears a voice in the field. And he who says: "Yes, yes," and he who says: "No, no."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁפַטְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַקּוֹרֵא בְּלֹא נְעִימָה וְשׁוֹנֶה בְּלֹא זִמְרָה, עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְגַם אֲנִי נָתַתִּי לָהֶם חוּקִּים לֹא טוֹבִים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shefatya said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Concerning anyone who reads without a melody or studies without a song, the verse states: “So too I gave them statutes that were not good,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shefatya said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who reads without a pleasant melody and repeats without a song, upon him the Scripture says: "And I also gave them statutes that were not good, etc."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא יָדַע לְבַסּוֹמֵי קָלָא — ״מִשְׁפָּטִים לֹא יִחְיוּ בָּהֶם״ קָרֵית בֵּיהּ?! אֶלָּא כִּדְרַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא, דְּאָמַר: שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים הַיּוֹשְׁבִים בְּעִיר אַחַת וְאֵין נוֹחִין זֶה אֶת זֶה בַּהֲלָכָה — עֲלֵיהֶם הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְגַם אֲנִי נָתַתִּי לָהֶם חוּקִּים לֹא טוֹבִים וּמִשְׁפָּטִים לֹא יִחְיוּ בָּהֶם״.
human_translation: Abaye strongly objects to this: because one does not know to make voice pleasant, you read concerning him: “And judgments whereby they should not live”? Rather, in accordance Rav Mesharshiyya, who said: Concerning two Torah scholars who dwell in the same city and are not pleasant to one other in halakha , the verse states: “So too I gave them statutes that were not good, and judgments whereby they should not live.”
llm_translation: Abbaye objects to him: Because he did not know how to establish a light matter - "They shall not live by My laws" is read in it?! Rather, like Rav Mesharshaya who said: Two scholars sitting in one city and do not delight in each other in matters of halakha - concerning them the verse says: "And I also gave them statutes that were not good and judgments by which they could not live."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי פַּרְנָךְ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הָאוֹחֵז סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה עָרוֹם, נִקְבָּר עָרוֹם. עָרוֹם סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: נִקְבָּר עָרוֹם בְּלֹא מִצְוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Parnakh said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who holds onto an uncovered Torah scroll, will be buried uncovered. Can it enter your mind to say uncovered? Rather, say he will be buried uncovered, without mitzvot.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Parnakh said Rabbi Yohanan: Anyone who holds a Torah scroll naked, will be buried naked. Naked, is it your mind's conclusion? Rather say: buried naked without commandments.

hebrew_text: בְּלֹא מִצְוֹת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נִקְבָּר עָרוֹם בְּלֹא אוֹתָהּ מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Can it enter your mind to say without mitzvot? Rather, Abaye said: He will be buried uncovered, without that mitzva.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Without commandments, your mind has ascended?! Rather Abaye said: One is buried naked without that commandment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי סָבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי רַבָּה: מוּטָב תִּיגָּלֵל הַמִּטְפַּחַת וְאַל יִגָּלֵל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai, son of Rabbi Yannai the Elder, said in the name of Rabbi Yannai the Great: It is proper the cloth be rolled and one should not roll the Torah scroll
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai, son of Rabbi Yannai the Elder, in the name of Rabbi Yannai the Great, said: "It is better for the Torah scroll to be rolled up, and not for the Torah scroll to be rolled out."

hebrew_text: ״וַיְדַבֵּר מֹשֶׁה אֶת מוֹעֲדֵי ה׳ אֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, מִצְוָתָן שֶׁיִּהְיוּ קוֹרִין אוֹתָן כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד בִּזְמַנּוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מֹשֶׁה תִּיקֵּן לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁיְּהוּ שׁוֹאֲלִין וְדוֹרְשִׁין בְּעִנְיָנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹם. הִלְכוֹת פֶּסַח — בַּפֶּסַח, הִלְכוֹת עֲצֶרֶת — בָּעֲצֶרֶת, הִלְכוֹת חַג — בֶּחָג.
human_translation: “And Moses declared to the children of Israel the appointed seasons of the Lord” the mitzva that they should read each one in its time. The Sages taught Moses enacted for the Jewish people that they should make inquiries and expound upon the matter of the day. the halakhot of Passover on Passover, the halakhot of Shavuot on Shavuot , and halakhot of Sukkot on Sukkot .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And Moses spoke the appointed times of the Lord to the children of Israel," their commandment is that they should read them each and every one in its proper time. The Rabbis taught: Moses established for Israel that they should inquire and expound on the matter of the day. The laws of Passover — on Passover, the laws of Shavuot — on Shavuot, the laws of Sukkot — on Sukkot.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ בְּנֵי הָעִיר וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת מְגִילָּה
llm_translation: We will return to you, sons of the city, and go up to her, tractate Megillah.
